rawRange.raw: Per Pellet 7 (43) Pellets Per Shot 6 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Kill Confirmed Juggernaut Clown Infection Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off HUD Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The AA12 , or Auto Assault-12 , is an automatic combat shotgun developed in 1972 by Maxwell Atchisson. The most prominent feature is reduced recoil. The current 2005 version has been developed over 18 years since the patent was sold to Military Police Systems, Inc. The original design was the basis of several later weapons, including the USAS-12 combat shotgun. The shotgun fires in fully automatic mode only. However, the relatively low cyclic rate of fire of around 300 rounds per minute enables the shooter to fire semi-automatically with brief trigger pulls. It is fed from either an 8-shell box magazine, or a 20- or 32-shell drum magazine. In-game Information [ ] The AA12 fires from a 20-round drum magazine, with 60 rounds to spare. The AA12 is very useful for mid and close ranges due to its high fire-rate, similar to that of the SPAS 12 . It has very high damage and low spread to accommodate it, making this weapon an absolute beast no matter what range it is being shot from. For some reason, the AA12 has noticeable bloom, but there is also a quick enough spread recovery that the bloom is pointless. The AA12 is also very useful on mobile, since it requires little aim to kill due to it being a shotgun. Despite how powerful the AA12 is, there still comes drawbacks to counter the pros of this weapon. However, whatever the case, a kill with this weapon is guaranteed even at far ranges. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High magazine size for a shotgun. Tighter pellet spread compared to other semi-auto shotgun counterparts. High headshot damage per pellet. Fast rate of fire. Fast reload for a shotgun. Reloads all of its shots at once. Very fast spread recovery counters bloom. Deals flat damage, no fall-off. Cons: Slow movement speed. Low body damage at long ranges High bloom per shot. Deals flat damage, no ramp-up. Tips [ ] The AA12 is one of the easiest (if not the easiest) Shotgun-class weapons to get a kill with, as it can be spammed without being directly punished. The huge magazine size and quick reload also help with this weapon. You can use this weapon from any range, as every pellet deals a flat damage of 7 (43 if on headshot). The pellet spread changes minimally, so there's no need to adjust your aim the longer you shoot. This weapon is powerful at long-range, and is especially deadly against players using a Sniper Rifle. Its ramped-up damage at close-range is also good for ambushes, firing 2-3 shots will quickly kill your target. The AA12 is especially deadly if used from an elevated platform and shooting down at your opponents. Gallery [ ] Stage one development. Stage two. Stage three. AA12 in real life. Trivia [ ] AA12 was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on September 15th, 2019. The AA12 used to be known as the Atchisson Assault Shotgun and by Maxwell Atchisson . However, this was known today as the " Auto-Assault 12 Shotgun " due to having the ability to turn fully automatic. The AA12's stats are quite similar to a combination of SPAS 12 and XM1014 . They are also the only automatic shotguns in the game. Originally, it oddly used the M14 's sounds, however, this was changed after 2 days. Just like most other shotguns used today, AA-12 uses a 12-gauge shell. In reality, it can also use buckshot shells or slug shells. This is not present in the game, however. It is the 3rd shotgun that feds the magazine. The 1st being MAG-7 , the 2nd being Calico , the 4th being TOZ-106 , the 5th being the Nutcracker , the 6th being the RJL Breach , and the 7th being Saiga-12 . Coincidentally, the MAG-7 and the TOZ-106 uses a standard box magazine, the Calico and the Nutcracker uses a helical magazine, the Saiga-12 uses an AK banana magazine, and the AA-12 and the RJL Breach uses a drum magazine. While MAG-7 and the Calico are pump-action shotguns, AA-12, Nutcracker, RJL Breach, and Saiga-12 are automatic, and TOZ-106 is bolt-action. The AA12 fires at 300 RPM which is faster than a majority of shotguns in the game. It is the second weapon that feeds a drum magazine, first being Tommy Gun , third being PPSH . Against all odds, The AA-12 in-game fires close-bolt, even though in real life, it fires open-bolt. The charging handle is also seen reciprocating everytime the weapon is fired, but it doesn't always reciprocate in real life. The old firing sound came from Team Fortress 2's Frontier Justice . 45-75 (150) Gamemodes Standard Randomizer Gun Rotation Hard Mode Special Fan-fire Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The ABS Rifle is a lever-action rifle inspired by the Lever-Action Rifle toy by the American company BrickArms . In-game Information [ ] The ABS Rifle is a grey, plastic lever-action rifle. However, unlike most of the other Marksman Rifles, its firing speed is particularly slow, with a 1-second interval between shots. However, its ability to fan fire somewhat negates this. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Decent Accuracy. Fan-Fire ability. Headshots insta-kill. Cons: Poor damage compared to other lever action rifles. Slow firing rate if not fan fired. Slightly slow reload speed. High spread for its class. Has low magazine capacity. Low reserve ammo. Tips [ ] The ABS Rifle's primary fire is very unreliable because of its high spread and slow firing speed. It's recommended to use its fan-fire ability instead by right-clicking. This will fire all of your shots quickly, allowing you to get a kill with this weapon in no time. Make sure that you're at close-range to get a kill with the fan-fire ability. This weapon loads its bullets individually instead of an entire magazine. However, the reloading speed is particularly slow, which won't help you in an intense fight. To get a headshot, only use the first bullet in the clip, as it's the only 100% accurate shot. Reload the ABS Rifle to keep your accuracy. Two single bodyshots while at close-range can be an alternate way to get a kill. Trivia [ ] The ABS Rifle and the Dual Volcanics are the only lever-action weapons that cannot double jump. The ABS Rifle is the only Marksman Rifle that can fan-fire. The ABS Rifle was intended as a weapon for Arsenal: Reloaded . Its design is based on the BrickArms Lever Action Rifle. Gallery [ ] Development stage image. The toy gun that inspired the ABS Rifle. 6 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Afterburn Kill Icon Creator Civicus Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Acid Spitter is a weapon that was added into the Halloween Update II of Arsenal . Being the "brother" of the Flamethrower , the Acid Spitter functions the exact same way, sharing its damage, ammo, limited range, and special afterburn ability. However, there is a unique element to the Acid Spitter, independent from the Flamethrower: its flame particles are bigger and harder to see through. This can practically blind the user's targets but also hamper the user's own vision. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Large magazine size. Very low ammo consumption. Decent rate of fire. Fast afterburn. Fast reload. Flame particles make it hard for opponents to see through. Cons: Extremely low damage. No headshot multiplier. Low mobility. Afterburn will wear off after a few seconds. Unable to be used at longer ranges. Sluggish movement speed. Flame particles make it hard for the user to see through. Tips [ ] Unlike its "brother", the Flamethrower , the Acid Spitter's flame effect is less transparent, meaning it's harder to see through. This has its pros and cons. This is good against enemies, especially during ambushes, as they won't be able to tell where to shoot. This is bad for the user who won't be able to see through the flames either, so they will need to mentally pick a target before flaming them in order to guarantee a kill. The Acid Spitter can hit multiple enemies at once, so target groups of enemies rather than individuals if it's possible. The Acid Spitter is best used if you sneak behind an opponent and burn them from behind, rather than confronting them head-on. This weapon loses to almost every other weapon in Arsenal if in a direct confrontation, so ambushing is recommended. If you're being shot at, equip your Knife and run away and find a different route to your opponents. Not doing so will make you an easy target to kill. If you die before you can finish off a player, the afterburn effect of the Acid Spitter will let you be credited as an assist if a teammate kills your burning opponent. Do mind that afterburn will not be as effective if your opponent is still near full HP. It would just be a mild inconvenience to them. You'll be guaranteed a kill through afterburn if your opponent is approximately around the range of 20 HP. Gallery [ ] Stage one development. Stage two. Stage three. Stage four. Trivia [ ] Acid Spitter was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on October 21st, 2020. The weapon was originally going to have a pullback attachment. The Acid Spitter is one of the weapons that have an afterburn effect, along with the Spellbook , the Tavor 's Incendiary shells, the Flamethrower and the Flaming Pumpkin . Much like Flamethrower, Acid Spitter can be broken in any approaches: In the currently inactive gamemode Juggernaut, the Acid Spitter does not do any damage against the juggernaut or as the juggernaut. This has been fixed after. Sometimes, the afterburn doesn't instantly kill the player once the damage hits 100 or more. This also affects the Flamethrower and the Flaming Pumpkin as well. The afterburn damage was used to be broken. This was later fixed on January 5th, 2021. Despite spitting green flames, the afterburn effect's flames are orange-red, like the normal Flamethrower. It is the signature weapon of the Hazmat, Tetra, and Crackles skins. 100 Firing Mode Single Projectile Special Projectile Arch Kill Icon Creator ROBLOX Contents 1 Weapon Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History Weapon Information [ ] The Admin Launcher was available for ROLVe moderators, admins, and ROBLOX developers during the Egg Hunt 2019 event. It was used to give players the Eggmin egg, which gave players a badge too. It was essentially a bootleg Baseball Launcher that fired insta-kill eggs that gave players badges instead of baseballs. The firing animation of the weapon is flinging the egg out. The Admin Launcher was discontinued after the 2019 Egg Hunt event. It can still be spawned in by using a custom gamemode in private servers and can still be fired, however the projectile does not appear. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast fire rate. Instant-kill upon hitting a player with an egg. Cons: Arching projectile makes it harder to hit enemies across further ranges. Trivia [ ] This weapon and the Influencer Launcher were the only weapons with a projectile that gave players badges upon impact. 20-70 (46-80) Gamemodes Standard Counter Blox Gun Rotation Clown Infection Randomizer Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 (Current) Valve (Archived) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The AK-47 (simply known as Heavy Rifle in Gun Game ) is a Russian assault rifle developed in the early 1940s by Mikhail Kalashnikov and later became the main service rifle of the Soviet Armed Forces until it was replaced by the AKM . Its design was inspired by an earlier German assault rifle known as the StG-44. The AK-47 fires intermediate and powerful 7.62x39mm rounds, and is (arguably) the most known gun. In-game Information [ ] Current Archived The AK-47 is an automatic rifle that holds 30 in the magazine within the ammo reserve of 60. It carries quite the punch for people who know how to tap fire at long ranges, and spray at close. Although the headshot damage is lower than more popular culture suggests, it still is viable due to the extremely low time to kill in Arsenal . The only major setback is the high recoil, which is somewhat jarring when first shooting the weapon. In the archived version, the AK-47 reflects the rifle's real capabilities; the AK-47 will deal 23 damage at very long ranges and will do 62 damage upon a headshot at most ranges. It fires from a 30 round mag, with 60 rounds in reserve, and comes with a two-second reload time. The only downside to it is its high spread, hindering its ability to be utilized at long ranges. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast reload time. High damage at close ranges. Moderate magazine size. Good fire rate. Cons: High spread penalty. Moderately low minimum damage. Hefty recoil Tips [ ] The AK-47 deals respectable damage, but also has high spread and recoil. Because of this, only the first 10 bullets are accurate enough to kill opponents from mid-range. As with every weapon with high spread, more bullets will land if shooting from close-range. The spread is quite unpredictable. It's practically only more accurate than Machine Guns. The high spread will also make it difficult to land headshots, so beware. The AK-47 takes 2.8 seconds to reload. This is fast, but when in intense fights, you can easily be killed before you finish reloading. Gallery [ ] Current AK-47 stage one development. Stage two. Stage three. Stage four. Stage five. Stage six. Stage seven. Stage eight. Stage nine. Stage ten. World model. Weapon render. AK-47 with vertical magazine. A wide showcase. AK-47 in real life. Trivia [ ] The current model of the AK-47 was revealed in the Arsenal Discord during the Sci-Fi Update development on September 10th, 2020. A model of the AK-47 from Unit: Classified ( ROLVe other project) made an appearance in the Summer Update II trailer. The inspect animation is taken from Counter Blox , ROLVe's other game. The reload sound is also taken from Counter Blox. The AK-47 uses the same base animations as the G36 , albeit slightly edited when pulling the bolt. Strangely, the AK-47's archived model was an AKM taken from Left 4 Dead . The AK-47 is one of the main weapons used in the "story mode" games Operation: Infiltration and Operation: Exfiltration . 21-61 (43-86) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Gallery 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The AK74 is an assault rifle developed in the early 1970s by Soviet weapons designer Mikhail Kalashnikov to replace the earlier AKM (itself a refined version of the AK-47 ). It uses a smaller 5.45×39mm cartridge, replacing the 7.62×39mm chambering of earlier Kalashnikov-pattern weapons. The rifle first saw service with Soviet forces in the 1979 Afghanistan conflict. The head of the Afghan bureau of the Pakistani Inter-Services Intelligence claimed that the CIA paid $5,000 for the first AK-74 captured by the Mujahideen during the Soviet–Afghan War. Today, the rifle is used by most countries of the former Soviet Union. Licensed copies were produced in Bulgaria (AK-74, AKS-74 and AKS-74U), and the former East Germany (MPi-AK-74N, MPi-AKS-74N, MPi-AKS-74NK). In-game information [ ] In-game, the AK74 reflects rifle's real capabilities: The AK-74 will deal 21 damage at very long ranges, and will do 70 damage upon a headshot at most ranges. The AK-74 can be best be seen as a balance between its older counterpart, the AKM , and Western Bloc rifles such as the M4A1 . It fires from a 30 round mag, with 60 rounds in reserve, and comes with a two-second reload time. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage at close quarters. Fast rate of fire. Fast reload time. Moderate magazine size. Cons: High spread penalty. Moderately high recoil. Low minimum body damage. Trivia [ ] The AK74's uniquely-orange magazine can be attributed to the 5.45x39mm round's special design, requiring special plastics for magazine construction The AK74's full name is the " Автомат Калашникова образца 1974 года ", which when translated means " Kalashnikov automatic rifle model 1974 ". The AK74M, a modernized variant of the AK-74, is currently in use by the Russian Federation's armed forces alongside the AK-12. The AK74 in-game features a folding wire stock, indicating its an AKS-74 variant. Strangely, the AK-74's model is mirrored to the left side. This trait is shared with the AKM . In the Mega Update, the AK-74 used Insurgency's AK-74 firing sound. The AK74's firing sound was changed to the 2013 CS:GO AK-47 firing sound. Gallery [ ] AK74 in real life. 22-78 (56-112) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The AKM is a 7.62×39mm assault rifle designed by Mikhail Kalashnikov. It is a common modernized variant of the AK-47 rifle developed in the 1940s. Introduced into service with the Soviet Army in 1959, the AKM is the prevalent variant of the entire AK series of firearms and it has found widespread use with most member states of the former Warsaw Pact and its African and Asian allies as well as being widely exported and produced in many other countries. The production of these rifles was carried out at both the Tula Arms Plant and Izhmash. It was officially replaced in Soviet frontline service by the AK-74 in the late 1970s, but remains in use worldwide. The AKM maintains the AK-47's wood stock, but has simpler individual parts that are favorable for mass production. Like the AK-47, many variants of the AKM exist such as the AKMS, AKML, and AKMP. In-game Information [ ] The AKM is a powerful weapon up close, with its hefty recoil and high close range body damage. At longer ranges, the weapon suffers owing to its low minimum body damage and its powerful recoil. Headshots with this weapon will always take 2 shots to kill at any range, making headshots a viable way to kill targets at range. The AKM is fed by a 30-round mag, with 60 rounds in reserve. Its reload time lasts two seconds. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Fairly fast fire rate. Fast reload time. Moderate magazine size. Cons: Moderately low long range body damage. High spread penalty. High recoil. Trivia [ ] The AKM is the most commonly found variant of the AK family of firearms and was introduced into Soviet service in 1959. It fires a 7.62x39mm cartridge. A common tactic with the AKM was to have massed numbers of troops advance rapidly, firing the AKM as they went. While this often resulted in highly inaccurate shot scores, this Soviet-style Blitzkrieg tactic of putting thousands of rounds at a target was deemed effective. Besides the 10 million AKMs manufactured in the Soviet Union alone, millions more were produced under license by Eastern Bloc nations such as Romania, Bulgaria, and Poland. Pirated copies were also produced worldwide, numbering in the tens of millions. The AKM, like the AK-74 in-game, have their charging handles and fire selectors on the left side. Their fire selectors are set to semi-auto, however, they fire in fully-automatic mode. It is the signature weapon of Anna, Phoenix and Casual Bot. Despite the AKM being Phoenix's signature weapon, the Old Habits Badge still requires scoring a kill with the AWP as the respective skin. The AKM's firing and reloading sound used to have the sound of the AK-74, however, this was changed in the Summer Update , to distinguish it from said weapon. The weapon model is mirrored, as the real life model of the AKM has the charging handle on the right side, instead on the left. 18-43 (31-54) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Firing Mode Automatic Creator Unknown Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.067 23.521 2.65 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 1.747 1 Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Weapon History General Information [ ] The AR-PDW , also known as the AR-57 or AR-57 PDW , is an American automatic rifle with an AR-15/M16 lower and a 5.7×28mm monolithic upper. It uses 50-round P90 magazines mounted horizontally on top, with brass ejecting through the top of the weapon. It was designed by AR57 LLC . In-Game Information [ ] The AR-PDW (previously called the AR57 ) is an automatic rifle that is seen in Arsenal: Reloaded and Arsenal . This weapon is fairly efficient, having a fast fire rate, high damage, low spread, and low recoil. This weapon can be used both at long, and short ranges. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Great magazine capacity. Low spread for its class. Can kill enemies quickly due to the fire rate and damage. Cons: Moderately slow reload. Tips [ ] The AR-PDW's firing speed and immense damage make it one of the more deadly Automatics in the game. Take advantage of this. It's practically a more accurate version of the P90 . The AR-PDW also shoots very accurately, allowing you to effectively fight from mid- or even long-range. Be careful when fighting from long-range as the distance will make your damage have fall-off. Its accuracy allows it to defeat opponents currently using Shotguns. In gamemodes without the "promotion on kill" mechanic, such as Randomizer or Gun Rotation, the AD-PDW is very good at fighting off squads of foes. Its gigantic magazine capacity allows you to take on many at once, but only at the cost of a slightly slow reload. 260 (direct hit) 195 (splash damage) 22 (self-damage) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Rocket Jump Splash Damage Double Cannon Kill Icon The Arm Cannon is a projectile weapon that was introduced in the Halloween Update III . It is a pirate-designated cannon attached to an arm that fires rusty cannonballs. The Arm Cannon is a unique weapon because of its damage, counting the direct impact and splash damage. Its ability to rocket jump guarantee the player with a whole-map look and whole-map snipe if possible. This cannon can be reloaded shell-by-shell which means the player can reload after each shot and if the player misses their shot, the ball have a high splash range which means the player can severely damage the target and kill them with another shot or assist another player(s) to kill the target. The player can also kill several players camping at a point with the canon, guaranteed by the instant-kill direct hit damage and also the prominent splash damage, but the weapon also have some disadvantages, such as the player can kill themselves when using this weapon when engaging in close-quarter combats because of the high splash, the projector is slow and the empty reload speed is hazardous, which can guarantee the enemy a kill when the player can't reload, melee-fight, med-pickup or hide in-time. The slow rate of fire also made up for the disadvantages, making each shot count. The best strategy when using this gun is to snipe or shoot from a long distance, and try to not engage in any close-quarter combat situations. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Ability to rocket jump . 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. One-shot kill on direct hits and splash damage. Huge blast radius. Holding the left mouse button activates two cannonballs at a time. Cons: Long empty reload time. Users can easily kill themselves if not careful. Slow rate of fire. Slow projectile speed. Small delay between shooting and the projectile being released. High self-damage. 20-25 (75) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Firing Mode Automatic Special Scope Creator PrimeFIRE94 Armament is a futuristic, automatic rifle that has a scope to compensate for longer ranges. Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Armament is a Jovian, scoped laser rifle released in the Galactic Assault Update of Arsenal . It is commonly used by interplanetary travelers due to is extreme accuracy at long ranges. This weapon has a slower fire-rate compared to some of the weapons of its sort, however, this weapon has a higher magazine capacity compared to most of the other automatic rifles. This weapon also has a scope that performs like the scopes used on most snipers. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High ammo count. High headshot damage. Contains a scope for longer ranges. Low spread for its class. Scope reduces spread. Cons: Slower fire rate for its class. Low damage. Tracer shots allow opponents to track your position. Tips [ ] The main downside of the Armament is its low damage of 20-25. This makes it a losing battle against more powerful weapons. To make up for this, the Armament is effective from long-range, where you can be just outside of some weapons' range (such as Pistols and Shotguns). Use the Armament's scope at mid- to long-range to make your shots more accurate. At close-range, however, do not use the scope so you don't hamper your vision while aiming at opponents. Headshots are the most effective way to get kills with the Armament, so aim for the head as much as possible. It deals a hefty 75 damage, which essentially can be enough for a teammate to get you an assist. Gallery [ ] TBA Trivia [ ] It was revealed in a trailer that a Cephalokin Elite canonically created the Armament. 19-33 (30-112) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Automatics Counter Blox Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Arcade All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Steyr AUG or the Armee-Universal-Gewehr (commonly known as the AUG , and previously as the Marksman Rifle in Gun Game ), is an Austrian 5.56×45mm NATO bullpup assault rifle, designed in the 1960s by Steyr-Daimler-Puch and now manufactured by Steyr Mannlicher GmbH & Co KG. It was adopted by the Austrian Army as the StG 77 ( Sturmgewehr 77 ) in 1978, where it replaced the 7.62×51mm NATO StG 58 automatic rifle (a licence-built FN FAL). In production since 1978, it is the standard small arm of the Austrian Bundesheer and various national police units. Its variants have also been adopted by the armed forces of dozens of countries. Steyr AUG importation into the U.S. began in the 1980s as the AUG/SA (SA denoting semiautomatic). President George H.W. Bush banned the AUG via an executive order under the 1989 Assault Weapon Import ban. Six years into the ban, AUG buyers gained a reprieve as cosmetic changes to the carbine's design allowed importation once again. Changes included the pistol grip being changed into a thumbhole stock, and the barrel left unthreaded to prevent attachment of flash suppressors and silencers. The ban sunsetted in 2004, and in 2008 Steyr Arms worked with Sabre Defense to produce parts legally in the U.S. In-Game Information [ ] The AUG is a top-of-the-line assault rifle, sporting decent damage at closer ranges, accuracy, and recoil. This weapon has low spread, which is easily used at long range. It carries 30-round magazine, which is not an issue despite this weapon has slightly fast fire-rate. However, it comes with some drawbacks; namely the slightly longer-than-average reload time in its class, and the low minimum damage. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Decent close-range damage. Has low spread. Moderate magazine size. Fairly fast rate of fire. Scope makes shots more accurate. Cons: Low minimum body damage. Longer reload time compared to other assault rifles. Hip-firing is less accurate at long-range. Tips [ ] The AUG is a very powerful weapon from any range, thanks to its re-addition of an intergral scope. At longer distances, use the AUG's scope to see enemies clearly and shoot more accurately. At close-range, do not use the scope and fire normally. Scoping in will limit your vision and your aim. The AUG is more of a one-and-done weapon due to its mighty killpower, but very slow reload. To be most effective with this weapon, be sure to get a kill within the first clip, or you'll be a sitting duck for opponents while you're reloading. Trivia [ ] The AUG in real life features a unique "progressive trigger". It allows the user to switch between firing modes by simply putting the right amount of pressure on the trigger. For example: To fire at semi-automatic speed, the trigger needs to be pressed gently. To fire at fully automatic speed, the trigger needs to be pressed forcefully. The AUG is one of the 4 bullpup weapons in the game along with the L86A3 , the Dual Shotguns , and the FAMAS . The AUG is taken from Counter Blox . In Gun Game , the AUG is the only automatic rifle with a scope. The AUG is also the only weapon to be removed in Gun Game until it was brought back in the Mega Update. The AUG along with the Rocket Launcher , the Peacemaker , the Barrett , the Trench Gun , the G-17 , the XR15 , and the DB Shotgun are the only primary weapons that appear in the Arcade gamemode. The AUG fires a 5.56x45mm NATO cartridge in real-life. The current model is the AUG A1 , as evident by its integral scope, while the previous and the pre-alpha model is the AUG A3 , with its picatinny rail and a shorter barrel. The pre-alpha model also featured an ACOG Sight . The AUG did not have a scope at all prior to 10 Year Anniversary Update , which made it less effective from further distances. 75-150 (210-285) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection All Weapons Bows Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectile Party Snipers Only Firing Mode Automatic Projectile Special Ramp-up Projectile Arch Scope Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Autobow is a fictional, automatic derivative of the Crossbow , which holds 15 arrows in the magazine and 30 in reserve. It has a similar distance decay ability like the Crossbow and has mild recoil. It has a moderate rate of fire, and the bolts travel very slowly. Body hits from this weapon can possibly one-shot, but it always one-shot kill on the head. Unlike the Crossbow, it is equipped with a scope. Users may have trouble reloading as the animation will obstruct the crosshair. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Using scope has greater magnification. One-shots at close-range. One-shots on headshot. Fast rate of fire. High damage. Fairly fast reload. Large magazine size. Cons: Reload animation obstructs most of the view. Projectile arch and speed can make it difficult to kill at long ranges. Tips [ ] The Autobow is a versatile weapon, being able to kill from any distance. However, it performs best if at close-range, where its ramped-up damage is strong enough to insta-kill. It also kills upon headshot, so firing from a safe distance in an attempt to get one is a good strategy. If firing from long-range, use the scope to see your targets better. Do beware that aiming directly at them won't make your projectiles land, as they will drop to the ground before they reach . Try aiming a little bit higher than their head so the projectile arc is high enough to land a hit. The Autobow has an incredible damage range. Worst case scenario, a single shot from far away that deals 75 damage will be enough for a teammate to get you an assist. Trivia [ ] The ammo ticker refills before the reload animation finishes. This weapon is featured in the Holiday Havoc trailer. The Autobow is the first projectile weapon to have a scope. The Autobow is the final weapon to use In the Snipers Only gamemode , where getting a kill wins the round. 115 (345) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Counter Blox Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Snipers Only Firing Mode Bolt-action Special Scope Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Arctic Warfare Police (short for AWP ) is a British bolt-action sniper rifle designed by Accuracy International , normally chambered for either 7.62x51 or .308 cartridges, and purpose-built for precision. Main Archived The AWP is a very powerful weapon, as evidenced by its 115 body shot damage at all ranges and 322 damage headshot. Like the M40 and MS556 , the AWP is uses a bolt-action firing mechanism, meaning that the player will have to cock the bolt after every shot. This causes the AWP to have an agonizingly slow firerate, especially when compared to other powerful 1-shot sniper rifles like the Barrett and Railgun . The sluggish firing speed paired with its slow pullout time makes it extremely important to hit each shot. Like the other snipers, the AWP comes with a scope that can be accessed using the RMB or the V key. On mobile devices, the sniper scope can be accessed by pressing the scope button. In the Archived version of Arsenal , the AWP (simply known as Tactical Sniper in Gun Game ) is quite similar to how it is today. The only difference was the abhorrent magazine size, with 5 rounds in each mag. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Perfect accuracy. One-shot kill for both bodyshots and headshots. Accessible scope allows for better magnification. Large magazine. Firerate can be increased by double keying Cons: Sluggish reload and barrel covering the crosshair. High recoil. Extremely sluggish movement speed. Slow fire-rate. Slow pullout time. Scope tracer may giveaway user position Tips [ ] The AWP is best used from a very far distance, where you can easily shoot at opponents but they cannot easily shoot back at you. Because the AWP makes the user slower, equip your Knife if travelling across the map to avoid being easily killed. Do beware that the AWP takes a while to fully pull out, so equip it if you find a good spot to snipe from or if you suspect an opponent is around the corner. As with every Sniper Rifle, do not scope in if your opponent is at mid- or close-range, as the limited vision will make you an easy kill. Trivia [ ] The AWP is part of Accuracy International's series of Arctic Warfare bolt-action rifles, including notable weapons such as the Arctic Warfare Magnum ( AWM ), Arctic Warfare Suppressed ( AWS ), and the AWP itself. It's normally chambered for 7.62x51mm/.308 Winchester (AWP and AWS) or .338 Magnum (AWM) cartridges, but is able to be made for others. The AWP is most notable for its inclusion in the Counter-Strike series as a powerful bolt-action rifle with a distinctive muzzle report, and with it being the signature weapon of Phoenix in Arsenal and the Old Habits Badge requiring a kill with this weapon as the respective skin, this further connects the reference. However, in the Halloween Update , the Phoenix skin now has an AKM , but the badge wasn't affected. The in-game model is most likely an AWM. The AWP makes the same sound as the AWP from 2012 in CS:GO except it is slightly quieter. Despite being extremely powerful, the AWP stands for Arctic Warfare Police and is chambered in a lighter law enforcement caliber being 308. Winchester. Even with that, the AWP still possesses a massive 1-shot kill capability. Gallery [ ] AWP in real life. 30-90 (75-150) Gamemodes Standard Legacy Competitive Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Nredly (Current) Unknown (Previous) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The M1918A2 Browning Automatic Rifle is one part of the BAR family, a set of automatic rifles used by the U.S. in World War One designed for the "walking fire" concept, though in practice was used more as a traditional, bipod-fired light machine gun. It was eventually succeeded by the M60 in 1957. In-game Information [ ] The BAR is a very powerful automatic rifle, packing quite some punch with each bullet. The damage is a guaranteed minimum four shot kill to the body and a minimum of two shots to the head, though at close range players will see two shots to the body, and one shot to the head killing their targets. It has a surprisingly low spread, meaning the BAR has use up to longer range engagements. However, the BAR's main drawback is its fire rate; players may lose out at closer ranges to faster firing weapons. There is a silver lining though- with the BAR's low magazine size and low fire rate combined, players will likely never need to reload the BAR mid fight. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Low spread. High damage. Overall slow ammo consumption rate due to its fire rate. Quick reload. Cons: Sluggish rate of fire. Small magazine size for its class. Slow movement speed. Gallery [ ] Remastered model of BAR created by Nredly. BAR in real life Trivia [ ] When it was first released, the player carrying the BAR in third person appears to be held incorrectly. The BAR is considered both an automatic rifle and an LMG, although it was rarely used as the latter due to the low ammo per magazine. The BAR was also designed to be carried by an infantryman during an assault advance while supported by the sling over the shoulder or to be fired from the hip. The BAR had an FN-designed pistol grip and the rate-reducer mechanism with two rates of automatic fire that was shelved in favor of a rate-reducer mechanism designed by Springfield Armory . The BAR has the same firing sound and reload sound as the M1918 BAR in Day of Infamy . 200 (600) Gamemodes Standard Kill Confirmed Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Arcade All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Scope Recoil Jump Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Barrett M82 is a recoil-operated, semi-automatic anti-materiel precision rifle developed by the American Barrett Firearms Manufacturing company. Despite its designation as an anti-materiel rifle, it is used by some armed forces as an anti-personnel system. The M107 variant is also called the Light Fifty for its .50 BMG (12.7×99mm NATO) chambering and significantly lighter weight compared to previous applications and the 15% heavier base M82 model. The weapon is found in three variants, the original M82A1 (and A3), the bullpup M82A2 and Barrett M107A1 with muzzle brake designed to accept a suppressor and made out of titanium instead of steel. The M82A2 is no longer manufactured, though the XM500 can be seen as its successor. In-game Information [ ] Current Archived In Arsenal , it is the fifth strongest weapon in the game, only being outmatched in damage by the Musket , Pulse Musket , Tavor , and the Literal Gun . It deals 200 damage; twice the maximum health capacity. Since you can fire multiple shots without reloading, it's easy to get kills with this weapon. However, its lengthy reload and slow walking speed makes it harder to hit when pushed up close. Its semi-automatic nature does make it surprisingly effective at killing opponents in close-quarters combat. However, it has lots of recoil, so spamming the weapon isn't recommended at longer ranges. As of the Christmas 2020 Update, the Barett now knocks the user back slightly while in the air. While it is possible to perform a recoil jump similar to the DB Shotgun or DBS to a lesser extent, it would require the user to expend quite a bit of ammo to achieve such a feat. The Barrett M82A1 (simply known as Heavy Sniper in Gun Game ) was different in the Arsenal Archived than it is now. It had a crosshair, a trait shared by snipers in the Archived version. However, it had the widest crosshair in the game, making it hard to land a body shot, let alone a headshot. The fire rate was also much slower compared to how it is now. It also un-scopes after a shot when your scoping. However, It still killed enemies with one-shot. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros Guaranteed one-shot kill on body hit or headshot. Has no spread. Scope allows for better magnification. Large magazine size for a sniper rifle. Able to recoil jump . Cons Extremely sluggish movement speed. Somewhat slow fire rate Extremely slow 5.5 second reload time. Massive recoil. Slow pullout time. Air knockback is noticeably weaker than the DB Shotgun and DBS . Scope tracer may giveaway user position Tips [ ] The best strategy with the Barrett is to use at least 3-5 shots to recoil jump, then use the rest to snipe opponents that are down below. Don't recoil jump too high! You can easily be spotted in the sky and shot down. The Barrett only lets you recoil jump upward , not forward. Do not use this weapon to get around the map. If you get a kill while up in the sky, you can attempt to shoot at other opponents while falling to quickly promote to the next weapon. If you use up all your shots, the best thing to do is resort to melee combat with your Knife instead of waiting out the entire 5 seconds of the reload. This situation is a win-win, as you can either get a kill or be killed by an opponent and instantly regain all 10 shots upon respawn. You can still hide behind a wall or object to reload, but you will more likely to be found and killed while doing so. Trivia [ ] Barrett was renamed to HCS-50 during Arsenal: Reloaded Beta Testing . The HCS-50 was also used in another ROBLOX game, Enforcement . Barrett was one of the few archived weapons that still persisted their Gun Game design. The Barrett deals the fifth highest damage in the game, only surpassed by the Tavor , the Musket , the Pulse Musket and the Literal Gun . The Barrett has the highest DPS of any weapon in the game, with 400-500 DPS to anything but the head, and a whopping 1120-1400 DPS to the head. The gunfire sound is used from Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 . The Barrett is meant to be used as an anti-material rifle, but can be used for anti-personnel roles if needed. The Barrett is tied with the SPAS 12 for the 4th longest reload time with 5.5 seconds, surpassed by the MG42 with a 5.75-second reload, the Musket with a 6-second reload, and the Dual Volcanics with an 18-second reload time (only if both magazines are emptied). Carrying the Barrett is extremely heavy; it weighs 29.7 lb (13.5 kg). It's heavier than all the machine guns in the game. The in-game model is an M107 , the modified version fit for U.S Military weapon designations. This is the signature weapon for the Jackeryz and Beezul skins. The Barrett is the first of the three semi-automatic sniper rifles in-game. The Barrett in-game is fitted with a bipod. The Barrett along with the G-17 , the XR15 , Peacemaker , the AUG , the Trench Gun , the DB Shotgun and the Rocket Launcher are the Arcade gamemode weapons. 45-67 Gamemodes Standard Typical Colors Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Ramp-up Projectile Arch Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Baseball Launcher is a projectile weapon, firing arching baseballs towards an enemy. At closer ranges, the Baseball Launcher deals 45 damage, and deals max damage at longer ranges (67 damage). It fires baseballs at a somewhat capped rate, being semi-automatic. It feeds from a 10-round cylinder and has twenty baseballs in reserve, along with a somewhat long reload time. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Arching shot allows for the projectile to hit enemies behind walls. Decent fire rate. Decent magazine size. Decent reload time. Cons: Projectile Arch makes it harder to hit enemies across further ranges. Fires a projectile, meaning that timing is key. No headshot multiplier. Gallery [ ] Baseball Launcher in real life. Trivia [ ] Before the 2.1 Update , the model for the Baseball launcher was different and seemingly did less damage. The model was taken from a ROBLOX gear called Snowball Cannon . This is the signature weapon of the Commando, Santa, Baseball Star and Ski Star skins. The model is based on the TKB-0249 Russian launcher. This is one of the few weapons to have a ramp-up. The firing sound for this weapon is similar to the firing sound of the real life "Thumper" grenade launcher, also known as the M79 . 18-43 (28-50) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Laser Tag Legacy Competitive Competitive Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Tracer Shot Kill Icon Creator Unknown The BH10 is a futuristic SMG that was released during the Sci-Fi Update of Arsenal. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The BH10 performs similarly to the P90 . It has a fast firing speed and fair accuracy, only having low damage. Tap-shooting this weapon will reduce the spread at longer ranges and kill enemies quickly. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. High magazine size. High damage at close quarters. Cons: Low minimum damage. Relatively high spread. Moderately slow reload. Moderate recoil. Tracer shots can give away position at far ranges. Tips [ ] The BH10 is the most effective at close- or mid-range, where its quick firing speed can easily overwhelm opponents that aren't paying attention. At long-range, only the first 7 shots from the BH10 will be accurate enough to land on your target. However, firing a few at a time, then waiting before firing again will allow you to land more shots. The BH10 also has a slow reload of 2.5 seconds. Make sure to get the kill if in an intense fight, because running out of ammo will make you an easy kill to your opponent. The BH10 shoots tracer shots, which will make it easy for opponents to figure out your current location. To avoid this, only take out targets that are near you instead of far away. That way, your victim's teammates won't be able to find you. If possible, try to target opponents that are indoors instead of out in the open to limit the visibility of your tracer shots. Trivia [ ] The BH10 is a reference to the 2001 shooter game, " Halo: Combat Evolved ", and the entire franchise itself. It shares the appearance of the SMG and the MA5D Assault Rifle. This, along with the Pathbringer , the Z80 , and the Pulse Musket do not use the Evaporate kill effect by default. Per Pellet 30-60 (37) 30 (thrown) Pellets Per Shot 10 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Hackula Hackula DX Insane Mode Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Single-fire Projectile HUD Icon Creator Civicus Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Blunderbuss is a flintlock shotgun , that was added in the Halloween Update III of Arsenal . Blunderbuss is considered, an early predecessor to the shotgun, due to functioning similarly. This weapon saw a wide-service in medieval and Napoleonic armies, along with Muskets . The Blunderbuss provides a high damage in the closer range, plus fast reload, making this an independent weapon when there is only the user and the enemy. However, the user is only allowed 1 shot, and afterwards throws the Blunderbluss in the direction they are currently facing, which can deal extra damage if it hits an opponent. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Quick reload time. High damage at close range. Able to be thrown after every fired shot. No damage fall-off . Cons: Only one round per magazine. Moderate recoil. Low reserve ammo. When thrown, projectile arch makes it a bit hard to hit enemies at longer ranges. Last shot doesn't throw the weapon. Tips [ ] The Blunderbuss excels at ambushes rather than taking opponents head-on, as you only have limited ammo to use. Keep an eye out for ammo boxes dropped by any dead players to avoid losing ammo completely. There's a secret to the Blunderbuss: you don't have to wait for the entire reload animation. As soon as your character throws a Blunderbuss away, that is when you can fire again (not when your character pulls out another one). If your shot lands but doesn't kill, aim a bit more upward so you can deal an extra 30 damage to your target, potentially finishing them off. The best strategy with the Blunderbuss is to get close to the enemy and try to land a shot, then immediately retreat to reload. Try to patrol the map and pay attention to the corners, as players can hide in them and wait for an enemy to come nearby. Trivia [ ] This weapon used to drop on to the ground upon death. The Blunderbuss still drops when thrown. This originally could cause servers to break because the dropped blunderbusses didn't de-spawn, although this was fixed. Despite the Blunderbuss being able to be reloaded, the player just throws the weapon away after every shot. Occasionally, when hitting or killing a player, it will make a LG phone echo ringtone. 100-684 67 (self-damage) Gamemodes Brickbattle Projectiles Party Hard Mode Bomb Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Special Charged Shot Rocket Jump Kill Icon The Bomb is a weapon in the Brickbattle gamemode. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Bomb is an intriguing weapon in its unique fuse time mechanic, the Bomb's base fuse time is 3.2 seconds and explodes on impact. Players can hold the right mouse button to charge the bomb to make the fuse run its course faster. It is recommended that players don't fuse the bomb for too long, as the overcooking the Bomb can result in death. The Bomb can instantly kill anyone unfortunate enough to be caught in its explosions, coupled with its large splash radius, It should be noted that any player that can utilize the bomb's strengths is to be feared. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Explodes on impact. Instantly kill an enemy upon blast. Ability to cook the bomb by holding RMB. Explosive area-of-effect capability allows for collateral kills. Rebound ability. Has the fastest rocket jump in the game. Infinite ammunition. No reloading required. Cons: Users can easily kill themselves if not careful. Sluggish 2.5-second cooldown. High self damage upon rocket jump. Rocket jumps send users forward instead of upward. Tips [ ] The Bomb is a very dangerous weapon, as it insta-kills both opponents and the user. Make sure to throw your Bombs far away from you as possible to avoid blowing yourself up. Tapping the fire-button will immediately throw your Bomb, exploding within 1 second. Throwing Bombs with a 1 second timer will often explode in mid-air, so you this attack works best at close-range to make sure the Bomb gets a kill. (Remember not to get too close as the explosion can kill you too) Holding down the right-click button will give your Bomb a 4 second timer. Letting go of the button will throw the Bomb. Use this attack to throw Bombs at opponents who are at a good distance away from you. This means not at close-range. Beware that you cannot throw another Bomb until the first has exploded, so make sure to use this attack wisely. When using the 4-second attack for the Bomb, work on your timing. When you should let go of the right-click button depends on how far your target is from you. Immediately throwing is best for killing players at long-range. It can even hit an opponent on the other side of smaller maps. Throwing when there's 2-3 seconds left is best for opponents at mid-range. The Bomb has the fastest rocket jump in the game. Tapping the fire-button while aiming below you will initiate a rocket jump. However , you will travel forward instead of upward. You can use this to get to the other side of bigger maps very quickly. Beware that rocket jumping will deal a hefty amount of damage, so you can only rocket jump once before you blow yourself up. Trivia [ ] The Bomb was added to Standard as an actual weapon in the September Update before being removed due to possible backlash. The Entertainer and Performer skins (and their Jester counterparts) have this as their signature weapon. The Bomb was broken in the Projectiles Party gamemode. But later this was now has fixed. All: 0 Bomber: 1000 Gamemodes Bombfest Firing Mode Single Special Tracer Shot Knock-Back Kill Icon Creator MidnightKrystal The Bomb-Blaster is the main weapon used for the Bombfest gamemode, the model is similar to OddBall however unlike Oddball, Bomb-Blaster possesses tracer shots and stores infinite ammo. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros and Cons 3 Audio 4 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] When aiming at the supposed opponent; Bomb-Blaster can knock them back by 60% pre shot to prevent them from getting The Bomb and throwing it to the ring for successful goal. There are also one pre-use variations in which players can use to suit the best in a situation, they can be spawned on a green pad with a item cooldown of 15 seconds. Bomber is an explosive-type that can able to eliminate a single opponent (or more if the splash damage is registered on others) however unlike most of explosives in the main game, this cannot be used for rocket jumping thus doing so will instant kill the user. The range is also reduced by 45. They can be identified in a orange glow. Pully is a snatch-type that can only be used on the dropped bomb, this tolerates a teleportation of the bomb on user's hand upon a successful shot. They can be identified in a purple glow. Taser is a stun-type that shock a single opponent for 5 seconds straight before taking control again. They can be identified in a blue glow. Lastly, Thief is a theft-type that can be used to steal from an opponent or even a teammate holding the bomb. The range is also reduced by 45. They can be identified in a green glow. Pros and Cons [ ] Note: The pros and cons here only documented the gameplay of Bombfest gamemode. Default Bomber Pully Taser Thief Pros: Pushes opponents away upon shot. Unlimited use. Cons: Deals absolute zero damage against all sources. Pros: One-shot kill upon direct and splash contact. Cons: Users can easily kill themselves if not careful. Weapon range reduction. Unable to rocket jump. Pros: Able to snatch the dropped bomb upon a successful shot. Cons: Users can waste the ability if not careful to capture the bomb. Pros: Stun the opponent for 5 seconds. Opponent holding the bomb would drop the projectile upon a successful shot. Cons: Users can waste the ability if not careful to aim at a opponent. Pros: Steal the bomb from a opponent and a teammate. Cons: Users can waste the ability if not careful to aim at a opponent. Weapon range reduction. Normal: 101-103 (285) Charged: 120 (360) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Bows Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Hard Mode Firing Mode Single Projectile Special Fall-off Projectile Arch Charge Shot Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Bow is a weapon added in the 4th of July Update . It features a charge mechanic that ups its damage the more it is charged. Just like the Crossbow, it travels in an arc and has a ramp-up feature. This makes it effective to use in long-range. When using this weapon, players should take full advantage of the "pull-back" feature. The bolt/arrow travels further and does more damage this way, one-shooting the enemy on a full charge. Players should use it like how they would use the crossbow: long-range sniping. Due to the fact that it is charge shot, it's not recommended to take the Bow into close quarters, as players can easily be killed while charging. However, the Bow should not be pulled back for too long. Once the Bow hits full-charge, the velocity of the fired arrow will slowly decrease as the arrow is over-charged. When the arrow fully charges up, it must be aimed to release it as fast as possible, otherwise, it will not go very far. However, if one does have to get into close quarters, tap shooting is a viable option, with a 2-shot kill. However, the Bow's range goes down severely, so not charging up the weapon should only be used in emergency close-range situations. The right mouse button can be used while charging the arrow to cancel the drawing. This is only used to save ammo or to switch weapons without firing. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: All arrows will insta-kill, charged or not. Charge mechanic allows for more damage the longer the fire is held. Decently fast charge time. Projectile will travel further on a higher charge level. Fall-off helps deal more damage. Cons: Slow fire rate. Charging for too long will decrease the arrow's velocity and effectiveness. Bow shots cannot be pre-charged without efficiency being lost due to arrow overcharge. Tips [ ] The Bow requires you to be calm (and have a little bit of luck) in order to get a kill. Unlike the other weapons, jumping around and flicking your aim won't help. Staying in one place and shooting is your only viable strategy. Without charging up, the Bow hits opponents at close-range. However when charged, it hits at long-range. This allows for quick reactions if confronted up close, and calm, calculated shots if sniping far away. As mentioned before, all arrows will insta-kill, no matter the charge or if it lands on head or body. Use the charge for distance rather than damage. Work on your ability to predict. Try guessing where an opponent is running to and send an arrow in that direction. This is easier against opponents running in a straight line, or is approaching you directly. Unless you have no other option, don't try to hit any opponents that are constantly running and jumping around. The Bow is useless against opponents that are on a higher platform than you. Aim for opponents that are on your height level. You can attempt to hit the opponent with an uncharged shot, as the arrow's heavy arch angle will be more likely to land it. Do note that this may be tricky as you'll mostly be shooting from a blindspot if directly below the opponent. On the other hand, the Bow is effective if you're above, and your opponents are below. For a bigger chance of success, use the Bow against groups of opponents that are close together instead of trying to hit a single target. If all else fails, remember that you can resort to melee combat with your Knife . This especially comes in handy during the Gun Rotation gamemode if everyone has the Bow. If you move unpredictably, you can dodge and weave between flying arrows and attempt to backstab opponents. If you're coming to Arsenal as a Typical Colors 2 player, the Bow is nearly the exact same as the Huntsman that the Marksman uses. However, the Bow deals way more damage, with all of its arrows being able to insta-kill without aiming for the head. Nevertheless, use the Bow exactly as you would the Huntsman. Gallery [ ] Development of the Bow. Trivia [ ] The Bow was listed as Compound Bow in the DevForum post of July Update . The Bow has the fastest reload in the game. The Bow is the signature weapon of the Spidra and Waike Delinquent skins . The Bow is used to utilize the same sounds and mechanics as Team Fortress 2's Huntsman. The Bow in-game is more specifically known as a Compound Bow, using a system of cables and pulleys to bend the weapon's limbs. The Bow along with the Pocket Potassium , the Golden Gun , the Musket , the M79 , the M16A2 's grenade launcher, and the RPG are the only weapons in the game that carries a single only one round. The Bow can be fired after a match ends if it is fully charged. However, it cannot deal damage. 28-40 (100) Gamemodes Standard Firing Mode Bolt-action Special Scope Kill Icon Creator Bluay Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Gallery 3 Pros & Cons 4 Trivia 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The C14 Timberwolf (simply known as Marksman Sniper in Gun Game and also known as R700 in the Alpha ) is a Canadian made sniper made by the company PGW Defence Technology's Inc ( Prairie Gun Works ). In-game Information [ ] This weapon was very similar to that of the MS556 but was lower in body shot damage. Because it was added in quickly, ROLVe possibly didn't get a chance to balance it. It was super easy to obliterate enemy's because of its ammo pool and its higher damage. Also, it was a perfect weapon for the gun-knife combo. Gallery [ ] A Solid Color C14 Timberwolf. C14 in real life. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast fire rate. Crosshair was available. One-shot kill to the head. Sniper scope helps players pick off from longer ranges. Cons: Low body damage. Trivia [ ] C14 Timberwolf is one of an few archived weapons that still persisted their Gun Game design. The in-game model is the Remington 700 . The C14 didn't have an inspect animation and had a choppy reload animation, this was possibly due to this weapon being added so late in the game. The C14 was the only Canadian made weapon in the game. Per Pellet 6 (13) Pellets Per Shot 9 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Pump-Action Special Fall-off HUD Icon Creator nettimato Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Informaton 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] An American-made prototype shotgun, the Calico is a dangerous weapon with an absurdly large 25-round helical magazine, with a spare magazine in reserve. In-game Informaton [ ] The Calico fires a typical 9-pellet spread, with each dealing from 6 to 13 damage. As it is a shotgun, it is best used in closer ranges with targets. The Calico also has an extremely large 25-round helical magazine, and players will seldom need to reload when using it. However; should a player need to reload, the Calico's magazine fed nature lets them reload it quickly. It is also pump-action, so players will have to wait a brief period of time to re-pump the weapon after firing a shot. The Calico has an extremely wide pellet spread compared to other shotguns, making it so that you need to be very close to your intended target. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Largest magazine size in-class. Fastest reload time in-class. Very high damage or instant kill when close range. Firerate can be increased by double keying Cons: Slow rate of fire. Very wide pellet spread. Low damage per pellet. Tips [ ] The Calico is one of the more difficult Shotgun-class weapons to get a kill with, as it is only effective at very close range. Do not attempt to shoot from mid-range, as you will have to depend on luck rather than your aim to even land a hit. If shooting down at enemies from a higher platform, crouching will slightly ramp-up your damage. To make up for its range, the Calico's 25 shots per magazine and fast reload will help you win intense fights at close range. Gallery [ ] Calico in real life. Trivia [ ] The Calico Shotgun was a prototype 12-gauge pump-action shotgun showcased in 2012, during the SHOT Show . However, since then the manufacturer has not given any word about it; as such, it is assumed to have been canceled. Calico Light Weapons System , or simply Calico, is well known for their top-mounted, helical-feed magazines on all of their firearms. An example would be their Calico 9mm pistols, capable of holding 50 or 100-round magazines, or the Calico SMG, such as the Calico M960. The Calico was modeled by MAD STUDIO developer, nettimato, who also did the STEN , G11 , TOZ-106 , the Dual Shotguns , the Focus , the Stake Launcher and the Peppermint Rifle . The Calico has a delay before firing when switched or getting it, however, this was patched in the September Update . The Calico is the second shotgun that feeds from a magazine with the first being the MAG-7 and the third being the AA12 . 10-40 (11-46) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Firing Mode Automatic Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Candy Cane Miniguns are a Christmas-themed weapon. The weapon design resembles the Empty Shell LLC.'s XM556 Microgun with a pair of 6-rotary barrels. In-game Information [ ] The gun runs off a single ammo pool of 400 rounds, making it being a second highest ammo pool in the game after Minigun , the gun also fires 2 barrels at once without pause. The only drawback of this weapon is high spread, but it is not a problem if you are fighting in close to medium combat, and the consecutive firing of 4 bullets combined with the fast firerate means you are almost guaranteed to hit a target except in extreamly long range maps such as boulevard, lumberhouse, or diner. Because of its killing capabilities, it is one of the best weapons in the game. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. High ammo pool. 4 bullets per shot. Fixed spread pattern. No reloading required. No rev-up time. Cons: High spread penalty. Low minimum damage. Tips [ ] The Candy Cane Miniguns are a ridiculously powerful weapon, as it shoots very quickly, and each individual shot uses four bullets . To balance its firing speed and bullet usage, this weapon only deals 10-40 damage and its spread is very high. The Candy Cane Miniguns will absolutely dominate close-range fights. However, due to its spread, it's less viable at long-range. Luckily, this weapon has a fixed spread pattern, preventing users from having to predict which bullets will land. If firing from long-range, aiming for the upper-half of your target's body will make it more likely to deal headshot damage. Aiming for the head itself is less viable. If using the Candy Cane Miniguns in a gamemode without the promotion-on-kill mechanic (such as Randomizer or Gun Rotation), keep an eye out for ammo boxes to constantly refill your ammo, as this weapon does not have ammo reserve. Gallery [ ] Sketch. Drawn silhouette. Weapon render. Trivia [ ] Candy Cane Miniguns was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on December 18, 2020. This, along with its normal counterpart, the Minigun, are the only weapons in the game that shoot multiple bullets and are not considered shotguns. This is most likely inspired from the ROBLOX limited item known as the Candy Cane Launcher . 80 (direct hit) 60 (blast damage) 14 (self-damage) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Firing Mode Automatic Special Splash Damage Blast Jump Kill Icon Creator Bluay (Inspecting audio) Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.75 0.1 19.041 1 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY The Chord Tosser is a weapon that was added in the Summer Update III of Arsenal . It is an electric guitar that shoots team-colored sound waves, each one dealing a splash damage of 80. This weapon also features a unique blast-jump. Instead of shooting at the ground while jumping, the user simply needs to point towards the air and right-click , which will send them in the direction they are aiming. Although, this comes at the cost of 14 HP. Contents 1 Pros & Cons 2 Tips 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Fast fire-rate. Unlimited ammo capacity. Splash damage allows for area-of-effect kills. Blast-jump speed is fast. Cons: Moderately slow projectile speed. User can damage or kill themselves if not careful. Blast-jumping is fast enough to send users off the map. Tips [ ] The Chord Tosser is one of the most powerful weapons in Arsenal . Not only can it deal splash damage at a fast pace, it also has the ability to blast-jump. The best strategy for the Chord Tosser is to blast-jump, then start firing on opponents down below. This way, it will be easy for you to get a kill and hard for your targets to fight back. Remember that your projectiles have splash damage, so you can potentially get multiple kills if you target groups of enemies. To get insanely fast travel speed while mid-air, you have to do two blast-jumps , one after the other. The first one should be aimed upwards, which will throw you off the ground. The second should be pointed forwards (at a slight upward angle to stay in the air longer). This specific blast-jumping method will get you high in the air and circling around the map quickly. This will allow you to fire in all directions. This method also helps you to memorize the current locations of your opponents, so when you promote off the Chord Tosser you know where to go for your next kill. The Chord Tosser is also good to use defensively, as you can escape opponents quickly with a blast-jump. Trivia [ ] The Chord Tosser's model is based on the Fender Telecaster electric guitar. 37-50 1-2 (self-damage) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Concussion Mania Concussion Mania 2 Randomizer Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Bolt-action Special Rocket Jump Splash Damage Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Concussion Rifle is a bolt-action explosive carbine, modeled after the De Lisle carbine ; modified to fire explosive rounds. It is the sole weapon in the gamemode, Concussion Mania . The Concussion Rifle is a mix of a normal bolt-action rifle and a rocket launcher . It shoots explosives that operate similar to that of a rocket launcher, as each shot sends an explosive round. However, as the explosive-tipped rounds have the same velocity as any other bullet in the game, dodging the explosive blasts generated by the rounds is nearly impossible. If players utilize the decent blast radius of the Concussion Rifle's rounds, they can score multiple kills if a group of enemies are close together. It is also capable of rocket jumping , and is one of the most efficient weapons for doing so. Upon a player jumping and firing at their feet, they will only be dealt 1 damage and will fly upwards. This can also be used against enemies, albeit with 50 damage dealt instead of 1, sending them flying. If the player fails to rocket jump they will be dealt 2 damage. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Can send enemies flying off the map. High reserve ammunition. High damage. Very low self-damage when rocket jumping. Cons: Small 6-round magazine in general. Moderately slow reload. Does not have extra damage on impact hit. Users can damage themselves upon splash range. Tips [ ] The Concussion Rifle is one of the deadliest weapons in the entire game, as it immediately makes an explosion on wherever the user is aiming. In other words, this is a hitscan weapon, but instead of traditional bullets, it makes explosions. The traditional (and still effective) strategy with the Concussion Rifle is to use 1-2 of your shots to blast-jump, then while mid-air, shoot down at opponents still on the floor. You can blast-jump higher by rubbing against a wall while mid-air and then firing against that wall. In the Concussion Mania gamemode , the player that's the highest in the air has the biggest advantage as they can see everyone down below. The Concussion Rifle's extreme knockback have upsides and downsides. Because this weapon deals tiny self-damage, you can blast-jump to your heart's content. The knockback it does on opponents , on the other hand, will make it hard for you to track them when they're launched away. Opponents hit by the Concussion Rifle will have a hard time fighting back, as they get knocked back and it's more difficult to hit someone that's mid-air. Remember that it takes three explosions to kill an opponent. This is half of the Concussion Rifle's magazine. In Concussion Mania, reloading leaves you very vulnerable to opponents. Make sure to avoid reloading as much as possible by making your shots count. Trivia [ ] The weapon model the Concussion Rifle is using is the De Lisle carbine, a .45 ACP British firearm that is considered one of the quietest firearms ever made. It was mainly used during World War II in very limited quantities by specialist units. The De Lisle carbine in real life does not fire explosive shots. This weapon is tied with the Lightning Cannon for the lowest self damage while rocket jumping . This gun is one of the few guns that can be used for recovery from falling off the map (rocket jumping off the walls in Dizzy , scaling the boat and launching off the water in Aircraft ). Originally, this weapon did a flat 50 damage per explosion, killing opponents in only two shots. Originally, if a player had a frame unlocker, they would be able to zoom with the weapon, but this was patched in the August Update . Originally, this would do 20 self-damage while strafing. This weapon's old firing sound was taken from Classic 's old firing sound from Typical Colors 2 , which was taken from a Team Fortress 2 weapon with the same name. This is the signature weapon of Aviator skin . 63-77 (186-232) Gamemodes Standard Firing Mode Semi-automatic Creator Castlers The Creagle is a fictional, gold-colored variant of the Deagle exclusive for the developers due to it being very unbalanced. It was secretly added on May 24, 2019 and for Castlers as a joke before being removed a few hours later. The one which had been added publicly was on May 24, 2019 and was removed later was a Deagle re-skin. There is a developer exclusive new-variant Creagle called Golden Creagle . The visual difference between the Creagle and the Golden Creagle is that some parts of the weapon are grey while the Golden Creagle is all gold except for the grip. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Creagle is an exact reskin of the Deagle except it has no spread and recoil. It also makes Waluigi's "wah" sound when the player fires. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: No spread and recoil. High damage. Decent rate of fire. Cons: Low 7-round magazine capacity. Trivia [ ] This weapon was terminated from the game's code. Weapon History [ ] 05/24/19: Added into the game of Arsenal . 100-175 (310) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Bows Only Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Hard Mode Firing Mode Single-fire Projectile Special Fall-off Projectile Arch Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Crossbow is a ranged weapon using an elastic launching device similar to a bow; it consists of a bow-like assembly called a " prod ", mounted horizontally on a main frame called a " tiller ", which is hand-held in a similar fashion to the stock of a long gun. Crossbows shoot arrow-like projectiles called " bolts " or " quarrels" . A person who shoots crossbow is called a crossbowman or an " arbalist "(after the arbalest, a European crossbow variant used during the 12th century). In-game Information [ ] In-game, the Crossbow 's slow fire rate and projectile arch make it a really hard weapon to use, but when a player is hit, it is a rewarding experience. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Instant kill upon hit. No reloading required. High ammo pool. Cons: Slow fire rate. Projectile Arch can make it difficult to hit targets. Trivia [ ] Before a patch was made, ramp-up seemed to be non-existent, so the crossbow only did 50 damage on the body with 150 on a headshot. However, this bug went unnoticed for a few months as nobody but the developers knew that it was supposed to have distance decay. The Crossbow's model and animations were used for a Doctor primary, the Crusader's Crossbow in Typical Colors 2 . 8-92 Gamemodes Standard Firing Mode Automatic Kill Icon Creator Valve Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History General Information [ ] The CZ75 (simply known as Auto Pistol in Gun Game ) is made by Česká zbrojovka Uherský Brod ( CZUB ) in the Czech Republic. First introduced in 1975, it is one of the original "wonder nines" featuring a staggered-column magazine, all-steel construction, and a hammer-forged barrel. It has a good reputation amongst pistol shooters for quality and versatility at a reasonable price. In-game Information [ ] The play-style to this weapon is very similar to that of the G-18 at the time as it was another rapid-fire pistol. The spread is not a problem with this weapon nor the damage as it has decent damage for a pistol at that position in the game. The users expect that the weapon has low ammo capacity and high recoil, which makes long ranges shots harder to hit the opponents. The ideal strategy is to either walk around trying to find an enemy up close, or bait an enemy close to you. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Able to hold fire. Very high damage at close quarters combat. Cons: Low magazine and ammo capacities. High recoil. Low minimum damage. Trivia [ ] Sometimes, the attached magazine does not appear whenever the player level up to this weapon. During the Gun Game /ALPHA phases, the magazine does not appear on the pistol. The kill effect of the same name is applied to it. This sword has a range of 5 and a fire rate by 0.8. It has one of the highest damage outputs of the swords as it has ability to heal the user upon hitting the target by 35. Pros and Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Damage dealt return as health. Cons: Lack of backstab mechanic. Trivia [ ] It is the signature weapon of the Scarecrow, Farmer Scarecrow, Hallowed Scarecrow, Holiday Scarecrow, Seeker of Hearts(Classic) and Herobrine Delinquent skins. This sword is based off the Darkheart gear created by ROBLOX in October 13th, 2009.
