22-27 (75-150) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Firing Mode Semi-automatic Burst-fire (ADS) Special ADS Fall-off Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The French Chauchat ( Fusil Mitrailleur Modele 1915 CSRG ) or DB Chauchat was the French Army's standard light machine gun during World War I and while one of the first inexpensive and portable fully-automatic rifles, is generally thought of as being the worst machine gun ever put into service. Despite its poor public reputation, the weapon is functional outside of conditions where its faulty magazine design would cause jams and malfunctions. Notably, the weapon as it is represented in Arsenal is a fusion of two Chauchats. In-game Information [ ] In-game, the DB Chauchat is a double-barreled LMG. When using the weapon's AA sights, the DB Chauchat will deliver a 2-round burst, which will instantly kill a target upon a headshot if 2 shots connect. At longer ranges, it will take 5 shots to the body to kill an enemy. Even with the special burst fire, the Chauchat has a low rate of fire and moderately high spread, so the possibility of landing a burst may be at a low percentage. Although it has a notably quicker reload than other machine guns, it still has a very slow reload. Firing in automatic mode will give the weapon high spread and somewhat moderate recoil, along with a very low rate of fire. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High headshot damage. ADS allows for greater aim and a 2-burst mode. Fast reload for a machine gun. Low ammo consumption rate. Cons: Slow rate of fire. Low first-shot accuracy. High spread penalty unless using ADS. Long burst delay when using ADS. Slow movement speed. Moderate recoil. Lowest 40-round magazine capacity in-class. Long pullout time. Tips [ ] The DB Chauchat functions more like a Marksman Rifle than a Machine Gun. Instead of spraying bullets by holding down the firing button, you only shoot two at a time. Hence, this weapon won't exactly make any one-sided fights in your favor. The DB Chauchat's accuracy is questionable , as it generally does not shoot accurately. However, if you aim-down-sight (by right-clicking), its accuracy becomes viable. This means that it's best to not use this weapon at close-range to avoid moving your aim too much to hit your shots. Being at mid-range also makes it easier to hit headshots. The DB Chauchat's reload is incredibly slow, so it is especially important to get a kill before you empty a magazine. Holding out this weapon will make you slower. You can revert to your original speed by equipping your Knife . Gallery [ ] ADS DB Chauchat in real life. Trivia [ ] The main reason for the weapon's poor reputation is its many flaws. The Chauchat's open-faced magazine allowed debris to enter the weapon and cause clogging. Its poor component quality lowered reliability drastically. Parts of differing qualities were often mixed together. Overuse of the weapon to the point of overheating caused a lack of function. The Chauchat utilizes a muzzle booster/gas assist and a long recoil system (often seen in shotguns, and the only use of it in an automatic weapon). The poor design of the Chauchat is not entirely the fault of the weapon or its designers; the French had to reinvent the wheel in order to get around existing patents on gas-operated machine gun mechanisms. France's resulting creation was overcomplex and unreliable but got the job done. The Chauchat was one of the first light, automatic rifle-caliber weapons designed to be carried and fired by a single operator and an assistant, without a heavy tripod or a team of gunners. The DB Chauchat is one of the weapons that has the ability to ADS. The others are MK18 , the M14 EBR , the Falkor , the Vector , the Pulse Musket , and the DBS . The DB Chauchat is the fourth weapon with burst fire capability added to Arsenal . The DB Chauchat is also the second 2-round burst weapon added into Arsenal , the other is the XR15 . Due to a glitch, players cannot use the burst fire ability on mobile. Per Pellet 3-36 (6-41) Pellets Per Shot 11 (22) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Typical Colors Wild West Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Hackula Arcade Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Break-action Special Recoil Jump Double Burst Fall-off HUD Icon Creator Revenant3D (Current) Unknown (Previous) Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio 7 Weapon History 8 Sources General Information [ ] The DB Shotgun is a side-by-side double-barrel shotgun with two shells at the ready. Each shell fired from the shotgun via left-clicking will shoot out 9 pellets, dealing 12 damage per pellet at close ranges and 3 damage at long ranges. Right-clicking with the DB Shotgun in hand fires both barrels at once, doubling the number of pellets shot and knockback received while in the air. The DB Shotgun also grants players the ability to shotgun jump, as known as the recoil jump ability, providing a useful utility both into and out of combat. To shotgun jump, players will need to jump and fire at their feet by either left-clicking or right-clicking. This will launch them into the air, but controlling in mid-air can be rather difficult. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Has recoil jump ability. Extremely fast fire rate. Instant burst firing mode, allowing for higher damage. Fast reload. Cons: Low magazine tube size. Frequent reloads due to low tube size. Low minimum pellet damage. Massive recoil. Tips [ ] The best strategy for the DB Shotgun is to use first shot for a recoil jump, and use the second shot to kill an opponent. This weapon is not very effective at mid-range. Find ways to get closer to opponents. Doing a recoil jump and then pouncing on an oblivious opponent may be the way to go. The DB Shotgun may have a fast reload, but beware that it's not fast enough to reload in an intense fight against an opponent. If you're coming to Arsenal as a Typical Colors 2 player, the DB Shotgun is a bit different than the Lupara DB. Both weapons still need to be used at close-range in order to deal serious damage. However, while the Lupara DB can still somewhat deal good damage at mid-range, the DB Shotgun cannot. The DB Shotgun has a unique ability to fire both barrels at once by right-clicking, dealing more damage and making it more likely to get kills. Trivia [ ] According to the model's creator, Revenant, the DB Shotgun's model is based on the Super Shotgun from DOOM Eternal , created by Mark Van Haitsma , and the Double Barrel Shotgun from Pavlov VR , created by Emmanuel Marshal . [ 1 ] The weapon was wielded with one hand prior to its current model. The previous model can still be seen as a worldmodel. The old DB Shotgun was taken from Typical Colors 2 , where it is used by the Flanker class and is known as the Lupara DB . Strangely, the animations of the shotgun were specifically changed for use in Arsenal. They are still the same in Typical Colors 2 . It is based on Team Fortress 2's " Force-A-Nature ". Both can also use their recoil to perform a double/triple jump. This reference is still prevalent, despite the change of model. It is one of 3 weapons that is capable of recoil jumping, the others being the DBS and the Barrett . The DB Shotgun, along with the Rocket Launcher , the Trench Gun , Peacemaker , Barrett , G-17 , the AUG , and the XR15 are the only primary weapons that appear in the Arcade gamemode. It is currently the shotgun with the fastest fire rate even without RMB, as RMB fires both shells simultaneously. This is the signature weapon of the Beach Bum, Campbell, Rough Houser, and Slayer skins. The badge "Evil no More" is obtainable by getting a double barrel shotgun kill with the Campbell character. The badge name, choice of character, and choice of the Double Barrel shotgun as the weapon is a reference to the Evil Dead horror series. The shotgun's old reload sound was taken from Stalker: Shadow of Chernobyl . Gallery [ ] Reload. Weapon Render. 100 (125) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Clown Infection Firing Mode Break-action Special Recoil Jump ADS Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The DBS (also known as Double-Barreled Sniper ) is an extremely powerful double-barreled weapon. It is an elephant barreled weapon that fires a large caliber bullet, which is the reason why it has a very long barrel. It instantly kills no matter how close or far players are from their target and does 114 on a headshot at any range. As it is a double-barreled rifle, the DBS can only load two rounds at a time. It is also equipped with a simple optical sight, which can be looked down upon by right-clicking. The fire rate is extremely fast, and players can expect an easy kill as long as they keep the aim true. Recoil jumping is possible with the DBS. It is able to launch players very far up into the air with every pull of the trigger. It can be performed by aiming down at the character's feet, jumping, and firing at the ground. Players will take no damage from this, so it's recommended to do this as often as possible to gain a height advantage. Despite looking like a shotgun, the DBS is essentially a two-barrel cannon, and thus the gun has no spread, requiring an accurate shot to kill. When reloading, the bullets being ejected and put into the barrels, if seen carefully, are actually rifle rounds. this proves that it is not a shotgun. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros Instant kill on any part of the body. Capable of recoil jumping . Fast rate of fire. Equipped with an optical sight. Quick reload speed. No spread. Cons Small 2-round ammo capacity. Optical sight has less zoom for its class. Hefty recoil upon firing. Frequent reloads due to low magazine tube size. Tips [ ] The DBS is both useful and dangerous to the user. It one-shots opponents, but its recoil can sometimes mess up your aim and movement. The DBS isn't as effective at long-range like the other Sniper Rifles, but it is able to successfully hit an opponent at mid-range. Its scope isn't as zoomed in as the other Sniper Rifles, so it can only let you see so far. A viable strategy for the DBS is to use one or both shots to find a higher place, then carefully shoot down at opponents below. You can also do the DB Shotgun's strategy to use the first shot to recoil-jump, then immediately use the second to get a kill. Do mind that this will make it a lot easier for opponents to kill you if you're not fast enough. Try not to jump and shoot at opponents, as the recoil can stop you from moving forward. Gallery [ ] ADS Reloading DBS in real life. Trivia [ ] While at first glance the DBS appears to just be a scaled-up version of the DB Shotgun, the DBS is actually a side-by-side elephant gun. It is a very large caliber firearm designed for big-game hunters. On reloading, the shells loaded into the breech are clearly and noticeably massive. In reality, such a gun would be uncontrollable when fired, as the recoil would tear the shoulder support off. Also, the muzzle energy from such a weapon would usually result in the user being concussed and deafened. The DBS's sounds are the same as the DB Shotgun , albeit slowed down and lowered in pitch. The DBS is based on the CZ Hammer Classic shotgun because of the exposed hammers and the shape of the stock. Killing the player with the DBS while in mid-air at 20 studs will get the "Elephants can't fly" badge. The DBS is one of the guns with ADS, the others are the MK18 , the M14 EBR , the Falkor , the Vector , the Pulse Musket , and the DB Chauchat . It is also the first sniper rifle to have an access to ADS while the Pulse Musket being the second. The DBS model was originally used for Marksman's primary weapon, the Poacher's Pride in Typical Colors 2 . This is one of 3 weapons that you can recoil jump with the others being the DB Shotgun and the Barrett . It is the signature weapon of Jockey, Arctic Excavator, Mamor, and Farmer skins. The sight on the DBS appears to be a Nydar Model 47, an early optical sight which first appeared in 1945. If aiming-down-sights with the DBS with the "Enemy Outlines" setting on, the outlines will not appear in the scope. Critical Damage Overview Magazine Ammo 7 21 Damage 62-77 (186-263) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Counter Blox Pistols Clown Infection Leagcy Competitive All Weapons Hackula Headshots Only Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall cXVIc3Q= Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Nredly (Current) Unknown (Previous, archived) Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.35 21.952 2 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 2.621 1 The Desert Eagle (colloquially known as the Deagle ), is a semi-automatic pistol, known for chambering the largest centerfire cartridge of any magazine-fed, self-loading pistol. It has also found fame through its portrayal in different FPS games including Valve's Counter Strike series and Activision's Call Of Duty series. Former American arms manufacturer, Magnum Research Inc. (MRI), designed and developed the Desert Eagle in the late 1970s. The design would later be refined by Israel Military Industries (IMI), which would also be responsible for manufacturing it until 1995, when the contract shifted by MRI to Saco Defense in Saco, Maine. In 1998, MRI regranted the manufacturing rights back to IMI. In 2005, IMI sold its small arms branch to the private holding company SK Group, where they would rename it to Israel Weapon Industries. Since 2009, the Desert Eagle Pistol has been produced in the United States at MRI's Pillager, Minnesota facility. Kahr Arms acquired Magnum Research in 2010. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] A pistol chambered for various magnum cartridges, the Deagle is a powerful pistol with both intense body and headshot damage. It is able kill an opponent with two shots at anywhere on the body, and deliver an instant kill on the head. However, the Deagle's damage comes with drawbacks. It has the small 7-round magazine. Spamming with the Deagle easily expends ammo, even though the fire-rate is slow for its class and the reload time is fast. The Deagle also has a high recoil, which can obstruct the users' aim. If faced in the situation where range is involved, try not to spam fire and aim for the head. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Has low spread. Fast reload. One shot-kill on the head. Cons: High recoil. Small magazine size. Slow rate of fire. Tips [ ] As with any first-person shooter the Deagle has appeared in, this weapon's most infamous trait is the high recoil. Spamming your shots will make it impossible to land any hits, so you'll need to space out your shots as much as possible. Use the Deagle at close-range so you can quickly two-shot nearby opponents. If at mid-range, take careful aim so you can land a headshot. At longer ranges, crouch so your aim is easier to control and get a headshot. Gallery [ ] In third person. A Solid Color Deagle. Deagle in real life. Previous Deagle in real life. Trivia [ ] The version in-game seems to fire a .50 AE cartridge, based on the 7-round magazine capacity. Although the barrel looks thinner than it's supposed to be. The current and archived version appears to be based on the Mark VII . The previous version in-game appears to be the Mark XIX , owing to the Picatinny rail placed on the top of the barrel. Sometime in May 2019, the Creagle variant of the Deagle was secretly added into Arsenal by Castlers, but was eventually removed one day later. It is the signature weapon of the Festive Partygoer, Fro, Fro Vice, Holiday Panda, Partygoer, Red Pand,a and Soccer Star skins . Before the Summer Update , the Deagle used the same firing sound effect present of the Deagle from the Counter-Strike series. This was eventually changed to the sound the Deagle used in another popular ROLVe game, Counter Blox . The archived version was called the " Desert Eagle ". The model was also used for the archived version of the Golden Gun. The Pre-Alpha/Alpha version was taken from Counter Blox: Roblox Offensive another ROLVe project. Deagles are typically colored silver, but black versions exist as well. Popular movies such as The Matrix and Austin Powers feature the Deagle. The Dispenser is a plastic stick that holds small candies inside with a Delinquent head on top that can be pressed down on; the Dispenser always throw out candies, while the users pressed on the Delinquent head. The Dispenser holds 18 candies in a clip with 72 ammo in reserve, even though they are not bullets. Its damage is quite low, doing 20 per candy, meaning that it can kill an enemy with 5 shots. However, it is an automatic projectile weapon so it can instantly kill an enemy. Due to its fire rate, it can also quickly expend its magazine capacity of 18. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Decent clip size. Fast auto fire rate. High ammo reserve. Cons: Low damage. Has projectile arch, making it harder to hit enemies. Magazine will easily be expended due to its fire rate. Gallery [ ] Stage one development. Stage two. Stage three. Stage four. Trivia [ ] Dispenser was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on October 3rd, 2020. The Dispenser is one of the joke weapons along with the Literal Gun , the Pocket Potassium , the Potassium Power , the Origami Gun , the Very Long Bat and the TP Launcher . The Dispenser is based on the PEZ dispenser candy . The firing sound for the Dispenser is the same firing sound used for the Baseball Launcher a little bit in higher pitch. 45-56 (135-180) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Headshots Only Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Kean1sh Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Dragunov sniper rifle is a semi-automatic designated marksman rifle chambered in 7.62×54mmR and developed in the Soviet Union for use as a designated marksman rifle, or DMR. As most Soviet troops were equipped with submachine guns and assault rifles, the Dragunov could provide long-range firepower to support the troops far in front of its barrel. In-game Information [ ] The Dragunov can be seen as a counterpart to the Western Bloc rifles, such as the M1 Garand . Players can expect a minimum three-shot kill on the body, a guaranteed one-shot kill on the head, and a high magazine capacity similar to rifles such as the M1A1 Carbine . What makes the Dragunov stand out from the others though is its fast reload time and its fast rate of fire. Because of its similarity to other semi-auto rifles, the Dragunov suffers from the same problem: the high spread penalty. Players will have to tap fire to make every shot count, although aiming for the head or going closer makes up for it. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. High damage. High magazine capacity. Fast reload time. Cons: Slow movement speed. High spread upon continuous shots. Tips [ ] The Dragunov is one of the Marksman Rifles with the fastest (if not the fastest) firing speeds the game. It shoots only slightly slower than any Pistol-class weapon. Its damage range 45-56 damage, which will even let you quickly beat an opponent holding a Pistol-class weapon. However, the Dragunov is also the slowest movement-speed Marksman Rifle, so traversing through the map may be difficult. Remember that you can revert to your original speed by equipping with your Knife instead. The Dragunov is best at close-range to ensure that its high spread of bullets will be more likely to hit opponents. You can try to fire a shot from a long-distance, but you will have to take careful aim. A headshot from any range will reward you with a guaranteed kill. Trivia [ ] The Dragunov also appears in the beta version of the game. But the beta version is called the SVD and is equipped with a PSO-1 scope to it. When it was released, the Dragunov has the appearance of the M14 in third person. The Dragunov's spread is no more the same as the FN FAL . Originally the killicon for this weapon was a placeholder, using a similar killicon to map hazards and suicides. The killicon was later changed to the M14. The Dragunov model came from ROLVe's other game, Typical Colors 2 as the Classic . The damage and some sounds in Dragunov are similar to the SKS Rifle. Gallery [ ] Dragunov in real life. In-Game Information [ ] The Dual Berettas had a great fire-rate and a low damage. The spread was moderate, compared to the PRISMAS . They carried 30-round magazine capacity with 60 ammo in reserve. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. Decent reload speed. High magazine size. Cons: Moderate high spread. Low minimum damage. Trivia [ ] The Dual Berettas are inspired from the weapon with the same name in CS:GO . This weapon at the time did less damage than its single version, the M9. This was the first dual-wielded weapon in Arsenal . The Dual Berettas made a re-appearance in MURDER inside the reception room in Miami . 36-60 (50-75) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Double-action Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.15 22.401 1.9 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 1.31 1 The Dual LCRs are a pair of Ruger LCR revolvers. The LCR itself is a compact revolver built by Sturm, Ruger & Company . The name in LCR stands for " Lightweight Compact Revolver ". It incorporates several novel features such as a polymer grip and trigger housing, monolithic receiver and constant force trigger. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] Added in the Summer Update III , the pairs shoot at least a bullet per fire, dealing a 36 damage on the body and 50 damage on the head at long range. In close range, this weapon can 2-shot kill on the body, while a single shot in the head. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Tight spread. High damage in close range. Faster fire-rate. Cons: Somewhat lengthy reload. Magazine is quickly emptied due to its fast fire-rate. Tips [ ] The Dual LCRs accuracy, damage, and firing speed make it a deadly weapon at intense fights, especially against other Pistols. However, the crushing downside is its reload, which takes approximately 3.5 seconds. This leaves you wide open for a free kill during intense fights. When confronting an opponent at close-range, quickly empty out your shots to get the kill without getting damaged. At longer ranges, however, it's best to space out your shots. Remember that the Dual LCRs' reload is particularly slow, so you need to avoid reloading as much as possible. Gallery [ ] Stage one development. Stage two. Stage three. Stage four. Stage five. Final model creation. Ruger in real life. Trivia [ ] The Dual LCRs along with the PRISMAS , the Dual Shotguns , the Dual Volcanics , and the Micro Uzis are the only dual-wielded weapons in current Arsenal . It is also the first dual-wielded revolver to be added to Arsenal . These weapons were going to be called the Ruger , but it was renamed to Dual LCRs later due to being dual-wielded. Per Pellet 3-42 (8-108) Pellets Per Shot 24 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off HUD Icon Creator nettimato Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The High Standard Model 10A (also known as the Dual Shotguns ) are pair of dual-wielding shotguns by the USA company, High Standard Firearms, from 1967 to 1977. They were introduced in the Summer Update II . In-game Information [ ] The Dual Shotguns are similar to the DB Shotgun , having a high pellet count, a fast rate of fire, and low damage. Despite its main con of doing low damage, the rate of fire and pellet count make up for it, doing above average damage at close and medium range. However, for the sake of balance, the low damage per pellet will still be a problem as seen by shooting. It also has a gruesome reload, among the slowest in the game, and can be a major problem if spraying doesn't kill the enemy. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. High pellet count. Decent ammo capacity. 2-by 2-reloading allows topping off. High maximum damage per pellet Cons: Low minimum damage per pellet. Long reload time. Tips [ ] The Dual Shotguns are one of the easiest (if not the easiest) Shotgun-class weapons to get a kill with, due to their bigger and fixed pellet spread. The pellet spread makes this weapon viable from any distance, from close-range to nearly long-range. However, this does not mean you can snipe someone from across the map, so don't waste time trying to do so. Do not get too cocky when using the Dual Shotguns, as its overpowered shots are balanced out by its slow reload. Avoid losing all of your shots if possible. Gallery [ ] The Dual Shotguns in real life. Trivia [ ] The Dual Shotguns are the 4th dual-wielded weapons to be added to Arsenal , the others being the Dual Volcanics , the PRISMAS , Micro Uzis and the Dual LCRs . It is also the first dual-wielded shotgun to be added to Arsenal . Unlike other dual-wielded guns in the game, the dual shotguns use a different model in each hand. This is due to the bullpup design, as firing the right-handed model from your left hand (or vice versa) would cause spent casings to be ejected at the shooter. This is the fifth weapon that was made by MAD STUDIO developer, nettimato, others being the Calico , the G11 , the STEN , the TOZ-106 , the Focus , and the Stake Launcher . The Dual Shotguns is one of the 4 bullpup weapons in the game along with the AUG , the L86A3 , and the FAMAS . The Dual Shotguns has the most pellets out of all the shotguns in the game after the DB Shotgun . 35-105 (87-131) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Wild West Pistols Kill Confirmed Juggernaut Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Lever-Action Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.6 0.35 22.401 1.5 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 2.621 1.5 The Dual Volcanics are a pair of American-made lever-action repeater pistols made by Volcanic Repeating Arms . It is a pistol version of Volcanic's famous lever action rifles. The first design was in 1854, where partners Horace Smith and Daniel B. Wesson, worked on the Smith & Wesson lever pistol. After this, they formed a firearms company named Smith & Wesson, which was then changed to Volcanic Repeating Arms, until Oliver Winchester (one of their biggest investors) forced the company out of business, and took the assets to make New Haven Arms Company in April 1857, which was responsible for the making of the Henry Rifle . Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Dual Volcanics deal a damage range of 35-105; 35 is being dealt upon a long-range body shot, while 105 is being dealt at closer ranges, instantly killing an opponent. They also require two headshots to kill at longer ranges, due to the weapon dealing 87 damage upon an accurate long-range headshot. It is worth mentioning the Volcanics come with a spread penalty upon successive shots and a slow rate of fire, meaning that players will have difficulty hitting targets beyond medium ranges. The Volcanics come with a large 16-round ammo pool, with 8 cartridges in each pistol. While this capacity comes as an advantage in prolonged fights, upon the expenditure of all ammunition, players will have to suffer through a lengthy reload process. This is due to rounds having to be loaded individually, 2 rounds loaded into the pistols every couple of seconds. Every shot must count as the Dual Volcanics are infamous for having the longest reload, standing at eighteen seconds or three times the reload of the Musket if the magazine tube is empty. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High ammo capacity. High damage. 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. Large magazine size for its class. Cons: Relatively slow rate of fire. High spread upon continuous shots. Grueling 18-second empty reload time. Tips [ ] The Dual Volcanics are a very technical weapon. It deals respectable damage, but its reload is very, very slow. Unlike most of the other Pistols, the Dual Volcanics reloads its ammo one bullet at a time. And since it takes 2 seconds to reload 2 bullets and there are 16 per magazine, well... Due to its slow reload, the Dual Volcanics identifies as a "one-and-done" weapon, which will push users to get a kill without reloading if possible. The Dual Volcanics will only get you a kill at close-range. At this distance they deal hefty damage, but if you get very close it will one-shot kill opponents. At mid-range, you'll only deal at least 35 damage. This won't guarantee any kills, but you can attempt to get an assist if a teammate helps you kill your target. Its slow firing speed makes you weaker at intense fights. Try to sneak and get a close-range kill to avoid getting shot at. Gallery [ ] In third person. The Volcanic Pistol in real life. Trivia [ ] The Volcanics in-game can be found in real life as the Volcanic Repeating Pistol , firing either a .31 or .41 caliber "Rocket-ball" cartridge. It was manufactured by Smith & Wesson , known at the time as " Volcanic Repeating Arms Company ". The Rocket-ball cartridge the Volcanics use is often seen as underpowered, with muzzle energy being 56 pounds per foot compared to the 9mm being 383 pounds per foot of energy. This weapon's spread increases each time when fired, which makes no sense as the pistols alternate shots. One pistol firing should not affect the other pistol's spread. The Volcanics along with the PRISMAS , the Dual Shotguns , Dual LCRs and Micro Uzis are the only dual-wielded weapons in current Arsenal . This is the signature weapon of the Alchemist Plague Doctor, Beckoned Pirate, Halloween Vampire, Pirate, Plague Doctor & Vampire skins. The Dual Volcanics has the longest empty magazine reload time in the entire game, with a whopping 18-second reload, triple the time it takes to reload the Musket which takes 6 seconds. The Dual Volcanics almost makes the same exact sound as the PRISMAS but is more lower-pitched and the sound passes slowly with a very audible sound. The Dual Volcanics are the only lever-action weapon in the game that do not allow their wielder to double jump. The Dual Volcanics used to not have its firing sound effect. 48-130 (1-2 self-damage) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Slaughter Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Splash Damage Kill Icon Creator Unknown Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.2 22.401 2.7 PROJECTILE SPEED BLAST RADIUS 5.11 The Electric Revolver is an electrical version of either the S&W M10 or the Colt New Service revolver. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] Added in the Anniversary Update of Arsenal . It is a powerful fictional automatic revolver made up with electric bullets that can kill an enemy in three hits at long ranges and one at close range. Firing with the Electric Revolver lacks spread and does not headshot. Shots came with splash damage allowing players to kill multiple people with it; the particles are seen distinctively. It is also automatic, so players who hold their mouse down will experience a fast rate of fire. It also has a low ammo capacity, meaning that going full auto will expend its ammo in a few seconds. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Fast rate of fire. Has area-of-effect damage. Has no spread. One shot at close range. Cons: Fast ammo consumption rate. Splash damage can damage or kill the user. Small magazine capacity. Slower reload compared to other revolvers. No headshot multiplier. Tips [ ] The Electric Revolver is essentially a weaker version of the EM249 , keeping the same AOE damage and fast fire-rate, but with a very small magazine size. Remember that you do not need to aim directly, but rather at an opponent's feet to deal damage with this weapon. This weapon can be used at any range, as it's good for sniping from a distance or one-shotting up close. This weapon may shoot automatically, but it's best to only shoot one or two at a time to avoid its slow reload. Trivia [ ] The Electric Revolver to be either based on the earlier models of the S&W M10 or the Colt New Service revolver. When it was released, the Electric Revolver had the appearance of a Windicator in third person. The killicon formerly used an icon of a Windicator. The Electric Revolver is one of the automatic pistols along with the G-18 , the TEC-9 , the Little Tom , and the Falkor . It is also the first automatic revolver to be added into Arsenal . The speed loader is still visible on the player's arm if they turn their FOV to 110 or above on settings. Electric Revolver is the sole weapon in Slaughter gamemode. It supposed to represent as a taser for the event. It also essentially has only one ammo in its magazine for the gamemode, with more ammo being available by finding and picking them up. 13-135 (1-2 self-damage) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Splash Damage Fall-off Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Not to be confused with the M249 . Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The EM249 is an electric variant of the M249 and was added during the Anniversary Update . Some changes to it include the stock completely cut off, electric ammo, made of different materials, and more. The EM249's high magazine capacity allows users to not suffer from frequent reloads. Its fast rate of fire and no spread means that the players will be shredded in a few seconds. However the EM249's low minimum damage, sluggish movement speed, reload time, and the absence of a headshot multiplier means killing enemies might be slower. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Very high ammo capacity of 100. Fast rate of fire. Splash damage allows for area-of-effect kills. Has no spread. High damage at close ranges. Cons: Users can damage or kill themselves if they are close to the splash damage. Sluggish movement speed. Grueling reload time. No headshot multiplier. Low minimum damage. Tips [ ] This weapon does not have headshot damage. Instead, aim for an enemy's feet to let the splash-damage effect of each bullet hit. This weapon is good to use from any distance, however it excels the most at long-range. Because there's no spread, you can easily deal more damage than any opponent that is firing back at you. If you fight an enemy at close range and the EM249's bullets accidentally damage you, pick up your enemy's dropped health kit before moving on. This will guarantee your survival, especially in the Randomizer gamemode. This weapon has 100 bullets in one clip, but in turn the reloading speed is very, very slow. If you end up reloading this weapon, it is recommended that you find a safe place to hide first, as you'll be vulnerable in more open areas. Gallery [ ] Development of the weapon. Trivia [ ] EM249 was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on November 17, 2019. Its counterpart, the M249 , was removed from Arsenal after the re-haul update. The M249 was later readded in Summer Update III . This gun was made in the morning of the day of the Anniversary Update. It's the reason why there used to be a placeholder kill icon and no reload sounds. When it was first added to the game, the EM249 has the appearance of the M60 in third person. The killicon used to have an icon of the M60, now the EM249 had received an official killicon. The bullets on the reloading animation are currently broken. Its model and animations were used for the M249 in Typical Colors 2 , but recolored, without electric bullets, and with a stock. After the EM249 had no spread in the Community-Ops Update , the crosshair would still expand just like when it had spread. However, in the Summer Update II , the crosshair no longer expands. Unlike its bullet counterpart, the EM249 has no stock. The EM249 makes an appearance in the RPG Event as the weapon used by the Cover Unit enemy. It even stayed true to its original stats, dealing massive damage against the Heroes. 100-684 67 (self-damage) Gamemodes Hard Mode Insane Mode Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Special Charged Shot Rocket Jump Kill Icon The Explosive Barrel is a weapon that was added in Halloween Update III . It is a re-skin of the Bomb that can be used exclusively in Hard / Insane Mode. Contents 1 Pros & Cons 2 Tips 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Explodes on impact. Instantly kill an enemy upon blast. Ability to cook the bomb by holding RMB. Explosive area-of-effect capability allows for collateral kills. Ability to rocket jump. Infinite ammunition. No reloading required. Cons: Users can easily kill themselves if not careful. Sluggish 2.5-second cooldown. High self-damage upon rocket jump. Tips [ ] The Explosive Barrel is a very dangerous weapon, as it insta-kills both opponents and the user. Make sure to throw your Barrels far away from you as possible to avoid blowing yourself up. Tapping the fire-button will immediately throw your Explosive Barrel, exploding within 1 second. Throwing Barrels with a 1 second timer will often explode in mid-air, so you this attack works best at close-range to make sure the Barrel gets a kill. (Remember not to get too close as the explosion can kill you too) Holding down the right-click button will give your Explosive Barrel a 4 second timer. Letting go of the button will throw it. Use this attack to throw Barrels at opponents who are at a good distance away from you. This means not at close-range. Beware that you cannot throw another Barrel until the first has exploded, so make sure to use this attack wisely. When using the 4-second attack for the Explosive Barrel, work on your timing. When you should let go of the right-click button depends on how far your target is from you. Immediately throwing is best for killing players at long-range. It can even hit an opponent on the other side of smaller maps. Throwing when there's 2-3 seconds left is best for opponents at mid-range. The Explosive Barrel has the fastest rocket jump in the game. Tapping the fire-button while aiming below you will initiate a rocket jump. However , you will travel forward instead of upward. You can use this to get to the other side of bigger maps very quickly. Beware that rocket jumping will deal a hefty amount of damage, so you can only rocket jump once before you blow yourself up. Unlike the Bomb, the Explosive Barrel is slightly heavier and less bouncy. Make sure to adjust your aim for this. Trivia [ ] The Explosive Barrel previously does not deal any damage to enemies, the user can take damage from this weapon however. The Bomb's kill icon was used as a placeholder until the Explosive Barrel got a kill icon of its own. 18-37 (31-120) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special ADS Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.15 22.401 3.1 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0.873 2.184 1.2 The Falkor FG-9 is an American AR-15 pistol that is produced by a relatively small firearms company in Montana, USA called Falkor Defense. It was made to capitalize with the increase in popularity of pistol carbines. To date, there is not much information about the FG-9, with the only semi-useful info being on its store page. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Falkor was added during the Sci-Fi Update of Arsenal. It has a sight that helps to aim at the opponents easier. However, it has a limited magazine of 17, and its hip-firing causes the spread to go high. Hip-firing is not suggested because of the amount of spread it has. Instead, using the holo-sight is very much suggested because it makes spread much better to control. The Falkor has an accessible sight when you right-click on your mouse for PC or press "LT" for Xbox . Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Accessible sight. Good close-quarters combat (CQC) damage. Larger magazine size compared to other pistols. Decent rate of fire. Cons: High spread upon hip-firing. Low minimum damage. Moderately slow reload. High muzzle flash while using sight, which may obstruct tracks. Tips [ ] The Falkor's accuracy is really, really bad. This limits its effective distance to only close-range. If you ADS with the Falkor, you can fire more accurately from mid-range. However, this weapon is completely useless at long-range, even if you ADS. Its spread is way too high for it to kill any opponents far away. Don't ADS when at close-range so you can easily aim and track the position of your target. Using ADS will limit your vision, allowing opponents to take advantage of you. The Falkor may have a fast reload, but it's not fast enough to let you reload in the middle of an intense fight. While reloading the Falkor, your opponent can easily kill you. Make your shots count. You only have 17 per magazine, and you'll often run out of ammo at the worst time possible. Make sure that whoever you're firing at can easily be killed. Opponents that are around a corner or are positioned above you are huge no-no's. Gallery [ ] ADS. Stage one development. Stage two. Stage three. Stage four. Falkor in real life without the sight. Trivia [ ] The weapon was revealed in the Arsenal Discord server during the Community-Ops Update development on May 3rd, 2020. The Falkor is one of several weapons able to aim down the sights, along with the MK18 , the M14 EBR , the DBS , the Vector , the Pulse Musket , and the DB Chauchat . The Falkor is also the first pistol to receive a sight attachment. The Falkor is one of the automatic pistols along with the G-18 , the Electric Revolver , the Little Tom , and the TEC-9 . When it was first released during the Sci-Fi Update , the Falkor had a whopping 30 bullets per magazine, and it shot way faster than today. Because of this, most of the playerbase considered the Falkor to be the best Pistol-class weapon in the game. However, this has since been nerfed to only 17 bullets per magazine and a slower firing rate when Summer Update III released, bringing us to today's Falkor. Some people often mistake the Falkor as an assault rifle due to the fact that it looks nothing like a traditional pistol. 20-28 (27-33) Gamemodes Standard Counter Blox Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator dev_keni (Current) Ev3rSoul (Previous) Valve (Archived) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The FAMAS is a bullpup assault rifle designed and manufactured in France by MAS located in Saint-Étienne, which is now a member of the French government-owned Nexter group. It is being replaced as the service rifle of the French military by the HK416F. It is known by French troops as Le Clairon (The Bugle) due to its distinctive shape. The FAMAS is recognised for its high rate of fire at 1,100 rounds per minute. In-game information [ ] In-game, the FAMAS 's major strength is its fast rate of fire that can shred enemies fast. Along with the decent damage, players can shred in under five shots that hit. However, the drawbacks are the high spread penalty, lowering its utility at longer ranges, the slightly small magazine size, and the long reload time. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. Decent damage. Cons: Slow reload speed. High spread penalty. Small magazine size for an assault rifle. High recoil. Tips [ ] The FAMAS is only effective during intense fights that take place at close-range. It's best to avoid players with a Sniper Rifle or Marksman Rifle, which are more powerful at long-range. Be a bit more careful at mid-range because the spread is more noticeable at this distance. Try to get a kill within the first clip, as the FAMAS' slow reload will make you very vulnerable to opponents. Gallery [ ] Development of the current version of the weapon. FAMAS in real life. Trivia [ ] FAMAS, along with L86A3 , were revealed on Twitter on September 8th, 2019. The FAMAS' full name is the " Fusil d'Assaut de la Manufacture d'Armes de Saint-Etienne ", which is translated in English to the " Assault Rifle from the Saint-Etienne Weapon Factory ". The design of the FAMAS in-game model appears as the FAMAS F1 , with a small trigger guard. In old Arsenal , the FAMAS model is the FAMAS G2 , a modernized version of the F1. It features the distinctively large trigger guard. Uniquely, these 2 models use 2 different types of magazines. The F1 uses a proprietary magazine, while the G2 uses standard AR-15 magazines. When this weapon was being tested, it would only do as little as 2 damage from far ranges excluding headshot. This was a bug in the Community Testing Environment version, and developers fixed it. The FAMAS is one of the 6 bullpup weapons in the game along with the AUG , L86A3 , P90 , Dual Shotguns , and the Tavor . The FAMAS is also featured in " Counter Blox ", another game developed by ROLVe . Before the weapons were released, it can be seen in one of GDILIVES' (now JOHN ROBLOX) videos. It does only 4 damage to 2 at far range. The FAMAS is an ambidextrous gun, meaning left-handed shooters and right-handed shooters can use the FAMAS with equal ease. The FAMAS was introduced in 1978, replacing the MAT-49 for the French Military. This weapon was originally seen in Bluay's gun test. The firing sound of the FAMAS was taken from the Sturmgewehr 44 ( STG-44 ) from another ROLVe game, Unit 1968 . Both of them use the PM MD 63 Romanian AK (with a wooden grip) sound taken from a 2005 game Project Reality. Its model and sounds have remained unchanged since the September Update. Though, only the model of the weapon would eventually be changed in the 10 Year Anniversary Update The previous model lacks the grenade launcher sight, and 2 fire selectors (one in front of the trigger, and one behind the magazine release). 20 Gamemodes All Special Demotion Double Jump Boost Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Fasticuffs is a modified version of the Fisticuffs melee, doing a fast amount of punches while playing a Dragon Ball Z punching sound effect and having lightning particles emit from the player's hands. This melee weapon has fast punches, however, it has low damage. These traits are similar to the Squeaky Hammer . Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of punches. Double jump ability. Boosted walk speed. Ability to demote players on kill. Cons: Lowest damage out of every other melees. Requires 5 hits to kill unlike other melees. Trivia [ ] The Fasticuffs is a reference to the Lightning Fists that Vegito has in the Dragon Ball franchise. This deals the least damage per hit out of every melee weapon in the game, if including admin-exclusive weapons. Otherwise, it is the Squeaky Hammer . This used to be the signature weapon of the Weeb Delinquent, before being replaced by the Ban Hammer. When a player punches an object with the Fasticuffs, Dragon Ball Z punching sounds will be played. 57 (76 on direct hit) (11 self-damage) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Juggernaut All Weapons Firework Launcher Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Firing Mode Semi-automatic Projectile Special Rocket Jump Splash Damage Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Firework Launcher launches fireworks from a 4-round magazine, acting somewhat like a Rocket Launcher with faster firing, longer reload time, and less damage. It takes up to two hits to kill a player. It will also launch nearby players on impact. Precision and accuracy with the rockets are required for a successful kill. Compared to most explosive weapons in Arsenal , the Firework Launcher deals lower self-damage, has less ammunition, reloads longer, deals less damage, and cannot jump as high, but it fires slightly faster. Due to weapon's tendency to launch other players on impact, the weapon may pose a greater threat in close combat, especially in small, closed spaces. It will lack in wide, open spaces. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Low self-damage when rocket jumping. Launching enemies may result in cheap kills via launching them off the map or into hazards. Fast projectile speed. Capable of rocket/recoil jumping . Cons: Very small 4-round magazine. Sluggish reload time. Fires a projectile, meaning that timing is key. Users can kill themselves if not careful. No one-shot capability, unlike most other explosive weapons. Launches players, making it harder to land a consecutive hit. Gallery [ ] Firework Launcher in real life as the M202. Trivia [ ] This gun is inspired by the M202 Flash , but shortened significantly for handheld use. The first firing sound effect is inherited from the Black Box in Team Fortress 2 . The previous firing sound effect was inherited from the Air Strike in Team Fortress 2. Its model and animations were used for the weapon now removed, the Incendiary Cannon an primary weapon for Arsonist in Typical Colors 2 . This is the signature weapon of the Uncle Sam skin . This is the sole weapon in the Firework Launcher gamemode . The Firework Launcher fires faster while rocket/recoil jumping . 16-49 (41-61) Gamemodes Standard Classic Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Ramp-up Kill Icon Creator devkeni (2025) Valve (2016) Contents 1 General Information 2 In-Game Information 3 Pros & Cons 3.1 Current: 3.2 Archived: 4 Tips 5 Trivia 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The FN Five-seven (marketed as the Five-SeveN and simply known as Pistol in Gun Game ) is a Belgian weapon made by FN Herstal , Introduced in 1990. The Five-SeveN was developed in conjunction with the popular weapon, P90 . It took FN 5.7×28mm, which was the same as the P90. The Five-SeveN is widely used all over (both in games and in real life) and is very common to see. In-Game Information [ ] Current Archived The Five-SeveN is one of the more powerful pistols in the game, with its high damage output, moderate recoil, and its magazine size similar to that of TEC-9 . It also has a very high rate of fire for being semi-auto (its rate of fire is compared to that of the G-18 ). However, one of two major drawbacks is the high spread penalty, making the weapon not doable for long-ranged combat. The weapon's rate of fire also causes the user to expend the magazine quickly if not careful. The Five-SeveN was added to the game in Gun Game since the beginning. However, it was removed in the Mega Update . It stayed in the game for over three years, though the weapon made its return in the 10 Year Anniversary Update after nearly 7 years. The stats are nearly identical to the current version, as it had low recoil. It had a high magazine of 20 rounds with ramp-up and high damage. The only difference is that the spread is much tighter compared to its current version, and it had a slower rate of fire. Pros & Cons [ ] Current: [ ] Pros: High magazine capacity. High damage at close range. Very high rate of fire. Cons: High spread. Low minimum damage. Magazine can be easily expended due to its fast fire rate. Archived: [ ] Pros: Low spread. High magazine capacity. High damage in CQC. Cons: Slow rate of fire. Low minimum damage. Tips [ ] The Five-SeveN is incredibly deadly at intense fights. However, its main weakness is range , due to its damage falloff and spread. To make the most of this weapon, approach closer to enemies before firing to rampup your damage. Its best performance is 3 bodyshots or 2 headshots, at close range. Its fast firing speed dominates against other Pistols and rivals most SMGs, so don't be afraid to take them on. Trivia [ ] This is another weapon from CS:GO that is also used in Counter Blox as well. The current Five-SeveN has the highest RPM out of all the pistols in the game. This can be observed by holding down the fire button on mobile. In the Classic gamemode , the Five-SeveN is the very first weapon to use. The weapon model, along with MP5-SD retained their early Gun Game design during their return. 6 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Incendiary Special Afterburn Kill Icon The Flamethrower is an incendiary device designed to project a controllable jet of fire. Flamethrowers saw use in modern times during World War I and more widely in World War II as a tactical siege weapon against fortifications and enemy emplacements. Most flamethrowers in the military use liquid fuel, typically either gasoline or diesel, but commercial flamethrowers are generally blowtorches using gaseous fuels such as propane; gases are safer in peacetime applications due to the less mas flow rate of the flames and can dissipate faster. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Flamethrower is one of the earliest weapons added in Arsenal . It was re-added in the Summer Update II . The Flamethrower is a powerhouse in close range; its fast afterburn and fire rate combined can obliterate an enemy that is unfortunate enough to get close to it. In addition, it is accompanied by its large magazine of 150, making it a weapon that is to be feared when in range of it. The Flamethrower, however, has a limited range of use, meaning that long-range attacks can't be performed using this weapon, which can be a problem since most players won't try to get close to a player holding the Flamethrower and would most likely kill them from a distance, rendering it ineffective. In addition, the slow mobility makes it easy for someone to quite run away when they are ambushed. Therefore, to effectively use this weapon, players must be caught off-guard and ambushed before they have time to react. Luckily, the afterburn can be a blessing here. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast afterburn. Large magazine size. Very low ammo consumption. Decent rate of fire. Cons: Low damage, including afterburn. Afterburn can be stopped by picking up a health pack. Very limited range. Long reload time. No headshot multiplier. User runs slower. Tips [ ] The Flamethrower can hit multiple enemies at once, so target groups of enemies rather than individuals if it's possible. The Flamethrower is best used if you sneak behind an opponent and burn them from behind, rather than confronting them head-on. This weapon loses to almost every other weapon in Arsenal if in a direct confrontation, so ambushing is recommended. If you're being shot at, equip your Knife and run away and find a different route to your opponents. Not doing so will make you an easy target to kill. If you die before you can finish off a player, the afterburn effect of the Flamethrower will let you be credited as an assist if a teammate kills your burning opponent. Do mind that afterburn will not be as effective if your opponent is still near full HP. It would just be a mild inconvenience to them. You'll be guaranteed a kill through afterburn if your opponent is approximately around the range of 20 HP. Gallery [ ] Previous model, blue Previous model, red Previous model, yellow Previous model, green Current Flamethrower stage one development. Stage two. Stage three. Stage four. With multiple grips. Trivia [ ] The current model of the Flamethrower was created back and was revealed in the Arsenal Discord server on May 25th, 2020. The previous Flamethrower model was inherited from Typical Colors 2 , used by the Arsonist class. According to EMIRPERIF, the Flamethrower is based on three games. One of the more noticeable ones being the Far Cry - Series flamethrower model, the others are still being researched. The Flamethrower, the Tavor 's Incendiary shells, the Spellbook , the Acid Spitter , and the Flaming Pumpkin are the only weapons to have the afterburn effect. Much like Acid Spitter, Flamethrower can be broken in any approaches: If the magazine is emptied, the Flamethrower would continuously fire with single shots as the magazine goes by negative. This would later be fixed in the Halloween Update II: Part II . In the currently inactive gamemode Juggernaut , the Flamethrower does not do any damage against the juggernaut or as the juggernaut. This has been fixed after. The afterburn doesn't instantly kill the player once the damage hits 100 or more when the Christmas Update II: Part II came out. This was later fixed on January 5th, 2021. This also affects the Acid Spitter and Flaming Pumpkin . Players using the weapon can kill spectators in any positions. It used to be the signature weapon of Garcello skin . 45-53 (4 afterburn damage) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Firing Mode Thrown Special Projectile Arch Splash Damage Afterburn Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Flaming Pumpkin is a small Halloween-themed projectile weapon that is a pumpkin which is carved with a fire effect. The Flaming Pumpkin seems to have a glowing part inside its model. It also has a projectile arch, but that is not a problem due to it having a splash damage and afterburn abilities. The Flaming Pumpkin runs on an ammo pool of 50. The users have to throw the Flaming Pumpkins at the enemies or near the enemies due to their reason. It has a fire effect which can burn enemies with its afterburn effect while it deals a damage of around 45. Throwing it near the enemies can also damage the enemies from the splash damage, and can summon the fire on the ground from it which can also burn enemies when they walk into it. However, when throwing the Flaming Pumpkin without caution, the user can also damage themselves from the splash damage with its afterburn effect, which also damages them. It can be easily be stopped when the user picks up a health pack. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Somewhat high damage. Enemies being affected by fire can give away their location. Summons a pool of fire that gives users an afterburn effect upon walking into. Fast throw rate. Fire pool stays longer. Cons: Afterburn deals a low damage of four per tick. Users can easily kill themselves if not careful. Trivia [ ] This weapon, the Spellbook , the Tavor with incendiary rounds, the Flamethrower and the Acid Spitter are the only weapons that have an afterburn effect. The Flaming Pumpkin is currently the only weapon that can summon a hazard. The model is re-used from the armor that the Grug skin is using and the Pumpkin Staff melee. The Flaming Pumpkin is the signature weapon for Grug skin. The afterburn damage used to be broken. This was later fixed on January 5th, 2021. This weapon was removed due to it intending to be buffed, but instead triggering the anti-cheat. 26-61 (43-76) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator SomeBlueAngel Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.05 23.521 2.1 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 0.873 1 Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Magpul FMG-9 is a foldable prototype SMG manufactured in the United States by Magpul Industries in 2008 that is made for concealed carry. It fires 9x19 Parabellum rounds and fire rate of 1200 RPM. In-game Information [ ] In-game, the FMG-9's high damage, low spread, large magazine size, fast reload, and fast fire rate allows destruction at any range. However, even though the FMG-9 has a high magazine capacity, the magazine is still easily expended due to its fast fire rate. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. High damage. Fast reload. Low spread. Higher than average magazine size for its class. Cons: Magazine is easily expended due to its fast rate of fire. Tips [ ] The FMG-9 is one of the best SMGs in the game, as its damage, fast firing speed, and nearly perfect accuracy will allow you to get a kill in no time. In fact, its only con where ammo is quickly used up can be ignored, because the pros will usually prevent this from happening. The FMG-9 can be used from any range, especially from longer distances! Do beware that there is a tiny bit of bullet spread, so you will need to space out your shots if you fire from long-range (across the map). Reloading the FMG-9 is fast enough to help you in an intense fight where you're currently being fired at. Gallery [ ] Inspect. Equipping animation Stage one development. Stage two. Stage three. Stage four. Stage five. FMG-9 in real life. Trivia [ ] FMG-9 was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on February 3rd, 2020. The FMG-9's action is blowback. The FMG-9 fully equips before the equip animation finishes. The FMG-9's kill icon used to be a placeholder. The FMG-9's own kill icon was given in May 19th, 2020. When pulling out the FMG-9, its breech (the back end which folds open) actually clips through the character's right arm in the viewmodel animation. Unlike in game, the actual FMG-9 did not leave its prototype stage, meaning that the gun was actually never widely produced. Magpul Industries has since come out in 2021 with two redesigned successors to the FMG-9, the FDC-9 (carbine variant) and the FDP-9 (pistol variant), which are set to be released in 2022. 22-45 (34-51) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The FN FAL is a battle rifle designed by Belgian small arms designer Dieudonné Saive and manufactured by FN Herstal. During the Cold War the FAL was adopted by many countries of the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO), with the notable exception of the United States. It is one of the most widely used rifles in history, having been used by more than 90 countries. Because of its prevalence and widespread usage among the militaries of many NATO and first world countries during the Cold War, it received the title "The right arm of the Free World". It is chambered for the 7.62×51mm NATO cartridge (although originally designed for the .280 British intermediate cartridge). The British Commonwealth variant of the FAL was redesigned from FN's metrical FAL into British imperial units and was produced under licence as the L1A1 Self-Loading Rifle. In-game Information [ ] The FAL is a powerful battle rifle: players can expect a weapon with similar performance to the SCAR-H ; that is, having similar damage stats, fire rate, and magazine size. The FAL has a minimum of 4 shots to kill, with headshots giving the weapon a 2-shot kill. Unlike the SCAR-H, however, the FAL has lower damage and lacks a scope. The magazine and fast fire rate, similar to the Potassium Power and SCAR-H , contradict, each other firing at a speed of 700 RPM, meaning players will need to make every shot count. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Decent reload speed. Fast fire rate. Somewhat low spread. Cons: Small magazine size. Magazine is easily expended due to its high fire rate. Somewhat slow movement speed. Gallery [ ] FN FAL in real life. Trivia [ ] The in-game model's fire selector is set to semi-auto despite being fired in full auto. This gun was designed by the Belgian armaments industry FN Herstal in the late 1940s and produced from the early 1950s till present. Official production by FN stopped in 1988, however licensed FAL rifles are still made by other companies alike. The British version of the rifle, the L1A1 , would be the UK's standard rifle until the bullpup L85. The FAL served famously in Africa, Asia, and South America. The gun was infamously used by the Colombian separatist group FARC . Despite the gun's reputation for reliability, gun tests showed that the Russian AKM and AK-74 were nearly three times more reliable than the FAL. The FN FAL is called " The Right Arm Of The Free World " due to its prevalence and widespread usage among the militaries of many NATO and first world countries during the Cold War. 20 (25) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Laser Tag Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Tracer Shot Kill Icon Creator nettimato Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Focus is an energy assault rifle with rotary barrels, added in the Sci-Fi Update of Arsenal . Each of the barrels has its own iron sights, excluding the unused one in the middle. While being fired, a hammer/bolt device cycles back and forth on a track on top of the receiver, impacting an illuminated button behind the barrel that is currently in upright position. The weapon draws power from a glowing cassette contained within the frame of the weapon, partially seen through the vents on the cover. While being reloaded, the entire top and front half of the weapon hinges open, allowing the depleted energy cassette to be replaced. The Focus functions similarly to the Laser Rifle and Pulse Laser with its tracer shots, perfect accuracy and 60-shot capacity, but trades the insane fire rate for some extra damage per shot. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast fire rate. No spread or recoil. Large magazine size. Perfect accuracy. Cons: Somewhat low damage per shot. High ammo consumption rate. Tracer shot can give away the user's position. Somewhat slow movement speed. Tips [ ] The Focus is effective from any distance, as it is 100% accurate and does not have weaker damage based on distance. You can potentially use this as if it was a Sniper RIfle and hit an opponent from the other side of the map. The Focus has a fast fire rate, but in reality it only fires as fast as a Pistol-class weapon. In fact, the Focus has the slowest fire rate of all the Automatic Rifles in the game. This means you have an equal fighting chance with opponents using a Pistol, Marksman Rifle, or Sniper Rifle. However, you'll lose outright to any opponent using a Shotgun. Shots worth 20 damage will kill a full health opponent in 5 shots. However, headshots that deal 25 damage will kill them a bit faster within 4 shots. The Focus has a respectable reload speed of 3 seconds. However, this won't help during an intense fight where you're currently being shot at. Luckily, you don't need to worry about this too much since you have 60 shots per magazine. However, you should still keep an eye on your ammo as prolonged fights with individual opponents can deplete the magazine quickly. Gallery [ ] Submission by nettimato. Original concept art for the weapon. Early sketch from 2019. Trivia [ ] The weapon takes inspiration from Pulse Rifle from Dead Space , automatic variants of the Laser Rifle from Fallout 4 , FR-27 Sanction Flechette Rifle from Deus Ex: Human Revolution and the look and feel of energy weapons in Mad Paintball 2 . An earlier concept art for a similar multi-barrel energy weapon called Ion Blaster was also published to the Arsenal Discord in April 2019. It was supposedly intended to be a shotgun and it was essentially a bulkier version of the Focus barrel module sitting on top of a shotgun receiver. The Focus is the sixth weapon to be created by nettimato, first being the STEN , second being the Calico , third being the G11 , fourth being the TOZ-106 , fifth being the Dual Shotguns and seventh being the Stake Launcher . The Focus is the signature weapon for Cyber Punk and Tech-Head skins . 100 Gamemodes Classic Wild West Double Trouble Hot Potato Juggernaut Infected Firing Mode Single-fire Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Weapon History General Information [ ] The FP-45 Liberator is a pistol manufactured by the United States military during World War II for use by resistance forces in occupied territories. The Liberator was never issued to American or other allied troops, and there are few documented instances of the weapon being used for its intended purpose; though the intended recipients, irregulars and resistance fighters, rarely kept detailed records due to the inherent risks if the records were captured by the enemy. In-game Information [ ] The FP-45 Liberator is the third gun to appear in-game. Just like all guns in MURDER , the pistol has one bullet and an indefinite ammo capacity. Upon a hit, it will instantly kill the murderer. It can also be crafted once the player has collected five loot. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Instantly kills a player upon a hit. Able to crafted once the player has obtained five loot. Infinite ammo capacity. Cons: Only one round in the chamber. Kills a user if shot at an innocent. Critical Damage Overview Magazine Ammo 18 72 Damage 18 (22) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 (Current) TCtully (Previous) VALVe (Archived) Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.043 22.401 1.83 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0.088 1.572 0.5 The G-18 , or the Glock 18 , is a selective-fire variant of the Glock 17 , developed at the request of the Austrian counter-terrorist unit EKO Cobra, and as a way to internally test Glock components under strenuous conditions. Originally produced in 1986, the G-18 is a machine pistol–class firearm bearing a fire-control selector switch on the rear left side of the slide. Depending on which position of the switch, the pistol has a different firing mode. With the selector lever in the bottom position, the pistol fires fully automatically, however if the lever is in the top position, the pistol fires semi-automatically. Typically, the firearm is used with an extended 33-round-capacity magazine, although other magazines from the Glock 17 can be used, with available capacities of 10, 17, 19 or 24 rounds. The Glock-18, unlike all its other siblings, is only offered to military, law enforcement, and government organizations. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] In-game, the G-18 is a powerful fast automatic pistol. The G-18 has similar headshot damage to the Hi-Power pistol at close range. However the players must watch out for the ammo as the very small magazine size of 18 makes the ammo very expendable when considering the quickest fire rate. Luckily, the reload is fast, so players can get back to battles easily. However the players should also watch for the spread, since the spread is also very unforgiving. Shooting with the G-18 for any more than a second at a time will result in a massive spread penalty that gives itself a spread larger than most shotguns. Because of this; tap-firing is highly advised as it saves ammo and prevents the spread penalty from ruining accuracy. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Extremely fast fire rate. Fast reload. High magazine capacity for a pistol. Able to hold fire. Deals the same damage from any distance. Cons: High spread upon holding fire. High ammo consumption rate. Low overall damage. Tips [ ] The G-18's gimmick of having automatic firing speed can be difficult for players to handle. It fires very quickly and the spread gets very high. This reduces the G-18's effective range to close-range. The fast firing speed will allow you to quickly kill opponents without them retaliating. The G-18 is notoriously infamous for running out of ammo at the worst time possible: while in the middle of an intense fight. Before you start firing, make sure you're in a good position against your target, such as an open area. If your target can hide behind the map's props or is on a higher platform, you will fail to kill them. This weapon does have a fast reload, so you can get back into the fight quickly. However, if your opponent has a stronger weapon such as a Shotgun, expect to lose the fight while reloading. Trivia [ ] Despite its name, the archived version of Arsenal G-18 model better resembles a Glock 26 and resembles G-19X In the current game. The G-18 currently uses the same kill icon as G-19X's. In real life, the Glock-18 can switch between semi-automatic and automatic. The G-18 currently uses the old G-19X's model in third person, albeit some minor differences. The Archived G-18 also uses the current G-19X in the view model. The G-18 is one of the automatic pistols along with the Falkor , the Little Tom , the Electric Revolver and the TEC-9 . The G-18 in ROLVe's other game, Counter Blox , is semi-auto with the option of switching to burst. Today, the Glock is the most popular pistol, with total sales exceeding 20 million units. Glocks are made of durable, high-strength polymer, with simple designs and having an automatic safety switch. Their exceptional reliability might explain their popularity. Before Glocks rose to fame, the most popular pistol was the M1911 . Gallery [ ] G-18 in real life. Archived G-18 in real life. 27-40 (33-50) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Counter Blox Pistols Kill Confirmed Juggernaut Clown Infection Arcade All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 (Current) TCtully (Previous) Unknown (Original) Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.25 22.401 1.83 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 1.048 0.5 The G-19X , or the Glock 19X , is a compact and lighter version the Glock 17 , primarily manufactured for law enforcement. The Glock 19X combines the best features of two of its most popular and most trusted field-tested platforms. The full-size Glock 17 frame and the compact Glock 19 slide have joined forces to produce the ideal pistol for all conditions and all situations. The 19X comes in the coyote color with the first-ever factory colored slide, finished with an improved nPVD slide coating to prevent corrosion. Additional features include the GLOCK Marksman Barrel , no finger grooves, ambidextrous slide stop levers and lanyard loop. Included with the pistol is a standard 17-round magazine, two 17+2-round magazines and coyote-colored pistol case. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] In-game, the G-19X is a large-magazine pistol with a focus on hitting every shot with the weapon's perfect accuracy. It fires from a 17-round magazine and carries 3 magazines in reserve. It deals 27-40 damage upon a body shot and deals 33-50 damage upon a headshot at different ranges. The G-19X has perfect accuracy because it has no recoil and has very low spread, meaning that wherever the crosshair is pointed, the G-19X will hit it. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: No spread. Large magazine size and ammo count. High damage in close quarters. Fast reload. Cons: Moderately slow fire-rate for its class. Tips [ ] In conclusion, the G-19X is your all-round Pistol. It deals a fair amount of damage, only to be hampered by a moderately slow firing rate. This means you will have to be careful if it comes to intense fights. If your chosen target has a weapon that can fire quickly (such as other Pistols, or SMGs), then you can expect a losing battle. If possible, try being more sneaky around your opponents, instead of facing them head-on. If all goes well, you they won't notice you until your second or third shot. From longer distances, the G-19X takes four bullets to kill, even with headshots. At close-range, it only takes two or three. Take advantage of long-range combat as this weapon is 100% accurate. The big magazine size of 17 bullets and a fast reload makes the G-19X a good weapon for intense fights. Gallery [ ] In third person. G-17 in real life. Previous G-17 in real life. G-19X in real life. Trivia [ ] Today, the Glock is the most popular pistol, with total sales exceeding 20 million units. Glocks are made of durable, high-strength polymer, with simple designs and having an automatic safety switch. Their exceptional reliability might explain their popularity. Before Glocks rose to fame, the most popular pistol was the M1911 . The G-19X is the signature weapon of the Deadlinquent, Delinquent, Delinquent That's Cool, Delinquent with No Brim, Elflinquent, Firefighter, Lynn, Shark, Summer Delinquent, Suspicious Stranger, Throwback Delinquent, and Zack skins . The G-19X in-game appears to fire a 9mm cartridge, as evidenced by the 17 round mag capacity. It can be chambered for a multitude of other cartridges asides from 9x19mm, including but not limited to 10mm Auto, .45 ACP, and .357 SIG. Formerly, the G-19X dealt 25 (35+ up-close) damage for a headshot at mid-long ranges and 22-25 body shot (30+ up-close) damage through in mid-long ranges. The previous G-19X's model looks similar to the G-18 in Arsenal Archived . The G-19X has the same model as the G-21 . The previous G-19X's firing sound was taken from the G-17 from Counter Strike: Source . The G-19X along with the Rocket Launcher , the Peacemaker , the Barrett , the AUG , the XR15 , the Trench Gun , and the DB Shotgun are the only primary weapons that appear in the Arcade gamemode. The G-19X is also one of two weapons that cannot be picked up. The other being the Knife . G-19X was originally called the G-17 . G-19X and the previous G-18's firing sound was taken from Call of Duty: Modern Warfare (2007 version) , which is used for the M9 in the game.
