Compared to the Glock 20 chambered in 10mm Auto, the slide of the Glock 21 is lighter to compensate for the lower-energy .45 ACP cartridge. The standard Glock 21 magazine is of the single-position-feed, staggered-column type with a capacity of 13 rounds. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The G-21 is a high capacity and high damage pistol with a focus on hitting every shot with the weapon's perfect accuracy. It fires from a 13-round magazine and carries 3 magazines in reserve. It deals 45 damage upon a bodyshot and 56 damage upon a headshot at long ranges. It has zero recoil and zero spread, meaning that wherever the crosshair is pointed, the G-21 will hit it. This weapon also has a low fire rate, adding more to its focus on perfect accuracy; players utilizing the Glock will have to wait a brief period of time to fire again after every shot. This weapon is best used at range. It's best used to pick off enemies' health from a distance, as the perfect accuracy means it can be used at long range very effectively. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Decent amount of damage. Decent magazine size. Powerful damage range. Fast reload speed. No spread and recoil. Cons: Moderately slow fire rate. Tips [ ] Just like the other weapons in the Glock family, the G-21 is your all-round Pistol. Deals good damage, only to be hampered by a slow firing speed. Pick your targets carefully, depending on their current weapon. Because the G-21 fires slowly, opponents using other Pistols or SMGs are losing battles. The G-21 is one of the more stronger Pistols, so it can dominate intense fights as long as you land your shots. No matter the distance or if hitting headshots, this weapon only takes 3 shots at minimum to get a kill. Obviously, beware that it will lose against stronger weapons such as Shotguns. The G-21 can only win against weaker Pistols or Projectiles. Trivia [ ] The G-21 previously used the G-19X 's firing sound. This is the signature weapon of Anarchist skin . The G-21 has the same model as the G-19X. Today, the Glock is the most popular pistol, with total sales exceeding 20 million units. Glocks are made of durable, high-strength polymer, with simple designs and having an automatic safety switch. Their exceptional reliability might explain their popularity. Before Glocks rose to fame, the most popular pistol was the M1911 . 27-51 (90-180) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Kill Confirmed Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Automatic Special Scope Fall-off Kill Icon Creator nettimato Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Heckler & Koch G11 is a non-production prototype assault rifle developed during the late 1960s, 1970s and 1980s by Gesellschaft für Hülsenlose Gewehrsysteme (GSHG) (German for "Association for Caseless Rifle Systems"), a conglomeration of companies headed by firearm manufacturer Heckler & Koch (mechanical engineering and weapon design), Dynamit Nobel (propellant composition and projectile design), and Hensoldt Wetzlar (target identification and optic systems). The rifle is noted for its use of caseless ammunition. It was primarily a project of West Germany, though it was of significance to the other NATO countries as well. In particular, versions of the G11 were included in the U.S. Advanced Combat Rifle program. In 1990, H&K finished the development of the G11, intended for the Bundeswehr and other NATO partners. Although the weapon was a technical success, it never entered full production due to the political changes of German reunification and lack of procurement contract. Only 1000 units were ever produced, some of which made their way into the hands of the Bundeswehr. Ultimately, the German armed forces replaced the G3 with the G36 . In-game Information [ ] With high damage, a large 45-round magazine, the G11 is a weapon suited to a high power role. Players should expect a 4-shot kill at minimum, with a potential for a 2-shot kill should enemies be in closer ranges or being headshot at longer distances. However, the only major downside of the G11 is its fire rate; players will fire at a rate slower than that of even the slowest SMGs. This can be an issue if all shots fired do not connect, so this weapon requires very good aiming skills. The G11 has an integral scope that can be accessed by right-clicking, allowing greater use of it at longer ranges. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Scoping allows for better magnification. Scoping decreases spread and recoil. Large 45-round magazine capacity. Cons: Slower fire rate for its class. Hip-firing without scope has a high spread penalty. Hip-firing has moderate recoil. Long reload time. Tips [ ] The G11 is a very deadly weapon due to its hefty damage and huge magazine size. However, its biggest weakness is accuracy. Firing without using the integral scope makes it difficult to land your shots, so use the scope when possible. However, hip-firing (shooting without using the scope) is best reserved for targets at close-range, as scoping in will limit your vision and can get you killed. Distance is also a distinct, versatile advantage with the G11. You can use the scope to shoot targets at long-range accurately, while hip-firing at close-range deals enough damage to kill an opponent in two shots. Gallery [ ] In third person. Early version. G11 in real life. Trivia [ ] The G11 was finished in 1990, although the German reunification and lack of contracts meant that the weapon was never adopted by any military groups, and it was also deemed obsolete due to the production of the G3 . Only about 1,000 models were ever produced. The G11 in real life also has a burst firing mode. This model of the G11 seems to resemble the G11 K1 model. The G11's model was made by a Discord user and MAD STUDIO developer, nettimato, who also created the Calico , the STEN , the TOZ-106 , the Dual Shotguns , the Focus , the Stake Launcher and the Peppermint Rifle models. There is a flaw when unloading the G11, there should be a button behind the scope to release the magazine. 20-58 Gamemodes Standard Randomizer Firing Mode Automatic Kill Icon Creator Unknown The Heckler & Koch G3 is a 7.62×51mm NATO, select-fire battle rifle developed in the 1950s by the German armament manufacturer Heckler & Koch in collaboration with the Spanish state-owned design and development agency Centro de Estudios Técnicos de Materiales Especiales (CETME). Contents 1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History In-game Information [ ] The G3 has decent damage for an assault rifle but what shines is that it has a great firerate and low spread. However, it is a heavy weapon, and as a result, players will move slower when holding this weapon. If they can deal with this movement speed, this weapon will shred their enemies. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Decent magazine size. Great firerate and low spread. Cons: Slow movement speed. Sluggish reload time. Trivia [ ] G3's sniper variant could be found under the name of G3SG1 . Much like the G3SG1, it's model was from Counter Blox, another ROLVe game. The G3 was actually a further development of a project by Mauser engineers during the final years of World War II. The gun ended up being very successful for many countries. It has also been featured in numerous conflicts. 24-54 (31-62) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Legacy Competitive Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Heckler & Koch G36 is a 5.56×45mm assault rifle, designed in the early 1990s by German company Heckler & Koch as a replacement for the heavier 7.62mm G3 battle rifle. It was accepted into service with the Bundeswehr in 1997, replacing the G3. Since then, it has also been a popular export, and the G36 has seen active service in military and police units in several countries, including Germany, Spain, and the United Kingdom. The G36 is gas-operated and feeds from a 30-round detachable box magazine. In-game Information [ ] In-game, the G36 functions similarly to the M16A1 or the AUG . Like the above-mentioned weapons, it has a very tight spread and a somewhat high rate of fire. The reload is fairly quick and the damage is slightly above average for its class. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Very tight spread. Above-average damage for its class. Somewhat high rate of fire. Very quick reload. Moderate magazine size. Cons: Moderately high recoil. Ammo expends quickly due to the high fire rate. Gallery [ ] G36 in real life. Trivia [ ] The variant of the G36 seen in-game is actually the G36C ('C' standing for 'Compact'), which is a subcarbine version of the standard G36. The G36's magazine have studs molded on it and can be locked with other magazines in order to reload quickly. The G36 can also use a 100 round Beta-C drum magazine. The gun's firing sound is taken from the Galil AR in Counter Blox . The G36 is used to show a player's weapon skin in the Locker . The G36's model is taken from another one of ROLVe's games, Unit: Classified, but untextured. Similarly, its reload and firing animations are also from Unit. It shares the same inspect animation as the Sako 85 . 38 (114) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Counter Blox Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Scope Kill Icon The G3SG1 is a German 7.62×51mm sniper rifle derivative of the G3 battle rifle, and is primarily used in a sharpshooter role. G3SG1 rifles were produced from the G3's lines, by choosing individual rifles and modifying them both internally (triggers, fire modes) and externally (the addition of a scope and mount, bipod and cheek riser). Contents 1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History 8 Sources In-game Information [ ] The G3SG1 has low damage for a sniper rifle but it is an automatic sniper rifle and can easily destroy enemies with just one headshot. However, it is a heavy weapon, and as a result, players will move slower when holding this weapon. If they can deal with this movement speed, this weapon will shred their enemies. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Largest magazine size out of all sniper rifles. Will always one-shot kill to the head. Scope allows for better magnification. Fastest rate of fire in-class. Extremely low spread. No recoil. Cons: Slow movement speed. Sluggish reload time. Below average body damage for a sniper rifle. Scope tracer may giveaway user position Tips [ ] The G3SG1 has the fastest fire-rate of all the Sniper Rifles in the game. However, each shot deals little damage. However, as with every Sniper Rifle, a single shot on the head is an instant kill. The G3SG1 in particular loses to Automatic Rifles and Shotguns. The G3SG1 deals a flat damage of 38 per shot, so you can use this weapon from any distance. This means it takes 3 bodyshots to kill an opponent. The best distance to fire is from long-range, where you can simply scope in and shoot while your opponents will have trouble hitting you back. If firing from mid-range or closer, do not use your scope. This will make it easier to fight opponents who are jumping to and around you. Even with its fast fire-rate and big magazine size, you should still space out your shots. The G3SG1's reload is particularly slow. You can spam your shots if you see multiple opponents grouped up together. Especially in gamemodes where there's no promotion-on-kill mechanic such as Randomizer and Gun Rotation. Trivia [ ] The G3SG1's model is borrowed from " Counter Blox ", another game developed by ROLVe . The G3SG1 is a DMR Variant of the normal G3. The SG stands for Scharfschützengewehr (" Sharpshooting Rifle "). This used to be the signature weapon for Phoenix, after replacing the AWP and before being replaced by the AKM . The G3SG1 was inspired by the gun with the same name in CS:GO . The G3SG1's old firing sound was the same as the one used by the G3SG1 from CS:GO . The G3SG1 is the second sniper to be added and one of the only three semi-auto snipers in the game. As with the MP5K and the UMP-45 , the G3SG1's firing animation incorrectly portrays the weapon. The charging handle moves backwards after every shot, where as in real life, it is non-reciprocating. The previous version of the gun was incorrectly equipped with a PSO-1 scope. This was later fixed in the current version, switching it to the Hensoldt Z24 scope. The G3SG1 was originally going to be added into the game during the development of Gun Game however it was left scrapped and later released to the archived phase of Arsenal . 17-61 (43-76) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Monkey Business Firing Mode Automatic Kill Icon Creator Unknown (Current) Valve (Previous) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros and Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The IMI Galil is an automatic rifle that was part of the IMI Galil gun family that was created by Israel and used in the late 1960s. In-game Information [ ] The Galil assault rifle's firing rate is designed to be faster. the damage ensures that whenever the bullets hit. However, this weapon has a high spread penalty, meaning the Galil can be used in close to middle ranges. Pros and Cons [ ] Pros: Fast fire rate. Fast reload. High headshot damage. Cons: High recoil. High spread upon continuous shots. Low minimum damage Trivia [ ] The model of the Galil in-game model appears as the Galil SAR . In old Arsenal , the Galil model was based on the IWI ACE 23 from the ACE family. They were the modernized versions of the IMI Galil family. The Galil is closely related to the Valmet Rk 62 , which is an improved version of the AK-47 . The Galil used AK-47 's firing sound as a place holder. 60-90 (75-150) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Firing Mode Automatic Kill Icon The Gatling Gun is a rapid-firing multiple-barrel firearm invented in 1861 by Richard Jordan Gatling. It is an early machine gun and a forerunner of the modern electric motor-driven rotary cannon. Contents 1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History In-game Information [ ] The Gatling Gun is primarily colored beige with black barrels, and as it is a Machine Gun, it slows down the walking speed of any player who pulls it out. Unlike the other Machine Guns, the Gatling Gun has a fixed pattern of shots when fired. However, the majority of these shots shoot around the user's crosshair rather than indirectly. This means that when you start shooting, the spread is already high. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros High damage. High ammo capacity. Keeps its same accuracy over time. Cons Shoots around the crosshair instead of into it. Slow reload time. High spread. Very slow pullout speed. Tips [ ] The Gatling Gun has a very weird spread compared to the other Machine Guns. While its accuracy does not get worse the longer you fire, it still fires shots around your crosshair rather than into it. Due to this, the Gatling Gun when used at mid-range (and further) requires luck to land shots rather than skill, unless you figure out the fixed spread pattern. To guarantee that more shots will land, use the Gatling Gun at close-range. Pulling this weapon out will slow you down. Equipping your Knife to close the distance then switching back to the Gatling Gun may do the trick. The Gatling Gun takes 2 seconds to pull out before you can start firing. You'll have to hope that you don't promote to this weapon in the middle of an intense fight. Before turning any corners, pull out the Gatling Gun ahead of time so you'll be ready to kill any opponents. Its incredibly slow reload time makes the Gatling Gun a "one-and-done" weapon, as it prompts players to get a kill within the first clip, or face the consequences. If you don't want to wait out the slow reload, resorting to getting a backstab with your Knife can be an alternate solution. Trivia [ ] The Gatling Gun once had no reload sound. The firing mechanism requires the user to crank the lever but instead using default minigun animation. 60 Gamemodes Swordfights Special Double Jump Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros and Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Ghostwalker is one of the weapons exclusive to the Swordfights gamemode. This is a basic sword out of the bunch, with one special ability which is the double jump ability, like the Ice Stars or Illumina and given a x4 jump height. Players should use this as an advantage; one of the ways to do this is by throwing off the movement. When spawning at the top and fall to the middle, double jump to make sure the enemy doesn't know where you land or use it to gain an advantageous place in the map. Pros and Cons [ ] Pros: Double jump ability. Jump height is increased by x4. Cons: Lacks backstab mechanic. Trivia [ ] The sword is based off the Ghostwalker created by ROBLOX in 2010. Like the Ice Dagger , the Ghostwalker isn't wielder transparent. Obviously, it also does not give a transparency bonus for kill streaks with this weapon because players get a different sword for every kill in Swordfights. It is the signature weapon of the Festive Ghastelle, Festive Phantina, Ghastelle, Ghost of Developing and Phantina skins. It is a golden reskin of the original Bomb . Contents 1 Pros & Cons 2 Trivia 3 Audio 4 Weapon History Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Explodes on impact. Instantly kill an enemy upon blast. Ability to cook the bomb by holding RMB. Explosive area-of-effect capability allows for collateral kills. Ability to rocket jump. Infinite ammunition. No reloading required. Resets people's score when they are killed with the weapon. Cons: Users can easily kill themselves if not careful. Sluggish 2.5-second cooldown. High self-damage upon rocket jump. Trivia [ ] Although it is similar to the Golden Bow , unlike the latter it does not appear in the standard rotation. This, the Golden Bow, the Golden Musket , and the Golden Creagle are the only weapons that demote on a kill. Though, there is a chance the thrower will not get demoted upon blown up themselves. 100 (280) Special Demotion Ammo Regeneration Fly Explosive Rounds Kill Icon Creator Castlers The Golden Creagle , formerly known as the Creagle , is a fictional, gold-colored variant of the Deagle exclusive to developers and Aimer_Btw. The Golden Creagle is basically a golden reskin of the Creagle , as all of the weapon except for the grip is gold. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Golden Creagle's fire rate is ridiculously fast, insta-kills, has perfect accuracy, no recoil, demotes on a kill and regenerates all of the ammo in its magazine upon killing. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: One-shot kill on any part of the body at any range. Virtually no spread and recoil whatsoever. Demotes on a kill. Insanely quick reload. Shoots every few milliseconds. Capable of fly ability. Explosive rounds. High magazine. Capable of rocket jumping . Trivia [ ] This, the Admin Launcher and Influencer Launcher are the only three developer-exclusive weapons in the game. They are all also the only secondary weapons in the game except for Fasticuffs and Very Long Bat . The Golden Creagle, along with the Golden Bow , Golden Musket , Golden Hush Puppy and the Golden Bomb , are the only non-melee weapons that demotes on a kill. The Golden Creagle is the only weapon that regenerates ammo upon killing someone. The Golden Creagle is at the center of controversy, as exploiters have been able to get their hands on this weapon, allowing them to sweep a server and win games in less than a minute after it starts. After the Golden Creagle was patched, if an exploiter equips it will automatically kick them, however it's now eliminated from the game's code. When a user is killed, the kill feed shows Aimer_Btw's avatar as the kill icon. The Golden Creagle is a secondary weapon, meaning that it takes the slot with the melee. This rearranges the hotkeys of the weapons. This weapon shared the same firing and reloading audios as the Deagle . 100 (125) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Counter Blox Typical Colors Automatics Wild West Pistols Legacy Competitive All Weapons Hackula Headshots Only Hard Mode Hackula DX Monkey Business Firing Mode Single-fire Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 (Current) Unknown (Previous) VALVe (Archived) Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] Current Archived The Golden Gun is a very powerful pistol of its gold variant that is usually obtained towards the end of a match in Arsenal . In gamemodes that involve the Golden Knife , it will be the second to last weapon, with the Golden Knife serving as the last one. However, in Legacy Competitive and in a few other gamemodes, the Golden Gun is the last weapon instead, though in Hard Mode, it is the 13th weapon. The Golden Gun can also be obtained randomly in Randomizer . The current Golden Gun is based on the Tanfoglio Thor pistol. The Golden Gun will always instantly kill an enemy with its 100 damage upon body shot and 125 damage upon headshot. It gives players two rounds for use, one for the magazine and one for reserve, with a reload time of roughly 3.5 seconds. The Golden Gun, upon killing an enemy, converts them into a golden statue. When you are 1 level away from achieving this weapon, the bottom center of your screen will have a message saying "Golden Gun is next!" There is a bug in gamemodes that skip the golden knife in which the "Golden Gun is next!" message appears one level before the Golden Gun is actually next. Legacy Competitive does not have this issue. As the Golden Gun can only carry a single round at a time, players will need to be extra careful to guarantee that their shot will hit, as they will be vulnerable during its long reload time. Luckily, players can pick up ammo packs to fill up their reserves when they run out. The Golden Gun in Arsenal Archived used the sound and the model of the Deagle , which caused it to have a faster reload. This didn't change the magazine with only one bullet. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Guaranteed one-shot kill. Perfect accuracy. Cons: Only one-round in the chamber and reserve. Long reload time. Only one reserved bullet. Tips [ ] The Golden Gun is arguably the most difficult weapon in the entire game (behind the Golden Knife ) to get a kill with, as its "one shot at glory" gimmick does not allow any mistakes. Its reload is incredibly slow, which makes it easy for opponents to kill you. You also only have two bullets, therefore two chances before you're left with only your Knife . The Golden Gun will only be effective if you carefully take aim. Even with its perfect accuracy, the Golden Gun is best at mid-range, where you can easily see your targets and have less chances of any bullets hitting you. Flicking your aim is an option, but this has less chance of success than carefully aiming. It is recommended that you work on your melee combat in case you run out of the Golden Gun's ammo. If you're skillful enough, you can easily get a backstab and reach the Golden Knife (or end the game, depending on your current gamemode). If melee combat isn't working out, the alternate solution is to find the nearest ammo box. As soon as you pick it up, immediately switch back to the Golden Gun , as it needs to reload before it can be shot again. Gallery [ ] In third person. Golden Gun in real life. The actual Golden Gun in the James Bond film, The Man with the Golden Gun. Archived Golden Gun in real life. Trivia [ ] The current model of the Golden Gun was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on January 10th, 2020. The previous version fired a 4.2mm "dum-dum" round, more colloquially known as a " Hollow-point ". Ironically, the Bond series Golden Gun uses such rounds. The bullets themselves were made from gold. In reality, such a bullet would be so heavy that the round itself would need an extremely powerful propellant to make it fatal. As such, in reality, the gun would have massive recoil. Before the Community-Ops Update , the original model was based upon the Golden Gun from the James Bond franchise , particularly its depiction in the 1974 movie The Man with the Golden Gun . The Golden Gun along with the Musket , the RPG , the M79 , the M16A2 's grenade launcher, the Bow , and the Pocket Potassium are the only weapons in the game that carry a single round. This is the signature weapon of Gaslight Detective, Detective, and Bloxy Delinquent skins . In the Halloween Update , the Golden Gun can now be obtained in the Randomizer gamemode but can't grant the Golden Knife . The Golden Gun has the same body and headshot damage as the Sunflower Sun when it returned to Arsenal . This is one of many weapons which were revealed before they got added into the game including the L86A3 , the FAMAS , the Ice Stars , the FMG-9 , the Maxim-9 , the Tavor , the Micro Uzis , the Flamethrower , the Pocket Potassium , the Z80 , the Literal Gun , the Vector , the Pulse Musket , and the TP Launcher . The current model is based on the Tanfoglio Thor, a single-shot handgun based on the frame of a conventional 1911-style pistol. It fires various types of rifle calibers. The one in-game looks like it fires the .308/7.62 NATO round. In third person, the selected weapon skin will appear on the barrel of the gun if the player holding it has one equipped. However, in first person, the weapon skin won't appear. The Golden Gun makes an appearance in the RPG Event as a secret weapon/ability that the Delinquent can find after defeating a secret boss. 45 (150) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Counter Blox Typical Colors Wild West Swordfights Knife Fight Laser Tag Bows Only Special Backstab Double Jump Demotion Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-Game 1.2 Archived 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] In-Game [ ] The Golden Knife is the final weapon only in various gamemodes, most prominently being Standard. The player's current Knife skin will have a gold color (any glowing parts of the skin will be yellow) when this weapon is obtained. Three regular hits, or one stab to a victim's back will result in a kill, and winning the game. The victim will turn into a golden statue when killed. Assists do not count as kills for this weapon, unless the target killbinds or accidentally kill themselves. So players will need to ensure a victim's death in order to count it as a kill. Unlike the regular Knife, players using the Golden Knife run slightly faster and have the additional ability to double jump . This allows for easy mobility and rooftop access to jump onto unsuspecting victims. Archived [ ] The Golden Knife does the same role except it cannot backstab, double jump, and does less damage. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Can instantly kill a player by backstabbing. User runs slightly faster. Double jump ability. Grants win upon kill. Demotes players on kill. Cons: Can only fight opponents that are at close-range. The user is easily killable by other weapons. Slow rate of stab. Tips [ ] The Golden Knife is the most important weapon in the entire game, as it's the only way to win a game of Arsenal (in most gamemodes, of course). To get better at using the Golden Knife, practice by using your regular Knife to kill opponents. The Golden Knife is all about stealth . Recklessly running to opponents will get you killed very quickly. Avoid confrontations with opponents unless you're in a good position/location to get a backstab. Stay hidden until you find a possible target that will guarantee you a kill. If you miss that backstab, you'll be killed. A prime target for the Golden Knife is a player that is all alone , and has not seen you yet. These players will be easy to backstab. It will be easier to kill a singular target, instead of a group of opponents. A target can't fight back if they don't know where you are, so make sure to stay out of their sight. Take advantage of your increased speed and double jumps. These new abilities will allow you to traverse across the map a lot easier. These abilities are also good for escaping opponents that are shooting at you, or make trickstabs a lot easier to do. Your double jump ability allows you to get to higher places you couldn't before, or even dodge bullets mid-air. Try not to expose yourself in open areas. Instead, run through high or low areas of maps that players normally don't run through. This will allow you find easy targets to kill. Examples of these areas would be: The sandcastle, or the roofs of the buildings in Beach . The glass table in the middle of Kitchen Khaos . The underground tunnels of Dizzy . The roof of the "Stinky's Coffee" building in Boulevard . The trees, or the area full of parked cars in Tuscan . Anywhere that's not the sewers level in Street Corner Remastered . "Trickstabs" will come in handy with the Golden Knife if your target isn't an easy kill. These include: Drop stab: jumping off a higher platform on a target down below, stabbing their back as you land. Matador stab: you run to a target, but just next to them. Once you're past them, flick your aim left or right (depending on which side your opponent is on) and backstab. Hurdle stab: you run to a target, jump, crouch mid-air to avoid bumping into your target, then flick your aim downards (and diagonally if you're off to the side) and backstsab. Do note that you will need to jump over your target's shoulders and not their head, as doing this trickstab while on their head will only count as a hit. Trivia [ ] The Golden Knife used to be able to headstab, dealing 150 damage in the face. This was quickly removed. This is the first melee weapon that allows its users to double jump, the second being the Squeaky Hammer . Getting a player's first kill with this grants the badge "Golden Touch" which awards a free character crate. This is a reference to the Greek myth of King Midas, in which everything he touched turned to gold. Another badge called "Podium of Gold" is granted when the top 3 players have the Golden Knife. The addition of the double jump for the Golden Knife was likely intentional with the introduction of the Summer Update 's Concussion Mania gamemode in tandem with the sheer dependence on luck due to the position of enemies before 03/06/20. This is the only weapon in which an assist (exception of assisted suicides) will not progress the player to the next level. The only knife skin that doesn't have a golden version is Fisticuffs. The Ban Hammer appears to have no golden version but it gets a slight reflection. The Golden Knife's image with Pencil skin on the kill-chart originally says "WICK'D" in yellow text. The Golden Knife is also based on the Golden Knife ability from CS:GO where if a player wins the points of arms race game mode, they will get a Golden Knife and will need to kill an enemy to win and gain XP points. The golden weapons, alongside their ability to turn their victims into gold upon death, may be a reference to Team Fortress 2's Golden Frying Pan and the Saxxy , the melee variants of which turn enemies into solid gold upon killing them. 99 (297) Gamemodes Standard Insane Mode Hackula Firing Mode Single-fire Special Demotion Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The golden musket is the gold, albeit the weaker version of the Musket and Pulse Musket . It deals 99 damage to the body, not 1-shot killing a target at any range, far unlike its brothers. The golden musket also carries 1 round with a punishing 6-second reload time in addition to 4 bullets in reserve. The only thing special was the demotion, plus the one-shot kill headshot, therefore players should aim for the head when using it. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros Demotes players on kill. One-shot kill on the head. Cons Only one round in the chamber, so the weapon must reload every time after firing. Low reserve ammo. Only deals 99 damage on bodyshot. Grueling 6-second reload time. Tips [ ] The Golden Musket is an incredibly harder (and more annoying) version of the original Musket , as it only deals 99 damage for a bodyshot. However , there are multiple solutions to getting promoted from this weapon: A bodyshot, followed up with a single hit from your Knife will secure the kill and demote your opponent. Firing at an opponent and hope that a teammate gets you an assist. Firing at an opponent after you see one of your teammates shoot at them. Aiming for the head, although it will be more difficult against opponents using lighter weapons. Briefly camping in one spot so you can take your time to aim. It will be easier to get a headshot with the Golden Musket if your opponent is using a heavy weapon, which will make them walk slower. Keep an eye on what weapons your opponents are holding and pick the best choice. Heavy weapons include all Machine Guns and most Sniper Rifles. Just like the original Musket, if you cannot wait for the long reload, resorting to melee combat with your Knife is your only option. Hiding in an enclosed space will let you reload the Golden Musket in peace. In the end, you do not have to worry about using the Golden Musket, as it only appears in Hard Mode/Insane Mode and it rarely shows up in the weapon pool for Standard/Legacy Competitive. It also never shows up in Snipers Only. Still, it would be a good idea to remember the aforementioned tips just in case you have the misfortune of getting this weapon. Trivia [ ] Xonae confirmed this weapon is not supposed to be in Standard gamemode. 31-65 (51-102) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio (Outdated) 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The M3A1 Submachine Gun (also known as the Grease Gun ) is an American submachine gun (SMG) chambered for .45 ACP, developed as a replacement for the Tommy Gun due to its ease of production, lighter weight, and ease of use. In-Game Information [ ] The Grease Gun is a very powerful submachine gun, seeming more akin to a rifle than an SMG. It has high damage, with a minimum of 32 at all ranges, ensuring that you will always have at least a four-shot kill. However, the Grease Gun has its drawbacks. It has a low rate of fire; even slower than most semi-automatic guns being spam-clicked. It also has a small magazine size of 20 rounds. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Low spread. Quick reload. Cons: High recoil upon continuous shots. Slow rate of fire. Small magazine capacity. Trivia [ ] The variant of M3 in-game appears to be the M3A1, as evidenced by the lack of a cocking lever and the use of the character's hand to pull the bolt back manually. Normally in real life, the Tommy Gun is more accurate than the M3A1, but in-game, the M3A1 is more accurate than the Tommy Gun. In-game, the Grease Gun incorrectly holds 20 rounds in a 30 round magazine, likely due to balance reasons. When it was first brought into the game, its damage was very high, allowing people to often score multi-kills. The M3 is an automatic, air-cooled blowback-operated weapon that fires from an open bolt. Constructed of plain 0.060-inch-thick (1.5 mm) sheet steel, the M3 receiver was stamped in two halves that were then welded together. Left over M3 magazines from WWII were used by the MAC-10 during the early production to reduce costs. 38-57 (114-171) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Laser Tag Legacy Competitive All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Tracer Shot Fall-off Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.4 22.401 2 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 0.088 0.5 The Handcannon is a fast break-action laser pistol. It fires a laser beam using a magnetic repulse which creates a semiautomatic contrast in order to launch the energy projectile. Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] With an 8-round magazine, this weapon is a threat comparable to the Deagle , trading in damage for perfect accuracy and more rounds. As an accuracy-based weapon, this pistol has an unusual trait of being efficient at long-range despite its lowered damage. It one shot-kill on the head and has ramp-up that increases damages based on closer proximity to enemies. Because of its ramp-up, it is best to take advantage of the increased damage at close range to deal maximum damage that can sweep a player in two body-shots. However, more conservative players may pick off a headshot at long range, which can be easily done due to its perfect accuracy. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Perfect accuracy. Fast reload. Quick movement speed. Cons: Tracer shot can give away the user's position. Small magazine size of 8. Somewhat slow rate of fire. Takes 3 shots to kill a person if body-shot. Tips [ ] The Handcannon performs best if picking off a single target instead of being swarmed by multiple opponents. It has a slow firing speed, so you will not be able to take on more than one enemy at a time. Focus on individual fights instead. Keep a good distance from opponents to make it easier to land shots with the Handcannon. Getting too close may make it confusing for you on where to shoot. The Handcannon loses to Shotgun-class weapons, so beware of this. Despite its perfect accuracy, it is recommended not to use this like a Sniper Rifle from long-range as 38 damage can only do so much. Stay within mid-range and the Handcannon will be effective. Trivia [ ] This weapon's model was used as a base for the Flare Gun for Typical Colors 2 , borrowing animations and even parts of the model. The previous firing sound was taken from the Diamondback from Team Fortress 2 . It is the signature weapon of the Castlers, Cyber Hero, Holiday Castlers, and Ronaldinho Soccer skins . It was the signature weapon of Ace Pilot in the August Update , but was changed back to the MP5K in the Anniversary Update and was changed to the P90 in the Christmas Update . The Handcannon was also reworked into a ramp-up style weapon in the September Update, formerly being a fixed 42 damage to the body. The Handcannon bears a vague resemblance to the 45MW.TRG Dominator firearm from Psycho-Pass . The Handcannon is ROLVe developer Castlers' favorite weapon. Developers have the unique ability to carry a second weapon of their choice in the game. Castlers' second weapon is the Handcannon. The Handcannon makes an appearance in the RPG Event as the weapon used by the Commander Unit enemy. HE Grenade Current Alpha Overview Magazine Ammo 1 0 Damage 45-100 4-7 (Thrown) Gamemodes Standard Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Special Splash Damage Charge Shot Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros and Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History 5 Source General Information [ ] The High Explosive Grenade (shortly known as HE Grenade ) is a commonly used grenade (most known for its use in CS:GO .) It bears resemblance to the standard M67 Frag Grenade made by the US army used in many wars after World War II. In-game Information [ ] It used to be the weapon before the Golden Gun until it was removed from the Mega Update . This is different from the Bomb because the bomb has a brief delay until it can be used again after it explodes, while the HE Grenade has a very long delay. Pros and Cons [ ] Pros: Able to hit enemies upon throwing the grenade towards them. Ability to cook the grenade by holding it. Does not explode while cooking the grenade. Cons: 1 pre-use grenade. Long delay before using it again after each throw. Players can easily dodge the grenade. Users can easily kill themselves if not careful. Trivia [ ] The HE Grenade was originally going to be added into the game during the development of Gun Game however this was left scrapped and later released to the ALPHA phase of Arsenal . 87 (108-195) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Wild West Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Apartment Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Lever-Action Special Double Jump Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Henry Repeating Rifle is an American lever-action rifle that made its debut in 1860, notable for being the basis of the Winchester rifle. Besides being the most popular in the Wild West era, the Henry Rifle was also a prized weapon in the American Civil War, and was one of the main weapons used in the Battle of Little Bighorn. However, its design made it unable to attatch a bayonet , one of the most useful attatchments in historical battles. It functions differently compared to other existing Shotguns. After a shot, the user has to push out the lever, located at the bottom, to eject the shell and then pull the lever back to cock in a new one. When reloading, the user has to hold the lever open and use their free hand to load shells into the chamber located at the side of the weapon's barrel. In-game Information [ ] The Henry Rifle is a mid to long-range weapon, due to the weapon's two-shot kill minimum at all ranges, a sluggish rate of fire owing to the lever-action mechanism, and a one-shot kill potential at all ranges upon a headshot. However, due to the slow rate of fire, aiming precisely with this gun is likely required. It can be compared to the Spencer Carbine , as they are both lever-action rifles that allow players to double jump by simply jumping in midair. However, the difference is that the Henry Rifle has the ability to reload 1 by 1, unlike the Spencer, which requires waiting for its long reload time. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. No spread and is completely accurate at all ranges. 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. Capability of double jumping allows for greater movement. Headshots can one-shot. Cons: Slow rate of fire. High recoil. Sluggish empty reload. Low magazine capacity of 6. Tips [ ] While the Henry Rifle does have the ability to double jump, make sure not to overuse it. This weapon only shoots one bullet, so extreme movement like double-jumping may make you miss more shots. Use the double-jump ability to instead find higher places to shoot from, and escape opponents while reloading. The Henry Rifle deals 87 damage from any range , so it is recommended that you try to shoot from a distance rather than up close to opponents. Trivia [ ] The model for the Henry Rifle is incorrectly modeled after the Winchester 1873 rifle, as the use of a loading port on the right side of the receiver can attest to, along with the distinctive wooden handguard. The actual Henry Rifle did not feature a wooden foregrip and was reloaded by a muzzle-bottom tube instead of being loaded by the breach. The Henry Rifle is named after its creator, Benjamin Tyler Henry. Production of the Henry Rifle lasted from 1860 to 1866 under the New Haven Arms Company. The firing sound effect for both the Henry Rifle and the Spencer Carbine originated from the Sniper Rifle in Team Fortress Classic . The Henry Rifle can fire a variety of cartridges such as .44 Magnum, or the .44 Henry Rimfire. Prior to the Showtime! Update , the Henry Rifle didn't have the double jump ability. It is the signature weapon of the Wanderer and Lone Wanderer skins . The models, sounds, and animations for this weapon are also used for a primary weapon of choice for the Flanker in Typical Colors 2 , known as the Perceptionist , although it acts like a shotgun and not a rifle. The double jump ability is most likely a reference to the Flanker from TC2 , a former ROLVe game. The Henry Rifle is the sole weapon in the Froggy's Apartment quest. This references popular carnival game culture where target shooting games use the Henry as the weapon platform mounted on the stalls. Gallery [ ] Henry Rifle in real life. In-game Henry Rifle in real life. 27-45 (37-56) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Pistols Kill Confirmed Juggernaut Clown Infection Legacy Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.15 22.401 1.9 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 2.621 1 The Browning Hi-Power is a single-action, semi-automatic handgun available in 9mm and .40 S&W. It was based on a design by American firearms inventor John Browning, and completed by FN Herstal's Dieudonné Saive, as Browning died before his design could be finalized by him. The name Hi-Power was chosen for its relatively high magazine size of 13-rounds, which at the time was twice the size of more contemporary pistols' magazines. It has been used by many armed forces and was produced for 82 years before its discontinuation by Browning Arms and FN Herstal. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Hi-Power is a quick, above-average weapon firing from a 13-round magazine, acting as a better version of the M1911 . Players can expect to kill with two shots to the head at all ranges, and can always expect a three-shot kill at close-quarters combat (CQC). The weapon quickly reloads from an average magazine capacity, helping to ensure minimal downtime between the magazine dumps. As with other pistols, rapidly firing the Hi-Power will increase the weapon's spread to a point that it is nearly unusable at longer ranges. Tap-firing with the Hi-Power can help players kill at long ranges. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. High maximum headshot damage. Fast reload. Somewhat large magazine capacity. Cons: High spread upon continuous shots. Magazine is easily expended due to its rate of fire. Tips [ ] The Hi-Power is one of the more accurate Pistols, although its spread becomes useless around the 7th shot. The Hi-Power is great from low- and mid-range. You can easily spam shots from either of these distances and nearly every shot you make will land. It also reloads quick, allowing you to continue shooting in the middle of an intense fight. If you're coming to Arsenal as a Typical Colors 2 player, you should note that the Hi-Power is similar to the Pistol you know, but it's slightly different: Unlike TC2's Pistol, for the Hi-Power you'll have to rapidly click the fire button on your device to shoot instead of holding it down. Beware that the Hi-Power is less accurate than TC2's Pistol, so you'll need to space out your shots a bit. The Hi-Power is more powerful, as its damage range is 27-45 compared to the Pistol's 7-22. Shooting an opponents head makes you deal crit damage, too. The Hi-Power is a slightly better version of the Pistol for Flanker. In TC2, its ammo is 12 / 36. The Hi-Power in Arsenal has an ammo pool of 13 / 39. Gallery [ ] Hi-Power in real life. Trivia [ ] The Hi-Power designer, John Browning, was the same person who designed the M1911 , along with many others. The Hi-Power's weapon model appears to have been reused from Typical Colors 2 , found in-game as the Pistol , as the Flanker and Mechanic 's stock secondary. At the time, the Hi-Power had almost two times the magazine capacity of contemporary pistols, notable examples being the Luger and the M1911 , firing from 8 and 7-round box magazines respectively. This is the reason the weapon is named the Hi-Power. The Hi-Power was the most used military pistol, having been used by 50 different countries. After 82 years of production, it was discontinued in 2017. The weapon is referred to as the HP, GP, BAP, or BHP, but is mainly called the Hi-Power . The Hi-Power's firing sound was taken from the game, Day of Infamy . The Hi-Power's firing sound is most notably used a placeholder for new, just released weapons and is used for the Literal Gun and the Origami Gun . 81-99 (297-396) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Pistols Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Hackula Headshots Only Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Single-fire Special Suppressor Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Nredly (Current, Previous) Unknown (Original) Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.7 22.401 1.85 INITIAL SPREAD 0 The Mk22 (better known as Hush Puppy ) is a single-fire pistol manufactured that was manufactured for the Navy SEAL forces during Vietnam by Smith & Wesson . It is a modified Smith & Wesson Model 39 with a slide-locking mechanism and a wider grip frame for its 14-round mag. The reason for its slide-locking mechanism is to keep the gun itself quiet while firing, as to not give the user away to any sentries or watchdogs nearby, which this weapon was designed to take out, most importantly the latter, hence the nickname "Hush Puppy". Unfortunately, more information regarding the use of the Mk22 is hard to come by because of the confidentiality that surrounds this weapon. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Hush Puppy was added to Arsenal during the Mega Update . The Hush Puppy has a powerful amount of damage. Players would be rewarded with a whopping 297 damage if they aim for the head. Along with no spread, players that aim their crosshair at the players will guaranteed land their shot. Landing a shot on an opponent's body can be easily used for an assist if a teammate is around. The weapon also has a fall-off, making it a one-shot kill at close range. However, even in a long range encounter it is still of great use. While it might not kill an enemy on the first shot, it still does a huge amount of damage, basically guaranteeing that you'll at least get an assist. The weapon doesn't come without problems. Its slide-locking mechanism means that players will need to manually re-chamber the weapon after every shot, resulting in a substantially lowered fire rate. The slow fire-rate makes the weapon particularly difficult to use for those unable to land a hit. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Has no spread and recoil. Silenced shots do not give away the user's spot for enemies. Firerate can be increased by double keying. Cons: Slow fire rate. Small magazine size. Slow reload speed for its class. Tips [ ] The Hush Puppy is unique compared to the other Pistols: It cannot spam its shots. There's a 0.5 delay between each shot. It's 100% accurate. Its reload speed is a lot slower than the other Pistols, meaning that you're very vulnerable when reloading during intense fights. It deals enough damage to be effective from any range, making it one of the most versatile Pistols in the game. The Hush Puppy deals 99 damage at close-range, and for some distance at mid-range. Any further and the damage will have fall-off. But don't get too close! Remember that the Hush Puppy has a slow firing speed, so you cannot get kills quickly. Stay at a good distance and you'll be more likely to not get shot. Of course, headshots will insta-kill. Since the Hush Puppy has no spread, it's practically sub-classed as a Sniper Rifle. It deals a ton of damage, even from far away. At longer ranges, crouch down to slow down your movement and make it easier to aim. Beware that you can easily be attacked if an opponent finds you. Because its normal damage range is 81-99, it will take two shots to kill an opponent. However, you can just shoot once and wait for an opponent to get you an assist. Alternatively, you can land a shot, then land a regular hit from your Knife to demote them. Talk about being too close for comfort! If you're coming to Arsenal as a Typical Colors 2 player, note that the Hush Puppy is not like the Silenced Pistol that Agent uses. The Silenced Pistol fires fast, very much unlike the Hush Puppy. This means you'll need to make your shots count instead of spamming them. On the bright side, the Hush Puppy deals massive damage against enemies compared to the Silenced Pistol. Gallery [ ] In third person. Hush Puppy in real life. Trivia [ ] The Hush Puppy (Mk22) was one of Naked Snake's starting weapons in Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater . It works nearly the same in-game as it does in Arsenal ; the only main differences being that in MGS3, it held tranquilizer rounds, and the suppressor was detachable. Also, the gun is the signature weapon of the skins Snake Eater (who is a reference to Naked Snake), Veteran, and Fallen Veteran. Getting a headshot kill with the Hush Puppy while wearing the Snake Eater skin will grant the player the Virtuous Combatant badge, which is a reference to the Virtuous Mission in Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater. The Hush Puppy is the first weapon with a silencer to be added to the Mega Update of Arsenal . The Hush Puppy is also one of the 6 weapons which have a silencer, the others are the MP9-S , the MK18 , the Mauser Carbine , Maxim-9 , the Sako 85 , and the Vector . 3500 (300) Gamemodes Swordfights Special Backstab Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Ice Dagger is one of the weapons exclusive to the Swordfights gamemode. As its name suggests, it is a light-blue, icy reskin of the Dagger melee. It also has a little light blue sparkle affect to it. It is the only weapon in the Swordfights gamemode that has the ability to backstab. It is quite considered the most powerful melee, having a 3500 damage which is extremely high for a melee, along with a backstab ability allowing it to instantly kill a player. The Ice kill effect is also applied to this weapon. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Capable of backstabbing. Instantly kill the target on hit. Cons: Does not demote of kill. Extremely short attack range. Trivia [ ] The Ice Dagger deals the most damage out of every melee weapon in the game, including Swordfights, doing 3500 damage on the body and 300 on the back. The Ice Dagger is based off the Icedagger gear created by ROBLOX in 2012. Like the Ghostwalker , the Ice Dagger is not wielder transparent. 30 per shuriken 120 (secondary fire) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Hard Mode Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Burst-Fire (3) Special Projectile Arch Double Jump Fan-fire Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Ice Stars are shurikens with frozen ice tips. They are a projectile weapon and run on an ammo pool system instead of a magazine system like the Minigun or M40 . It has an arch, and the arch is similar to the Razor Bomb . This weapon is best suited for mid-range, similar to the Crossbow . This weapon allows players to jump twice in the air like the Spencer Carbine and Henry Rifle . The Ice Stars throw three shurikens per click, dealing 90 damage if all shurikens hit. Right-clicking or pressing the V key throws all three shurikens at once which deals 120 damage, despite only throwing three, insta-killing the enemy; on mobile, players can press the scope button to throw all three shurikens at once. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast projectile speed. Fast fire rate. High ammo pool. No reloading required. Double-jump ability. Burst-throwing allows multiple shots in one click. Insta-kill on burst-throwing. Cons: Projectile arches, making it harder to hit enemies at longer ranges. No headshot multiplier. Long delay between burst throws. Low damage for a projectile. Tips [ ] The Ice Stars' biggest advantage is its ability to burst-fire . This method is a lot stronger than the primary-fire option with the potential to insta-kill. However, this lacks range. The burst-fire attack resembles a Shotgun, powerful but cannot go far. Try not to use the primary-fire attack (which throws out one star at a time) as much as possible, as it can easily be dodged. Save the primary-fire attack for enemies at a distance, especially at mid-range. Take advantage of its ability to double-jump. You can use this ability to get closer to enemies or to dodge enemy attacks while in mid-air. This especially comes in handy with a tricky projectile weapon like the Ice Stars. Here's a little secret: newer Arsenal players using the Ice Stars do not know the ability to burst-fire exists. Use these players to get an easy kill, especially if you have a difficult weapon to get a kill with (such as the Musket ). Gallery [ ] Development of the weapon that should've been snowflake stars. Model of the weapon. Trivia [ ] The Ice Stars model was revealed by EMIRPERIF in the official Arsenal Discord server on December 18, 2019. EMIRPERIF originally going to make snowflake stars based on a ROBLOX gear, Silver Snowflake as suggested by Dogutsune however it ended up as ice stars instead. This, the Spencer Carbine , the Henry Rifle , the Golden Knife , the Lever Shotgun , the Ghostwalker and the Illumina are the only weapons in the game that have the double jump ability. The Ice Stars' current mechanics seem to draw inspiration from the Overwatch character Genji, a cybernetic ninja who is also capable of double-jumping and throwing volleys of shurikens. The Ice Stars currently has no firing sound. It is almost never worth it to use the left click fire because right click usually deals more than three shurikens, and throws shurikens faster Audio [ ] Current Firing https://robloxarsenal.fandom.com/wiki/File:Ice-stars-burst.ogg Previous Firing https://robloxarsenal.fandom.com/wiki/File:Ice-stars.ogg Weapon History [ ] 12/20/19: Added into the Christmas Update: Part II of Arsenal. 05/16/20: The weapon mechanic changed: Fire rate buffed. With this sword, the player has stronger jumps and a lunge ability when attacking mid-air. It is the best mobility in the gamemode, it also boasts 104 damage; posing a threat to those who have even taken smidges of damage however unlike the rest of the swords, Illumina has a 1.6 fire rate. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Insta-kill on hit. Quick mobility. Ability to fly upon swinging melee mid-air. Cons: Lack of backstab mechanic. Trivia [ ] The Illumina will still be held in the player's right hand if they are taunting. This sword is based off the Illumina gear created by ROBLOX in 2009. It is the signature weapon of the Christmas Nomad skin. Per Pellet 24-90 (37-106) Pellets Per Shot 6 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off HUD Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Inertial Shotgun ( Sjögren Inertia Shotgun ) is a Swedish 12-gauge semi-automatic shotgun. It is particularly known for being the first use of an inertia recoil operation in a firearm. In-game Information [ ] The Inertial Shotgun 's statistics rival that of the Trench Gun . It boasts high per-pellet damage that does not fall-off as harshly compared to other shotguns, allowing this weapon to be used out to longer distances. On top of that, the weapon's semi-automatic mechanism increases its rate of fire to top tier levels. However, the Inertial Shotgun has a low magazine capacity. Combined with the weapon's rate of fire, players can expend their ammo in a matter of moments should they continually miss their target. Fortunately, the weapon's 1-by-1 reloading allows one to top their magazine off at any opportune moment. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. High damage with a low fall-off. Tight spread for a shotgun. 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. Cons: Small magazine size. 1-by-1 empty reloads are slow. Higher recoil for a weapon of its class. Tips [ ] The Intertial Shotgun can be used easily when shooting, but its other aspects (such as the recoil and reload) may be tricky to deal with. If possible, avoid reloading this weapon and get a kill early. Its reload is slow and it will leave you vulnerable during intense fights. This weapon is very good at mid-range due to its tight spread of pellets, and can even hit opponents who are both far and on a higher platform. This also applies to any opponents currently recoil jumping . Gallery [ ] The Inertial Shotgun in real life with a full stock and long barrel. Trivia [ ] The in-game model compared to the real model has a sawed-off barrel and no stock. The Inertial Shotgun was produced for a short time of 1 year (1908-1909) and only 5,000 of the models were produced. It is the signature weapon of Gal skin . 100 Firing Mode Single Projectile Special Projectile Arch Kill Icon Creator Roblox The Influencer Launcher or better known as Video Star Launcher was available for ROLVe staff and content creators from the Stars Program during the Egg Hunt 2019 event. It was used to give players the Video Star egg, which gave a badge too. It was an altered Baseball Launcher which fired eggs that could instantly kill opponents, rewarding players who got hit with the Video Star badge related to the Egg Hunt 2019 event. The Influencer Launcher was discontinued after the 2019 Egg Hunt event. It can still be spawned in by using a custom gamemode in private servers and can still be fired, however the projectile does not appear. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast fire rate. Instantly kills a player upon hitting with an egg. Cons: Arching projectile makes it harder to hit enemies across further ranges. Trivia [ ] This and the Admin Launcher were the only weapons with a projectile that gave players badges upon impact. The shooting animation of the weapon is flinging the egg out. 36 (150) Gamemodes All Special Backstab Demotion Kill Icon The Knife is a melee weapon. The Knife deals 36 damage on-hit. When a player kills an enemy with a Knife, the victim gets demoted, losing a level and going back to their previous weapon. It is available at every level except Level 32 in Standard and Gun Rotation, and Level 16 in every other gamemode excluding Brickbattle, Clown Infection, and Swordfights. The Knife has a backstab mechanic, in which if a player manages to stab an enemy whose back is facing towards them in a 135-degree angle, it will instantly kill that enemy. Additionally, the Knife allows for a fast movement speed while active, allowing for extra mobility during battle. The Knife also has different skins that can be equipped in the locker , each with their own golden counterparts (except for the Fisticuffs and Ban Hammer). Knife skins are merely cosmetic and have no differing statistics. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Can instantly kill a player by backstabbing. Demotes players on kill. Fast movement speed while active. Cons: Can only fight opponents that are at close-range. The user is easily killable by other weapons. Slow rate of stab. Tips [ ] The Knife is very useful when it comes movement . If you equip it, you can run faster and jump slightly higher. The best time to pull out your Knife is when you have a heavy weapon that slows down your movement speed, such as a Machine Gun or a Sniper Rifle. If your current weapon is a Pistol, there's no need to pull out the Knife to run faster, as your speed will stay the same. Be careful when running with your Knife, as it makes you the most vulnerable to enemy players. If you're running with your Knife, make sure to pull out your current weapon before turning any corners to avoid getting killed by any enemies you meet. Try getting kills with your Knife if you see any opportunity to. Be careful of this, as any reckless attempts with the Knife will heavily punish you. Knife kills will slow down the progress of opponents as they get demoted to their previous weapon, but you get promoted to your next. Getting a Knife kill on someone with the Golden Knife will also prevent them from winning the game, although this is very risky. The best time to get kills with your Knife are: When the opponent's back is turned towards you. If the opponent has not seen you yet. If the opponent has a weak weapon, such as a throwable projectile or a Pistol. If your weapon needs to reload, but you dealt enough damage so you can demote them with one hit from your Knife. "Trickstabs" are more difficult, but rewarding ways to kill with the Knife. These should only be attempted as a last resort or if you're confident it will work: Drop stab: jumping off a higher platform on a target down below, stabbing their back as you land. Matador stab: you run to a target, but just next to them. Once you're past them, flick your aim left or right (depending on which side your opponent is on) and backstab. Hurdle stab: you run to a target, jump, crouch mid-air to avoid bumping into your target, then flick your aim downards (and diagonally if you're off to the side) and backstsab. Do note that you will need to jump over your target's shoulders and not their head, as doing this trickstab while on their head will only count as a hit. Sky-ward stab: when a target jumps over your head, simply flick your aim upwards. Your stab will technically count as a backstab due to their back being directly on-top of your head. Aerial stab: this is one of the more complicated stabs, but it's very similar to the drop stab. Before stabbing, you will need an explosive projectile like the Rocket Launcher, a gun with explosive ammo, M16A2 as an example, or a gun with recoil jumping, such as DB Shotgun or Barrett. Launching yourself up in the air with the weapon, you'll be airborne through the sky. Meanwhile, look down to seek a potential target. Once you are close to that target, equip your melee and stab them once you land on their back. You will also have to time when you take out your melee, but it's recommended to do it right after you are airborne. You can also do the same in Concussion Mania. Gallery [ ] A red Solid Color Knife. Trivia [ ] In the Mega Update , the Butterfly Knife was used as the default melee. In the 2.6 Update , three other melees were added and the Butterfly Knife was replaced by the Dagger. However, there is a slight chance for the Butterfly Knife to appear in the locker immediately when first starting the game. Also in the Mega Update , the handle was pure black with some gray bolts attached between the blade and the handle. This was changed to pure shiny blue in 2.6 Update . Before in Arsenal Archived , the Knife dealt 20 damage per hit. Many Knife skins are based on popular media and pop culture, or are taken from Typical Colors 2 . The Energy Blade is likely inspired by the energy sword from Halo . The Saber is inspired by the lightsaber wielded by Star Wars character Kylo Ren . The Endbringer is heavily inspired by the Crucible energy blade from Doom Eternal . Da Melee is based on the Arsenal Discord moderator, Buildingssssss. The Delinquent Pop melee is a reference to popsicle figurines from the Blue Bunny Ice Cream company. The When Day Breaks melee is a reference to S.D. Locke's Proposal for SCP-001 known as When Day Breaks. The Annihilator's Broken Sword is taken from a Typical Colors 2 melee weapon named Broken Sword . There are exclusive melees that are only available to ROLVe staff members, such as the SpaceKatanaOLD, SuperSpaceKatana, the Equip, the Crucible, and the Moderation Hammer. The Moderation Hammer used to have the Ban Hammer's icon as a placeholder and its rarity being Promo before unknowingly changing to a blank icon and being promoted to the Admin rarity. The Moderation Hammer's inspect animation is bugged, where it will go inside the player instead of away from them. The Super Space Katana has no model which makes it impossible to use. The Crucible and Katar are the exact same melee as the Endbringer and Energy Katar, respectively, except the blade doesn't come out of the weapon in the equip animation. The default skin for the Knife, the Dagger, appears in Typical Colors 2 as the model for the Tunnel Rat weapon. The Knife itself also appears in Typical Colors 2 as a developer-only weapon where the user turns into the Delinquent . Just like in Arsenal , this weapon allows to user to insta-kill enemies upon backstab, and the user's weapon changes after each kill. Some content creators can be given exclusive melees by the developers. FusionJack_ was given the Gaster Blaster melee. The Knife's demote sound is taken from from CS:GO's Guardian gamemode where a player gets killed by an attacker during a round. The archived Knife is based off the CS:GO terrorist-side knife. The Pencil melee's icon was simply the word "WICK'D", as the Pencil is inspired from the John Wick movies. However, the "WICK'D" icon was changed to an actual icon of the Pencil in the Pre-Halloween Update II release. The Banana's kill-icon would turn yellow whenever the user got a backstab. The Bloxy melee is the only melee to have an unusual attached to it. The Newspaper melee had a glitch where the user could clip through walls by deploying it while looking up. The Fish melee is the first melee to have jiggle mechanics. When equipping the Moai melee, the vine boom sound plays. The Ban Hammer could've been obtained through the removed fake Admin Gamepass or the expired code "hammertime" The Butterfly Knife's icon originally used the one from Counter-Strike: Global Offensive . The Night's Edge and The Darkheart were temporarily added to the daily shop on April 20, 2022. The Frog melee can be obtained via purchasing the Froggy UGC accessory from the Avatar Shop . The Golden Rings melee from the Winter Update overwrites whatever kill effect the user had equipped with Gold, the effect used by the golden weapons. 100 Gamemodes Classic Cold Killer Murder Madness Double Trouble Juggernaut Infected Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Evil Presence 4 Audio 5 Trivia 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Knife is a Murderer-only weapon. Swinging this weapon with M1 will instantaneously kill a bystander, and throwing this weapon with M2 will allow it to be used at a longer range. Thrown knives will be recovered after 2 seconds, and during that time the Murderer is unable to use it. It is gained by the Murderer 10 seconds after the start of a round. When held, pressing E while looking at a dead body with at least 1 loot will allow you to take the appearance of it and make the body disappear. When a player is killed, 15 seconds are added to the round timer in every gamemode except Cold Killer and Murder Madness. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Instantly kills a player upon a hit. Can be thrown for a ranged attack. Cons: Very close ranged without throwing. Thrown knives take a few seconds to get back. Evil Presence [ ] If the Murderer has not killed anyone for 90 seconds, they will be notified that their Evil Presence is showing. During this time, their vision goes grayscale, and all other players will have their locations revealed to the murderer. They also turn completely black with glowing red eyes, and they emit a black smoke. If they kill someone, their Evil Presence will stop and everything will appear normal again. The Evil Presence can also be conditionally applied to players, usually in other gamemodes. Some conditions that can cause it are... Being infected in Infected. Having the revolver in Hot Potato. Being the Juggernaut or Freezer in Juggernaut and Cold Killer. Evil Presence can not show in Murderer Madness. 35 (43) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 (Current) Unknown (Previous) Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.4 0.1 22.401 2.6 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 0 0.5 The 2.7mm Kolibri is an Austro-Hungarian semi-automatic pistol produced in 1914, and was widely known to fire the world's smallest pistol cartridge available. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Kolibri is the smallest weapon in Arsenal . It is a three-shot kill to both the body and the head. It also has perfect accuracy due to not having spread, meaning whenever the crosshair is pointed, the Kolibri will guarantee hit it. It also has no fall-off, making it exceptional at long range compared to other pistols. However, the main drawbacks of the Kolibri is its small magazine size; having to not pair well with its insanely-fast fire-rate, which can expend its ammo in mere seconds. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Has no spread and recoil. Fast fire rate. Perfect accuracy. Fast pullout time. Cons: Small magazine capacity. Magazine is expended within seconds due to its fire rate. Tips [ ] The Kolibri's 7 shots can be used up quickly, so make sure not to fire them all at once. If you space out your shots, you'll be more likely to get a kill with this weapon with the first magazine. Three good shots from any range will kill from any distance since the Kolibri does not have ramp-up or fall-off damage. Gallery [ ] Kolibri in real life. Trivia [ ] The Kolibri was marketed and designed by an Austrian watchmaker named Franz Pfannl and advertised as a ladies self-defense weapon able to easily fit inside a handbag, despite the cartridge's inherent weakness. Only about 1,000 copies of the Kolibri were produced in real life. The Kolibri in-game is much stronger than its real life counterpart. The Kolibri's bullet itself is incredibly weak, with literature at the time suggesting the round was capable of penetrating only 10–40 millimeters (0.39–1.57 in) of a wooden pine board. The bullet wasn't even strong enough to penetrate a leather jacket. The real life Kolibri's bullet actually carries less energy than an average punch. In real life, the Kolibri lacks bore rifling, which makes it extremely inaccurate. Due to its extremely small size, the Kolibri would be very difficult to reload. Kolibri in German means hummingbird, the world's smallest bird, as a testament to the weapon's minuscule size. When on any mobile device, the Kolibri's firing mode changes to full automatic. Due to its small size, the Kolibri clips through viewmodel characters that have cosmetics on their hands. It is the signature weapon of Surfer skin . 19-33 (27-38) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Kill Confirmed Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Ev3rSoul Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The L86A3 is the light support weapon (LSW) of the British SA80 family, though its many shortcomings led to its withdrawal from British Armed Forces service in 2019. In comparison to its brethren, the L86 boasts a longer barrel, the addition of a bipod, and a prominent rear vertical grip. In-game Information [ ] While an accurate weapon to roll, its damage and fire rate are quite low. The L86A3 is best used at longer ranges, where it can outgun most of its opponents. However, it falters in close engagements where those with faster weapons will easily outperform the L86. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Low ammo consumption rate. Moderate magazine size. Good maximum damage. Low spread - making it usable at long ranges. Cons: Low minimum damage. Slow rate of fire. Long reload time. High recoil Gallery [ ] Development of the weapon. L86A3 in real life with bipod. Trivia [ ] L86A3, along with the current version of FAMAS , were revealed on Twitter on September 8th, 2019. The L86A3 LSW is the squad automatic weapon part of the SA80 family. It is also fictionally designated as the A3, because the L86 line only went up to A2. The gun's rear vertical grip is for the user (lying prone) to have better control of the gun while the bipod is deployed. The earlier predecessors and variants of the L86A3 proved to be so unreliable that sometimes during firing, the gun would fall apart. The L86A3 is one of the 4 bullpup weapons in the game along with the AUG , the Dual Shotguns , and the FAMAS .
