12 (15-110) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Laser Tag Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Tracer Shot Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Laser Rifle is a futuristic-themed automatic rifle released during the Sci-Fi Update in on September 29, 2020. The Laser Rifle performs similarly to the Pulse Laser , except for the reloading time which is faster than the Pulse Laser's reloading time. The Laser Rifle has no spread which helps for long-range combat, This weapon has an extremely fast fire rate which helps defeating enemies quickly, and a high magazine size to prevent frequent reloads from happening too often. However, there are downsides such as low damage per shot, which makes killing opponents harder to do, and even with the high magazine size, the magazine size will expend fast due to its fire rate. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Very fast fire rate. Has no spread and recoil. Above-average magazine size for its class. Can kill enemies quickly if well aimed. Cons: High ammo consumption rate. Moderately slow reload. Tracer shot can give away the user's position. Can cause lag when spammed due to Tracer Shot. Low damage per shot. Slower movement speed for its class. Magazine size is easily expended due to its fire rate. Tips [ ] The Laser Rifle is very deadly, as it fires very quickly and accurately. However, its low damage and slow reload will make you a sitting duck if you miss your shots. The Laser Rifle's reload speed is 2.5 seconds, too slow to let you reload in an intense fight without dying. You may be able to kill opponents fast, but missing a few shots won't secure you the kill. It's especially important to keep your aim steady with the Laser Rifle. Stay at mid-range as much as possible, as this is your most advantageous distance against opponents. The Laser Rifle can potentially snipe someone from long-range, you're more likely to miss if you don't keep your aim constant on your target. At close-range it's even worse, as you'll have to track your opponent if they start hopping around you, which will waste a huge amount of ammo. At mid-range, you can easily aim at your target without moving your aim too much. The Laser Rifle has the most noticeable tracer shots in the game, so beware of any players using them to find your location. Gallery [ ] Sketch. Stage one development. Stage two. Stage three. Stage four. Stage five. Weapon render. A image used for a survey where users have to pick which colours are perfect. Trivia [ ] The Laser Rifle was revealed in the Arsenal Discord during the Summer Update II development on June 4th, 2020. The Laser Rifle was originally the Pulse Laser's name. It is the signature weapon of the Robo Sorcerer. This, the Focus, the Pulse Laser, the Railgun, the Plasma Launcher, and the Sunflower Sun has a unique equipping sound. The Laser Rifle makes an appearance in the RPG Event as the weapon used by the Commander Unit enemy. Per Pellet 4-47 (9-55) Pellets Per Shot 9 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Wild West Typical Colors Randomizer Kill Confirmed Juggernaut Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Lever-Action Special Double Jump Fall-off HUD Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Lever-Action Shotgun is a shotgun model similar to that of the Winchester models from the 19th century, created by legendary firearm designer John Browning. It made its debut in the middle of the "American Frontier" (or "Wild West") era in 1887. While no longer produced since 1901 (due to the invention of more effective firearms), its popularity made its way into multiple media, such as western-themed films and video games. It functions differently compared to other existing Shotguns. After a shot, the user has to push out the lever, located at the bottom, to eject the shell and then pull the lever back to cock in a new one. When reloading, the user has to hold the lever open and use their free hand to load shells into the chamber located at the top of the weapon's handle. There is an option to flip this weapon by putting two fingers in the lever to spin it, but given the size, weight, and time to do so, it's highly impractical in a fight. In-game Information [ ] At first glance, the Lever Shotgun in-game seems lacking in performance, with a slow fire-rate. However, it holds the unique and very useful ability to be able to double jump by simply jumping in midair. When double jumping, sound will play as well as a puff of white smoke. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Double jump allows better mobility. One-shot kill to the body at close ranges. 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. Cons: Low minimum damage per pellet. Slow empty reload. Slow rate of fire. Tips [ ] The strategy for the Lever Shotgun is based on your movement. Once you master this, it will be easier to get kills even with the low damage and slow reload speed. This weapon's added ability to double-jump will help you get close to enemies to ramp-up damage, and help you escape enemies while reloding. As with every Shotgun-class weapon, the Lever Shotgun especially needs to be shot while at close-range to enemies due to its low damage making it nearly useless at mid-range. Even with its weak power, it will only take a maximum of two shots (or one headshot) to get a kill. It is a lot easier than what the stats say. If you're coming to Arsenal as a Typical Colors 2 player, play with the Lever Shotgun as usual, but you must adjust your strategy a little: An Arsenal player's speed is similar to the Flanker in Typical Colors 2, so using the Lever Shotgun should be familiar. Compared to the Typical Colors 2 version, the Lever Shotgun in Arsenal actually deals a lot more damage at a 47 max per pellet compared to 10.5. This will help you get some very easy kills compared to back in TC2. There's also the added bonus of crits on any headshots made, so take advantage of this. Remember that you only have 100 HP compared to 125 HP, so you will die very quickly if you get too reckless. Trivia [ ] This Lever-Action Shotgun model appears to be a sawn-off version of the Winchester Model 1887 , which is capable of firing either a 12 gauge or 10 gauge shell. The end of the reload animation may be a reference to the Terminator -style reload, where Arnold Schwarzenegger flips the shotgun in such a way that the lever is re-cocked and the gun able to be fired again. In reality, flipping the weapon without an enlarged lever loop is completely impractical and would likely result in one's fingers being broken. The shotgun is also mostly flipped backwards. This, the Spencer Carbine , the Henry Rifle , the Golden Knife , the Ice Stars , the Ghostwalker and the Illumina are the only weapons in the game that have the double jump ability. The model of the Lever Shotgun as well as its animations came from Typical Colors 2 and is the primary weapon of the Flanker class, albeit with a different viewmodel angle, while retaining the old shooting sound effect. This weapon's ability to double jump is also a reference to the Flanker, as he has the natural ability to double-jump in his game. 70 (2 self-damage) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Laser Tag Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Rocket Jump Splash Damage Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Lightning Cannon is a futuristic weapon in Arsenal , having characteristics of an explosive and a beefy rifle. It fires a bolt of lightning from its barrel which causes a hit registration-based weapon. It performs similarly to the Concussion Rifle and has aspects of the R800 . Like the Concussion Rifle, it has a rocket jump ability and it will launch players far away, potentially leading them to hazards. The Lightning Cannon fires slower than the R800 but can be constantly fired by holding down the left mouse button. It has 10 rounds in each magazine, reserve ammo of 20, and has no spread. However, the Lightning Cannon has drawbacks, such as a lack of a headshot multiplier and the slow rate of fire as stated before. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Large magazine capacity. High damage. Splash damage allows damaging multiple enemies with one hit. Can Rocket jump with little damage done to self. Cons: Slow fire rate. No headshot multiplier. High knockback lowers chance to land a consecutive hit. Players can kill themselves if not careful. Somewhat small explosion range. Gallery [ ] Stage one development Stage two. Stage three. Weapon render. Early view for the Lightning Cannon. Trivia [ ] The model of the Lightning Cannon was created back and was revealed in the Arsenal Discord server on December 24, 2019. It was never confirmed to be in the game, but it was made into the update. The Lightning Cannon and the Concussion Rifle are the only non-projectile weapons that players can rocket jump with. The weapon design seems to be inspired by the Volt Caster weapon from Anthem or the Lectro Shock Rifle weapon from Fortnite . 810-1350 (1125-1687) Gamemodes Standard Randomizer Gun Rotation Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.5 22.401 1.9 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 2.621 1 The Literal Gun is a joke weapon in Arsenal that is unique compared to its class. The model of this weapon is made of metal letters that spell out the word "gun" twice. One is used for the grip, while the second is used for the barrel of the gun. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] Literal Gun's damage is around 810 damage (headshots are 1125-1687 damage), meaning that enemies will be instantly killed in one-shot and its fast reload means going back to battle won't be a big deal. However, due to drawbacks, the Literal Gun suffers from a slow rate of fire, making a miss of a shot punishable along with the low magazine capacity. The high spread may be an issue, although the low rate of fire helps with tap-firing. Before it was changed to where it is now, the previous Literal Gun's model was the same, but it used a Hi-Power 's sound, held a capacity of 13, and its damage was around 45. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: One-shot kill at all ranges. Fast reload, as shared with the pistols of the game. Cons: Slow rate of fire. Small magazine and ammo capacities. High spread upon continuous shots. Tips [ ] Try to shoot the Literal Gun from long-range, as its first shot is 100% accurate. Its other two shots are very inaccurate, so make the first shot count. The other two shots can still be used at close- or mid-range, especially during intense fights. It should be very easy to get a kill with this gun due to its ridiculous power. However , beware that you only have 2 reloads before you can no longer use this weapon. In case this happens, keep an eye out for ammo boxes dropped by dead players, as one will give you back three shots. The Literal Gun is ridiculously powerful when fighting against the Hackula boss, especially since headshots deplete a good chunk of his HP. However, the chances of obtaining this weapon during the boss fight is extremely rare. Gallery [ ] Development of the weapon. With a custom bullet. Trivia [ ] The Literal Gun was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on April Fools 2020. The Literal Gun currently holds the record of having the highest damage in the game, with the Musket and the Pulse Musket coming second, the Tavor coming third, and the Barrett being fourth. The Literal Gun is the only weapon that can do over 1000 damage per shot. This, along with the Origami Gun , the Pocket Potassium , the Very Long Bat , the TP Launcher , the Dispenser and the Potassium Power are considered "joke weapons". Originally the Literal Gun had similar stats to the Hi-Power however it was later buffed heavily. It also originally had the same firing sound as the Hi-Power, but it was changed to a comedic "Pew" sound effect. The letter "n" from the "gun" word that acts as the barrel, is actually interlocked with the lower hole of the letter "g" in the "gun" word that acts as the grip. The model of the Literal Gun was created and was revealed in the Arsenal Discord server on May 31st, 2020. It has a similar knife version of it called the Literal Melee. It is the signature weapon of Tomfoolery Delinquent skin. The font used for the creation of the Literal Gun is the "Gill Sans" font. 30-45 (37-56) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hard Mode Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.15 22.401 1.83 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 0.873 0.5 The Little Tom is a semi-automatic pistol designed by Alois Tomischka from Czechoslovakia. It is considered as the first double action only semi-automatic pistol, produced until 1925 and 45,000 were made. Its strange feature was the top-loading magazine which could be inserted and released from the top. Contents 1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History In-game Information [ ] The Little Tom has no spread at all making it suited for any range. This gun destroys enemies if players can aim as it works somewhat like a low damage and low ammo machine gun. However, it has a major difference in fire rate and ammo capacity, trading 9 rounds for automatic-firing capabilities and less damage. This removes the ability to kill an enemy with 4 shots. This gun can shred enemies, but players need to watch out for the ammo. With only 9 rounds, the magazine empties out faster than people might first think. The gun is automatic after all, so reloading can happen quite often if the player continues to miss with this weapon. It can take about half the magazine to kill an enemy. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Fast rate of fire. Decent reload time. No spread and recoil. Cons: Low 9-round magazine capacity. Magazine is easily expended due to its fire rate. Gallery [ ] Little Tom in real life. Trivia [ ] The Little Tom is the first and only double-action semi-automatic handgun to be ever created. The Little Tom fires a .32 ACP which is comparable to 9mm. The Little Tom reuses the previous G-17's firing sound. The Little Tom is one of the automatic pistols along with the G-18 , the TEC-9 , the Electric Revolver , and the Falkor . 34-51 (102-153) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Pistols Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hard Mode Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Kill Icon Creator Unknown Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.2 22.401 1.75 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 0.437 0.5 The Luger (also known as Pistole Parabellum , Parabellum-Pistole, Pistol Parabellum ) is a toggle-locked recoil-operated semi-automatic pistol first produced by Georg Luger as a successor to the Borchardt C93. The P08 model is generally recognized as the "face" of the Luger pistol models, for its use by Germany during World War I and II (though in WWII, it was supplanted by the Walther P38). Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The weapon performs very similarly to the Handcannon pistol. The Luger P08 trades lower overall damage for faster firerate. When using this weapon, headshots can instantly kill an enemy. Despite the reduced headshot damage, it can still one shot an enemy, therefore, with the faster firerate, it is more efficient than the Handcannon, provided all shots are headshots. However, because of drawbacks; this weapon does have a major downside to it, which is its body damage. With only 22 damage to the body, it will take five hits for a kill, which is very inconvenient as the gun only has 8 rounds in its magazine. Not only that, but despite the Luger having a fast rate of fire, it is capped, so it will take time to land those five shots, giving the enemy plenty of time to kill the user. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Headshots insta-kill Deals fair body damage. No spread and recoil. Perfect accuracy. Quick reload. Decent Firerate Cons: Small 8-round magazine. Tips [ ] The Luger is an underrated monster at intense fights. It takes 2 shots to kill at close-range, and its perfect accuracy allows you to land an easy headshot kill from a distance. The Luger also reloads slightly faster than the other Pistols in the game. Because of the Luger's low magazine size, space out your shots . This will prevent you from wasting ammo and reloading. An alternate strategy is to headshot-snipe opponents from long-range. This will be easier if you crouch down, as it will slow your movement and make it harder to be fired back at. Do beware that bodyshots will heavily punish you, so this strategy comes with risk. Only do this if you have no better options. You can hit an opponent and deal enough damage for a teammate to finish them off and give you an assist. Gallery [ ] Luger in real life. Trivia [ ] The Luger is a German toggle-locked semi-automatic pistol that uses a jointed arm to lock and was developed by Georg Luger as an improved version of the C-93 Borchardt and is most notable for its use by Germany during WWI and WWII. The Luger can fire either a 7.62x21mm or a 9x19mm Parabellum cartridge. During both World War I and II, Allied soldiers often captured Lugers as trophies/prizes from German soldiers. The grip of the P08 has a place where it can attach a carbine stock. There is a carbine version of the P08 called Model 1902 Carbine, with an extended barrel and a carbine stock attached, the weapon is also normally used with a 30-round snail drum mag. The Luger uses the same reload sound as the G-19X , the G-21 , and the G-18 , albeit with a lower pitch. 37-110 (189) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The M1 Garand is an American-made semi-automatic rifle that replaced the Springfield M1903 and was used heavily in both WWII and the Korean War, chambered in .30-06 and widely known for its distinctive ping, made upon the ammunition clip ejecting. In-game Information [ ] The M1 Garand is one of the semi-automatic weapons in-game, and as such, players must wait for a brief delay before firing the weapon again. However, the M1 Garand does have a good damage range, being one of the few semi-automatic rifles to instant kill to the body at closer ranges. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Fast empty reload. Decent rate of fire. Cons: Low 8-round magazine capacity. High spread upon continuous shots. Tips [ ] The M1 Garand might be a bit more difficult to get a kill with due to its lower accuracy, as its spread gets higher more quickly compared to the other Marksman Rifles. While the M1 Garand is still somewhat effective at mid-range, it is actually easier to fight at close-ranges as well. Its maximum ramp-up is 110 damage, which will secure a kill. It is not recommended to shoot from long-range, unless a carefully placed shot is made. Trivia [ ] Although the weapon is often pronounced "Ga-rand", John Garand, the weapon's designer, apparently preferred the pronunciation that would rhyme with errand , being "Ger-rend". The Garand's distinctive ping comes from the ejection of an empty 8-round En Bloc clip, of which the M1 Garand used. It is said that Axis forces in WWII used this ping to alert themselves to an empty rifle, although the usefulness of this noise was likely very low with multiple enemies and deafening gunfire often preventing the hearing of such sound in the first place. It is also said the Allies spoofed the sound to lure Axis soldiers to their doom. The M1 Garand came from Unit 1968 and was modeled by Ben. In popular culture, particularly video games, the M1 Garand is depicted as impossible to reload until all 8 shots are fired. This is a common misconception, as the M1 Garand features a clip-release button on the left side of the receiver. This most likely originated from Allied soldiers being instructed to not bother with reloading mid-clip. To reload an M1 mid-clip, the user must first press the clip release button with their supporting hand, then pull back on the charging handle. Reloading then continues as if the rifle were empty. "Garand Thumb" is a painful occurrence when the M1 user tries to load an en-bloc clip into the gun, the user's thumb would get slammed into the metal receiver due to a pre-mature release of the bolt or the user's ineptitude with reloading the weapon. The M1 Garand and the Springfield Rifle are the only weapons that have a faster empty reload time. Gallery [ ] M1 Garand in real life. 45-56 (135-180) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The M14 is a United States 7.62mm battle rifle that replaced the aging M1 Garand . Initially designed as a direct counterpart to the AK-47 series of rifles, a trial version, the T44, fed off a specialized round. However, the U.S. Ordnance Group objected, wanting the rifle to feed off the 7.62x51 NATO round. Several more modifications for standardized-features resulted in a rather bulky rifle. The M14 would serve as a long-range, hard-hitter. It was used partially through the Vietnam War before being replaced by the M16A1 assault rifle. Current Archived In Arsenal , the M14 is a rifle that shows its power. Its high damage, such as a one-shot kill upon a headshot at all ranges and a minimum three-shot ensures enemies will get suffered. Its fast rate of fire means shredding enemies at close range is an easy task. However, the M14 has a high spread penalty, more noticeably seen than other semi-autos. Spamming the M14 results in the weapon being unusable at longer ranges, even though aiming for the head somewhat makes up for the high spread penalty. The M14 was different in the Archived by a noticeable change. Unlike the current version, the M14 didn't have almost any spread at all. However, the damage and the rate of fire remained the same. This made it very powerful and even compared to that of Mossberg 500 we have in the modern version. However, this was later nerfed to the current M14 in-game. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Highest magazine capacity out of all semi-automatic rifles. Fairly quick reload. Fast rate of fire. Cons: High spread upon continuous shots. Slow movement speed. Tips [ ] Take advantage of the M14's ability to shoot from mid-range. This way, you can easily beat any enemy who has a Shotgun-class weapon. Unless the enemy is close to you, space out your shots to prevent the M14 from having high spread. Don't pick spots that are too high to shoot from. The M14 may be somewhat accurate, but it is not Sniper Rifle-classed. Gallery [ ] A red Solid Color M14 in BETA Arsenal . M14 in real life. Archived M14 in real life. Trivia [ ] While the M14 is portrayed as a semi-automatic weapon in-game, in reality, it is select-fire, meaning it can fire in either semi-auto or automatic. However most M14s portrayed are semi - auto. Although the M14 being replaced by the M16 , some soldiers still use the M14 today, although rare. The M14 has a variant called the M1A , which is the civilian market and is only semi-automatic. The M14 EBR is the more modern version of the M14. The M14's firing sound is the same as the old M14 firing sound in Unit 1968 , a Vietnam War ROLVe game. This weapon was used for Trooper's secondary weapon, the Boonie Blaster in Typical Colors 2 . The damage is very similar to the SKS that was added to Arsenal. 20-25 (60-165) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Automatic Special ADS Fall-off Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The MK14 EBR is an American military selective fire battle rifle chambered for the 7.62×51mm NATO cartridge. It is a variant of the M14 battle rifle and was originally built for use with units of United States Special Operations Command, such as the United States Navy SEALs, Delta Force, and task specific Green Berets ODA teams/units. These weapons are made for both the designated marksman and the close combat roles. Since 2010, the U.S. Army has assigned two M14 EBR-RI rifles per infantry platoon for units deploying to Afghanistan. The M14 EBR-RI has a standard weight 22.0-inch (560 mm) barrel and lugged GI flash hider; it is not to be confused with the Mk 14 Mod 0 or Mod 1. In-game information [ ] It has a rather high headshot damage, making this a more power-based weapon. It has a slow fire rate, albeit still quick compared to weapons such as the Grease Gun . The MK14 EBR also does less damage compared to its normal counterpart, the M14 . Similar to the MK18 , the EBR uses an EoTech sight that you can access by pressing RMB or LT on Xbox, reducing recoil and firing more accurately. This can also be a sniper rifle if you have to aim for the person themselves instead of just the head. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Accessible sight by pressing the right mouse button. Moderate magazine size. Fast fire rate Decent reload time Cons: High recoil. Somewhat high spread upon hip firing. Sluggish movement speed. Gallery [ ] ADS M14 EBR in real life. Trivia [ ] The M14 EBR is more formally known as the Mk 14 Enhanced Battle Rifle and is a modernized, compacted variant of the M14 battle rifle, originally requested to be developed by the Navy SEALs . While the gun is select-fire, it is more commonly used as a designated marksman rifle. If you use ADS, pull out your melee without removing the ADS and pull out this weapon, you will get a lot less spread and recoil. while not having the ADS, although, the only cons of doing this is that you will have no crosshair, but using a custom crosshair will make this weapon very Overpowered. The M14 EBR is one of the weapons that has access to ADS. The others are the MK18 , the Falkor , the DBS , the Vector , the Pulse Musket , the DB Chauchat , and the MP5 It is also one of the 3 weapons that use EOTech XPS2 Holographic Sight. The others are the MK18 , and the Falkor . There was once a glitch where using ADS would activate the reloading animation. However, this bug was patched. 18-30 (25-34) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Automatics Kill Confirmed Juggernaut Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Nredly (Current) Unknown (Previous, Archived) The M16A1 is an assault rifle used for its service in the Vietnam War which was made to replace the M14 battle rifle. The gun received praise for its killing power, lightweight, and accuracy. However, it was infamous for jamming at the most inconvenient circumstances. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The M16A1 is an automatic weapon , firing 5.56mm rounds from a small 20-round magazine. The weapon's damage ranges from 18-34, 18-30 from a body-shot and 23-34 on a headshot. The M16A1's low magazine size can expend the ammo quickly, although the weapon's remarkably low spread penalty and mediocre damage should allow you a kill within a single magazine. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Decent damage at close quarters. Very fast rate of fire. Tight spread. Decent Reload. Cons: High ammo consumption rate. Small magazine size. Low minimum body damage. Trivia [ ] The M16A1 is the production model of the XM16E1 , the second variant of the first M16 rifle. It was deployed to US troops during the Vietnam war, used to replace the aging M14 . The M16A1 is the signature weapon of the Beret, Corporal, Cthulhu, Cyber Mercenary, Deserted Beret, Grunt, Operative, and Secret Agent skins. It was also formerly a signature weapon of Paintballer. This was changed to the Mossberg 500 , and then to the Paintball Gun . It was also formerly the signature weapon of the Magician. This was changed to the Spellbook in the Summer Update II . The firing mode of M16A1 was originally burst fire in Arsenal Archived . The previous in-game M16A1 is modeled after an older version of the rifle, the XM16E1, which has a 3-prong flash hider like the in-game model. The old model of the M16A1 was taken from Unit 1968 , a ROLVe game set in Vietnam. The previous model can still be seen as a worldmodel. AR : 28-42 (35-52) GL : 112-150 (15 self-damage) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Burst-fire (3-shots) Projectile shot (GL) Special Mode Switching Fall-off Projectile Arch (GL) Rocket Jump (GL) Splash Damage (GL) Kill Icon Creator Nredly (Current) Unknown (Previous) The M16A2 is a military rifle born from the U.S. Marine Corps' experiences with the prior iterations of the M16, the XM16E1 and M16A1 , and was once the USAF's service rifle, though it was eventually replaced by the newer, more modular A4 variant. Differences from the prior A1 variant were mostly to improve reliability and performance, and it also marks the transition from a triangular style of handguard to the cylindrical one. The M16A2 featured in Arsenal has an attatchment: a grenade launcher named the M203. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] M16A2 M203 The rifle contains 30 rounds per magazine, along with 90 rounds of reserve ammunition. Every time you fire with the weapon, it will fire 3 rounds out, each dealing 28 or 48 damage on body shot or headshot respectively. It's best used whenever the grenade launcher misses its shot or you're in close range. It is also more effective than the grenade launcher at longer ranges. The main reason the M16A2 is considered powerful, however, is the addition of the M203 grenade launcher, which can be accessed with the RMB. This explosive projectile weapon comes with one round already in the tube, and one for reserve. The grenade fires in an arch, so hitting targets at longer ranges requires aiming higher to land the grenade near or on the target. Upon hitting or splashing next to an enemy, the grenade will do 112-150 damage. Multiple kills are possible if multiple enemies are clustered together. However, it takes around 3 seconds to reload after firing the M203. The grenade also travels slowly compared to normal bullets. This, coupled with the grenade's quirky arch, makes the grenade launcher less effective at longer ranges. The Grenades also needs to be used wisely, as they cannot be refilled with ammo packs. Players can also rocket jump with it, like the M79 . However, precision is required because of the way that the grenade's splash damage works. Pros & Cons [ ] M16A2 M203 Pros: One-hit kill when firing 3-round burst at close quarters. Fast fire rate when bursting. High damage. Decent reload time Moderate magazine size Cons: Somewhat long burst delay in between bursts. Slow movement speed Pros: One-hit kill on contact and splash. Explosive area-of-effect capability allows for multi-kills with one grenade. Faster projectile speed than most explosive-launching weapons. Fast reload time for an explosive weapon. Rocket jump ability. Cons: Arching projectile makes it harder to hit enemies from long range. Users can instantly kill themselves if not careful. Only 1 grenade in the tube and reserve. Small area-of-effect range. Grenade cannot be refilled by ammo packs. Users can throw themselves out of the map if not careful. Tips [ ] The M16A2 is a very versatile weapon, as it is a burst rifle and has a grenade launcher (the M203). This means that you can shoot bullets or explosives, depending on the situation of the current battle. Remember to right-click (or tap the assigned button on mobile) to switch between bullets and grenades. Note that there's a 1-second delay between switching ammo and starting to shoot. Split-second timing is an infamous element in Arsenal , so don't switch ammo during an intense fight. The best strategy for the M16A2 is to use the M203's grenades to get a kill, and save the M16A2's bullets for when you run out. The M203's grenades are much more powerful than the M16A2's bullets. They deal enough damage to insta-kill opponents. However , the size of its explosion is smaller than other explosives. You'll have to carefully take aim to secure a kill. Since there's only two grenades, you can use one to do a rocket-jump and land on a higher platform. Then, you can use the remaining grenade to get a kill while aiming from above. Keep an eye out for ammo boxes on the ground to give yourself more grenades. One ammo box gives you one grenade. The M16A2's bullets have decent range, however they deal minimal damage at longer distances. The best time to use the bullets are when an enemy is close to you, as you can quicklly put them away in under three burst-shots. This is crucial, as using a M203 grenade in this situation would result in a self-death, or even a demotion Trivia [ ] The M16A2 is a part of a long line of American rifles dubbed the M16s . It is the successor to the M16A1 and the XM16E1 , made after combat experience in Vietnam proved both guns to be deadly to its user, adding extensive modifications to the weapon overall. The grenade launcher under the M16A2 is the M203 GL, a single shot 40mm launcher designed to be attached under a rifle, meant to replace the older M79 grenade launcher. The M16A2's grenade launcher is the only weapon with ammo in the game that does not auto-reload if the setting is turned on. The M16A2's grenade launcher is the only weapon that can launch enemies without providing a self-damage reduction when jumping. The M16A2 has the resemblance of the weapon used in the film " Scarface " (1983) that the protagonist "Tony Montana" used at the end of the film. M16A2 is the only other 3-round burst weapon in the game along with the Plasma Launcher . The M16A2 was seen in the BOGO badge icon, hinting that it can allow for multiple kills. This weapon used to be the signature weapon of the Paintballer. However this was changed. The M203 along with the Golden Gun , the RPG , the Bow , the M79 , the Pocket Potassium , the Musket and Golden Musket are the only weapons that hold a single round.= Initially, the grenade was team colored. In the Adopt Me trailer, the Delinquent skin was seen holding the M16A2, but in the trailer, the M16A2 is fully automatic instead of burst fire. This, the Spellbook and the Tavor are the only weapons in the game that have a mode switch ability. The M203's previous firing sound was taken from Killing Floor 2 . The previous model can still be seen as a worldmodel. Gallery [ ] Current M203 activation. Previous M203 activation. The M16A2 and M203 in the Arsenal trailer. The M16A2 and the M203 in real life. 28-84 (70-105) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Pistols Kill Confirmed Juggernaut Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 (Current) Unknown (Previous, Archived) Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.15 22.401 2 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 1.048 1 The M1911 is an American made single-action, semi-automatic, magazine-fed, recoil-operated pistol chambered for the .45 ACP cartridge that is manufactured by Colt Manufacturing Company. It served as the standard issue sidearm to the US Armed forces from 1911 to 1986 and served in wars, such as World War I, World War II, the Korean War, and the Vietnam War. The M1911 was replaced by the M9 Beretta for the standard-issue US army sidearm in October 1986, but due to its popularity, modern versions of it are still being used in some units of the US special forces and Navy. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] In-game, players can expect a high recoil firearm with a preference for shorter ranges, due to the weapon's high spread penalty upon firing in rapid succession. This high spread penalty is one of the main problems with this weapon; the other is the magazine size. However, tap-firing the M1911 can mitigate both of these issues. Players should note the weapon's nearly uncapped semi-automatic rate of fire, as the M1911 can be rapidly fired by those capable of doing so. Luckily, the weapon shares a fast reload time with the majority of the pistols in Arsenal . This can be paired with the weapon's high headshot damage of 96 at point-blank, allowing players to easily kill enemies with two shots. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Quick reload. Fast rate of fire. Cons: High spread and recoil upon continuous shots. Small magazine size. The magazine is easily expended due its fast fire-rate. Tips [ ] The M1911 is pretty effective at mid-range when shooting while approaching an opponent to get damage in before they start fighting back. Do mind that the high spread only allows the first 4 shots of your magazine to land, so don't stay at mid-range for too long. Two headshots from mid-range will also do the trick. The M1911 only takes two shots at close-range to kill. However, a headshot while near your target will instantly kill them. Its fast reload speed makes it good for intense fights. There's no harm in using all of your shots in one go. But you can still stop for a second to reset the spread. Gallery [ ] M1911 in third person. M1911 in real life. Previous M1911 in real life. Trivia [ ] The weapon designer, John Browning, was the same person who developed the M2 Browning, Hi-Power , Trench Gun , BAR , and many others. The M1911, formalized designated the "United States Pistol, Caliber .45, M1911" by the USAF , is a semi-automatic single-action pistol utilizing the .45 ACP cartridge. It served as the USAF's standard sidearm from its adoption in 1911, until 1986, before being replaced by the Beretta M9 . The M1911's previous mesh is from another ROLVe game, Unit 1968 . The previous firing sound uses the old firing sound of the M1911 in Unit 1968 . It is the signature weapon of the Contractor, and the Heister skins . The M1911 older model was originally used for Flanker's secondary weapon, the Winger in Typical Colors 2 . The previous version found in Arsenal was modelled after the blank-firing Bruni 96 M1911, due to its lack of details. The M1911 was the most popular pistol in 1990s, before being taken over by the M9 and eventually the Glock family. It was a six-shooter used by the US military and manufactured by the American companies, Colt and Smith & Wesson . In-game Information [ ] This was the first revolver in the game, but it was removed in the mega update. It functions most similar to the Windicator having similar 37 damage, fast reload, somewhat decent headshot damage, but unlike the Windicator, it has way less recoil and spread, making it much better for longer ranges. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Low spread. Quick reload. Cons: Low damage for a revolver. Small magazine. Trivia [ ] The M1917 is incorrectly modeled after either the Colt Python or SW Model 629 revolver rather than an M1917 revolver. The M1917 is predecessor of the Peacemaker , Peppergun , Webley , Windicator , Electric Revolver , Python , Dual LCRs and the Pathbringer . This gun was later improved in the Unit 1968 game by ROLVe . 35-105 (80-120) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The M1919 Browning machine gun is a .30 caliber machine gun that was widely used during the 20th century, especially during World War II, the Korean War, and the Vietnam War. The M1919 saw service as a light infantry, coaxial, mounted, aircraft, and anti-aircraft machine gun by the U.S. and many other countries. In-game Information [ ] The M1919A6 Machine Gun boasts powerful bullet power; a one-shot kill up close, a two-shot kill to the head at longer ranges, and a minimum three-shot kill. The magazine size is also high, being at 100. However, since the M1919A6 has high damage, it trades for a high spread penalty, forcing users to go closer to hit most of their bullets. It also trades for long reload time. However, the high damage maintains the effectiveness of the weapon at long-range not as bad. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Large magazine size. Fast rate of fire. Cons: High spread penalty upon continuous fire. Sluggish movement speed. Grueling reload time. High magazine consumption rate. Tips [ ] The M1919A6 Machine Gun has extremely high spread when fired. In fact, it's the most inaccurate Machine Gun in the entire game. The M1919A6 Machine Gun is most effective at close-range. Firing from mid-range (and of course, long-range) will have to depend on luck, and therefore a waste of time and effort . You can close the distance between you and your target by equipping your Knife , then switching back to the M1919A6 Machine Gun. If firing from mid-range, try firing only around 5 bullets a time, then stopping for a second to reset the spread. Believe it or not, you can accidentally get a headshot from a random bullet when shooting this weapon if you get lucky. Its incredibly slow reload time makes the M1919A6 Machine Gun a "one-and-done" weapon, as it prompts players to get a kill within the first clip, or face the consequences. If you don't want to wait out the slow reload, resorting to getting a backstab with your Knife can be an alternate solution. Trivia [ ] When it was first released, the M1919A6 Machine Gun appears to be held incorrectly in view model. The M1919A6 was an air-cooled development of the standard US machine gun of World War I, the John M. Browning-designed water-cooled M1917. In real life, when the gun was ready to fire, a round would be in the chamber and the bolt and barrel group would be locked together, with the locking block at the rear of the bolt. When the rear of the trigger was pivoted upwards by the operator, the front of the trigger tipped downward, pulling the sear out of engagement with the spring-loaded firing pin, allowing it to move forward and strike the primer of the cartridge. The M1919A6 has the second-fastest reload in the machine gun class behind the DB Chauchat . The M1919A6 Machine Gun's firing sounds were taken from Unit 1968: Vietnam . The M1919A6 animations were taken from Unit 1968: Vietnam . When held, the player moves at 12.3 studs per second, slower than any other gun. 34-99 (171) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Inland M1A1 Carbine is an American semi-automatic carbine firing a .30 Carbine caliber round. In-game Information [ ] The M1A1 Carbine is a semi-automatic rifle that packs a punch. Its powerful damage, such as an instant kill upon a headshot, a two-shot kill upon a body shot at close range, and a minimum three-shot kill. The fast rate of fire allows quicker killing speed to enemies, meaning that players will be killed in a matter of seconds at close range. Because of the rule of drawbacks, just like other semi-auto rifles, the M1A1 Carbine suffers a high spread penalty upon spamming. However, the spread starts to increase upon the third shot, but will quickly recover to both high precision and accuracy. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Fast rate of fire. Large magazine size. Fairly fast reload. Cons: Somewhat slow movement speed. High spread upon continuous shots. Tips [ ] The M1A1 Carbine is one of the easier Marksman Rifles to get a kill with, due to its ability to effectively deal damage from any distance. A headshot from long-range or spamming shots at close-range will guarantee you a kill. Even with its big magazine size, make sure not shoot all the bullets at once. If you see that they are not hitting your target(s), it's best to stop and wait for a second for the spread to reset. If your opponents have not noticed you, you can use the time to quickly reload. Trivia [ ] The M1A1 Carbine was created because Germany's use of glider-borne and paratrooper forces to launch surprise ‘Blitzkrieg’ attacks behind the front lines generated a request for a new compact infantry weapon for support troops and paratroopers alike. The rifle originated as a design by Jonathan "Ed" Browning, brother of the famous firearm designer John Browning. The M1A1 was used from WWII and far into the Vietnam War and was widely used by military, police, and civilian forces around the world after that. The M1 Carbine is incorrectly named the M1A1 Carbine . The difference is the M1 is the fixed stock, but the M1A1 is the variant with the folding metal stock. The M1A1 also has a select-fire variant called the M2 carbine , capable of firing in full-automatic. The M3 Carbine was another variant that is select-fire and has an infrared scope, however most M3 IRs were semi - auto only. The M1A1 Carbine is the most produced American Rifle in WWII. Strangely, the M1A1 Carbine can do a one-shot kill potential on the body at close range despite the max body damage being at a 99. The M1A1 Carbine is often noted to be very similar to the M1A1 Paratrooper, albeit the Paratrooper having faster movement speed, lower accuracy, and a slightly lower-pitched firing sound. While the M1A1 Carbine in Arsenal has a fixed wooden buttstock, in reality, the M1A1 variant was mainly manufactured with the folding paratrooper stock. Despite this, the stocks on refurbished M1A1s were commonly swapped out in armories. The M1A1 Carbine was designed to replace a handgun instead of a rifle. The M1A1 Carbine's firing sound and reload sound effect was taken from the M1A1 carbine in Day of Infamy , only sped up. These effects were also used for the weapon in Unit 1968 , a previous ROLVE game. Gallery [ ] M1A1 Carbine in real life. 34-99 (171) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The M1A1 Paratrooper is a variant of the M1A1 Carbine issued to paratroopers. In-game Information [ ] The M1A1 Paratrooper acts somewhat similarly to its counterpart, the M1A1 Carbine but with two statistical differences: having faster movement speed at the cost of accuracy. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Fast rate of fire. Large magazine size. Fairly fast reload. Cons: High spread upon continuous shots. Tips [ ] The M1A1 Paratrooper is one of the easier Marksman Rifles to get a kill with, due to its ability to effectively deal damage from any distance. A headshot from long-range or spamming shots at close-range will guarantee you a kill. Even with its big magazine size, make sure not shoot all the bullets at once. If you see that they are not hitting your target(s), it's best to stop and wait for a second for the spread to reset. If your opponents have not noticed you, you can use the time to quickly reload. Trivia [ ] Despite being similar to the M1A1 Carbine, the M1A1 Paratrooper has a folding stock built-in. The folding stock was used to make the gun light and compact, making it suitable to carry in parachuting jumps, hence the name "Paratrooper". The M1A1 Paratrooper saw most of its usage throughout WWII, being favored by paratroopers for its lightweight and firepower, but its reputation on the battlefield deteriorated by its lack of penetration and stopping power. Strangely, just like the M1A1 Carbine, the M1A1 Paratrooper can do a one-shot kill potential on the body at close range despite the max body damage being at a 99. The metal frames of the folding stock usually broke earlier than the weapon itself. The M1A1 Paratrooper's firing sound and reload sound effect was taken from the M1A1 carbine in Day of Infamy , only sped up. Gallery [ ] M1A1 Paratrooper in real life. 18-54 (45-67) Gamemodes Standard Counter Blox Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros and Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History 7 Sources General Information [ ] The M249 is a gas-operated general-purpose machine gun made by the American military starting in 1984. It has been used in a variety of different wars. In-game Information [ ] The M249 has a fast rate of fire while being somewhat accurate for a machine gun. It also boasts some similar specs to the Negev , such as a high magazine capacity (albeit 50 rounds less), slow reload time and slow movement speed. However, the M249 has higher minimum damage and tighter spread, outperforming the Negev at longer ranges. Pros and Cons [ ] Pros: Very high ammo capacity of 100. Fast rate of fire. High damage at close ranges. Cons: Sluggish movement speed. Spread gets higher very quickly. Grueling reload time. Low minimum damage. Tips [ ] Just like some of the other Machine Guns, the M249's spread makes it not so viable at mid-range. More bullets will hit your targets if you get closer to them. Because holding this weapon makes you move slower, equipping your Knife can help you close the distance between you and your opponent quickly. If you cannot get close, you can attempt to fire shots by simply tapping (not holding) the fire button on your device. Just like every hitscan weapon in Arsenal , the M249's very first bullet is always 100% accurate. Its incredibly slow reload time makes the M249 a "one-and-done" weapon, as it prompts players to get a kill within the first clip, or face the consequences. If you don't want to wait out the slow reload, resorting to getting a backstab with your Knife can be an alternate solution. Trivia [ ] The weapon's return was sneak peeked in the Arsenal Discord on May 28, 2021. M249 was originally going to be added into the game during the development of Gun Game however it was left scrapped and later released to the archived phase of Arsenal . [ 1 ] This is an evolution of the Belgian weapon, the FN Minimi . A variant of the M249, the M249 SAW Para , features a collapsible stock and a shorter barrel. The current M249 model appears to be similar to the EM249 , but recolored, with regular bullets, and with a stock. The firing and reloading sound effects were taken from ROLVe's game, Typical Colors 2 . 80 (240) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Hard Mode Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Bolt-Action Special Scope Kill Icon Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 1 1 17.92 1.25 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The M40 is a bolt-action sniper rifle used by the United States Marine Corps, and put into service in 1966. They were built from standard Remington 700 rifles, with the addition of a scope and a few years into its service, the replacement of the wooden stock with a fiberglass one. While still in service with SOCOM today, it and several other sniper rifles (such as its successor, the MK 13 rifle) are currently being replaced by the Barrett MRAD sniper rifle. In-game Information [ ] Compared to the MS556 , the M40 fires one shot at a time from an ammo pool of 25, meaning that players will not need to reload, and only need to wait a brief period after every shot. On the other hand, the MS556 has no movement de-buffs, although it has a magazine size of 7, with an ammo pool of only 14, with the M40 being 25. The M40 has no spread and contains a scope, making aiming a crucial ability to have when using this weapon. Due to the extremely slow rate of fire, hitting 2 body-shots in order to kill an enemy will take too long, especially if the user is noticed by the enemy, so a headshot (or just a lot of time to land the body-shots) is almost required to advance. Missing with this weapon is extremely detrimental, so players should try their best to hit their shots. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Perfect accuracy. Scope allows for better magnification. No reloading required. Cons: Slow fire rate. Slow movement speed. Somewhat long pullout time. Tips [ ] The M40 is best at exclusively long-range compared to the other Sniper Rifles, as its mid-range combat ability is not as effective. If an enemy pounces on you while you are sniping, a quick shot to their body will deal 80 damage, which will hopefully be enough for a teammate to get an assist for you. If you're coming to Arsenal as a Typical Colors 2 player, the M40 is very different from the Sniper Rifle you are used to. In Arsenal , the M40's shots do flat hits for 80 damage along with insta-killing upon a headshot, instead of charging up its power the longer you're scoped in. Instead of waiting, it's a better idea to attempt quickscope shots instead. Shooting without scoping in is also an option, as you still will deal 80/240 damage if either scoped or unscoped. You also do not have a laser that gives your position away if you scope in, but instead only a tiny dot on wherever you are aiming. Use this to your advantage. Gallery [ ] M40 in real life. Trivia [ ] The M40 is the modified USMC ( United States Marine Corps ) variant of the Remington 700 , firing a 7.62x51mm round. The one in-game is the original version of the M40, using a one-piece wooden stock which also serves as the main weapon frame. The reason for the 25 round ammo pool and lack of reserves/reloading is that the character is loading a single round into the rifle after each and every shot, despite the M40 feeding from a 5-round internal magazine in real-life. The M40 itself also appeared in Typical Colors 2 as an old model of a primary weapon for Marksman (known as the Sniper Rifle ). The weapon model is also based on the Sniper Rifle from Team Fortress 2 , minus the charge (the mechanism in which the weapon deals more damage when scoped for longer) and slowed movement whilst scoped. This is the signature weapon of the Poke & The Marksman skins . 21-42 (32-48) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Automatics Counter Blox Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] An American-made carbine, the M4A1 is a shorter and lighter version of the M16A3 and is the main service rifle of the US Army and Marine Corps. It was first introduced in 1993 as an automatic version of the M4 series. In-game Information [ ] Current Alpha The M4A1 is quite the show, boasting similar statistics to the M16A1 , albeit coming with a larger magazine but with the cost of a higher spread penalty. The weapon's damage is 21 minimum, with a maximum of 48 upon a close-range headshot. Being quite the average automatic weapon, the M4A1 should prove to be easy to get a kill with. The weapon's high damage, magazine, and fire rate will make way for a player's kill. The M4A1 (simply known as Assault Rifle in Gun Game ) in the older versions is quite the same details and functions as the current version with the exception of the damage being low and it damages the player the same result (13). The M4A1 was later replaced by its suppressed version in mid-2016. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros Fast rate of fire. High damage. Moderate magazine size. Moderately accurate. Cons High spread upon continuous firing. Moderately slow reload time. Tips [ ] The M4A1 excels at intense fights. Its fast firing rate and damage can kill an opponent in under a second. This can only be guaranteed by good aim (obviously), as missed shots will force you to retreat and reload. Because of its high spread, stay within at least mid-range for more of your shots to land. If stuck at long-range, tap-fire instead of unleashing all of your bullets at once to land more shots. It kills very quickly at close-range because its damage is ramped up. Gallery [ ] The M4A1 in real life. Trivia [ ] The M4A1 Carbine is a shorter, lighter variant of the M16A2 , firing 5.56x45mm. The in-game version is supposed to be the M4A1, the fully automatic variant of the M4 carbine used by special operation units such as the Navy SEALs and the Rangers. The M4A1 Carbine can be seen in greater numbers than the M16 platform in military service, as it is both extensively used in the US Armed Forces and currently replacing the M16 rifles used by the USMC and US Army. The M4A1 firing sound is same as the current unsuppressed M4A1 from CS:GO . The M4A1 Carbine is the automatic variant of the 3-burst carbine; The M4 Carbine . The M4A1's in-game model is actually the Colt Model 723 carbine (as evident by the integral carry handle), which was a predecessor to the actual M4A1 (which has a detachable carry handle). This also applies to Nailgun . The M4A1's model was taken from Counter Blox . It is the signature weapon of GOC Present. 7-10 (35) Gamemodes Standard Firing Mode Automatic Special Suppressor Kill Icon Creator Valve Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros And Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History General Information [ ] The M4A1-S is a suppressed version of the M4A1 . In-game Information [ ] Unlike its current counterpart, it deals very low damage, and beats the Laser Rifle with lowest damage, dealing 7, as much as a single pellet from the MAG-7 . It also has a low magazine capacity about the size of the average M16 rifle (despite using a 30-round STANAG magazine). Other than the downsides, the accuracy and the recoil makes up for the damage. Pros And Cons [ ] Pros: High headshot damage. Decent fire rate. Great accuracy. Low recoil. Cons: Small 20-round magazine. Low minimum damage. Trivia [ ] It is one of the few weapons that were re-modeled in the Mega Update with some minor parts that removed. It is one of the 3 weapons in Arsenal Archived that equips a suppressor. The other are the USP-S and the MP5-S . In total, there are 7 suppressed weapons in current Arsenal , the 6 others being the Hush Puppy , MP9-S , Mauser Carbine ,   MK18 , Sako 85 and Vector . Made by Valve for Counter Strike: Global Offensive . The closest weapon to the M4A4 is the MK18 . The M4A4 preforms almost identically to the MK18, as it is modeled after it. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage at close quarter combat. Moderate magazine and ammo. Cons: Low rate of fire. Low minimum damage. Trivia [ ] The M4A4 is based on the Mk. 18 Mod 0 carbine , fitted with an ARMS#40 flip-up rear iron sight and KAC free-float RAS handguard. This is yet another weapon ROLVe took from CS:GO . ROLVe said that their games are heavily inspired by that of Valve's . 20-60 (46-118) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The M60 is a U.S-made 7.62x51mm general-purpose machine gun, more officially known as the United States Machine Gun . It was introduced in 1957 and has done duty in every branch of the U.S. military, along with that, some of the parts are based on the German MG42 , and was replaced/supplemented by the M249 machine gun. In-game Information [ ] Added in the Summer Update , the M60 is a powerful weapon with a large 150-round belt and another in reserve. While difficult to aim when spraying at longer ranges, players can easily utilize this weapon's relatively high damage to kill enemies. However, one major drawback of the M60 is its reload time; if a player manages to empty the entire magazine, they would face a long reload time, similar in length to the MG42. Due to its high spread penalty, it is recommended to use the M60 in closer ranges. This way, the M60 can easily hit more bullets, thereby doing more damage. Since the damage is already high, killing targets in close quarters combat should not be a problem. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros High damage. Very high ammo capacity of 150. Fast fire rate allows for very quick kills. Cons Sluggish movement speed. Grueling reload time. High spread penalty. Tips [ ] The M60 does have a spread penalty, but it's not as high as most of the other Machine Guns. In fact, it's similar to the M249 , but slightly more accurate. The M60 is most effective at close-range. However, in a few scenarios it's still viable at mid-range. Factors would include if your target is running from or to you, and how many objects are blocking your path. Using your Knife to run faster will help you close the distance between you and your target and fire at close-range. Tap-firing instead of holding down the fire button will make more bullets land from mid-range. Its incredibly slow reload time makes the M60 a "one-and-done" weapon, as it prompts players to get a kill within the first clip, or face the consequences. If you don't want to wait out the slow reload, resorting to getting a backstab with your Knife can be an alternate solution. Trivia [ ] With a belt capacity of 150, the M60 tied with the EM249 , the Flamethrower , and the Acid Spitter all have the highest ammo capacity out of any weapon in the game after the Minigun with the capacity of 800. The M60 was nicknamed " The Pig " during the Vietnam War, mainly due to its imposing silhouette, appetite for ammunition and bulky size. Still, soldiers appreciated its firepower and handling. The M60's old firing sound was the same as its incarnation in another ROLVe game, Unit 1968: Vietnam . The weight of an M60 in real life is 23.15 pounds (10.5 kg) due to its bulky size. The M60 is the signature weapon of Beard, Rambo Santa and used to be for the Rhino and Brute. After the Minigun was added back, the Brute's signature weapon switched back to the Minigun while the Rhino remains unchanged. 150-167 (192-199) 15 (self-damage) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Firing Mode Single-fire Projectile Special Projectile Arch Splash Damage Rocket Jump Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The M79 is a powerful American light grenade launcher that was developed in 1961. It was used by the US Military during the Vietnam War and fires a 40mm grenade round. In-game Information [ ] It works similar to that of the M16A2 's M203 grenade launcher but with more ammo and lower damage. The projectile is relatively quick, which allows for easier long-range hits, despite its projectile arch. It also works like the Rocket Launcher , with the splash damage and direct contact damage being the same. However, because it is a breech-loading weapon, it can only hold one grenade in the tube at a time. Players that miss a shot will suffer from a time-consuming reload. The M79 instantly kills on direct and splash contact. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: One-shot kill on direct and splash contact. Fast projectile speed. Explosive area-of-effect capability allows you for multiple kills. Ability to rocket jump . Large splash radius. Plenty of reserve ammo for if you miss. Cons: Users can easily kill themselves if not careful. Projectile arches make it harder to hit enemies at longer ranges. Carries only one round. Somewhat long reload. Somewhat slow load-out time. Gallery [ ] M79 in real life. Trivia [ ] The M79 uses a 40mm Grenade, just like the M16A2's M203. The M79 was used for the US Military during the Vietnam war. However, it was a stand-alone GL, meaning that it could take a long time to reload another gun and the M79 at the same time. So they thought of an idea to attach the grenade launcher to the rifle for the multi-purpose use, known as the M203 Grenade Launcher. The M79 received the nicknames of " Thumper ", " Thump-Gun ", " Bloop Tube ", " Big Ed ", " Elephant Gun ," and " Blooper ". The M79's inspect animation used to be broken, but in the Summer Update III , it got fixed. It is well known for not being used much, due to slight issues with the weapon's mechanisms. The M79, along with the RPG , the Bow , the Musket , the Golden Musket , the M16A2 's grenade launcher, the Pocket Potassium , and the Golden Gun are the only weapons in the game to hold a single round. 16-48 (40-60) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Pistols Kill Confirmed Juggernaut Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Nredly (Current) Unknown (Previous) Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.18 22.401 2 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 2.621 1.5 The Beretta M9 (officially designated the Pistol, Semiautomatic, 9mm, M9 by the USAF) is the designation for the Beretta 92F semi-automatic pistol used by the United States Armed Forces. The M9 was adopted by the United States military as their service pistol in 1985. The M9 won a competition in the 1980s to replace the M1911A1 as the primary sidearm of the U.S. military, beating many other contenders, and only narrowly defeating the SIG Sauer P226 for cost reasons. It officially entered service in 1990. Some other pistols have been adopted to a lesser extent, namely the M11 pistol, and other models remain in use in certain niches. The M9 was scheduled to be replaced under a United States Army program, the Future Handgun System (FHS), which was merged with the SOF Combat Pistol program to create the Joint Combat Pistol (JCP). The JCP was renamed Combat Pistol (CP), and the number of pistols to be bought was drastically cut back. The U.S. Army, Navy, Air Force, and Marine Corps are replacing the M9 with the M17 and the M18. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The M9 was added during the Mega Update of Arsenal , carries 16-round magazine with 45 ammo in reserve. The M9 is best used at close quarters with its decent rate of fire and high close range damage. Players can expect to kill opponents who fight in close range within two or three shots, but it takes up to 7 shots to kill an enemy at long range. This can be attributed to the weapon's spread penalty, which severely lowers the chance to connect with an enemy at long range. Fortunately, this can be mitigated with a short waiting period between shots, though moving closer to the target should be a priority with this weapon. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Decent rate of fire. High magazine capacity for a pistol. High damage at close quarters. Fast reload. Cons: High spread upon continuous fire. Low minimum body damage. Tips [ ] The M9 is one of the less accurate Pistols in the game (but has more accuracy than the Peppergun ), so aiming straight at enemies won't do the trick with this weapon. Because of its accuracy, this weapon is only effective at close-range. With this in mind, the best strategy to use the M9 is to go for the head, then finish them off with bodyshots. This way, the first, more accurate bullets will hit their mark, while the later, less accurate bullets will still land. The M9, like the other Pistols, reloads quickly, allowing you to reload in an intense fight. Gallery [ ] In third person. M9 in real life. Trivia [ ] The old model and sounds were used for the Conventional , a secondary weapon used by the Flanker and Mechanic classes in Typical Colors 2 . But in the Summer Update III they received a new firing sound. This is the signature weapon for the Fanboy skin . Getting a headshot kill with the M9 while using the Fanboy skin will award the player with the "Fanboy" badge . The M9 also appears in Robber , another ROLVe Game, albeit silenced. The M9 was the standard issue pistol for the U.S Armed Forces. While still in active use by the USAF, it is currently being phased out by the Sig Sauer M17. 18-35 (23-40) Gamemodes Standard Counter Blox Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown (Current) VALVe (Archived) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Military Armament Corporation Model 10 (simply known as CQB SMG in Gun Game , and better known as the MAC-10 ) is a compact, blowback operated open bolt machine pistol/submachine gun developed by Gordon B. Ingram in 1964, and chambered in the .45 ACP and 9mm cartridges. Despite never being referred to officially as the MAC-10 (and as the M10), the name MAC-10 has seen such common usage that it is how the weapon is generally identified. In-Game Information [ ] The MAC-10 is slightly a faster-firing, lower-accuracy Uzi . Just like any other SMGs, it is very ineffective at long ranges, highly effective at close ranges, and has a hefty penalty of spread. It has a much higher spread penalty in comparison to other SMGs, so it's best to completely avoid mid-long range interaction. It also carries 30-round magazine, but its fire-rate can easily expend the ammo quickly. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Very fast fire-rate. Decent damage at close quarters. Extremely quick reload. Minimal spread. Cons: Low minimum body damage. Magazine is easily expended due to its fire-rate. Tips [ ] The MAC-10 can be used from any distance, even from long-range. However, more bullets will land if you're at least at mid-range. If shooting from long-range, avoid firing all of your bullets at once. Your shots will be more accurate if you stop firing for at least half a second, then started firing again. The MAC-10 is fast enough to kill any opponent without being shot back at. If you're coming to Arsenal as a Typical Colors 2 player, the MAC-10 in this game is similar to the MAC-10 that Marksman uses. The only difference is that Arsenal's version fires slightly faster and deals a lot more damage. However, it reloads slightly slower than TC2's own. Trivia [ ] The MAC-10 was actually made illegal to produce by the ATF in 1972, along with many other guns. The MAC-10 appeared in Typical Colors 2 , as a secondary weapon for the Marksman class, albeit with a different model. The MAC-10 is a compact, blowback operated machine pistol developed by Gordon. B. Ingram in 1964 that's usually chambered in .45 ACP or 9mm through a special conversion. Its 30-round-mag suggests that it fires .45 ACP rounds. The MAC-10's current and archived model has its stock folded, while the previous model has it unfolded. In real life, the early versions of the MAC-10 use the magazines of the left-over WW2 M3 Grease Gun to reduce cost. The MAC-10 uses the Uzi's reload animation, albeit with a different bolt cycle animation. MAG-7 Current Previous Archived Alpha Overview Magazine Ammo 5 30 Damage Per Pellet 7-140 (16-161) Pellets Per Shot 9 Gamemodes Standard Legacy Competitive Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Counter Blox Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Pump-action Special Fall-off HUD Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The MAG-7 is a pump-action shotgun manufactured by Techno Arms PTY of South Africa since 1995. It was developed as a CQC (Close Quarters Combat) weapon which combined the concealed design of many submachine guns with the power of pump shotguns. It was originally manufactured with a civilian version alongside the normal version. The civilian version has a longer barrel and a fixed wooden stock. The version found in Arsenal is the original design. In-game Information [ ] The MAG-7 is an intermediate close-range weapon compared to other shotguns feeding on a 5-round magazine. the MAG-7 is capable of a 4-pellet kill anywhere on the body at close ranges, so aim should be taken at the head because of its very low damage. Along with its low damage, it also has huge spread. The firerate is very slow due to the pause after firing a shot. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Above-average maximum damage for its class. Magazine-fed means quicker reloads. Cons: Slow rate of fire. Small magazine size. Low minimum damage. Tips [ ] The MAG-7's less-than-ideal bullet spread requires the user to fight at close-range, instead of mid-range like most of the other Shotgun-class weapons. If you're stuck at mid-range, aiming at the upper-half of an opponent's body will help you deal respectable damage. Unlike the other Shotgun-class weapons, the MAG-7 reloads its entire magazine at one time. This will help you get back into fights quicker, but it will not help you if you're currently being shot at. Trivia [ ] The MAG-7 was the first magazine-fed shotgun in the game, soon followed by the Calico , AA12 , and TOZ-106 . The MAG-7 feeds from a stick magazine, the Calico feeds from a helical magazine, the AA-12 feeds from a drum magazine, and the TOZ-106 feeds from a box magazine. The MAG-7 was developed by Techno Arms PTY , a South African firearms company. It has never served in any law enforcement or military roles but is still manufactured to this day. It was developed as a close quarters combat shotgun, combining the aspects of a compact sub-machine gun and a pump-action shotgun. The MAG-7 uses a shorter, more obscure 12 gauge shell, using a 12 gauge x 60 mm cartridge compared to a 12 gauge x 69.85 mm cartridge most shotguns use today. The MAG-7 appeared in the archived version of Arsenal . However, instead of 5 shells per magazine, it has 8 shells per-magazine. ROLVe developers decided to reduce the magazine capacity to its current state in the Mega Update. This is the civilian version of the MAG-7, with a shorter barrel and removed stock. The MAG-7 is smaller in real life than it is in the game and is known for its bad ergonomics. The MAG-7 is able to be modded with an attachable stock and longer barrel in real life. If the max viewmodel is used, the reloading animation appears to be inaccurate; the player ejects the magazine but puts it back in. The MAG-7 firing and reloading sound is same as the MAG-7 from CS:GO before the major CSGO gun sound update. 22-36 (69-110) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Pistols Kill Confirmed Juggernaut Clown Infection Legacy Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.12 22.401 1.85 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 0.961 1 Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Makarov , in Russian, Пистолет Макарова ( Pistolet Makarova ), is a Soviet semi-automatic pistol. Designed under the leadership of Nikolay Fyodorovich Makarov, it became the standard-issue sidearm for the Soviet military and Militsya in 1951. In-Game Information [ ] The Makarov has no capped fire-rate, meaning that players do not have to wait whatsoever until firing another shot, essentially meaning it has an unlimited fire-rate. It's also very accurate due to its low spread, meaning it's good at most ranges. Players should aim for headshots when using the Makarov , as the weapon's powerful two-shot kill to the head combined with its uncapped fire rate, means the Makarov can be used as a deadly and dangerous handgun. However, users should take note of the weapon's paltry 9-round magazine, which is somewhat offset by the Makarov's fast reload speed; when the users spammed with the Makarov , the magazine easily runs out for a while due to its uncapped fire-rate. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Very fast fire-rate. High damage at close quarters. Low spread. Very quick reload time. Cons: Low 9-round magazine capacity. Low minimum body damage. Magazine is easily expended due to its fire-rate. Tips [ ] The Makarov is often underestimated by opponents due to its weak damage. However, its insanely fast firing rate makes this weapon deadly at close-range. If you sneak up on or suddenly pounce on enemies, the Makarov's firing rate will let you quickly kill them without taking damage back. Do beware that the Makarov is less effective at mid-range, and least effective and long-range due to its minimal damage for bodyshots. From any distance, however, 1-2 headshots will kill opponents quickly. The Makarov will can quickly run out of ammo during intense fights, but its reload is quick enough to allow you to start firing again. Gallery [ ] In third person. Makarov in real life. Trivia [ ] The Makarov has the fastest firing rate among the Pistols in this game. The Makarov became the Soviet Union's standard police and military sidearm in 1951. It was made after WWII with motives to replace the Tokarev TT33 and Nagant M1895 sidearms. The mesh is from another ROLVe game, Unit 1968: Vietnam . This is the signature weapon of the Animatronic Rabblerouser, Rabblerouser, RottingRouser, Summer Rabblerouser, and Throwback Rabblerouser skins . A silenced version of the model was used as one of Agent's primary weapons, the Silenced Pistol . The reload animation in-game incorrectly depicts the gun as a thumb-release rather than a heel-release gun.
