22-52 (34-60) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hard Mode Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio (Outdated) 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The MAT-49 is a submachine gun which was developed by French arms factory Manufacture Nationale d'Armes de Tulle (MAT) for use by the French Army and was first produced in 1949. In-game Information [ ] The MAT-49, like any other SMG, functions poorly at long ranges. However, it is slightly more accurate than other SMGs. This makes it somewhat usable in mid-range. Due to its low magazine of 20, it's best to make every shot count. However, the MAT-49 has a slower than average rate of fire for an SMG which is both a blessing and a curse. The slow rate of fire would make it less suitable compared to faster firing weapons in CQC but will not easily consume your ammunition. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Quick reload. Low spread. Cons: Somewhat slow rate of fire. Small magazine size for its class. Trivia [ ] The MAT-49 can fire 600 rounds per minute on full-auto. It also had a modified version that used two triggers for different rates of fire. The MAT-49 in-game uses the converted variant that was used by the Viet Cong . They converted the gun to fire 7.62mm Tokarev instead of 9mm Parabellum. The MAT-49 was introduced in 1949 to the French Armed Forces and remained in service until it was replaced by FAMAS in 1978. The model in-game has its slot for the stock removed. 18-35 (23-104) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Legacy Competitive Competitive Headshots Only Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Suppressor Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] Based on the PASAM SMG , the Mauser Carbine trades in ammo for damage in Arsenal . It has a magazine of 20 ammo, with 3 more magazines in reserve. In-game information [ ] The Mauser Carbine is similar to the MP9-S . However, the fire rate is slightly faster, it deals more damage, and the magazine is reduced to a mere 20, 10 rounds less than the MP9-S. It is also similar to the Focus, yet having a third of the damage but the same headshot damage. If players miss too much with this weapon, they will quickly find themselves in a bad spot, with reloading taking up a lot of precious time. The reload time is above average, so players can reload fast and get back into battle in no time. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Low spread and recoil. High damage. Extremely fast fire rate. Moderately fast reload. Slightly quieter shots do not reveal your location. Cons: Lower than average magazine size for its class. High ammo consumption rate. Low minimum damage. Magazine size easily expended due to fire rate. Tips [ ] The Mauser Carbine dominates intense fights. All it takes to get a kill is four landed shots, at the very least. This weapon also has a fast reload, which is another feature that makes it good at intense fights. Do note that the Mauser Carbine deals very weak damage at long-range. Stay at least within mid-range to get easier kills. While not a direct advantage, the Mauser Carbine's shots make softer sounds compared to other, louder weapons. Use this feature to hide your current loaction from opponents. Gallery [ ] The Mauser Carbine in real life with folded stock. Trivia [ ] The Mauser Carbine appears to be based on the PASAM submachine gun , a Brazilian derivative of the fully automatic Mauser M712 Schnellfeuer pistol . Although, the Carbine in-game has its wooden handguard extended towards the back. There are models of the Mauser pistols (including carbines) that either feed from an integral magazine or a detachable magazine. The Mauser was also known under the " Broomhandle " nickname due to the shape of the pistol grip. The variant in-game, the PASAM SMG , utilizes the 7.63x25mm Mauser cartridge. In-game, it seems to fire the .45 ACP cartridge for unknown reasons. The Mauser Carbine is the 4th weapon with a silencer to be added to the game. It is one of the seven guns to be equipped with a suppressor. The others are the MP9-S , the MK18 , the Hush Puppy , the Maxim-9 , the Sako 85 , and the Vector . Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] In-game, the Maxim-9 is a two-shot kill at close ranges and at long ranges through headshots. Its fast rate of fire and silenced nature make it great for ambushes. The Maxim-9 has a fair magazine capacity of 17, however the fast rate of fire and high recoil cause frequent reloads. The reload time is quite slow when compared to other pistols, so try not to run out of ammo. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. High damage. Silenced shot does not give spot away for enemies. Large magazine and ammo count. Low overall spread. Cons: Somewhat high recoil. Tips [ ] The Maxim-9 is one of the most powerful Pistols in the game. Its high damage, fast firing speed, and large magazine size will guarantee easy kills, as long as your aim can withstand its recoil. This weapon is powerful enough to be used from mid-range, but it's more powerful at close-range. If close enough, a single headshot from mid-range will insta-kill. Beware that the recoil becomes too high for you to see clearly at 5-7 shots. If at close-range, you can spam your shots. But at mid-range, it's better to space them out. Gallery [ ] The 1st stage of development. Stage 2. Stage 3 (finished). Iron Sights. Maxim-9 in real life. Trivia [ ] The Maxim-9 is the second pistol to have a silencer, with the first being the Hush Puppy . It is also one of the seventh suppressed weapons in the game, with the other five being the Hush Puppy , the MK18 , the MP9-S , the Mauser Carbine , the Sako 85 , and the Vector . This was one of many weapons to be revealed by ROLVe through their social media, with the others being the FAMAS , the L86A3 (both through Twitter ), the FMG-9 , the Tavor (both through the Arsenal Discord server), the FMG-9 , the Micro Uzis , the Flamethrower , the Pocket Potassium , the Z80 , the Literal Gun , the Vector , the Pulse Musket , and the TP Launcher . The Maxim-9 was also revealed in the Arsenal Discord server. The Maxim-9's previous firing sound uses the same firing sound from the USP-S from CBRO . In real life, the Maxim-9 can be both semi-automatic and automatic, but this game features the semi-automatic version. 24-54 (33-67) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Firing Mode Automatic Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The MG36 is a light machine gun of German origin. It was developed in the 1990s to complement the G36 assault rifle. Unlike the other variants of the G36 family of firearms, the MG36 was not very successful. It was never formally adopted. In-game information [ ] The MG36 performs similar to its assault rifle counterpart, trading movement speed for a 100-round Beta C-Mag . Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Low spread. High damage. Fast fire rate. Excellent ammo capacity. Decent reload time for a machine gun. Cons: Sluggish movement speed. Moderate recoil Tips [ ] The MG36 is the most accurate of all the Machine Guns due to its very low spread. You can practically use this weapon to snipe someone from a far distance if you don't get too reckless. If you're using the MG36 in a gamemode without the promotion-on-kill mechanic (Randomizer and Gun Rotation, for example), make sure to reload often to running out of ammo during an intense fight. The MG36 fires very quickly which will deplete its ammo in no time, so it's important to do this. Gallery [ ] One of the parts 1. One of the parts 2. One of the parts 3. The entire part merged. Finished model. Trivia [ ] The weapon was teased in the Arsenal Discord on May 23, 2021. While the MG36 is really just a G36 rifle fitted with a 100-round drum magazine, it has been upgraded to be equipped with a heavier barrel for continuous heavy fire. 15-45 (37-112) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Counter Blox Kill Confirmed Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The MG42 (known as the Maschinengewehr 42 ) is a 7.92×57mm Mauser GPMG (General-Purpose Machine Gun) designed and used by Nazi Germany during the second half of World War II. It was designed to replace the earlier, more expensive MG 34, though both weapons continued to be in use and production up to the end. Most notably for the MG 42, the weapon has a cyclic rate of fire of 1,200 rounds per minute- a large volume of fire that made it a good candidate for suppressive fire, and earned it the name "Hitler's Buzzsaw." In-game Information [ ] Players can expect a roller coaster of a weapon. The MG42 has one of the fastest fire rates in the game, meaning that users will quickly kill opponents in close to medium ranges. When burst fired, the MG42's spread penalty is sufficiently low enough to allow users to eliminate targets even at longer ranges. The really high damage helps too, and players can be killed in the blink of an eye. However, the weapon comes with two obvious downfalls; one being its low 50-round drum capacity for its class, made even smaller by the weapon's intense fire rate. This is not helped along by the MG42's reload time; players who empty out the weapon's drum will find themselves vulnerable for a lengthy period of time. However, since it takes so little rounds to kill a player anyway, any player who uses their rounds wisely will never have to deal with these issues. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros Insanely fast rate of fire. Very high damage up close. Low time-to-kill (TTK) at closer ranges due to devastating damage and fast fire rate. Very low recoil. Low spread for its class. Cons Sluggish movement speed. Grueling reload time. High ammo consumption rate. Low minimum body damage. Small magazine size for a machine gun. Expends it's ammo quickly due to its fire rate. Tips [ ] The MG42's minimal spread has a hidden advantage, as you won't have to move your aim too much to hit opponents. You can even hit opponents from far distances, More shots are likely to land if you position your crosshair on their head. At long-range, make sure you stop firing once in a while to reset the MG42's spread. Only the first 20 bullets are more accurate than the rest. Its incredibly slow reload time makes the MG42 a "one-and-done" weapon, as it prompts players to get a kill within the first clip, or face the consequences. If you don't want to wait out the slow reload, resorting to getting a backstab with your Knife can be an alternate solution. Trivia [ ] The MG42 is the fastest firing machine gun to be produced. It weighs about 25.57 pounds (11.6 kg), so in reality, carrying this would be extremely exhausting. The MG42's barrel can be swapped out and replaced in real life. The MG42 was taken from another game developed by ROLVe , Counter Blox . This weapon is also known as, " Hitler's Buzzsaw. " The MG42 in real life is usually used stationary with the bipod due to its high recoil. This weapon was released in The Update of All Time of Arsenal . This weapon looks similar to how a revolver would look, but instead of the cylinder containing bullets, it contains grenades. The weapon is also depicted with a scope, but isn't present in-game. In-Game Information [ ] The MGL is an automatic grenade launcher that does heavy damage. It is essentially a direct upgrade of the M79 , with a faster firerate, faster reload, and the same 1-shot splash damage ability, but has slower movement speed Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Fast rate of fire. Rocket Jump ability. Insta-kills an enemy. Splash damage allows for area-of-effect kills. High ammo for an explosive. Multiple shots in case you miss. Cons: Users can damage themselves upon splash range. 10-17 (27-41) [Each shot in 2 bursts] Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Micro Uzis are dual submachine guns that are a variation of the Uzi . The Micro Uzis were initially produced in the 1980s as a more compact version of the UZI. Each individual gun is weaker than the regular UZI, however, since they're both combined, they can yield greater damage, but also have a higher spread penalty. The Micro Uzis are one of the few dual wielded pistols in the game and the only automatic ones. It fires twice as fast as the regular UZI, shooting at a whooping 1250 RPM instead of the regular 600. There are a few drawbacks when it comes to the Micro Uzis, the most notable ones are the high bullet spread which would make it an inaccurate weapon and its low minimum damage. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Extremely high rate of fire. High damage in close range. High ammo capacity. Cons: High ammo consumption rate. High spread penalty. Long reload time. Low minimum body damage. Low accuracy. Tips [ ] The Micro Uzis are infamous for dominating close-ranged fights. It takes around 1 second for them to kill a nearby opponent. The most effective areas of a map to get a kill with this weapon is around corners, or jumping off a high platform and firing at an opponent below. Unlike their "big brother", the single Uzi , the Micro Uzis have very high spread, making them useless at mid-range and farther. However, the first 7-10 shots from the Micro Uzis are accurate enough to be used at mid-range. Use this for chip damage or to allow a teammate get you an assist. The Micro Uzis are a "one-and-done" weapon due to its ability to easily kill, but also with a slow reloading speed. Avoid emptying your ammo at all costs and make your shots count, or else you will be left vulnerable while reloading. However, it does take 3 seconds to reload, which isn't a long time if you're currently alone. Hide from enemies to reload and then jump back at them once loaded. Trivia [ ] It is one of the five dual-wielded weapons in the game along with the Dual Volcanics , the PRISMAS , Dual LCRs and the Dual Shotguns . It is also the first automatic dual-wielded weapon in the game. The second being the Dual Shotguns. The Micro UZI is the smallest in the UZI family, which includes the Mini UZI, the Uzi , and the UZI Pro. Micro UZI was initially produced by Israeli Military Industries in the 1980s as a super-compact version of the Uzi . Initially, it was sold only to members of the armored corps and special forces units of the Israeli Defense Forces , but due to several deals, the Micro Uzi would be manufactured by several U.S. companies. In real life, Micro UZI is classified as machine pistol, rather than an SMG, which is the same case for the MAC-10 . The Micro Uzi is a scaled-down version of the UZI that was introduced in the year 1986. It has an automatic fire of 1,250 RPM (rounds per minute) which is double the RPM of the regular Uzi. The Micro Uzis share the same firing and reload sounds with the Uzi from the Left 4 Dead series. Each click with the Micro Uzis shoots 2 bullets instead of one. There is a random bug where only half of the gun appears, this bug also removes the pull-out animation, reload animation and the fire animation, but you are still able to fire the weapon and kill somebody with it. It is unknown if this bug is patched or not. When the Micro UZIs were first added, the kill icon for the Micro UZIs was a crowbar. This was then changed to the UZI kill icon before it got a unique one This is one of many weapons which were revealed before they got added into the game including the L86A3 , the FAMAS , the Ice Stars , the Golden Gun , the FMG-9 , the Maxim-9 , the Tavor , the Flamethrower , the Pocket Potassium , the Z80 , the Literal Gun , the Vector , the Pulse Musket and the TP Launcher . They are used for the Performer ROBLOX toy. Gallery [ ] Micro Uzis in real life. 27-45 (37-150) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Tracer Shot Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.15 22.401 1.9 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 2.621 1 The Minifigure is an action figure that holds a blaster in their right hand. It's design resembles the official collectible Roblox figures created by toy company called Jazwares . Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Minifigure rapidly shoots their blaster at the user's demands, hitting an enemy will deal a regular damage of 27 and 37 on a headshot at long ranges. When reloading, the user will give the Minifigure a magazine and reload it themselves. The Minifigure is the final weapon needed to win a game of Laser Tag . Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Decent rate of fire. Large magazine size for a pistol. High damage. Fast reload. Cons: High spread upon continuous shots. Tracer shot can give away the user's position. Tips [ ] The Minifigure is a rather tricky weapon. It shoots quickly and deals respectable damage, but its spread gets high very fast. The Minifigure's spread becomes too high after 6 shots. The Minifigure is practically effective from almost any distance. In short-range, especially during intense fights, the user can spam the Minifigure's shots, where a majority of them are guaranteed to hit the opponent. At mid-range, the Minifigure is still viable to spam, but not very quickly to avoid high spread. From long-range, the Minifigure performs best if shot only once per second, imitating a Marksman Rifle. Once again, the high spread won't help at far distances unless shots are spaced out. The Minifigure has a fast reload, but it's slightly slower than the other Pistols. Beware. Although this weapon shoots tracer shots, they are very short. The majority of the playerbase doesn't take advantage of these. Gallery [ ] Weapon development. Weapon render. Trivia [ ] The Minifigure was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on December 21st, 2020. The Minifigure is based on the Elflinquent skin holding a blaster pistol. The figure resembles the same shape as real ROBLOX figures. There's also a rare chance that the Minifigure will take on the appearance of the Astronaut skin. The Minifigure is the first weapon in Arsenal to have voicelines. The Minifigure is one of the weapons that reloads its own ammo instead of the user. The other is the Pulse Musket. Audio [ ] As previously stated in the article, the figure can speak as a result of the player's actions, including: pulling the figure out, reloading their blaster, or inspecting the figure. 14-21 (16-24) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Typical Colors Kill Confirmed Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Rev-Up Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] Officially called the General Electric (Or Dillon Aero ) Machine Gun, High Rate, Caliber 7.62-mm, M134 , the " Minigun " is an American-made 7.62×51mm NATO six-barrel rotary machine gun with a high, sustained rate of fire. The Minigun was designed with the goal of helicopters to be equipped with an effective close-air-support weapon. In later years, the Minigun would both be used as a ground-based support weapon. However, pop culture created the myth of a handheld, multi-barrel machine of death, despite the real-life fact that hardly any human could lift, let alone wield such a weapon. However, the myth of the massive death machine would remain popular. In-game Information [ ] The Minigun runs off a single ammo pool of 800 rounds and has the highest ammo pool in-game. It is unique that it requires a windup period of 3 seconds before it is able to fire. However, players can "rev up" the weapon prematurely without firing by holding down RMB (right mouse button), although this will slow players down to the speed of crawling. The Minigun also comes with a heavy spread penalty that decreases immensely 3-5 seconds after players have begun revving up. It's best to jump before revving up, as jumping will keep your momentum mid-air. While the Minigun's damage is comparable to that of an SMG, its high rate of fire and large ammo capacity allows players to kill opponents at all ranges with ease. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Extremely high ammo pool of 150 rounds. No reloading required. Spread penalty deduction after 3 seconds of revving. Insanely fast fire rate. Pre-revving saves time. Can shoot 2 bullets at a time. Cons: Low mobility when firing or revving up. Must be revved up before firing. Low minimum damage. Somewhat high spread at first. May cause lag probably due to the size or the rev-up. High recoil. Tips [ ] Before turning any corners (where most enemies are most likely to be), make sure to hold RMB down to rev up. This will save you the 1 second pause between revving up and shooting if an enemy approaches you. You can hold both LMB and RMB to both fire this weapon and stay revved up after you stop shooting. Holding the Minigun will make you walk slower, especially if you rev it up. To move faster around the map, you should equip your Knife and switch back to the Minigun if you spot any enemies. Because the Minigun makes you slower, you'll be an easy target for any opponents with a Marksman Rifle or a Sniper Rifle. Try not to use the Minigun in very open spaces. Inside buildings or areas without anyone staring down the sightline are more advantageous for you. The Minigun's tighter spread can potentially kill an opponent from long-range. If you are coming to Arsenal as a Typical Colors 2 player, the Minigun is more or less the same. However, take note of its new stats: Compared to the Minigun from TC2, the Minigun for Arsenal has a tighter spread, so you can kill enemies from practically any distance. The Minigun also crits on headshot, which will make kills both fast and almost effortless. Just like facing off against enemy Agents, you are vulnerable to being demoted a level by an enemy's Knife if you are unaware. Stay vigilant to avoid being easily taken advantage of. Gallery [ ] Minigun in real life. Trivia [ ] The Minigun in-game is a six-barrel 7.62x51mm rotary machine gun more formally designated the M134 Minigun and is meant to be used on aircraft, sea vessels, land vehicles, and stationary positions. The large machine guns that were built on military vehicles were made smaller to be used by a human: hence the name "Minigun", despite its size still being big. The weapon's weight in real life is 85 pounds (39 kilograms), and still a hefty 41 pounds (19 kilograms) with the lightweight modifications, not including a power generator or ammo supplies. The Minigun's model and animations are imported from Typical Colors 2 , albeit minor differences like the fire rate and the ammo and the Arsenal version lacks of ammo pouches on the sides of the weapon. When getting a kill with the Minigun using the Brute skin , players can get the Right Person, Wrong Game Badge . This Badge references the Brute character from Typical Colors 2 , where his main weapon is the Minigun. The Minigun is the only weapon in the game in which the spread decreases the longer it's fired. It is the signature weapon of the Brute, Rhino & Rider Brute skins. Whilst the Minigun got removed, the signature weapon of Brute was changed to the RPG , and then to the M60 , and Rhino's signature weapon was removed then changed to the M60. After the Minigun was brought back into the game, Brute's signature weapon was reverted to his original signature weapon. Originally, this weapon dealt horrifically low amounts of damage to balance the fire rate, however, this was then buffed. The Minigun has the highest ammo pool in the game. The main reason behind the Minigun's short removal from the game was because of the trouble to make it work with the new sound replication. This also caused the removed gamemodes, Typical Colors and Automatics to be broken. The Minigun was used for as an accessory for the Brute ROBLOX toy. 18-37 (28-165) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Automatic Special ADS Suppressor Fall-off Kill Icon The MK18 Mod 2 is a variant of the M4A1 that was updated to use the Close Quarter Battle Receiver or (CQBR) for close combat situations. It was developed by the US Navy, as a low-profile replacement for the M4 and M16 series, not being ideally suited for all missions. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio 5.1 Previous 6 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] MK18's fast rate of fire helps with shredding enemies at any ranges combined with its ADS feature for extreme accuracy. It also has a suppressor, making its shots less audible. However, due to drawbacks, the MK18 has downsides, such as its low minimum damage, which means shredding at long range might be a problem, and even though the MK18 has an ADS ability, hip-firing will result in a high spread penalty. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros Decent damage in close quarters. Accessible sight. Fast fire rate. Silenced shots make it harder to reveal a player's position. Moderate magazine size. Cons Low first shot accuracy. Low minimum damage. High spread upon hip-firing. Long reload time. Magazine is quickly emptied due to fast fire rate. Gallery [ ] ADS Previous ADS MK18 in real life. Trivia [ ] The MK18, also known as the CQBR (close quarters battle receiver) , is an M4A1 Carbine with a replacement upper receiver that makes the weapon become more compact and easier to maneuver in tight, confined spaces, similar to the old Colt Commandos of the past. The MK18 firing sound is same as the old M4A1-S from CS:GO . It used to be the signature weapon of John Brick, as evident by the The Boogeyman badge where one must get a kill using the John Brick Skin with an MK18. However, in the Christmas Update , John Brick's signature weapon was changed to a pencil melee. The MK18 is the third silenced weapon to be added to the game. It is also one of the seven silenced weapon in the game with the others being the Maxim-9 , Hush Puppy , Sako 85 , MP9-S , the Mauser Carbine and the Vector . The MK18 is one of the weapons that has the ability to ADS. The others are the DB Chauchat , the M14 EBR , the Falkor , the Vector , the Pulse Musket and DBS . There is a glitch where the crosshair isn't visible with this weapon. First of all scope with this weapon, and switch to the knife. Now you don't have a crosshair. Also, hipfiring will have no spread and lower recoil, using a custom crosshair will make this weapon overpowered. This also happens with the other weapons which have access to ADS, however, the results can be different. Originally, if the player has minimized viewmodels setting on and accesses the sight, the ADS model will appear lower on the screen. 18-36 (30-45) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Colt 9mm SMG , also known as the Colt Model 635 , is a 9×19mm Parabellum submachine gun manufactured by Colt, based on the M16 family of rifles. The overall aesthetics are identical to most M16 type rifles. Changes include a large plastic gas deflector protruding from the rear quarter of the ejection port, and a correspondingly shorter dust cover. Factory Colt 9mm SMGs are equipped with a 10.5 inch length barrel and have an M16 style upper receiver, which means they feature a fixed carry handle, no forward assist and A1 sights (with 50 and 100 meter settings). The magazine well of the receiver is modified with pinned-in blocks to allow the use of smaller 9 mm magazines. The magazines themselves are a copy of the Israeli UZI SMG magazine, modified to fit the Colt and lock the bolt back after the last shot. In-game Information [ ] The Model 635 is an automatic sub-machine gun that was added in the Summer Update III of Arsenal . Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fall off allows close range shredding. High fire-rate. Decent damage at close ranges. Decent reload time. Cons: Low damage. Somewhat high spread. Trivia [ ] The model used most of the meshes from M4A1 . The Model 635 have the appearance of a M4A1 in third person. The Model 635 is one of the six active AR-15 based guns in Arsenal , the other five being the M4A1 , M16A1 , M16A2 , Falkor and the MK18 . The production of the Mosin–Nagant started in the Russian Empire during 1891. In-game Information [ ] The Mosin-Nagant is best used as a marksman's weapon. A shot to the head will instantly kill an enemy regardless of distance, and will always two-shot kill an opponent to the body at far range. However, players are advised to aim for the head, as the Mosin-Nagant has extremely slow bolt cycling, requiring players to wait a brief time longer than the Windicator 's reload time. It also has two unique features: one is being reloaded one-by-one. This can be a boon if players need to fire while reloading, although a full reload from empty will be punishing. The second is the fall-off, which allows the Mosin-Nagant to deal more damage at closer ranges. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Ramped-up damage if near opponents. Insta-kills if shot point-blank. Scope allows for better magnification. Reloaded 1-by-1, making it efficient when needing to fire while reloading. No spread or recoil. Cons: Slow movement speed. Slowest rate of fire in-class. Punishing reload time if the magazine is empty. Low ammo in reserve. Scope tracer may give away position Tips [ ] The Mosin-Nagant is one of the most versatile weapons in the game, as it can snipe from a distance and deal respectable damage up close. Sniper Rifles generally lose to Automatic Rifles and Shotgun-classes in close-quarters combat. The Mosin-Nagant is an exception as it deals hefty damage at close-range, making the user a threat that cannot be underestimated. Any bodyshot can potentially deal enough damage for a teammate to finish your job, giving you credit as an assist. You can also pull out your Knife and hit your target with a non-backstab to demote them. The most crippling downside of the Mosin-Nagant is its slow firing speed, which makes it less useful during intense fights despite its ramped-up damage. Make your shots count, even if flicking your aim. Keep the Mosin-Nagant at the ready before you turn corners, just in case you bump into an opponent or two. The Mosin-Nagant's slow firing speed can be sped up if you double-key (switch to your melee and back quickly). Trivia [ ] The Mosin-Nagant's official designation is the " 3-line rifle M1891 ", although it is more commonly known in the West as the Mosin-Nagant and in Russia as Mosin's Rifle. The version featured in the game is the M91/30 sniper version of the rifle. Its bolt is bent and is equipped with a PU scope. The Mosin is one of the most produced bolt-action rifles in history, with a total of 37 million units having been produced since the Mosin's first creation in 1891. It is still used to this day by various nations. The Mosin itself also appeared in Typical Colors 2 as a old model of a primary weapon for Marksman (Known as Efficient Eliminator ) The in-game Mosin-Nagant does not have a trigger. The firing sound is taken from ROLVe's Vietnam War game, Unit 1968 , from the Mosin Nagant. The Mosin-Nagant's inspect animation is currently broken. Gallery [ ] Mosin-Nagant in real life. Per Pellet 15 (37) Pellets Per Shot 9 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Kill Confirmed Juggernaut Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Pump-Action Special Fall-off HUD Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 GALLERY 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Mossberg 500 is a series of pump action shotguns manufactured by O.F. Mossberg & Sons. The 500 series comprises widely varying models of hammerless repeaters, all of which share the same basic receiver and action, but differ in bore size, barrel length, choke options, magazine capacity, stock and forearm materials. Model numbers included in the 500 series are the 500 , 505 , 510 , 535 , and 590 . In-game Information [ ] The Mossberg 500 's high damage per pellet is a great role in damaging enemies at long range, and just like the Pump Shotgun , the Mossberg 500 also has a 1-by-1 reload, meaning players can shoot while reloading. This doesn't come without any problems, however, since the Mossberg 500 has a wide pellet spread, meaning picking off enemies at longer ranges may be harder than other shotguns. Other drawbacks that come to mind are the slow rate of fire and the small ammo capacity of 5. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Very high damage per pellet. 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. High minimum pellet damage for its class. Moderate ammo capacity. Firerate can be increased by double keying Cons: Slow empty reload time. Wide pellet spread. Slow rate of fire. Sluggish movement speed Tips [ ] The Mossberg 500's bullet spread is "uneven", meaning that it fires in a somewhat fixed pattern but is still too wide. To guarantee that more pellets will land, the solution as always is to get closer to opponents before firing. This "uneven" bullet spread will not help with firing at opponents on higher platforms. However, it is viable when jumping off and pouncing on opponents. Get closer to opponents by holding out your Knife , then switching back to the Mossberg 500 when in effective range. Trivia [ ] The Mossberg 500 is one of the more ubiquitous shotguns in the world, and is extremely easy to clean & maintain. The model for the Mossberg 500 was used for Typical Colors 2 as the Gutbuster . The Mossberg in-game appears to have the elements of the "shockwave" variant, due to the iron sights and the grip, and the normal variant, due to the stock. When reloading the Mossberg 500, the player will not pump it after it has finished reloading, unlike other shotguns in the game. This is the signature weapon of the John, Woods, Mechanic and Arsonist skin . This weapon also used to be the signature weapon of the Paintballer skin. GALLERY [ ] Mossberg 500 in real life. Adopted by 40+ countries, it’s used by militaries, police, and paramilitary forces worldwide. In-game Information [ ] The MP5 is highly versatile, offering a fast fire rate, decent close-range damage (54 to the head, 43 to the torso), and low recoil. Its stability makes it effective in various combat scenarios. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Automatic Low-Recoil Low-Spread Quick Reload Accessible sight Cons: Far-range damage is poor. Trivia [ ] It uses animations from another ROLVe game, Enforcement . Weirdly enough you can aim down sights for this gun, despite it only having iron sights. The detailed name for this MP5 is MP5A3 as it has a collapsible stock. 18-87 (31-54) Gamemodes Standard Firing Mode Automatic Special Suppressor Kill Icon Creator devkeni (2025) Bluay (2016) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Weapon History 7 Sources General Information [ ] The MP5-SD (simply known as Silenced SMG in Gun Game ) is a German sub machine gun made by Heckler & Koch in 1974 (SD variant). This was removed in the Mega Update and replaced with the MP5K , but it was later brought back in the 10 Year Anniversary Update . This version of the MP5 uses a supressor attatchment, making its shots less audible. In-game Information [ ] The MP5-SD was relatively easy to kill with, but because it was low with damage, it was also easy to get killed with. It had a good magazine size and also a good ammunition reserve. All of this is completed with the low recoil, low spread, and very fast fire rate that was completely made better with the fast reload. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Low recoil and spread. Fast fire rate. Somewhat fast reload. Moderate magazine size. Supressor reduces noise considerably. Cons: Low body damage. Tips [ ] The MP5-SD is one of the easier weapons to get a kill with due to its fast firing speed, plus its low recoil and spread. This weapon dominates mid-ranged fights, so take advantage against players with close-ranged weapons like Shotguns or Pistols. Gallery [ ] A Solid Color MP5-S. Current MP5-SD in real life. Archived MP5-SD in real life. Trivia [ ] It is the first MP5 variant ever added in Arsenal (being added during the game's release under name "Gun Game" ). The second being the MP5K (added in the Mega Update in 2018), and the third being the MP5 (added in the Ocean Day Update in 2024). MP5-SD is one of an few archived weapons that still persisted their Gun Game design. It is also the only returning weapon in Arsenal that still persisted their Gun Game design, albeit with some minor differences. The current model is an A2 model with a fixed stock, while the archived model is an A3 model with a collapsible stock. The un-suppressed version, MP5 was originally going to be added to the game under the name of SMG by choice. Instead, the UMP-45 was chosen to be added. [ 1 ] The MP5-SD is a renamed variant of the MP5SD2 , a full stock, semi/full-automatic fire submachine gun. It is the only kind of MP5 that was redesigned majorly to MP5K . In 1974, Heckler & Koch worked on a sound-suppressed of the regular MP5 , and made the MP5SD3 (or the in-game MP5-S) which featured an integral but a detachable aluminium sound suppressor and a lightweight bolt. MP5D3 has a retractable buttstock, "SEF" trigger group and an integrated suppressor. The MP5D3 is a variant of the MP5A3 which has a retractable butt and selector for bursts of three shots but however, The MP5D3 has an integrated suppressor unlike the MP5A3. The MP5SD1 , MP5SD2 and MP5SD3 use a standard "SEF" trigger group (from the MP5A2 and MP5A3) There's another version of the MP5SD3, the MP5SD-N , which is the MP5SD3 with a retractable metal stock, front sight post with tritium-illuminated dot and a stainless steel suppressor. Along with the MP5 weirdly enough, you can aim down sights with MP5SD despite it only featuring iron sights. Weapon History [ ] 2016 2018 2025 April 18th, 2016 Added MP5-S into Gun Game . April 21st, 2016 Taken to the ALPHA phase of Arsenal . August 6th, 2016 Taken to the archived phase of Arsenal . November 27th, 2018 ( Mega Update ) Removed from Arsenal . August 18th, 2025 ( 10 Year Anniversary Update ) Re-added to Arsenal as MP5-SD . 18-43 (28-50) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown (Current) VALVe (Archived) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Heckler & Koch MP5K , in German, Maschinenpistole 5 Kurz (Kurz meaning 'short'), is a compact variant of the MP5 . Designed for close-quarters combat, the MP5K retains the reliability and performance of the original MP5 while offering greater maneuverability. Widely used by military, police, and security forces, it is valued for its compact size and low recoil. In-Game Information [ ] This gun boasts an impressive rate of fire, a reasonable reload time, and solid headshot damage, guaranteeing at least a four-shot kill at any range, making it quite dependable in combat. However, its minimum damage is relatively low. To compensate, players should focus on closing the distance to their targets or aiming for headshots. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. High damage at close quarters. Fairly fast reload. Moderate magazine size. Fairly low spread. Cons: Low minimum body damage. Tips [ ] The MP5-SD is one of the easier weapons to get a kill with due to its fast firing speed, plus its low recoil and spread. This weapon dominates mid-ranged fights, so take advantage against players with close-ranged weapons like Shotguns or Pistols. Trivia [ ] The MP5K is simply a shortened version of the MP5 family. During its release, it was known as the MP5. It was quickly changed to MP5K due to its small size. This is the signature weapon of the Communicator skin. Initially, the MP5K was the signature weapon for the Ace Pilot, but it was replaced by the Handcannon in the August Update and later restored in the Anniversary Update . However, it became the signature weapon for the Communicator instead. In the Christmas Update , Ace Pilot's signature weapon was changed to the P90 . The MP5K' s firing animation includes a small error wherein the charging handle moves backwards after firing the weapon. During the reload animation, the player's character will slap the charging handle. This is known as the “HK Slap”. Gallery [ ] MP5K in real life. 12-40 (28-46) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Counter Blox Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown (Current) VALVe (Archived) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Gallery 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Heckler & Koch MP7 is a personal defense weapon chambered for the HK 4.6×30mm armor-piercing cartridge designed by German defence manufacturer Heckler & Koch. It was designed together with the new cartridge to meet NATO requirements published in 1989, which called for an SMG-type weapon that had a greater capacity to defeat Kevlar body armour than pre-existing submachine guns using conventional pistol cartridges such as .45 ACP and 9×19mm Parabellum. The MP7 went into production in 2001, and is a direct rival to the FN P90, also developed in response to NATO's requirement by Belgian company FN Herstal. The weapon has been revised since its introduction and the latest production variants are the MP7A1 and MP7A2 . The proliferation of cheap yet effective soft body armor has begun to make guns that fire pistol ammunition (such as Heckler & Koch's earlier MP5 submachine gun and USP pistol) ineffective. In response to this trend, Heckler & Koch designed the MP7 (along with the cancelled UCP pistol, which uses the same ammunition) to penetrate soft body armor while being small enough to be used in place of either a pistol or a submachine gun. In-game Information [ ] The MP7 is a close-quarters oriented SMG, with a fairly high rate of fire and high spread to boot. It uses a large 40-round magazine, making it a very ammo-efficient weapon despite its fast rate of fire. The damage is remarkably decent in CQC, dealing up to 46 damage to the head at closer ranges and trailing down to 12 damage to the body at maximum range. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage at close quarters. Fast rate of fire. Fairly fast reload. Fairly low spread. Large magazine size of 40. Cons: Very low minimum body damage. Trivia [ ] The MP7, or Maschinenpistole 7 , was developed in response to NATO requirements for a new PDW firearm. PDWs are a hybrid between the Carbine and the SMG, allowing for greater armor penetration compared to SMGs, and a form factor small enough to easily be carried. The MP7 is the signature weapon of Broadcaster. The MP7 firing sound is same as the old MP7 from CS:GO . The MP7 in game has relatively high recoil contrary the MP7 in real life, in fact, low recoil is one of the selling points of the MP7. Gallery [ ] MP7 in real life without sights. 18-36 (20-41) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Automatics Counter Blox Kill Confirmed Juggernaut Clown Infection Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Suppressor Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Brügger & Thomet MP9 is a machine pistol designed and manufactured by Brügger & Thomet of Switzerland. In-game Information [ ] The MP9-S is a powerful sub-machine gun. It stays accurate up to mid-long range, and combined with its silenced nature, allows players to effectively kill targets farther than most sub-machine guns could without risk of return fire. It does not lose any close-range effectiveness, however. The MP9-S's rate of fire grants it a rather quick time to kill. As with a majority of sub-machine guns, players have a high walk speed. However, its low damage means that players will have to rely on both their accuracy and the weapon's accuracy, as it can take upwards of 5 shots at farther ranges before an enemy is killed. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast fire rate. Moderately low spread Moderately quick reload. Silenced shots won't give away your position for enemies. Cons: Low minimum damage. Magazine is easily expended due to fast fire rate. Spread is not low enough to be used beyond mid-range. Tips [ ] The MP9-S has an "uneven" bullet spread, meaning that it fires in a somewhat fixed pattern but is still too wide. This makes it only effective at close-range, but the spread is still low enough to be used at mid-range. For this weapon, there really isn't need to "space out your shots", because all of your bullets can be shot before the spread becomes to high. As usual, the spread is not low enough to be used at longer distances. Any attempts to do so will be useless. The reload is fast, but not fast enough to help you start firing again in an intense fight. Make sure your shots count. Trivia [ ] It is the silenced version of the MP9 , a weapon found previously in Arsenal Archived . A previous glitch allowed this weapon (along with many others) to deal upwards of 5000 damage if combined with the chickens from the egg hunt. A video of this glitch can be found here . The MP9-S is found in other games, such as the TMP or Schmidt Machine pistol from the old Counter Strike games (From 1.0 to Source) or in CSGO but without a silencer. The previous MP9-S firing sound was also taken from the TMP in Counter Strike: Source. This was included in the Counter Blox gamemode, although a suppressed MP9 never actually appeared within that gamemode, although in Counter Blox there is MP-9, but not suppressed. At one point, the gun had its firing sound removed with the rest of the silenced weapons. This was changed in the Showtime! Update . The MP9-S is the second weapon with a silencer to be added to the game along with the MK18 , the Hush Puppy , the Mauser Carbine , the Maxim-9 , the Sako 85 and the Vector . The reload sound sounds similar to the Counter Blox audio, except slowed down. 65 (182) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hard Mode Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Bolt-Action Special Scope Kill Icon Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.8 1 23.297 2.71 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The MS556 is a fictional variant of the M40 and Remington 700 rifles, notable for its use of the 5.56 cartridge and a 7-round box magazine rather than its predecessor's 7.62mm round. In-game Information [ ] In-game, the MS556 is a 7-round sniper rifle comparable to the M40 . Players can expect a constant 65 damage at all ranges to the body and an instant kill to the head at all ranges, dealing 182 damage to a player. The weapon has no recoil and player's shots will always hit at the crosshair. The MS556's scope can be accessed by players using the RMB. Players can take shots without scoping in for CQC and medium range combat, but scoping is recommended for long range. The MS556's fire-rate is somewhat faster than that of other sniper rifles. Though this is an advantage in some aspects, it also means it can somewhat deplete ammo faster than other sniper rifles. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros High damage. Scope allows for better magnification. Perfect accuracy. Cons Lengthy reload. Small magazine size. Slow fire rate. Scope tracer may give away position. Tips [ ] The MS556 is best at exclusively long-range compared to the other Marksman Rifles, as its mid-range combat ability is not as effective. If an enemy pounces on you while you are sniping, a quick shot to their body will deal 65 damage, which will hopefully be enough for a teammate to get an assist for you. It does have a fast fire-rate which will help you fight off an opponent at mid-range, but most of the time this will depend on your opponent having a bad weapon or aim. Even with 7 shots per magazine and 2 bodyshots for a kill, you should still make your shots count. The MS556's reload is slow and it won't help you if you're currently being shot at. Trivia [ ] The MS556 is a fictional weapon chambered for 5.56 and using a detachable magazine. However, 5.56mm snipers have been made. The MS556 is a mix of the M700, the C14 Timberwolf and the M40A5 Sniper Rifle. The MS556 was able to be fired at a rate similar to that of most semi-automatic rifles, but that has since been fixed and it now fires at a speed closer to that of the M40 . In the early version of the Mega Update , it performed far worse than how it performs in it's current state, as the body shot would deal a minimal 40 damage, as well as having a low ammo pool (5/15). It was later buffed over time. The MS556's model and sound effects are seemingly reused from the M40, though with a few differences, such as it's color and an added reload animation. It is the signature weapon of Marksman skin . The MS556 replaced the C14 Timberwolf from Arsenal Archived . 600 (750) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Hard Mode Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Single-fire Kill Icon Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.75 0.7 23.521 5.4 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Musket is a muzzle-loaded long gun that appeared as a smoothbore weapon in the early 16th century. The Musket seen in Arsenal appears to be based on a Percussion Cap musket, which appeared in the early-to-mid-19th century and usually fired a .58 caliber Minie Ball and was usually rifled. In-game Information [ ] The Musket is known for being both famous and infamous. It easily kills enemies with its over-the-top 600 bodyshot damage with 750 damage upon a headshot, instantly killing a player. On top of this, it has perfect accuracy, so all a player has to do is aim, and a kill will come rather quickly. However, it is infamous for its long reload of 6 seconds, whereas it only has a magazine of 1. This is extremely crucial to game time and survival. The Musket requires perfect aiming when shooting. If a player misses a shot, they are most likely going to lose a lot of time or die because of the Musket's notoriously long reload. It is an all-or-nothing weapon, backed up by the fact that the Musket can only fit one round. It acts like the Golden Gun in a sense, as both have one round but instantly kill. Because of this, the main problem with this weapon comes when players miss with it. This is due to a glaring downside, which is it's reload time. Since the Musket only has one round in its magazine, players will need to reload every time they fire. However, the sense of an all-or-nothing weapon goes away in the gamemodes Gun Rotation and Randomizer due to it's lengthy reload and 1 magazine capacity. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros One-shot kill on any part of the body across all ranges. Perfect accuracy. Cons Grueling 6-second reload time. Only one round in the chamber, so the weapon must reload every time after firing. Tips [ ] It must be noted that the Musket is the hardest Sniper Rifle to get a kill with (and most of the community say it's the hardest weapon overall). This weapon tests your patience and your ability to remain calm when aiming. Flicking your aim and shooting recklessly won't help you with this weapon. Because the Musket does not have a scope, its effective range is only at mid-range. It does have perfect accuracy, so you can still try to shoot from long range. From this distance, however, it is recommended to stay still and crouch to carefully take aim. If you cannot wait for the 6 second reload, your only other option is your Knife . Working on your melee combat is important because it can help you get a kill despite having a defective weapon like the Musket. Even if you get killed while fighting with your Knife, respawning is faster than reloading the Musket. In the rare chance that every player gets the Musket in the Gun Rotation gamemode , you should use your Knife instead of shooting the Musket, as this guarantees you more kills than everyone else. If you're still confident that you can reload the Musket, find a hiding place so you can do it without being attacked. Hiding in a corner, a small room, or on a higher platform are good places to sit down and reload. Trivia [ ] This weapon has the second highest damage in both head and body in the game per bullet, tied with the Tavor slug shell, only to be surpassed by the Literal Gun . The Musket has the longest reload time per bullet, with 6 seconds per bullet, which greatly surpasses every other weapon in the game, which all have reload times of less than 2 seconds per bullet. However, it does not have the longest reload time per magazine, being second to the Dual Volcanics , which takes a whopping 18 seconds to reload if the magazine is emptied out. Reloading in real life would have taken much longer, as the average reload speed of a rifleman during the 18-19th century was usually 20 seconds. The Musket is based on the 19th century-pattern percussion rifle called the Springfield 1861. Notably, the Springfield 1861 had a rifled barrel, much like later musket models. This allowed it to fire its Minie Balls accurately for up to a distance of over 500 yards. These kinds of muskets are known as "rifled muskets". The Musket, along with the Pocket Potassium , the Golden Gun , the Bow , the RPG , the M203 , the Spellbook , and the M79 are the only weapons in the game that carry a single round. In Gun Rotation and Randomizer, getting a kill with this weapon will allow you to fire the next shot almost instantaneously without the need to reload. However, missing will result in the grueling 6-second reload. The Musket is the signature weapon of the GOC Past skin . The Musket is the only sniper rifle to not have a scope ability. The old firing sound of the Musket is the firing sound of the Rifle from Mount & Blade: Napoleonic Wars . 11-22 (18-28) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Legacy Competitive All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon The Nailgun is a weapon that was added in the Halloween Update . The rifle uses a model very similar to the M4A1 with the exception of the handguard, grip, stock and the magazine. The Nailgun has perfect accuracy without spread, making it useful at any range, similar to the Laser Rifle and the Pulse Laser . This weapon has an incredibly fast fire rate and it will kill the enemy easily, however it also quickly empties its ammo capacity due to this. Contents 1 Pros & Cons 2 Trivia 3 Audio 4 Weapon History Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast fire rate. Large 60-round magazine. Perfect accuracy. No recoil. Decent damage at close quarters. Cons: Low minimum damage. Reload is fairly slow. Somewhat slow movement speed. Trivia [ ] The Nailgun is based on David Wiggins' customized variant of an AR15, styled as a DeWalt Nailgun. The Nailgun's stats/base have been combined from 3 weapons: the damage is similar to the Tommy Gun , the model is similar to the M4A1 , and the spread, fire rate and magazine size are similar to the Laser Rifle and the Pulse Laser . The old firing sound effect was inherited from the Syringe Gun , used by the Medic in Team Fortress 2 , albeit higher pitched. The sound was updated in the Summer Update III to sound more like an actual Nailgun. The Nailgun uses a magazine shaped like an electric drill battery. It's magazine reads, "NAILZ". The Nailgun shoots bullets, despite being called a Nailgun. This is the signature weapon of the Joe skin . 1-74 (24-94) Gamemodes Standard Firing Mode Automatic Kill Icon Creator Valve (Archived) Bluay (Alpha) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros and Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Negev is a light machine gun manufactured by Israel Weapon Industries ( IWI for short). In-game Information [ ] The Negev comes with power in close quarters. Its ability to one-shot kill and its fast rate of power ensures that nearby enemies will get killed quickly. It also has a high magazine size, so running out of ammo is rare. However, due to drawbacks, the Negev has a very low minimum damage of 1, meaning all 100 shots have to directly hit the player. It also had terrible spread and combined with the low damage of 1, it instantly makes the weapon useless to use at long ranges. It also had a long reload time. Pros and Cons [ ] Pros: High close range damage. High magazine. Very fast fire rate. Cons: Long reload time. High spread penalty. Extremely low minimum damage of 1. Slow movement speed. Trivia [ ] This is another overseas weapon, being a NATO weapon. It is known for hunting and self-defense, plus it is the most innovative and distinguishing feature is a one-piece receiver and buttstock, made of steel-reinforced polymer. This weapon was removed in the Mega Update . Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: 1-by 1-reloading allows topping off. High body damage. One-shot kill on the head. Cons: Long empty reload time. Trivia [ ] This and the XM1014 are inspired from the same guns with the same in CS:GO . Nova was originally going to be added into the game during the development of Gun Game however it was left scrapped and later released to the archived phase of Arsenal . [ 1 ] The Nova made a re-appearance in MURDER inside the reception room in Miami . Weapon History [ ] 08/06/16: Added into the archived phase of Arsenal . 11/27/18: Removed from  Arsenal . It has a gear which doesn't appear to be used for anything. Unlike all the other shotguns, it fires nuts instead of pellets. (The nuts are still hitscan.) Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High maximum damage. More accurate than most other shotguns. Magazine-fed means quicker reloads. Cons: Slow rate of fire. Somewhat slow reload, Low magazine size. Low pellet count. Fires a random pattern instead of a fixed pattern. Tips [ ] The Nutcracker's randomized pellet/nut spread means that you cannot risk any chances at mid-range. This weapon performs best at close range where every pellet/nut is guaranteed to hit. Running with your Knife then switching back to the Nutcracker can help you close the distance quickly. If still fighting at mid-range, aiming at the upper body of your opponent will make it more likely to get a headshot. Because of the randomized spread, aiming directly for the head will make it more likely that you will miss. Aim for the opponent's chest and you will deal respectable damage. Make all of your shots count, as the Nutcracker's reload is particularly slow. It does load in the entire magazine at once, however. The Nutcracker performs well when firing at opponents below you, but will not be as handy if fighting opponents above. Trivia [ ] The Nutcracker is currently the only shotgun to fire in a random pattern. Previously, the R800 fired in a random pattern when it was released. The world model appears to be team-colored. The Nutcracker's previous firing sound was taken from the Widowmaker from Team Fortress 2 . 100 Gamemodes OddBall Firing Mode Single Special Thrown Melee Weapon Kill Icon Creator MidnightKrystal The OddBall is a futuristic ball that can be picked up in the center of most maps in the self-titled gamemode . If the user wants to get rid of it, they must throw it to another player by a simple click. Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] If a user hold the OddBall in this gamemode, they will given a marked indicator that follows their movement and slowly drains their health similar to the Vampire curse from Hackula gamemode. The debuffs will go away once they throw the OddBall to the destination. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros High damage. Infinite ammunition. Perfect accuracy. Can be thrown with RMB. Cons One player gets it per game. (sometimes a bug can happen and it may spawn 2 balls instead of 1) Players can accidentally pass it to the enemy if not careful. Slowly drains health of the player who hold it. Trivia [ ] The OddBall uses the same inspect animation as the Superball. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Origami Gun functions similarly to the G-17 , albeit with lower damage, a slower rate of fire and a smaller magazine that matches Hi-Power . The Origami Gun's biggest strengths are its high magazine size and a lack of spread. Its three-shot kill headshot capability at closer ranges means that killing enemies will not be a challenge. However, the Origami Gun's lack of spread trades for the slower rate of fire compared to its class. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast reload, as shared with the pistols of the game. Somewhat large magazine capacity. Has no spread. Cons: Slower rate of fire compared to some other pistols. Very low damage range. Tips [ ] The Origami Gun is one of the less effective Pistols in the game, due to its abyssmal damage range. It takes an average of 8 shots to completely shut down an opponent with this weapon. Just like every Pistol but especially this one, do not use the Origami Gun at long-range. Its fall-off is incredibly weak, only dealing 19 damage per shot. Treat the Origami Gun as if it is a Shotgun, as it's only just effective at close-range. This will ramp-up your damage as much as possible. 4 bodyshots or 3 headshots will kill nearby targets. Keep an eye out for opponents with much more powerful weapons, such as Automatics, Shotguns, or other Pistols. Once you start firing, you need to kill your target as soon as possible before they can fire back. This is the only way you can get a kill with the Origami Gun. Alternatively, you can switch to your Knife and attempt a melee kill or backstab to promote from the Origami Gun. If all else fails, your last resort would be to land at least 1-3 shots, and hope that a teammate finishes the job so you can promote off an assist. Trivia [ ] The Origami Gun was listed as just Origami in the DevForum post for Summer Update II . The Origami Gun is one of the joke weapons along with the Literal Gun , the Pocket Potassium , the Potassium Power , the TP Launcher , the Dispenser , and the Very Long Bat . The Origami Gun uses the same firing sounds as the Hi-Power. It is a Christmas-themed projectile weapon as its name implies, a red ornament. The weapon has 50 ammo and fast throwing speed. The unique gimmick of this weapon is the bleeding effect which deals a small amount of damage on the target over time. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast throw rate. High ammo pool. Able to make enemies bleed out. Cons: No headshot multiplier. Fires a projectile, meaning that timing is key. Projectile arches, making it harder to hit players. Trivia [ ] The weapon's functionality is similar to Wrap Assassin 's projectile from Typical Colors 2 which both are ornament that capable of bleeding the target. Critical Damage Overview Magazine Ammo 17 51 Damage 14-87 (43-109) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Counter Blox Pistols Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.2 22.401 1.8 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 2.621 1 The P250 is a 9x19mm semi-automatic pistol produced by SIG Sauer . The P250 chambered into 9x19mm was first revealed by the North American market on November 7th, 2007, and it was followed by the .45 ACP model in February of 2008. The last P250 models were released in 2009 and 2017, and production of the P250 halted as SIG Sauer moved on to the P320 . Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The P250 is the middle of the line pistol one can rotate onto, dealing a measly 14 damage on the body and 43 damage on the head at long range. In close range this weapon can 2 shot body and 1 shot head, making it very effective at close range. While its fire rate is capped, the large magazine helps to guarantee a user will not have to reload while fighting an opponent. It is not advised to use the P250 at long range, especially going for body shots as its spread penalty, recoil, and low long-range body damage means players will have trouble fighting off opponents. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage at close quarters. Quick reload. Large magazine size. High headshot damage. Cons: Low minimum body damage. High spread upon continuous shots. Somewhat capped fire-rate. Tips [ ] The P250 is a fairly easy weapon to get a kill with, as long as you stay within mid-range. At close-range, the P250 is the most deadly, as it takes a maxmimum of two shots to get a kill. It has a spread penalty that's very ineffective at longer distances, so it's important to aim for nearby targets instead. The P250 is practically weak when hitting bodyshots, so aim for the head as much as you can. Remember that it has a bit of recoil and spread, so this may be tricky. Just like the rest of the Pistols in the game, its reload speed is fast enough to reload in the middle of an intense fight. Gallery [ ] P250 in real life. Trivia [ ] Just like its counterpart in Counter-Strike: Global Offensive , the P250 has extremely low body shot damage, giving it the nickname " Swiss BB ", although this nickname is no longer in wide usage. Because of the Counter Strike series, the P250 is falsely known to be used by Counter-Terrorism organizations, in fact, they were mostly used by police. As of January 2018, the P250 was no longer found on the Sig Sauer website due to discontinuation. The P250 in Gun Game was burst fire. As well as 9x19mm Parabellum, it uses .22 Long Rifle, .380 ACP, 9×19mm Parabellum, .357 SIG, .40 S&W, and .45 ACP. 18-43 (28-50) Gamemodes Standard Counter Blox Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator dev_keni (Current) Unknown (Previous) VALVe (Archived) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The FN P90 (also known as FN Project 1990 PDWS ) is a compact personal defense weapon (officially a submachine gun) designed by Belgian manufacturer FN Herstal along with the FN Five-seven, both firearms built around the 5.7mm cartridge. It was designed in accordance with NATO's request for a compact weapon that could defeat Kevlar body armor, as the prior 9mm firearms were generally unable to penetrate such armor. Its unique attribute is its magazine. A long, flat cartidge (commonly black, sometimes orange) that slides into the top of the barrel instead at the bottom, unlike other weapons. In-game Information [ ] Current Archived The P90 's fast fire rate is effective at close-quarters and mid-distance. Its high headshot damage has the potential to kill enemies in three headshots. However, the P90 has a longer reload time than other SMGs. Unlike today's P90 in Arsenal , the old Arsenal P90 (simply known as Heavy SMG in Gun Game ) had similar damage to the Tommy Gun in today's Arsenal , albeit it had a lower body damage. The spread on the old P90 was considered very high, forcing users to mitigate closer to shred enemies. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage at close quarters. Fairly low recoil and spread. Fast fire rate. Quick movement speed. Large magazine and ammo reserve. Cons Low minimum body damage. Below average reload speed. Tips [ ] The P90 shoots quickly and is almost perfectly accurate, meaning that you can easily win most engagements with opponents before they even fire a shot. Exceptions would be any opponents with any Sniper Rifle or Shotgun, as they can potentially one-shot you before you can kill them. The P90 is viable to use from any distance , although it is most powerful at close-range. If firing from longer ranges, don't use all of your ammo at once. Shoot around 15 bullets at a time and stop for a second to reset your accuracy. You may have 50 bullets per magazine and a fast reload, but it is still best to reload constantly. The P90 uses ammo very quickly , so it's best to keep it loaded to avoid running out of ammo during intense fights. This also applies to gamemodes without the promote-on-kill mechanic such as Randomizer or Gun Rotation. Gallery [ ] A yellow Solid Color P90 in Arsenal Archived . P90 in real life. Trivia [ ] The P90 is a compact personal defense weapon (PDW) designed and manufactured by FN Herstal in Belgium. Created in response to NATO requests for a replacement for 9×19mm Parabellum firearms, the P90 was designed as a compact but powerful firearm for vehicle crews, operators of crew-served weapons, support personnel, special forces, and counter-terrorist groups. It is one of the few weapons in Arsenal Archived that was taken from CBRO . During the time it was re-released, the P90 had the appearance of the MP5K in third person. The P90's kill icon also had the MP5K's. It is the signature weapon of the Ace Pilot, Cait, Cyber Defence Unit, Holiday Pilot, Rookie and Reindeer skins. When it was re-released, it had a magazine of 20 rounds. This was changed to 50 prior to the Community-Ops Update . The firing, and reload sound effects may have been taken from a video titled pee-9-tee made by a small gun animating YouTube channel called MintiMintness. The model in-game is based on the TR variant. The Paintball Gun was inspired by ROBLOX 's BrickBattle Paintball Gun . In-game Information [ ] In-game, the Paintball Gun has a fast fire rate and infinite ammo, but has the low magazine capacity of 20. The Paintball Gun can almost instantly kill an enemy with its fast fire rate to make it easier for several people. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast fire rate. Has no spread. Infinite ammo. High damage. Quick projectile speed. Cons: Slow, delayed reload. No headshot multiplier. Projectile arch makes it harder to hit enemies at further ranges. Low magazine capacity of 20. Magazine is easily expelled due to its fast rate of fire. Trivia [ ] The animation finishes seconds before the actual reloading This weapon was listed in the DevForum post for the Summer Update II , but it was not in-game until the following day. This is the signature weapon for the Paintballer, replacing the Mossberg 500 . The model of the weapon is modeled after ROBLOX's Brickbattle Paintball Gun. When the paintball gun is shot at a window, it will result in a paint splatter instead of the window shattering. Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History 8 Sources General Information [ ] This weapon performs similarly to the Windicator due to its behavior. However, it additionally makes tracer shots when fired. The Pathbringer holds 6 futuristic bullets with 24 ammo in reserve; these bullets create a Tracer Shot which is a problem because the Tracer Shot always gives away your position at far ranges. The Pathbringer's damage is the exact same as the Windicator's body and headshot damage with its fall-off . Its reload time is fast, and the fire-rate is also fast compared to the Windicator. However, the Pathbringer's reload time and the fire rate are a little slower than these Windicator's behaviors. Even though when the users spam with this weapon, the spread continues to lack with its fire-rate. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Fast rate of fire. Quick reload. Cons: Small 6-round magazine capacity. High spread upon continuous shots. Tracer shot can give away the user's position. Tips [ ] The most dominant trait of the Pathbringer is its terrible ccuracy. Only its first two shots are accurate enough to hit opponents from mid-range. This weapon is most effective at close-range where it can ramp-up its damage to one-shot opponents. Space out your shots to slow down the spread from getting too high. The Pathbringer will dominate against weaker Projectile weapons, but will lose against Shotguns and Automatics if you get too close. This weapon reloads fast, but not fast enough to survive an intense fight. Gallery [ ] Trivia [ ] The weapon was leaked in one of mightybaseplate's Twitch streams. [ 1 ] It is modeled after a fictional weapon created by Alex Andreu in 3dsmax . This, along with the Z80 , the BH10 and the Pulse Musket do not use the Evaporate kill effect by default. If the player's FOV is set to about 110 or above, you can see the speed loader just floating next to the model in the inspect animation. This problem is shared with the Python . 45-75 (150-225) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Wild West Pistols Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Arcade All Weapons Hackula Hard Mode Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Single-action Special Fan-fire Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Revenant3D (Current) Unknown (Previous) Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.8 0.6 21.28 1.03 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 2.621 1.2 The Peacemaker (better known as the Colt Single Action Army ), is an American made revolver designed by William Mason and Charles Brinckerhoff Richards, and produced by Colt Firearms. It was made for the U.S. Government service revolver trials of 1872 by Colt's Patent Firearms Manufacturing Company (Colt Manufacturing Company), and was made the standard issue revolver for the U.S. Military until 1982. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Peacemaker will always instant kill upon a shot to the head at any range, and will do a minimum of 45 damage even upon hitting a target's body at longer distances. Be mindful of its low ammo pool; as the Peacemaker is gate loaded, players will have to individually load every round. If all of its ammunition is expended, the impending reload will be punishingly slow. The Peacemaker shares a unique ability along with the Peppergun , being able to rapid-fire with the use of the right mouse button (RMB). In this state, the Peacemaker will rapidly fire off all six shots, albeit with a markedly increased spread penalty. It's best to use the fan-fire ability of this weapon in close range as the primary fire-rate of the weapon is relatively slow which makes it less suitable for close-quarters combat. It is also suggested to use the single-shot mode at longer ranges. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Fan-fire ability. 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. Decent accuracy compared to other pistols on single shots. Fast rate of fire upon fan-firing. Cons: High spread penalty upon fan-firing. Slow primary rate of fire. Sluggish empty reload time for a revolver. High recoil when fan-firing. High ammo consumption when fan-firing. Tips [ ] The Peacemaker's most infamous trait is its recoil. This makes it hard to aim, especially during intense fights. Try to space out your shots. This will allow the recoil to wear off, giving you cleaner shots. The best strategy with the Peacemaker is to use its fan-fire ability at close-range, and fire single shots and mid-range. If you successfully fan-fire at an opponent but fail to kill them, reload one bullet and finish them off. Using single shots at close-range will make you quickly lose intense fights. If all else fails, try landing one shot on an opponent. A minimum of 45 damage is enough for a teammate to give you an assist. If you're coming to Arsenal as a Typical Colors 2 player, you might recognize that the Peacemaker is similar to the Quick Draw used by the Agent. However, take note: The Quick Draw's "doubled fire-rate" ability is manually used by the Peacemaker. Simply right-click to do so. Just like the Quick Draw, the Peacemaker's fan-fired shots are very inaccurate. Only use them at the correct time, which is at close-range. Gallery [ ] In third person. Peacemaker in real life. Trivia [ ] The Peacemaker is more accurately known as the Colt Single Action Army , a single-action revolver that holds six cartridges. Currently, it is still being sold and manufactured to this day as its 3rd iteration. Fan-firing/fanning is a shooting technique used with revolvers: a user holds down the trigger of their firearm, and rapidly hits the hammer repeatedly, allowing for the rapid-fire of single-action revolvers. It is the signature weapon of the Desperado, Handsome Hoss, Garbage Handler and Scrooge skins. The Peacemaker along with the Rocket Launcher , the Barrett , the G-17 , the AUG , the XR15 , the Trench Gun , and the DB Shotgun are the only primary weapons that appear in the Arcade gamemode. The name "Peacemaker" comes from the fact that it was used by law enforcement during the mid 19th century. This gun is used for getting the badge, "The New Bebop" which is to get a peacemaker kill with the Handsome Hoss Character. The model for this gun was used for the Quick Draw in Typical Colors 2 . The Quick Draw also functions the same as the Peacemaker, except its fan-fire ability only can be used after dealing enough damage (and fan-fired shots dealt more damage than normal).
