58-97 (81-121) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Pistols Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hard Mode Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Single-Action Automatic (Upon Fan-Firing) Special Fan-fire Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.8 0.6 21.28 1.03 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 2.621 1.2 The Peppergun , also known as the Pepperbox revolver. It is a type of weapon used in the 1820s-40s, until the introduction of the more modern revolver design by Samuel Colt. There are many variants of the Pepperbox in real life, but the in-game model is either based on the Lefaucheux or the Victor Collete Pepperbox. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] Similar in the gameplay to the Peacemaker with its 6 shots, fan-fire ability, and gate-loading, the Peppergun seems to be a much more body shot oriented revolver. The Peppergun is also one of the most common revolvers in the game. Unlike the Peacemaker, the Peppergun cannot instantly kill with a headshot. However, the its fall-off allows it to deal more damage in closer ranges to the point where it can one-shot enemies if a player gets close enough. It is a guaranteed two-shot kill otherwise. Thanks to its gate-loading nature, the Peppergun shares a slow reload time with the Peacemaker , although it gives players the benefit of being able to reload as they fire. Right-clicking allows players to fan-fire, allowing the Peppergun to shoot in a pseudo fast way that surpasses the speed of its cousin, the Peacemaker. However this is quite dangerous, even more than it's counterpart, as it increases the Peppergun's spread quite significantly, and rapidly dispenses all 6 rounds from every barrel quickly. This can kill at closer ranges before opponents have time to react. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Will one-shot in extremely close quarters. Extremely fast fan-firing rate. 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. Low spread upon primary firing. Cons: Only single-action revolver without a one-shot kill headshot ability at longer ranges. High spread penalty upon fan-firing. Low first-shot accuracy upon fan-firing. Magazine is easily expended upon fan-firing. Slow empty reload time. Slow primary rate of fire. Tips [ ] The Peppergun is a very questionable weapon. It can kill opponents in two shots, but its accuracy will make it very difficult to pull this off. Unlike the other Pistols, the Peppergun's accuracy limits its effective distance to only close-range. The Peppergun's fan-fire is very fast, taking only one second to shoot out all of its bullets. Use this when pouncing on an enemy so you can quickly kill them without getting hit. The first two shots are more accurate than the rest, and it deals enough damage to two-shot opponents. The best strategy to kill with the Peppergun is to fan-fire at an opponent from close-range. If you land several bullets but fail to kill your opponent, reload one bullet and primary-fire it to finish them off. This depends on your aim. Its accuracy when fan-firing gets very high. If you're not close enough to your target, most of your bullets will miss. An alternative way to finish an opponent off is to use hit them with your Knife , but only if your fan-fire hit them at least once. Gallery [ ] In third person. Peppergun in real life. Trivia [ ] Player characters in-game do not actually make any motions with their hand to cock the hammer after every shot, only raising it upwards and somehow managing to re-cock it. Due to control differences, mobile users could not fan-fire the gun before May 16, 2020. The audio of the Peppergun is commonly used in other ROBLOX games that feature guns. 24-70 (120-210) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator nettimato Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.2 17.92 3.25 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 2.184 1.25 Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Peppermint Rifle is a semi-automatic rifle with a team-coloured candy cane striped stock and a large tin of " Ye Olde English Peppermints " acting as a magazine. The iron sights have been moved off-center to the user side of the weapon to prevent the bolt handle from obscuring the view. In-Game Information [ ] The Peppermint Rifle is somewhat similar to the M1A1 Carbine , having the same slow movement speed, along with bigger magazines and faster reload. However, the Peppermint Rifle is slightly weaker, with its damage range only being 24-70 damage. A headshot will still one-shot an opponent. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage to the head. Rather quick reload time. Low recoil. Fast fire rate. Cons: High spread. Slow movement speed. Takes 4 or 5 shots to kill a target at further ranges. Tips [ ] Unlike the other Marksman Rifles, the Peppermint Rifle is terrible at long-range. Even if you manage to land a shot, it will at deal 24 damage at the least. Headshots will still insta-kill from any distance, although this can be rather risky. The Peppermint Rifle excels at closer-ranged combat, especially with its ability to fire shots very quickly. At this distance, it will take 2-3 shots to get a kill. As with every Marksman Rifle, especially the Peppermint Rifle's spread gets higher the more you shoot. If you're fighting at mid-range, be mindful of this. While it does have a fast reload, it takes about 3 seconds to do so. This won't help during an intense fight with an opponent. Run and take cover while reloading, then jump back into the fight. This will guarantee your survival. Gallery [ ] Workshop submission with a non-event alternative for the model. Trivia [ ] The Walther M1918 Model I prototype submachine gun was the inspiration for the weapon model, although much of the mesh had to be improvised due to general lack of reference images for such an obscure weapon. Originally, the Peppermint Rifle was supposed to be called " Pea Shooter ", had a green wooden stock and had a can of peas in place of the magazine. As the Arsenal Workshop re-opened for Christmas-themed submissions, the model was repurposed to meet the submission requirements. The original model was included in the same submission with the event version as a post-event alternative. The Peppermint Rifle's model was made by a Discord user and MAD STUDIO developer, nettimato, who also created the G11 , the Calico , the STEN , the TOZ-106 , the Dual Shotguns , the Focus and the Stake Launcher models. The Peppermint Rifle's old firing sound was taken from the M1A1 carbine in Day of Infamy, same with the M1A1 Carbine and M1A1 Paratrooper in-game. 14-70 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectile Party Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Special Fall-off Speed Boost Projectile Arch Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The PIZZA is a weapon in Arsenal that was added in the Halloween Update . This weapon can be used to throw pizza at enemies or to gain a temporary speed boost. The PIZZA deals little damage per hit; however, its ramp-up makes up for this, with a 2-hit kill at close ranges. It also has a very fast reload speed and fire rate. When right-clicking, the player will grab a pizza slice from the box and eat it, gaining a speed boost that only lasts for 10 seconds. This action consumes 1 ammo per use. The PIZZA has a pizza slice or "magazine" of 8 ammo with 40 reserved. When reloading, the user will throw the pizza box away and equip a new one. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Eating a pizza slice (by right-clicking) gives a 10 second speed boost. Extremely quick reload. Fast fire rate. Fall-off allows for high damage at extremely close ranges. Cons: Heavily affected by gravity. Low damage in mid and long ranges. High ammo consumption. No headshot multiplier. Small ammo capacity. Speed boost immediately stops upon kill or death. Tips [ ] The PIZZA's biggest strength is the speed boost. After eating a pizza slice, the user becomes twice as fast, the same speed as someone using the Golden Knife . Use the speed boost to get around faster, especially if the current map is large in size. The speed boost also makes you hard to hit. Move more unpredictably to make the most of this. Getting a backstab with your Knife becomes a lot easier while under a speed boost. Make sure to aim higher than you normally would when using the PIZZA. Being a projectile weapon, the slices are heavily affected by gravity. The PIZZA has rewarding ramped-up damage, but has very weak fall-off damage, too. Try to confront enemies at close-range to quickly get a kill with this weapon. If you eat a pizza slice for that speed boost, you can quickly approach enemies to ramp-up your damage. Trivia [ ] This is the only weapon with the special ability to grant a player with a speed boost, faster than using a melee. When inspecting the PIZZA, there are only 5 pizzas in the box instead of the 8 pizzas implied by the magazine size. While inspecting the PIZZA and using its ability, it makes an old ROBLOX sound " Pizza! ", which came from the pizza gear . The pizza box is a reference to Builder Brothers Pizza , the fictional company in Work at a Pizza Place . It is the signature weapon of the Pizza Boy skin. The pizza also appears in Arsenal Archived as a heal pack. 45-48 (60 on direct hit) 11 (self-damage) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Juggernaut All Weapons Projectiles Party Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Burst Fire Projectile Special Splash Damage Rocket Jump Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Plasma Launcher is a futuristic burst-fire weapon. The Plasma Launcher fires a burst of three plasma balls, each of which explode on contact with a surface, dealing damage in a huge splash radius. Like many explosive weapons, it is possible to rocket jump with the Plasma Launcher, but this will lead to some self-damage. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Infinite ammo. Burst fires quickly. High damage. Cons: Long burst delay between each burst-fire. Poor blast radius compared to other explosive weapons. No one-shot capability for an explosive weapon. Users can easily kill themselves in close quarters if not careful. Slow travel speed, very easy to dodge it. Trivia [ ] When the July 4th update first released, the Plasma Launcher used to fire 20 damage pellets at a faster rate, similar to the Slingshot but without a projectile arch and was able to rocket jump. This weapon along with the R800 , the Spellbook and the Z80 are the only non-Brickbattle weapons in Arsenal that have an infinite magazine and ammo. This is the only explosive weapon that doesn't launch players. This and the M16A2 are the only 3-round burst weapons in the game. The Plasma Launcher is the only weapon with two kill effects when killing a player. Those are Evaporate and Gib. The Scientist and Professor skins have this as their signature weapon. The weapon has a noticeably slower movement speed than the knife, despite the fact that the majority of the weapon is floating, while the only thing touching the user is the wristwatch controlling the plasma-arcs. 225-300 33 (self-damage) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Hard Mode Firing Mode Single-fire Special Splash Damage Rocket Jump Kill Icon Creator MidnightKrystal Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Pocket Potassium is a joke weapon that is a banana that shoots explosive bananas. Its explosion is a yellow banana color In-game Information [ ] In-game, its ability to one-shot kill upon a splash or a direct hit makes it easy to kill enemies. However, it only carries one round in a magazine. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: One-shot kill upon a splash or direct hit. Capable of rocket jumping . Explosive area-of-effect capability allows for multiple kills. Cons: Only carries one round. Moderately slow reload. Slow projectile speed, so timing is key. Somewhat high self-damage upon rocket jumping. Users can easily kill themselves if not careful. Tips [ ] The Pocket Potassium is naturally deadly to foes, but only with the right strategy. Because of its tiny magazine size and slow reload, missing a shot will allow opponents to capitalize. The best strategy with the Pocket Potassium is to blast jump with it and land on a high platform on the current map. Then, once it's reloaded, you can fire at opponents on the ground below. The reload is not fast enough to shoot in mid-air, so it's important to find a high platform after blast jumping. If possible, try killing two or more opponents that are close together so you can promote to the next weapon multiple times. Gallery [ ] Early Development. Trivia [ ] Pocket Potassium was revealed in the Arsenal Discord . The Pocket Potassium was listed as Banana Gun in the DevForum for the Summer Update II . This along with the RPG , the Bow , the Musket , the M16A2 's grenade launcher, the M79 and the Golden Gun are the only weapons in the game to carry a single round. The Pocket Potassium acts similar to the Banana Gun from the Super Smash Bros. series. The Pocket Potassium is one of the joke weapons along with the Literal Gun , the TP Launcher , the Potassium Power , the Origami Gun , the Dispenser , and the Very Long Bat . 24 (27) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Potassium Power is a fictional, comedic variant of the AK-74 . It reloads from a literal banana magazine, which can be clearly seen upon inspecting the weapon. In-game Information [ ] The Potassium Power is much more different compared to its AK cousins: It fires at a greater speed, does less damage per shot, and has a halved magazine size of 15 rounds, the lowest in its class. As long as players can deal with its low magazine size, the weapon can easily kill enemies within close range and is capable of longer-range fire when burst-firing it. Intrinsic due to the weapon's high rate of fire and small magazine, the Potassium Power will need to be reloaded if the players are unable to kill an opponent with their first. Reloads can be a detriment and potentially lead to death, as the reload speed is rather slow in comparison to other weapons of such magazine size and fire rate. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Quick rate of fire. Quick TTK (time to kill) in close quarters. Good damage for its class. Fairly fast reload. Cons: Low magazine size. Severe recoil upon continuous firing. High spread penalty upon continuous firing. High ammo consumption. Tips [ ] The Potassium Power's biggest weakness is its low magazine size. During the middle of a fight, it can run out of ammo at the worst time. To play it safe and secure the kill, only use this weapon at close-range. At this distance, your damage is maxed out through ramp-up, and more shots are likely to land. If you're stuck at mid-range and unable to approach closer, try burst-firing instead. Only shoot a few bullets at a time and then stop for a second. This will keep your accuracy, even from a distance. Your best strategy with the Potassium Power is ambushing. If you can jump off a higher platform while shooting at an unsuspecting enemy below, you can secure the kill quickly. This also works if you can predict when an opponent will turn around a corner. Gallery [ ] Potassium Power in real life as the AK. Trivia [ ] The Potassium Power is an AK that's both gold-plated and uses a banana magazine. It's a play on the AK-style curved magazines, often affectionately referred to as a banana mag. The weapon is based on hyper's literally a banana mag video. The magazine of Potassium Power is also based off the dancing banana from the Peanut Butter Jelly Time song. The reason why Potassium Power uses a banana magazine is because potassium is a nutrient found commonly in foods such as banana but more in the avocado. The Potassium Power is one of the joke weapons along with the Literal Gun , the TP Launcher , the Pocket Potassium , the Origami Gun , the Dispenser , and the Very Long Bat . The Potassium Power is the signature weapon of the Monky skin. This gun was also used to obtain the Monky skin, which can no longer be obtained. 8-33 (12-41) Gamemodes Standard Counter Blox Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Hard Mode Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Revenant3D (Current) VALVe (Archived) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The PP-19 Bizon ( Bison in English), is a 9mm submachine gun developed in 1993 by Izhmash, with its design notably lead by Victor Kalashnikov. It was built for police and counter-terrorist usage, and came into service in 1996. It features a prominent, 64-round helical magazine placed below the barrel, which offers a surprisingly high amount of rounds to be used in a very compact package. In-game Information [ ] Current Archived In-game, the PP-Bizon's fast rate of fire ensures that enemies will be shredded in a matter of seconds. The low spread and recoil helps with finishing users at longer ranges. The high ammo capacity helps with saving users time without reloading. However, the PP-Bizon has a long reload time, meaning if players run out of ammo, they would have to suffer long periods of time. The low damage can also be a pain at a whopping 8, although going closer and the fast rate of fire makes up for it. The PP-Bizon was in the archived version of Arsenal before it was eventually removed later around late 2017. It had a high ammo compacity but low damage and high spread. This wasn't really shamed though, and it was relatively easy to get off of. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High ammo capacity of 64. Low spread. Fast rate of fire. Good damage in close quarters. Has no recoil. Cons: Long reload time of 4 seconds. Very low minimum damage of 8 on the body and 12 on the head. Tips [ ] The PP-Bizon is a tricky weapon to use. It has a large magazine size and fast firing speed, but each bullet deals very small damage. This is why it is especially important to aim for the head, as headshots deal respectable damage. You can ramp-up the PP-Bizon's damage and kill enemies quicker by fighting at close-range. Try using the Knife to close the distance, and then switch back to the PP-Bizon. The PP-Bizon has one of the longest reloads among the SMGs, so it's important to get a kill within the first magazine. The slow reload leaves you as an easy target to your opponents, so be careful. Gallery [ ] Inspect PP-Bizon in real life. Trivia [ ] This weapon used to be in a deleted ROLVe game called Counter Blox: Roblox Offensive , but in Counter Blox , This weapon was supposed to be added in the game, but was replaced by the Thompson (or Tommy Gun). The PP-Bizon shares the same ammo with the Makarov , the 9x18mm Makarov round. The PP-Bizon shares 60% of the parts from AK-74 . The PP-Bizon's magazine, often mistaken for a grenade launcher, is made from a durable glass-reinforced polyamide and mounts under the handguard in line with the barrel, which makes the weapon more compact and concealable. All cartridges are aligned nose forward in the Bizon magazine and cannot be loaded incorrectly. The magazine and grip colour fragment resembles the Bullfrog Gun in Call of Duty Black Ops: Cold War . 16-34 (32-40) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Revenant3D (Upcoming) Unknown (Current) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Gallery 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The PPSh-41 is a Soviet SMG . It feeds from a 71-round drum magazine and fires a 7.62x25mm Tokarev pistol round. In-Game Information [ ] The PPSH was added in the game on as part of the September Update . When it was first released, the PPSH had pistol inspect animations, a magazine of only 30, the MAC-10 in the viewport model, and had the firing sound of the Uzi and the MAC . It also had no reloading sound along with very high spread. It wasn't shown in the 2.9.9 update log and was removed the next day due to it being unfinished and messy. After some fixes, the PPSH was re-added in the first Halloween Update to the praise of the community. The PPSH functions similar to the Tommy Gun , with both guns having high magazine capacity and low minimum damage. However, unlike the Tommy Gun, it has low spread. Because of the high fire-rate and low spread, it is useful at almost all ranges. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High maximum damage. Fast rate of fire. Fast reload. Largest magazine size in-class. Fairly low spread. Highest total ammo in-class. Cons: Low minimum damage. Trivia [ ] It's the third weapon in Arsenal to fire from a drum magazine. The PPSH is commonly known as the " papasha ", a Russian word meaning " daddy ." Its formal name is the " pistolet-pulemyot Shpagina ", transcribed in English as the Shpagin machine pistol . This gun was designed by Georgy Shpagin in 1941, and is still present in countries such as Syria and Albania. The PPSH was more commonly used with stick magazines rather than the more iconic drum magazine, as the manufacturing meant drum magazines were not interchangeable. Stick magazines proved both easier to reload and cheaper/easier to manufacture, and as such they superseded the drum magazines. When it was first released, the PPSH used to have the pistols ' inspect and reload animations. Gallery [ ] Weapon development. Render of the upcoming PPSH model. PPSH in real life. 60 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectile Party Insane Mode Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Special Projectile Arch Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Presents are a weapon added in Christmas Update . It behaves similar to the Superball , but unlike the Superball, it has limited ammo and is less bouncy when it hits a surface. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. High ammo pool. No reloading required. Cons: Slow throwing speed. Fires a projectile, meaning that timing is key. Projectile arches, making it harder to hit enemies at further ranges. No headshot multiplier. Trivia [ ] The Presents appear to be similar to the Gift For You taunt's present. The weapon is currently disfigured. 27-90 (37-112) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.15 22.401 1.9 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 1.31 1 The PRISMAS is a double-barreled, semi-automatic M1911 derivatives of Italian origin. They are based on the Arsenal Firearms AF2011A1 Dueller Prismatic pistol. The AF2011-A1s found in-game as the PRISMAS were created to increase the .45 ACP's power for a lower cost. The magazines, hammers, triggers, and barrels are connected together (although they are still separate) to allow the weapon to fire both barrels with one trigger pull. It can be chambered in both .45 ACP and .38 Super. They were created to celebrate the 100-year anniversary of the M1911s. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] In-game, this weapon can be tap fired. This deals 27 damage at the end of its damage-drop off, and deals high damage at close ranges. However, when this is fired repeatedly, the spread increases. The PRISMAS has a high 16 magazine with 8 cartridges in each gun and it has a decent reload, unlike the Dual Volcanics which has a lengthy 1-by-1 reload. However, with a low damage of 27, it gives players who put in the effort of headshotting. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High Headshot damage. Fast rate of fire. Big magazine size. Relatively low spread. Cons: Low damage at long ranges. Moderately slow reload. Tips [ ] The PRISMAS are practically easy to get a kill with, due to its good damage and fast firing rate. It especially dominates at intense fights because of its ramped-up damage is powerful enough to quickly two-shot opponents at close-range. The PRISMAS are less effective at long range, but are still viable due to its low spread. It can reload fast, but it's slower than most of the other Pistols in the game (because there's two guns to reload). Make sure you're not in the middle of an intense fight while reloading! Trivia [ ] This is one of the weapons that are dual-wielded. The others are the Dual Volcanics , the Micro Uzis , the Dual Shotguns , and the Dual LCRs . In the Starter Pack icon, The One skin can be seen holding the PRISMAS. And its also his signature weapon. The PRISMAS and the Dual Volcanics make the same firing sound, although the PRISMAS does not have the lever-action cocking sound. Gallery [ ] PRISMAS in real life. 12 (15-110) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Laser Tag Legacy Competitive All Weapons Dundertale Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Automatic Special Tracer Shot Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Pulse Laser , formerly called the Laser Rifle , is an automatic rifle that as the name implies, fires lasers. As such, the Pulse Laser is a fictional weapon. In-game Information [ ] The Pulse Laser has extremely low damage, but its extremely fast fire-rate somewhat makes up for this. The Pulse Laser has the fastest fire-rate in the game. It also has no spread and no recoil. Despite the Pulse Laser having the fastest fire-rate of all weapons in Arsenal , it has two major drawbacks. One is its very low damage, and even if a player lands their hits, enemies may have the chance to kill them first because of its severely low damage. Second of all, the Pulse Laser has a lengthy reload, causing players to suffer if they do not kill their opponents quickly. Combined with the fast fire-rate, the magazine is easily expended and players will have to suffer from lengthy reloads. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Very fast fire-rate. Has no spread and recoil. Above-average magazine size for its class. Decent reload time Cons: High ammo consumption rate. Tracer shot can give away the user's position. Can cause lag when spammed due to Tracer Shot. Low damage per shot. Slow movement speed for its class. Magazine size is easily expended due to its fire rate. Tips [ ] The Pulse Laser is very deadly, as it fires very quickly and accurately. However, its low damage and slow reload will make you a sitting duck if you miss your shots. The Pulse Laser's reload speed is 2.5 seconds, too slow to let you reload in an intense fight without dying. You may be able to kill opponents fast, but missing a few shots won't secure you the kill. It's especially important to keep your aim steady with the Laser Rifle. Stay at mid-range as much as possible, as this is your most advantageous distance against opponents. The Pulse Laser can potentially snipe someone from long-range, you're more likely to miss if you don't keep your aim constant on your target. At close-range it's even worse, as you'll have to track your opponent if they start hopping around you, which will waste a huge amount of ammo. At mid-range, you can easily aim at your target without moving your aim too much. The Pulse Laser has very noticeable tracer shots, so beware of any players using them to find your location. Gallery [ ] Pulse Laser as a Nerf gun. Trivia [ ] Despite the weapon appearing to have two barrels that can fire lasers, only the top barrel is usable. The weapon is reloaded from two power cells loaded into the back of the weapon, which appears to have some sort of energy source within. In a different case, though, the Nerf gun version of the Pulse Laser appears to have a magazine as a reload function, unlike its original function in the game. Pulse Laser has the fastest fire-rate in the game, surpassing both the Micro Uzis and Nailgun . The Pulse Laser shared the same reloading as the DBS , DB Shotgun and Lever Shotgun . However, all the sounds mentioned above have different pitches. The weapon model is based on the Soviet DP-64 45mm handheld Grenade launcher designed in 1989. The only differences are the material of the barrels and the detachable double uranium cores. Similarly, the Baseball Launcher is also based on a Soviet weapon, the TKB-0249 grenade launcher. The Pulse Laser is the signature weapon of GOC Future, R01-V3, Trooper and Dart Warrior skins . This weapon is the only weapon used in the Dundertale quest. This, the Focus , the Handcannon , the Laser Rifle , the R800 , and the Railgun are the only weapons that use the Evaporate kill effect regardless of what kill effect the player has equipped. The Pulse Laser was originally called the Laser Rifle . On April 13, 2021, toy company Hasbro has announced their official partnership with ROBLOX and released a Nerf blaster based on the Pulse Laser. The package contains a code that could be used to give out a back accessory item called, Arsenal: Pulse Laser . The Pulse Laser makes an appearance in the RPG Event as the weapon used by the Air Unit enemy. 300 (375) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Laser Tag Legacy Competitive Headshots Only Hard Mode Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Single-fire Special ADS Tracer Shot Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 The Pulse Musket is a futuristic weapon in Arsenal . It is a futuristic variation of the original Musket , being similar to it due to it's damage, but the Pulse Musket has the quickest reload time and can hold 3 bullets in a magazine. It is considerably the futuristic weapon with the highest damage dealt which is 300 (body-shot) and 375 (headshot). Plus, it has an accessible sight to aim at the opponent at long ranges which makes it easier to kill. The Pulse Musket's weaknesses are the slow rate of fire; in which players will have to wait a somewhat long time to fire again, and the Tracer Shot may give away it's position. It also has a unique reload where a mechanical arm on the side of the weapon grabs directly from the ammo reserve and loads it into the barrel. Contents 1 Pros & Cons 2 Tips 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Quick reload. One shot kill for both bodyshots and headshots. Accessible sight allows for far ranges kills, upon a right-click. No spread and recoil. Cons: Slow rate of fire. Tracer shot can give away shooter's location. Very low mag size. Tips [ ] The Pulse Musket is effective from any distance, as it deals a flat damage of 300, no matter how far you shoot from. It is recommended that you only scope in if shooting from long-range, and shoot without scoping within close- or mid-range. The Pulse Musket's fast reload will help you during intense fights, as you only need one shot loaded in to get a kill. The Pulse Musket wins against Pistols, SMGs, and Automatic Rifles. However, it rivals other Sniper Rifles, Shotguns, Marksman Rifles, and some SMGs. It depends on who lands their shot first. Gallery [ ] ADS (Blue). ADS (Red). ADS (Yellow). ADS (Green). Sketch. Stage one development. Stage two. Stage three. Stage four. Stage five. Stage six. Stage seven. Stage eight. Stage nine. Stage ten. Stage eleven. Weapon render. EMIRPERIF showcasing his Blender theme. Trivia [ ] The Pulse Musket was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on July 29th, 2020. The Pulse Musket's reload animation is based on the AR2 rifle and the Pulse SMG from the Half Life franchise. The Pulse Musket is one of the weapons that has access to ADS. The others are the MK18 , the Falkor , the DBS , the Vector , the M14 EBR , and the DB Chauchat . This, along with the Pathbringer , the Z80 , and the BH10 do not use the Evaporate kill effect by default. This is the signature weapon of the Astronut, Allocator, Cephalokin Recon and Corporate Exec skins . The Pulse Musket is one of the weapons that reloads its own ammo instead of the user. The other is the Minifigure . Per Pellet 11 Pellets Per Shot 10 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Typical Colors Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Pump-Action Special Fall-off HUD Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Pump Shotgun is a pump-action shotgun, resembling that of a Remington 870 with a sawed-off barrel and stock. In-game Information [ ] The Pump Shotgun's average damage per pellet allows for a quick kill at point-blank range. It also shares a one-by-one reload alongside other shotguns, granting the user the ability to fire the weapon whilst reloading. The Pump Shotgun's middling spread and slow rate of fire makes taking an enemy at range a chore. The weapon's minute ammunition capacity and sluggish reload speed makes it essential to only focus a single target. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Above average damage per pellet. One-by-one reloading allows topping off within a conflict. Cons: Slow empty reload cycle. Slow reload cycle. Slow rate of fire. Low ammo capacity. High pellet spread. Tips [ ] The Pump Shotgun's most noticeable con is its high pellet spread. Unlike most of the other Shotgun-class weapons, this means you would need to get closer to enemies than fighting at mid-range. Try not to shoot at opponents who are on a higher or lower platform than you. The Pump Shotgun will be easier to get a kill with if you fight someone on the same height level. If you're coming to Arsenal as a Typical Colors 2 player, use the Pump Shotgun exactly as you would the stock Shotgun from TC2, as they have the exact same stats. Do beware that the Pump Shotgun's bullet spread is slightly worse than in TC2 , so you will need to find ways to compensate. Trivia [ ] A pump-action shotgun is a class of shotguns that are distinguished in the way in which spent shells are extracted and fresh ones are chambered. A pump-action or slide-action firearm is one in which a forend can be moved forward and backward in order to eject a spent round of ammunition and to chamber a fresh one. The first slide-action patent was issued to Alexander Bain of Britain in 1854. The weapon was mistakenly referred to as the Trench Gun in the DevForum post for the 2.3 Update . The Pump Shotgun's model, animations, and (formerly) sound effects are all ported straight from Typical Colors 2 , where it is used by the Trooper , Arsonist , Brute , and Mechanic classes. This is one of the few guns that uses a generic name opposed to the actual weapon's name. 66-178 (267-534) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Monkey Business Firing Mode Double-action Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 sec 0.6 22.401 studs/s 2.7 sec INITIAL SPREAD 0 The Colt Python is an American .357 Magnum caliber revolver manufactured by Colt's Manufacturing Company of Hartford, Connecticut. It was first introduced in 1955, the same year as Smith & Wesson's M29 .44 Magnum . The Colt Python is intended for the premium revolver market segment. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Python is a fully black colored firearm. As with every revolver in Arsenal , it stores 6 bullets at a time and has an ammo reserve of 24. It also deals hefty damage, insta-killing opponents if nearby or upon headshot. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. No spread. Minimal recoil. One-shot on the head and close ranges. Cons: Small 6-round magazine size. Slow firing rate. Somewhat long reload. Tips [ ] Because of its perfect accuracy, the Python is great from long-range, where it will be easy for you to get kills, but harder for your targets to fight back. However, from long-range, you will need two carefully placed shots to get a kill, due to the weak fall-off damage. The Python is also a monster at intense fights, as landing a shot on the head or if the opponent is near is an instant kill. Be sure to get that kill before running out of bullets, because the Python's reload speed leaves you wide open in intense fights. Trivia [ ] Before being added as a weapon, a silhouette of the Python appeared in the voting icon for the Wild West gamemode . The speedloader is still visible on the player's arm if they turn their FOV to 110 or above on settings. This weapon shares this issue with the Pathbringer . This reuses the Electric Revolver 's animations. You can also see that the "spent rounds" inside of the Python's cylinder still have bullets inside them whilst reloading it. This issue is also present on the Webley 's reload as well. This weapon uses the same model as the Python in MURDER , just untextured. It was first introduced in 1955, the same year as Smith & Wesson's M29 .44 Magnum . The Colt Python is intended for the premium revolver market segment. In-game Information [ ] The Colt Python is the default gun for all sheriffs. Like all guns in MURDER , the revolver only has one bullet and an indefinite ammo capacity. Upon a hit, it will instantly kill the murderer. It can also be crafted once the player has collected five loot. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Instantly kills a player upon a hit. Able to crafted after obtaining five loot. Infinite ammo capacity. Cons: Only one round in the chamber. Kills the user if shot at an innocent. Per Pellet 10-30 (11-34) Pellets Per Shot 9 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Laser Tag All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Pump-Action Special Tracer Shot Fall-off HUD Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The R800 is a martian laser shotgun in Arsenal that was released in the July Update . It works similarly to the Pump Shotgun ; which has high spread, but high damage to make up for it. This gun destroys enemies in close range, so players should try to get in as close as possible when using this weapon. In longer ranges, this weapon struggles due to the extremely wide pellet spread, but lasers will still hit if aimed at the enemy's general direction, dealing 10 damage per hit, which is somewhat more than other shotguns. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High pellet damage. Infinite ammo and magazine. No reloading required. Cons: Tracer shot can give away the user's position. Can cause lag when spammed due to tracer shot. Low minimum damage per pellet. Widest pellet spread in-class. Tips [ ] The R800's infinite ammo will give you an edge over opponents in the midst of an intense fight, as you it never has to stop to reload. Even with its fast firing-rate, it's best to not spam too much. The tracer shots given from the R800's pellets will obscure your vision, even if for only a second. Spacing out your shots will allow you to miss less shots and track where your opponents are on your screen. Beware of the R800's wide spread, as it is almost useless at mid-range. You will have to be near opponents in order to deal serious damage. The easiest way to do this is to turn corners and immediately fire, where hopefully an opponent will be located. If you're coming to Arsenal as a Typical Colors 2 player, the R800 may look like Mechanic's Einsteinium that you're familiar with, but they function very differently. The Einsteinium fires a single shot that can hit enemies from any range. However , the R800 fires multiple pellets and has limited range. You will need to switch up your usual tactics when using this weapon. The R800 also does not give afterburn to targets, so your aim alone is the only way to get kills. Trivia [ ] The previous firing sound for the R800 came from the Widowmaker , a primary weapon choice for the Engineer from Team Fortress 2 . The R800 shares its model with a Typical Colors 2 weapon named the Einsteinium , a primary weapon used by the Mechanic class. This weapon, along with the Plasma Launcher , the Spellbook , the Z80 , and the Paintball Gun are the only non-Brickbattle weapons in Arsenal that have an infinite ammo pool. The R800 makes an appearance in the RPG Event as a weapon used by the "Enforcer Unit" enemy. However, the weapon acted more like the Einsteinium weapon from Typical Colors 2 , as it had the ability to deal afterburn damage to Heroes. 100 (300) Gamemodes Standard Railgun Royale Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Laser Tag All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Single-fire Special Tracer Shot Scope Piercing Shot Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] Current Rehaul The Railgun is a handheld high-velocity weapon that is extremely powerful. It will always instantly kill an enemy no matter where they are hit on the body, as it deals 100 body damage (280 on headshot). Another reason why this weapon is powerful because it is capable of shooting through enemies, granting the possibility for a collateral kill if enemies are lined up. Collateral kills are no different from the normal killing icon in the kill feed. The weapon cannot be reloaded and fires from a pool of 6 rounds, which can be refilled using ammo packs. The Railgun in the Mega Update is very similar to the Musket , in the fact that it is a one shot kill, it still used to shoot through players, holds a magazine capacity of 1, and has a very long reload after the users fired. It has an ammo reserve of 10. However, there is a key difference: it had one of the slowest movement speeds in the game. This means that the users have to hold their knife as a strategy to get anywhere on the map. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros One-shot to any part of the body across all ranges. Shoots through enemies allowing it to be able to kill multiple people at once. No reloading required. Scope allows for better magnification. Fast rate of fire for its class. Has no spread or recoil. Cons Tracer shot can give away the user's position. Low ammo pool. Sluggish movement speed. Tips [ ] The Railgun is a very good teaching tool to improve your reaction time. Since any shot that lands is an instant kill, you simply would need to keep an eye out for enemies and quickly aim in their direction. In Railgun Royale , your reaction time is put to the test, as a single missed shot or being in the wrong place is an instant death. Since the Railgun can be used from any distance, most of the time there's no need to scope in to see targets better. Only use it if your target is hard to see, such as if you are sniping someone from across the map. Beware that missing all six shots will make you lose access to the Railgun. In case it happens, consider working on your melee combat with your Knife , or your movement so you can grab nearby ammo boxes without getting hit. Trivia [ ] The Railgun is the sole weapon in the gamemode, Railgun Royale . A railgun uses electromagnetic force to launch a projectile at high speeds, using a pair of parallel conductors called "rails" on with a projectile accelerates along. This gives its name, the “Railgun”. Currently, they are only at the research stage and not seen in any handheld or military applications. The Railgun is the third semi-auto sniper in Arsenal with the Barrett and the G3SG1 . The Railgun is the signature weapon of the Digital Warrior skin. The Evaporate kill effect is used when a player is killed by the Railgun. The firing sound of the Railgun comes from the movie, Iron Man in 2008 during the Suit Up Scene. The previous model was taken from a ROBLOX gear called Halloween Ray Gun but with different textures. In rehaul, Railgun used to have a sound effect if shot through players. Railgun's damage was changed from 114 damage to 280 damage and then to 300 damage when hit headshot. 89-112 (120-150 on direct hit) 11 (23) (self-damage) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectile Party Hard Mode Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Special Rocket Jump Splash Damage Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Razor Bomb resembles the Batarang weapon that the popular DC Comics character, Batman, commonly uses. It is thrown in a forward motion, similar to how Batman throws his own Batarangs. In-game Information [ ] The player can throw this weapon at their enemies. When the razor bomb comes into contact with something, it will explode, dealing at least 89 damage to any player in its blast radius, with a 100% chance of a kill on a direct hit and at close ranges. With its superior damage and the absence of reloading, the razor bomb makes finishing off damaged players relatively easy. However, being one of the slowest projectile speeds in the game, the Razor Bomb can prove to be difficult to land a hit on far-away targets. This issue is further exacerbated by its slow fire rate, firing at a speed similar to the M40 . From long-ranges, splash damage hits will not one-shot the player and will make it harder to land a second hit since the first hit launches the enemy. As a result, long-range sniping with the Razor Bomb is not very effective, and due to its severely high damage, close-quarters fighting can easily result in suicide. Players can rocket-jump with this weapon, which deals 11 self-damage, the third-lowest in the game, behind the Lightning Cannon at 1/2 self-damage and the Concussion Rifle at 1/2 self-damage. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Can send players off the maps or into hazards using its blast force. No reloading required. Good ammo pool. Ability to Rocket Jump . Rocket Jumping only deals 11 self-damage. Cons: Users can easily kill or severely damage themselves if not careful. Slow projectile speed, so timing is key. Slow fire rate. The first splash hit will launch the enemy, making it harder to land the second hit to kill another player. Gallery [ ] Distorted model of the weapon. Trivia [ ] Razor Bomb was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on October 15, 2019. The Razor Bomb is NOT in randomizer contrary to popular belief. It got removed from it The Blade is likely based on the Razor Bats that Harry Osborn used in Spider-Man 3 . Sometimes in 3rd person view from another player, the player holding the Razor Bomb holds it incorrectly. Per Pellet 10 Pellets Per Shot 10 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Firing Mode Pump-Action Creator Revenant3D The RJL Breach is a sci-fi themed shotgun with a very fast firing rate, compared to other Shotgun-class weapons. Instead of shells, the pellets are stored in a drum magazine. Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The RJL Breach is a futuristic, shotgun released in the Galactic Assault Update of Arsenal . This weapon has a faster fire-rate compared to some of the weapons of its sort possibly due to it not being able to one-shot at close range, unlike most other shotguns. This weapon also has a high magazine capacity due to the use of a drum magazine. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High headshot damage, even in long ranges. High ammo count for a shotgun to compensate for the low damage. Faster fire rate to compensate for the low damage. Cons: Low damage. High spread upon continous firing. Tips [ ] The RJL Breach's may have a huge magazine size and fast firing rate, but beware that its pellet spread gets higher with each shot. In 7-10 shots, the spread becomes too high to be effective at mid-range. The reload is moderately fast, but not fast enough to help you in an intense fight. This weapon can potentially be used for chip damage by hitting enemies from long-range. However, you will not do respectable damage. If this is your strategy, you will have to hope that your target gets killed by a teammate, crediting you with an assist. The RJL Breach is practically an alternate version of the AA12 , where it deals slightly more damage in turn for the high pellet spread. Trivia [ ] The RJL Breach is mistakenly named RLJ Breach and RGL Breach in the DevForum post of Galactic Assault Update and the promotional material for it on Twitter. 97-130 22 (self-damage) Gamemodes Standard Typical Colors Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Juggernaut Arcade All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Rocket Jump Splash Damage Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Rocket Launcher is a projectile weapon that can hold and fire up to 4 rockets. The rockets do both splash and direct damage; 130 directly and 97 damage with splash damage. This is one of the five weapons that allow players to rocket jump , dealing 22 self-damage per jump. If players do not jump before firing this weapon at their feet, they will likely explode themselves. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Ability to rocket jump . 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. One-shot kill on direct hits. High splash damage. Cons: Long empty reload time. Users can easily kill themselves if not careful. Slow rate of fire. Slow projectile speed. Tips [ ] The Rocket Launcher is one of the most versatile weapons in the game, as it grants you both increased movement through rocket jumping, splash damage, and incredible power. The splash damage effect allows you to hit multiple opponents with one rocket. Successfully killing a group of opponents that are grouped up together will make you promote to the next weapon multiple times. This will let you make a huge gap between you and the other players on the scoreboard. A rocket deals 97 damage if it's not a direct hit. This will make it easy for a teammate to give you an assist, or even finish off weakened opponents with a single hit from your Knife . Remember that rocket jumping deals self-damage to you, which will make it easier for opponents to kill you while you're flying through the air. Rocket-jump damage alone, you can only do 4 rocket-jumps before you accidentally blow yourself up with a 5th rocket. If you blow yourself up, you get demoted. Be careful. If you're coming to Arsenal as a Typical Colors 2 player, you should note that you don't need to crouch before rocket jumping. Simply jump then shoot a rocket below you to do a rocket jump. If you try to crouch before rocket jumping, you will not go flying. Trivia [ ] The Rocket Launcher's model was taken directly from Typical Colors 2 , found in-game as the Trooper's primary weapon of choice. The model itself is based on the Rocket Launcher used by the Soldier from Team Fortress 2 as his primary weapon. Typical Colors 2's Rocket Launcher also only lets The Trooper rocket-jump 4 times before he blows himself up with a 5th. This is the signature weapon of Smiles, Soldier, and The Trooper. The design of this weapon looks to be part-M72 LAW, and part-RPG-7 with flipped grips. When the 3.3.15 update first dropped, the Rocket Launcher's overall damage was buffed. However, the buff was later shadow reverted in the Showtime! Update . The Rocket Launcher along with the Trench Gun , the Peacemaker , the AUG , the XR15 , the DB Shotgun , the Barrett , and the G-17 are the only weapons in the Arcade gamemode. 225-300 Gamemodes Standard Brickbattle Gun Rotation Randomizer Kill Confirmed Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Firing Mode Single-fire Projectile Special Rocket Jump Splash Damage Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The RPG or the Rocket Propelled Grenade is a projectile weapon that shoots a rocket which deals damage depending on how close an enemy is in its blast radius. Regardless, it can kill anyone in its blast radius with one hit, direct or splash damage. It only holds one rocket but has infinite ammo capacity. It is also possible to rocket jump with the RPG, which has a high rocket jump travel range. It deals no self-damage when rocket jumping. Though the RPG does a great deal of damage even not on direct contact, it comes with an ordeal: the reload time takes three seconds. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros One-shot kill upon direct and splash contact. Explosive area of effect capability allows for multi-kills with one shot. Ability to rocket jump. No self-damage when rocket jumping. Large area of effect range. Infinite ammo. Cons Long reload time. Holds only one shot. Slow projectile speed. Tips [ ] Because the RPG only has a magazine size of one rocket and an incredibly slow reload, be very careful on where you aim or rocket jump to. The RPG's rockets have a bigger splash damage-hitbox and instantly kills opponents caught in the explosion. If you can fire a rocket at a group of opponents, you'll promote to the next weapon multiple times. If done correctly, the RPG's rocket jump can send you flying very quickly around the map compared to other weapons that can rocket jump Trivia [ ] The term "Rocket Propelled Grenade" was actually from the Russian language РПГ or ручной противотанковый гранатомёт (transliterated as "ruchnoy protivotankovy granatomyot" ), meaning "hand-held anti-tank grenade launcher". The RPG's model is most likely inspired by the RPG-18 or the RPG-26 . This is the signature weapon of the Brickbattle, BuffBattle and Buff BrickBattle skins. The RPG was one of the weapons that were in Brickbattle , with the others being the Bomb , the Superball , the Slingshot , and the Trowel . The RPG along with the Pocket Potassium , the Bow , the Musket , the M16A2 's grenade launcher, the M79 and the Golden Gun are the only weapons in the game to carry a single round. The RPG previously had a 12 ammo capacity before being reverted to have infinite ammo. Since then, a singular "1" appears on the ammo section in-game rather than being empty like the rest of the weapons. Per Pellet 4 (24) Pellets Per Shot 8 Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Fall-off HUD Icon TBA Creator devkeni The Saiga-12 is a semi-automatic shotgun, originating from Russia. This weapon was added as a replacement of the RJL Breach . Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Saiga‑12 is a Russian-designed semi-automatic (and in some variants, fully automatic) shotgun developed in the 1990s by Kalashnikov Concern (formerly Izhmash). It uses a long-stroke gas-piston system with a rotating bolt based on the AK‑47 design, feeding from detachable box or drum magazines, and supports various gauges including 12, 20, and .410 bore. In-Game Information [ ] The Saiga-12 is practically a weaker version of the AA12 . It can hold a lot of ammo and shoots quickly, however its damage makes it one of the more weaker Shotguns in the game. Another thing to note is that its damage range has neither fall-off nor ramp-up, so it deals the same amount of damage from any distance, making both safe and risky plays both viable. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Bigger magazine. Deals flat damage, no fall-off. Reloads all of its shots at once. Initial shots have tight spread. Fast firing rate. Cons: Low bodyshot damage. Spread gets higher with consecutive shots. Tips [ ] The Saiga-12 is a special case compared to the other Shotguns, and that's due to having neither fall-off nor ramped-up damage. This means that no matter how far you are from a target, you deal the exact same amount of damage. You can shoot from a safe distance to hit the enemy with chip damage, however mind the spread. You can also still get up close to make sure more of your pellets land. While the Saiga-12 may be weak, its firing speed is its biggest strength. It fires as fast as a Pistol, so it beats other Shotguns and rivals the AA-12 in speed. This makes this weapon good at ambushing opponents and winning intense fights. Trivia [ ] Being the weapon replacement of RJL Breach , it uses its firing sound. It also uses the same reload animation as the AK-47 . Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] In-game, it functions similarly to the MS556 , although with the addition of a suppressor and a faster fire rate. The Sako 85 deals 60 damage, so it can 2-shot players to the body and will instantly kill an opponent upon a headshot. It also has a scope mounted on the weapon, which can be accessed using the RMB and the V key (scope button on Mobile). In conclusion, the Sako 85 has no major drawbacks other than its small magazine size and long reload time, however, these drawbacks are minor and should not be a major problem when it comes to using this weapon. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: One-shot kill to the head at all ranges. Suppressor reduces noise considerably. Fast firing rate for its class. Scope allows for better magnification. Perfect accuracy. Cons: Small magazine size of 6. Long reload time. Scope tracer may give away position Bolt-action Tips [ ] The Sako 85 deals a flat damage of 60, so it's both useful from long-range or defending yourself if an enemy attacks you at close-range. This means that it kills opponents with two bodyshots, or one headshot. 60 damage is enough for a teammate to get you an assist. Unlike most of the other Sniper Rifles which have a slow firing rate of 2.5 seconds, there's only a 1 second pause between shots with the Sako 85. This makes it more effective to fight opponents at close range, as you can quickly land two bodyshots to get the kill. If possible, avoid opponents who have more powerful weapons, such as Shotguns, Automatics or stronger Sniper Rifles. You may have a better chance against Pistols or Projectile weapons. Trivia [ ] The Sako 85 can fire calibers ranging from the .204 Ruger through to the .416 RM. The model this best represents is the 85 Classic Deluxe rifle. The bolting sound is taken from the weapon SSG-08 , from Counter Blox , another ROLVe game. The Sako 85 is the signature weapon of the Ghillie, Night Cap and Holiday Performer skins. The Sako 85 used to have a glitch that allowed players to fly around extremely quickly with it equipped. The Sako 85 is the 5th bolt-action sniper rifle to be added and the first sniper to have a suppressor. With the addition of the Sako, there are currently 7 suppressed weapons, with the other six being the MK18 , MP9-S , Mauser Carbine , Maxim-9 , Hush Puppy and the Vector . The Sako 85's muzzle flash does not appear at the end of the barrel and instead appears in front of the player. The Sako 85, when initially added to Arsenal , had a glitch that gave users the ability to fly (see Sako 85 Flying Incident ). The Sawed-Off is a powerful shotgun for close and mid range combat. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. High magazine tube capacity. Low recoil. 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. Cons: Slow rate of fire. Long empty reload time. Trivia [ ] According to Counter Strike wiki, the Sawed-off is based on the Remington M-870 with a shorter, 'sawed-off' barrel. The term "Sawed-Off" (also called Sawn-off in the UK and commonwealth countries) means shortening the barrel and the stock of a rifle and shotguns, making them easier to use at tight quarters. Sawed-off shotguns typically have a weapon length less than 18 inches and the shortened barrel will also give the gun a greater scatter effect if the user fires buckshot. Sawed-Off shotguns are infamously used by bank robbers because of their small size and ease of concealment. In Counter Strike: Global Offensive , while modeling a sawed-off, the name at the side of the shotgun was named " Relphington 808 " instead of " Remington 870 ". This is due to the fact that Valve wants to avoid copyright issues. SCAR-20 Current Alpha Overview Magazine Ammo 20 20 Damage 11-90 Gamemodes Standard Firing Mode Automatic Special Scope Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History General Information [ ] The SCAR-20 is a weapon created by FN Herstal/FN America in Belgium and the USA. This weapon was removed in the Mega Update . In-game Information [ ] The SCAR-20 is a powerful sniper rifle, a 1SK upon a headshot, a minimum 3SK. high magazine size, low spread and recoil, and a fast rate of fire for a sniper. Because the SCAR-20 is automatic, players that hold the trigger will experience the full-auto firing mode. However, in the name of drawbacks, if the players run out of ammo, they will have to suffer with a long reload time. Another issue with the SCAR-20 is that they only have 40 rounds in total, meaning only 2 magazines are enough to waste all ammo. Luckily, due to the high damage and low spread, players will have a low chance of struggling with these issues. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Low spread and recoil. Fast rate of fire for a sniper. High magazine size. Scope allows for better magnification. Cons: Small ammo count. Long reload time. Slow fire rate for an automatic weapon. Trivia [ ] The SCAR-20 (Also known as MK-20 SSR , which stands for " Sniper Support Rifle ") is a DMR ( Designated Marksman Rifle ) variant of the SCAR-17 , also known as SCAR-H (as seen in the current game) which it fires the same cartridge (7.62×51mm NATO) but there are some designs that are different compared to SCAR-H. It is pretty nice platform for SCAR-17 The pistol grip was shared from the M16A2 . The stock is different, as the buttplate and the cheek rest can be adjusted vertically or horizontally compared to SCAR-H's stock. 22-37 (75-168) Gamemodes Standard Counter Blox Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Legacy Competitive Firing Mode Automatic Special Scope Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Revenant3D and PrimeFIRE94 (Current) devkeni (Previous) Unknown (Second, Original) The FN SCAR ( Special Operations Forces Combat Assault Rifle ) is a fully automatic battle rifle, and is part of a duo set of weapons dubbed the SCAR-L and SCAR-H. The duo was made by FN Herstal to satisfy US SOCOM requirements, and was chosen by them as their main rifle. Despite its adoption by SOCOM, however, only the SCAR-H was acquired and conversion kits made to swap the SCAR-H from 7.62mm to 5.56mm as needed. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The SCAR-H in-game is a very powerful weapon. It feeds from a 20-round magazine (previously 30), firing with an unexpectedly fast fire-rate, comparable to assault rifles such as the M4A1 . The weapon will, at least, 5-shot kill anywhere on the body, with a potential 2-shot kill to the head. The addition of a scope, which can be accessed with right mouse button (RMB), gives the players an advantage upon use at longer distances. Therefore, this weapon is best used at close quarters and mid-range without the scope and longer ranges with the scope. However, the SCAR-H has drawbacks, which is the high spread penalty upon hip-firing and low magazine capacity with only 20 bullets. Luckily, fighting at long range will not be a problem due to the scope. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High headshot damage. Fast rate of fire. Accessible scope allows for better magnification. Fast reload. Accurate when using scope. Cons: High spread upon hip-firing when not using scope. Moderately low long-range body damage. Magazine is easily expended due to its fire-rate. Below average magazine size for its class. Tips [ ] The SCAR-H is a powerful weapon, but a tricky one at that. Its spread and small magazine size will make it more difficult to get kills. However, using the SCAR-H's scope will make your shots more accurate. The scope is best at mid- or long-range. But at close-range, it's better to not scope in so you can easily track your target while shooting. The SCAR-H is notoriously infamous for running out of ammo at the worst time: most often in the middle of an intense fight. It has a fast reload, but it's not quick enough to reload while being fired at. Due to the SCAR-H's tricky nature, you must ensure that your chosen target will be easy to kill. Opponents in an open area or are at close-range are easy pickings. If an area has a lot of obstacles obstructing your view, do not aim for any opponents there. The SCAR-H will most often win against Pistols if not reloading, so try targetting opponents that are currently holding one. Gallery [ ] Current model preview, as seen in the Arsenal Discord . Trivia [ ] The current version of the SCAR in game appears to resemble a SCAR PDW, which is a carbine variant of the SCAR rifle family. This is evident by the collapsible stock on this weapon. This is also the case with the SCAR-L. Despite receiving a new model, the worldmodel shows the previous SCAR-H model. The Previous SCAR model is the SCAR-H, a 7.62x51mm NATO rifle. It appears to be the STD (Standard) model, judging by the barrel length. The SCAR-H appears to have a PM II scope attached to it, although the actual scope actually offers a 15x magnification. This was the signature weapon of Joe until it was replaced by the Nailgun in a later update. The previous SCAR-H is the M16A1 and M4A1's old firing sound but lower pitched. SCAR-L Current Previous Archived Overview Magazine Ammo 30 90 Damage 22-37 (31-46) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Clown Infection Randomizer Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Revenant3D (Current) Unknown (Previous, Archived) The SCAR-L (simply known as the Burst Rifle in Gun Game ) is a Belgian assault rifle manufactured by FN Herstal. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The SCAR-L is a fully automatic weapon that deals average amount of damage against an enemy. The gun holds 30 rounds in the magazine and carries 90 rounds of ammo in reserve. It is best used in any ranges, since this weapon has low spread. It also has a fast fire-rate to pick off the opponent quickly. SCAR-L also had iron sights from the SCAR-H , which has been removed from the weapon itself due to having a usable scope. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast reload speed. Fast fire-rate. Low spread. High ammo capacity. High maximum damage. Cons: Low minimum damage. Tips [ ] The SCAR-L is one of the deadliest Automatic Rifles in the game. It shoots quickly, accurately, and deals a ton of damage in under a second. This weapon may have a low spread, but it's noticeably too wide at long-range. Get closer to enemies to secure a kill. The SCAR-L has distinct differences with its "cousin", the SCAR-H : The SCAR-L's magazine size is bigger by 10 bullets, so it allows more room for error. However , the SCAR-L does not have a scope, so its viable distance is only limited to at least mid-range. Gallery [ ] Current model preview, as seen in the Arsenal Discord . Trivia [ ] The model more resembles a SCAR PDW rather than a SCAR-L. This is especially prevalent when looking at the collapsible stock, as it is something that is only present in SCAR PDW models. This is also the case with the SCAR-H. The weapon's return was teased in the Arsenal Discord on May 29th, 2021. The archived model was taken as a choppy port of the Combat Rifle from Left 4 Dead 2 . The weapon's firing mode was burst-fire in Arsenal Archived . Scout Scrapped Current Alpha Pre-Alpha Overview Gamemodes Standard Firing Mode Bolt-Action Special Scope The Scharfschützengewehr 2008 (simply known as Light Sniper in Gun Game and shortly known as Steyr SSG 08 and known as the SSG 08 in Arsenal Archived ) is an Austrian bolt-action sniper rifle developed and manufactured by Steyr Mannlicher in 2008. This weapon was supposed to return in the Mega Update . However, it was scrapped as a tweet revealed. [ 1 ] Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Weapon History 6 Sources In-Game Information [ ] The Scout has similarities, compared to the M40 and MS556 with the damage and the fire-rate, making it somewhat a predecessor of the two weapons. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Good accuracy even without scoping. Scope allows for better magnification. Cons: Relatively slow fire rate. Gallery [ ] SSG 08 in real life. Trivia [ ] The Scout is superior to the SSG 04 in many ways, for example, the SSG 08 has an improved muzzle brake over the SSG 04, with the ability to attach a suppressor. The Scout is a highly accurate bolt-action sniper rifle, with a folding stock and an adjustable cheekpiece and butt plate. It usually is equipped with a bipod and a "butt spike" monopod for added stability, but however, It doesn't seem like it's in the in-game model. The Scout can shoot a .308 Winchester round, .243 Winchester, .300 Winchester Magnum and .338 Lapua Magnum in its detachable double-column box magazines. It can hold ten .243 Winchester or .308 Winchester, eight .300 Winchester Magnum and six .338 Lapua Magnum. However, the in-game model seems to hold the .243 Winchester or the .308 Winchester because 10 magazine capacity is the amount for which the Scout can hold. (If it is the .243 Winchester or .308 Winchester round) The Scout is taken from the popular game series that Arsenal based off, CS:GO (specifically The Arms Race Mode ). It is also in the game called Counter Blox , another game made by ROLVe . This game is heavily inspired by CS:GO . 37 (46) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Firing Mode Automatic Special Scope Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Revenant3D The SG550 is an assault rifle manufactured by SIG SAUER AG in Switzerland, it is based on an earlier model SIG SG 540 . The name in "SG" is an abbreviation for Sturmgewehr, which is "Assault Rifle" in German. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] Added in the Winterfest Update , the SG550 is fully automatic that deals average amount of damage against an enemy. Like most assault rifles in the game, this weapon holds 30 rounds and stores 90 ammo in reverse. While it is best used in any ranges, it may cause a high spread if the player continued to fire the rifle. It also fires slow compared to the rest of automatic weapons. The SG550 had an accessible scope to cooperate with, by clicking the right mouse button. When used, it shoots almost as accurately than it is on the rifle. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Accessible scope by pressing the right mouse button. Moderate magazine size. Decent reload time. Cons: Slow firing rate. High spread upon hip firing. Gallery [ ] Scope. Weapon render. SG-550 in real life. Trivia [ ] The name of SG550 is mistakenly spelled as SSG-550 in Revenant3D's render on Twitter . The model in-game is possibly based on the SG 551 LB , due to its shorter handguard compared to the real SG 550. While not being apart of the model in-game, the render showcased by Revenant3D featured a foregrip. Like the G36 , the magazine has studs and can be locked with other magazines for faster reloading. Despite its improved variant, the SG 553, being in another ROLVe game Counter Blox , this gun never appears in the Counter Blox gamemode. 55-96 (165-288) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Semi-automatic Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The SKS is a semi-automatic rifle chambered for the 7.62×39mm round, designed in the year 1943 by Sergei Gavrilovich Simonov. A reliable, simply designed, and relatively inexpensive weapon, the SKS was first produced in the Soviet Union (USSR) but was later widely exported and manufactured by various nations. In-game information [ ] The SKS can instantly kill an opponent with just one headshot and can 2-shot-kill enemies when shot to the body with a high magazine size and fine reserve. The fire rate is slow, making each shot count in combat. The tactical reload when shells are still in the muzzle is also slow, making timing important for the gun to not make the user die. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Decent empty reload time. Decent Firerate Cons: Slow pullout speed. Relatively slow tactical reload speed. Tips [ ] The SKS excels at mid- to long-range combat, but is better at close-range combat if it becomes more inaccurate. This weapon's spread isn't as similar as some of the other Marksman Rifles, so beware of this. The SKS has two types of reloads, both of which have advantages and disadvantages. The magazine reload (when the current magazine is empty) reloads the entire clip at once, but it takes a while to do so. This won't help if you're currently being attacked by an enemy. The individual bullet-reload (done if reloading while there's still ammo in the current clip) is good for reloading in an intense fight, and will give you a full ammo clip if done in time. Trivia [ ] The SKS has a broken inspect animation. The letters "SKS" stands for a Russian phrase called "Samozaryadny Karabin Sistemy Simonova", which translates into "Self-loading Carbine of the Simonov System". The animations seem to be from Unit: Classified for the SKS, which is another game that ROLVe created. It is one of the three weapons to have a mid-reload. The others are M1 Garand , and Springfield Rifle . 25-37 Gamemodes Standard Brickbattle Gun Rotation Randomizer Kill Confirmed Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Firing Mode Automatic Projectile Special Projectile Arch Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Slingshot is an automatic weapon that deals 20 damage per hit. It shoots projectile balls affected by gravity. It has an infinite ammo capacity and therefore no reload. However, this does not mean the user should constantly hold down the trigger and fire forever because that can easily give away the user's position. To be effective with this weapon, the user has to predict where the enemy is going and shoot a little ahead of where they are going (due to travel time of projectiles) to hit their shots. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Infinite ammunition. Fast rate of fire. Decent damage. No reloading required. Cons: Projectile balls are affected by gravity. No headshot multiplier. Can cause lag when spammed. Gallery [ ] In third person. Slingshot in ROBLOX Brickbattle Slingshot in real life. Trivia [ ] The Slingshot is the signature weapon for the Kyle and the Unga Bunga skins. The Slingshot was one of the weapons that were in the Brickbattle gamemode with the others being the Bomb , the Superball , the RPG and the Trowel . 45 1337 (Snowball Fight) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Hard Mode Snowball Fight New Years Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Special Projectile Arch Kill Icon The Snowball , is a weapon added in the Christmas Update of Arsenal . As its name implies, is snow curved up into a ball. It retains the same functionality of a projectile, such as an arch and the speed, and deals slightly more damage than a melee attack. Like other projectiles, timing is key. Contents 1 Pros & Cons 2 Tips 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. High ammo pool. No reloading required. Cons: No headshot multiplier. Low damage. Fires a projectile, meaning that timing is key. Projectile arches, making it difficult to hit players. Tips [ ] Snowballs can be thrown quickly, but they are also very weak, taking three to kill an opponent with full HP. It's better at getting assists rather than direct kills, so try sticking close to teammates if you have this weapon. This weapon is very bad against other weapons, but it especially loses to Shotguns or Automatics. Snowballs lack a damage range, so it deals a flat damage of 45 from any distance. It is recommended that you use this from mid-range to easily hit opponents and avoid easily getting shot at. Keep a look out for any opponents using a Sniper Rifle as they can easily counter this strategy. Trivia [ ] Just like the Water Balloon , the snowball could have been used to obtain the Fire Golem skin for the discontinued Cryptid Hunt . It is a signature weapon of the Ice Cream Man and Snowman skins. It has the same exact stats as the Water Balloon . Its a one-shot-kill weapon it the Snowball Fight gamemode . Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] Added in the Halloween Update II of Arsenal . The Soul Pistol , even with a close-range headshot, requires three shots to kill, making this weapon have measly damage. Its weakest damage is fall-off for 20 for bodyshots and 50 for headshots, Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. High magazine capacity of 17. Moderately fast reload. No recoil. High headshot and close-quarters combat (CQC) damage. Low spread. Cons: Low minimum damage. Tracer shots can give away the shooter's position. Fast ammo decrease on repeated shots. Tips [ ] The Soul Pistol's very tight spread makes it useful at mid-range. However, it best performs at close-range, where its damage is ramped-up enough to kill opponents in only two shots. Further from close-range takes 5 shots, but this will be easy since this weapon has 17 shots per magazine. As with every Pistol, this weapon is useless at long-range, as its spread becomes a lot more noticeable. The Soul Pistol does shoot tracer shots, but they are very hard to see compared to other weapons. Unless you're in a dark area, you don't have to worry about opponents finding your position. In Summer Update III , however, it was given an original firing sound. The Soul Pistol is the signature weapon of the Hackula skin .
