Per Pellet 8 (10) Pellets Per Shot 9 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Typical Colors Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hard Mode Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off HUD Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Franchi SPAS-12 is a combat shotgun manufactured by Italian firearms company Franchi from 1979 to 2000, notable for its ability to switch between semi-automatic and pump-action. It was generally sold to military and police forces, though many were sold on the civilian market as well. Its imposing appearance and its purpose as a military shotgun led to imports of the SPAS-12 to the U.S. being stopped by the Federal Assault Weapons Ban, despite it being renamed to the "Sporting Purpose Automatic Shotgun" (for which it most certainly was not designed). In-game Information [ ] It is the second fastest firing shotgun in the game. Holding down LMB will allow this weapon to be fired in a pseudo-full-auto state. Most players should be able to get a kill with this weapon. However, if you empty out the magazine, an extremely long 5.5 second reload time will have to be endured. This rarely happens though because it does massive damage per round despite not being a one-hit kill. Players should keep note of the spread as it increases when fired continuously. Most players will get a kill before having to go through an empty reload. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire for a shotgun. 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. High magazine size for a shotgun. Dominates in close range. Cons: High ammo consumption rate. Very slow 5.5-second empty reload time. Low damage per pellet. High pellet spread upon continuous shots. Tips [ ] The SPAS-12's bullet spread is actually more vertical instead of horizontal. This will make it easier to pick off individual opponents. It may look tempting, but it is recommended to not use this weapon while approaching an enemy from a distance, especially since you only deal 8 damage per pellet. Use your Knife to get closer to opponents and then switch back to the SPAS-12 once you're confident you can take them out in under 3 shots. If it's impossible to close the distance, space out your shots instead of spamming to deal respectable damage. A teammate that's nearer to your target can get you an assist. Trivia [ ] The SPAS-12 was once formerly known as the " Special Purpose Automatic Shotgun ", although the US Assault Weapons Ban led to the renaming of it to the " Sporting Purpose Automatic Shotgun ". It was first developed as a combat shotgun. When finishing the reload, the character animation appears to use the chamber to charge the weapon, unlike before, which appears to use the fore-grip to cock the weapon instead of using the chamber. The SPAS-12 can actually be changed from semi-automatic to pump-action, to allow it to reliably cycle low-pressure rounds such as beanbag shells and tear gas rounds. This is the signature weapon for Shock Force, Rioter, Punk Rioter and Breacher. This weapon is tied with the Barrett for the 4th longest reload time, with 5.5 seconds, only surpassed by the MG42 with a 5.75 second reload time, the Musket with a 6-seconds reload time, and the Dual Volcanics with an 18-second reload time. However, you can fire while reloading. The SPAS-12, XM1014 , and the Inertial Shotgun are the only semi-automatic shotguns in the game. In the Anniversary Update , the damage was buffed from 6 to 8. The SPAS-12 model and animations were previously taken from Typical Colors 2, where it is known as the " Deathblow ", being a secondary weapon for the Trooper, Arsonist and Brute. Despite the SPAS-12 in Arsenal being semi-automatic, the Typical Colors 2 variant is pump action. The model also uses the Tokyo Marui company version of the Franchi SPAS 12 . The firing sound effect used for this weapon was taken from the Panic Attack in Team Fortress 2 . The model in-game has it's folding stock removed. The SPAS in game reloads a shell without using the carrier latch button Gallery [ ] SPAS 12 in real life. Fire : 48-60 (+4) (110) Ice : 40 Darkness : 84-90 (110) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Juggernaut Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Special Projectile Arch Mode Switching Fire : Afterburn Ice : Slowness Darkness : Screen Shake Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Spellbook is a fictitious weapon based on fictional representations of medieval wizards , who are usually involved in some capacity with spellbooks . When equipped, the user will hold the opened Spellbook in their left hand, while the right hand shows the current spell selected. The Spellbook has three spells: Fire , Ice , and Darkness . To switch between spells, press the reload button. All spells are projectiles (which are not affected by gravity), so timing and patience is key. The Fire spell deals 60 damage and will inflict 4 dmg per second of burn damage until the player dies or picks up a health pack, similar to the Flamethrower . The Ice spell is the weakest, only dealing 40 damage. However, any targets hit will have their movement speed slowed down for 5 seconds. The Darkness spell is the strongest, dealing 90 damage. Additionally, hitting targets will make their screen shake, although they can counter this by adjusting their aim. Pros & Cons [ ] General Fire Ice Darkness Pros: Contains 3 usable modes for added versatility. Super fast projectile speed. Very minimal projectile arch. Has infinite ammo. Instantly kills any enemy that is on fire. Cons: Timing and careful aim is required due to the projectile. Sluggish fire rate. No headshot bonus on first hits. Pros: Burns enemies, doing a little bit of extra burn damage. 2-hit kill regardless of range and hit location. When an enemy is burned, they will take critical hits from weapons that also do fire damage. 1-hit kill when the burn is not treated in 5-7 seconds upon a hit. Cons: Burn damage is extremely minimal (Only 4 damage per second). Afterburn can easily be stopped if enemies pick up health pack. Pros: Slows down enemies, which can be extremely useful for taking out enemies who use the knife. Slowing down enemies allows you to more easily hit players. Cons: Does less damage, taking 3 hits to kill a player. Slowing enemies isn't a top priority, as the enemy can still shoot you. No headshot multiplier. Pros: Shakes the player’s screen, possibly causing them to lose their aim or focus. Kills a player in 2-hits regardless of range and hit location. Fastest projectile speed of all the 3 spells. Cons: More professional players won’t lose their aim while their screen is shaking. Very small niche, as there aren’t many situations where screen-shaking would be useful or lifesaving. Tips [ ] The Spellbook has multiple strategies for kills. However, all three spells have their risks, so it's important to decide which one to use. The Spellbook takes 1.5 seconds to switch between spells. It's a good idea to hide and pick your spell before you start fighting, as you'll easily be killed if you switch spells in an intense fight. It's important to practice with the Fire spell in particular, as it's the very first spell avaliable. This especially would help if you suddenly obtain the Spellbook while in an intense fight. The Spellbook is better at getting assists rather than direct kills due to its ways of dealing damage. Stick close to teammates to make this weapon more effective. The Fire and Darkness spells deal enough damage for a teammate to finish the job. The Fire spell is very deadly. Not only is its afterburn last long enough to kill a target, but landing a Fire spell on burning targets will insta-kill. Using the Ice spell on an enemy will make them too slow to run away, allowing you or your team to kill them easily. You can even take this a step further and backstab your slowed target with your Knife . Opponents hit with a Darkness spell will make their aim automatically shake for 5 seconds, making it harder for them to shoot accurately. This can be worked around if the player is more experienced as they can easily shift their aim to counteract the shaking. Beware of this. The Darkness spell's projectile speed is the fastest of the three spells, so it's easier to land from a distance. With the Spellbook in general, stay at mid-range to make it easier for your spells to hit your targets. Close-range is dangerous, and long-range will make it impossible to land any hits. Trivia [ ] This is the only weapon that has a lasting effect on the enemy. This weapon, the Tavor 's Incendiary shells, the Flamethrower , the Acid Spitter and the Flaming Pumpkin are the only weapons that have an afterburn effect. The Spellbook has the longest lasting afterburn. The Spellbook along with the M16A2 and Tavor are the only weapons in the game that can switch abilities. Erroneously, the control guide suggests that the Spellbook's modes can be switched with the right mouse button, which is not the case. Before being patched sometime in March, there was a bug with the Fire Spell that happened if a player died from burning, they would still be marked as your target even after respawning. Therefore, if they died to any environmental causes or died via resetting, it would count as your kill. The Spellbook is the signature weapon for the Mothree, Phantom Thief Magician, and Wizard skins. 87-174 (108-195) Gamemodes Standard Wild West Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Headshots Only Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Lever-Action Special Double Jump Kill Icon Creator Unknown The Spencer Carbine , or Spencer Repeating Carbine, is an early American-made lever-action carbine first manufactured in 1860. Contents 1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History In-game Information [ ] The Spencer Carbine will always deal 87 damage to the body, and will instantly kill upon a headshot dealing 108 damage to the player, irrespective of range. It fires from a 6-round tubular magazine, with a unique animation played upon reloading; characters will open the butt plate of the Spencer, before removing and replacing the tubular magazine. It requires a brief period after every shot to re-cock, due to the rifle's lever-action mechanism. The Spencer Carbine can be compared to the Henry Rifle with it's same firerate, damage, magazine capacity, and the double jump ability, but they are contrasted due to its reload time and ammo pool. The Spencer Carbine also has the ability to double jump: players can double-tap space on the desktop version, Xbox players can double-tap "A", and Mobile players can tap the jump button twice. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Has no spread. Capable of double jump, allowing greater movement. Cons: Slow rate of fire. Has high recoil. Somewhat long reload time. Has low magazine capacity. Quick movement speed makes it harder to land shots. Tips [ ] Although the Spencer Carbine has the ability to double-jump, make sure you do not overuse it. Remember that this weapon only shoots one bullet, and extreme movements like double-jumping will make you miss more shots. Use the double-jump ability to instead find higher places to shoot from, and escape enemies while reloading. You can also double-jump towards enemies to deal ramped-up damage. The maximum is 117, which will guarantee a kill. The Spencer Carbine only has 6 shots in one magazine, along with a very slow reload. Make every single shot count, as you will easily be killed if you miss all of them. This weapon has no spread, so it is recommended that you try to land a shot from long-range. Trivia [ ] The Spencer fires a .52 caliber bullet and can fire at a rate of around 14-20 rounds per minute. The magazine on the Spencer is an unusual location, found in the stock of the weapon. The reload animation in Arsenal is not the proper way to reload it; in order to reload the Spencer, people will either remove the spring and plate and drop cartridges in, or utilize a "Blakeslee Cartridge Box", which enables faster loading of cartridges into the magazine. The design is similar to a Sharps Carbine that was used in the American Civil War. The double jump ability is most likely a reference to the Flanker from Typical Colors 2 , a former ROLVe game. 85-243 (255-837) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Headshots Only Hard Mode Insane Mode Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Bolt-Action Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Springfield Rifle is a rifle based on the Springfield M1903. It would then go on service in 1906 and be replaced by the M1 Garand in 1936. In-game Information [ ] The Springfield Rifle is a heavy hitter. It boasts massive damage, being able to one-shot any enemy at close ranges without a headshot, only a two-shot kill at longer ranges. Its weakest possible damage is 85, which is more than enough for a teammate to get you an assist. However, the Springfield Rifle has a few drawbacks. It only has 5 shots before it needs to reload, and it has a slow firing rate of 1 second between shots. It also has very powerful recoil, which can throw off the user's aim. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Fast empty reload. 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. Has no spread. Firerate can be increased by double keying Cons: Slow rate of fire. Small magazine size. Somewhat high recoil upon firing. Tips [ ] Because the Springfield Rifle is the only Marksman Rifle with noticeably high recoil, this weapon might be a bit more difficult to get a kill with. The main tip is don ' t panic. The Springfield Rifle is more effective if you shoot carefully rather than recklessly. Do not spam your shots. You only have 5 bullets per magazine, and the Springfield Rifle has a somewhat slow reload. Make sure your shots count. This weapon is most effective at close range, as its ramped-up damage maxes out at a whopping 243 damage. Try to sneak up behind oblivious enemies to make it easier to secure a kill. If you cannot get close to opponents, simply take aim and try to land a shot from a distance. If you're lucky, a teammate will get you an assist, promoting you to the next weapon. Gallery [ ] Reload 1 (Tactical) Reload 2 (empty) Springfield Rifle in real life with slings. Trivia [ ] The Springfield Rifle and the M1 Garand are the only weapons that have a faster empty reload time. The gun in-game can block the player's view if using stretched resolution or black bars. When reloading with the Springfield Rifle, the player will fill the whole magazine using a stripper clip if the rifle is completely empty instead of reloading one-by-one. It shares the same firing sound as the TOZ-106 , albeit louder While the Springfield Rifle was replaced by the M1 Garand in 1936, it was still used (and modified) by the Marines and the Army as a sniper rifle during WW2. The rifle remains popular as a civilian firearm, historical collector's piece, a competitive shooting rifle, and as a military drill rifle. 23 Gamemodes Clown Infection Special Double Jump Backstab Speed Boost For the knife skin variant, see Knife Skins . The Squeaky Hammer is a melee weapon which appears to be a toy hammer. It grants a speed boost and the ability to double jump. Upon hitting a player, it makes a higher-pitched bat hit sound effect. The Squeaky Hammer is the sole weapon of the clowns in the Clown Infection gamemode , where the clowns are given many abilities inaccessible to normal players. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Faster swing rate than other melee weapons. Double jump allows better mobility. Gives a major speed boost. Cons: 5 hits required unlike the 3 hits for normal melees. Trivia [ ] This is one of the only melee weapons to be exclusive to a gamemode, with the others being the Sword , Venomshank , Firebrand , Darkheart , Illumina , Ghostwalker , Windforce and Ice Dagger . This is the first melee weapon to be exclusive to a gamemode and be in-game as a knife skin as well. The second is the Classic Sword . Announcers will say their backstab lines when getting a kill with the Squeaky Hammer despite it being unable to demote players. The Squeaky Hammer deals the second least amount of damage for a melee, only dealing 23, with the usual Knife doing 36 damage for a front hit. The only melee that does less damage is the Fasticuffs , doing only 20 damage for a front hit. 90-180 (112) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Holy Water Piercing Shot Splash Damage Kill Icon Creator nettimato SomeBlueAngel Contents 1 General information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General information [ ] The Stake Launcher is a semi-automatic rifle that fires sharpened wooden posts, otherwise known as stakes. Constructed from old wood and sheet metal, and held together by screws and leather belts, it boasts a handcrafted appearance. It comes with a bottle of holy water that is used to imbue the projectiles with power. The Stake Launcher can usually one-shot anywhere to the body if the players are at the minimum range. Hitting the secondary fire button will trigger an animation of pouring the contents of a holy water bottle into the hole on the user side of the receiver, upgrading the next projectile fired to deal splash damage and making the weapon emit sparkles. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Usually one-shot anywhere to the body at minimum range. Very high minimum damage of 90. Can pierce through multiple targets. Holy water adds splash damage. Cons: Slow rate of fire. Low magazine capacity of 9. Slightly long reload. Fairly high recoil. Gallery [ ] Pouring Holy Water. Workshop submission. Redesigned bottle without religious symbols. Original concept art. Cleaned up concept art. Trivia [ ] Strangely, the Stake Launcher is the only weapon that deals less damage upon a headshot than the maximum body damage. The Stake Launcher currently has a glitch where the splash damage can be detected without using the holy water special. The Stake Launcher's Holy Water bottle originally had a cross on it, however this was changed to avoid religious offense. The Stake Launcher is the signature weapon for Agetha skin . 26-61 (40-70) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator nettimato Contents 1 General Information 1.1 in-game information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio (Outdated) 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The STEN , or Shepherd and Harold Turpin Enfield , is a submachine gun firing 9mm bullets from a 32-round detachable box magazine. in-game information [ ] In-game, the STEN is one of the slower weapons of its category, and as such will be less effective at closer ranges compared to other SMGs , but has a higher damage to help make up for the rate of fire. Its high spread though lowers its utility at longer ranges, so players are advised to go closer or aim for the head at longer ranges. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Fast reload time. Large magazine size for its class. Cons: Slower rate of fire for its weapon class. High spread for its class. Trivia [ ] This gun was one of the 6 guns modeled by MAD Studios developer, nettimato, with the others being the G11 , Calico , TOZ-106 , the Dual Shotguns , the Focus and the Stake Launcher . The STEN guns were made since the British couldn't afford to buy a lot of Thompson submachine guns from the U.S during World War II. They were cheap and simple to make. It is based on the STEN family of submachine guns , which were used extensively by British Commonwealth forces during World War II and the Korean War. The STEN is one of the cheapest guns to ever be produced with a unit cost of only being $10. The STEN was used for the King ROBLOX toy. 100 (125) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Thrown Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Sunflower Sun is a projectile weapon that consists of both sunflower and its sunlight. In-game Information [ ] In-game, the sunflower sun is a powerful projectile weapon that can instantly kill an enemy with its infinite ammo and magazine capacities meaning that no reloading is required. However, it has a slow rate of fire for its situation, though its one shot and perfect accuracy capabilities make it one of the best weapons in Arsenal. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Guaranteed one-shot kill. Infinite magazine and ammo. Very accurate. No reloading required. Cons: Slow rate of fire. Trivia [ ] The Sunflower Sun was listed as Sunflower Son in the DevForum of Summer Update II . The Sunflower Sun's inspect audio is currently the longest weapon audio. The Sunflower Sun is the signature weapon for the Froggy skin. The Sunflower Sun is also a reference to an NES Game, "Super Mario Bros", where Mario is able to fire a fireball upon grabbing the Fire Flower power-up. The Sunflower Sun makes a return during the Pre-Halloween Update II but it is no longer uses a projectile as a Spellbook 's projectile. Instead, the Sunflower Sun uses a projectile as a beam. It is only non-laser weapon with the Evaporate kill effect equipped by default. 100-150 Gamemodes Standard Brickbattle Gun Rotation Randomizer Kill Confirmed Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Hard Mode Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Special Ramp-up Projectile Arch Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Superball originated from Brickbattle , which is an iconic and classic ROBLOX game, and was first presented in Crossroads . It is a projectile weapon that deals 100 to 150 damage on hit. It's a ball that is thrown very fast and is affected by gravity. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros Has infinite ammunition Moderate throw rate Rebound ability One shot kill Firerate can be increased by double keying (instantly switching to melee and back Cons Easily dodgeable Hard to hit enemies with because of the projectile arch Only rebounds once before it no longer deals damage. Tips [ ] The Superball may be easy to dodge, but there's a couple of scenarios where you can easily secure a kill: Throwing at an opponent who's jumping. Throwing at an opponent currently recoil jumping (this weapon archs less if throwing more vertically). Standing on a higher platform and throwing at the opponents below you. From long-range, as long as you angle it correctly. The Superball does not bounce off players, so you can potentially get a multi-kill if you line up your shot perfectly. Remember that the Superball can only rebound once . After that, it will no longer deal damage, even if it touches an enemy. This is why it's important to aim higher than to the floor. "Rolling" the Superball on the floor also won't work. Trivia [ ] It is the signature weapon of the Weightlifter & Volleyball Star skins. The Superball can still deal damage after hitting a solid surface. The Superball is one of the weapons that were in Brickbattle. The others are the Bomb , the RPG , the Slingshot , and the Trowel . 15-60 (152) Gamemodes Standard Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Scope Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Dragunov sniper rifle or Snayperskaya vintovka Dragunova (simply known as SVD-63 and Sniper in Gun Game ), is a Russian weapon chambered in 7.62×54mmR designed by the Soviet Union and produced by the Kalashnikov Concern (formerly, Izhmash). The Dragunov was made to be a squad support weapon as according to the Soviet Union, the long-range engagement ability was lost to ordinary troops when submachine guns and assault rifles were adopted. It is still being produced and is widely used to this day. In-game Information [ ] The SVD in game functioned similarly to that of the Mosin-Nagant , because of the 60 damage on the body. It was very powerless in close, medium, and even long range, mostly due to the long time until hitting another shot. The best thing to do was to aim for the head. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: One-shot kill to the head. Moderate bodyshot damage. Scope allows for better magnification. Cons: Slow fire rate. Small magazine capacity. Trivia [ ] While the SVD looks similar and functions like the AK-47, it is not a variant of the said gun. The ammo it uses is 7.62×54mmR which is the same caliber that the Mosin-Nagant uses. The weapon doesn't have its own icon. Instead, it uses the placeholder icon. The rate of fire is inaccurately slow. However, in reality, the rate of fire can be varied. The SVD scope is also called PSO-1M2 . 52 (Swordfights) 78 (Brickbattle) Gamemodes Brickbattle Swordfights Special Demotion Kill Icon The Sword is a gamemode-exclusive weapon that replaces the default knife. It also appears as one of the random weapons obtained in Swordfights. It is a reference to various classic Sword fighting games. The Sword does 52 damage on hit, allowing it to kill an enemy in two hits. However, it does not have the ability to backstab. With its high damage, getting a kill with the Sword can be made fast. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Has the ability to demote player on kills. Cons: Unable to backstab. Mediocre swing rate. Trivia [ ] Unlike the classic sword from the classic ROBLOX games (the weapon it is based on), it cannot lunge, a special attack that allowed users to reach higher places by being airborne or do higher damage. This is the signature weapon of the Annihilator, Crusader, King, Northern Crusader, Queen and Shard skins. This was released as a case -only melee in the Anniversary Update known as the Classic Sword. This was solved as false as the melee finally appeared in the shop on 02/14/20. This is the second weapon to have both skin and weapon variants, the first being the Squeaky Hammer . In private server Brickbattle, the sword does not function as it used to. On 12/08/18, the Sword was given to ROLVe staff members, wherewolfAMV and Campyfire to test it. It had different variants for both of them. It had a slightly visible gray texture with a black handle for wherewolfAMV. It had a long katana like a blade with a brown handle for Campyfire. The Linked Sword in Typical Colors 2 is also used by the Bloxxer Noobs in Vs. Bosses . Per Pellet 12 Gauge : 20-60 (23-138) Slug : 200-600 (227-690) Incendiary : 15-45 (17-51) Pellets Per Shot 12 Gauge/Incendiary : 9 Slug : 1 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Semi-Automatic Special Mode Switching Afterburn (Incendiary) Fall-off HUD Icon Creator Revenant3D Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The IWI Tavor TS12 is an Israeli semi-automatic bullpup shotgun, based on the IWI Tavor assault rifle. The Tavor TS12 is designed and produced by Israel Weapon Industries (IWI). In-game Information [ ] The Tavor's high damage from each pellet allows easy sniping at longer ranges, along with its fast rate of fire. It can be used for close quarters and mid-long range effortlessly. When right-clicking, the Tavor can also switch between different modes through rotating the magazine tubes, that contain different types of shells. The shells include 12 Gauge, Slug, and Incendiary. Slug will instantly kill an opponent from any range if the shot lands. However, it does have a slower fire-rate. It also has a tighter spread. Incendiary has the special effect of burning enemies. This will slowly chip away at their health until they die or find a health pack. However, the spread widens much more each time the Tavor is fired compared to the other modes. It can also deal headshot damage on burning targets whether or not the player was shot on the torso. In general, the 12 Gauge mode is enough to effortlessly dispatch of enemies, however, for very far away players, switching to Slug might be the best option. However, mode switching does take quite a bit of time, and it is recommended that you stay in 12 Gauge while in combat, or else you'll be left vulnerable for a second or two while you switch modes. Pros & Cons [ ] General 12 Gauge Slug Incendiary Pros: Very fast rate of fire. 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. Has different bullet modes to switch. High overall damage per pellet. Cons: Low magazine capacity of 5. 1-by-1 empty reloads are slow. Mode switching somewhat takes a long time to cycle. Pros: High damage. Cons: Somewhat wide pellet spread. Pros: Instantly kills at all ranges. Tight spread. Has no spread penalty. Cons: Fires slower than the standard Gauge. Pros: Burns enemies, doing extra damage. Deals headshot damage to burning targets whether or not the player was shot on the head. Cons: Very high spread when spamming. Afterburn can easily be stopped if enemies pick up health pack. Burn only does 4 damage. Tips [ ] The Tavor may have three types of ammo, but realistically it is best to focus on the 12 Gauge shells. If you suddenly get promoted to this weapon while in the middle of a fight, you won't have time to switch ammo. Switching between ammo types takes about 2.5 seconds, which will not help you if you're currently being shot at. Only do this when you first spawn or while alone. Each of the Tavor's ammo types specialize in different situations: 12 Gauge acts a regular Shotgun, shooting quickly in a fixed bullet spread. It's good for intense fights at close-range. Slug makes the Tavor act similar to a Sniper Rifle, as it insta-kills with only shooting one bullet down the crosshair. Best used at long-range. Incendiary is especially deadly, but has wide spread. Best used at close-range when there's multiple opponents so the afterburn effect credits you with an assist when they're killed. The Tavor is a very deadly weapon in gamemodes such as Randomizer and Gun Rotation due to their lack of promotion-on-kill mechanic, which will allow you to go on rampages and kill opponents both near and far thanks to its various types of ammo. Gallery [ ] Inspect. Stage one of development. Stage two. Mode switching. Tavor in real life. Trivia [ ] The Tavor was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on May 12th, 2020. The Tavor design is based off the IWI TS-12 shotgun. This weapon with incendiary rounds, the Spellbook , the Flamethrower , the Acid Spitter and the Flaming Pumpkin are the only weapons who have the afterburn effect. The Tavor shotgun is the second weapon with projectile changing, the first being the Spellbook. The Tavor slug round does the fourth highest damage in the game. However, this only applies in point-blank ranges. The Tavor was removed from randomizer for an unknown reason. The Tavor, the Spellbook , and the M16A2 are the only weapons in the game that has the mode switch ability. Critical Damage Overview Magazine Ammo 20 60 Damage 15-90 (37-112) Gamemodes Standard Counter Blox Gun Rotation Randomizer Kill Confirmed Juggernaut Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown (Current) VALVe (Archived) Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.06 22.401 1.9 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0.873 1.747 1.5 The Intratec TEC-9 is a blowback-operated line of semi-automatic pistols. They were developed by Intratec, an American subsidiary of the Swedish firearms manufacturer Interdynamic AB . Introduced in 1984, the TEC-9 was made of inexpensive molded polymers and a mixture of stamped and milled steel parts. The simple design of the gun made it easy to repair and modify. The TEC-9 developed a negative reputation for its association with organized crime, street gangs, and mass shootings in the 1990s. Most notably it was used during the 101 California Street shooting and the Columbine High School massacre. However, it was a commercial success, with over 250,000+ being sold, regardless on who or where it was sold to. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The TEC-9 , like the G-18 , is an absolute shredder. Its extremely fast fire-rate rivals that of an assault rifle. It also has ramp-up and can instantly kill at close quarters. However, it comes with a high spread penalty. Burst-firing the TEC-9 can assist with firing at longer ranges, as the spread penalty rapidly decreases with time after the last shot has been fired. The TEC-9 is one of the few weapons to have a low first-shot accuracy, meaning it has a low chance to fire in a straight line, similar to the MK18 . Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast fire-rate. Instant kill at close quarters. Quick reload. Large magazine size for a pistol. Cons: High spread penalty. Low minimum body damage. Magazine is easily expended due to its fast fire-rate. Low first-shot accuracy. Tips [ ] The TEC-9 is a very deadly weapon, just like its real life counterpart. It shoots at automatic speed, deals really good damage, and has a whopping 20 bullets per magazine. The main weakness of the TEC-9 is range, thanks to its spread . It will dominate close-ranged fights, but is a crippling weakness at further distances. The TEC-9's reload is pretty fast, allowing you to reload while getting shot at during an intense fight. Gallery [ ] TEC-9 in real life. Trivia [ ] The TEC-9 is not naturally fully automatic and is manufactured as a semi-automatic pistol out of the factory. However, the ease of modification allowed criminals to convert the weapon to fully-automatic, causing the US to force Intratec into creating a closed-bolt version of the TEC-9 that was harder to convert without special parts. The TEC-9 does have a second variant dubbed the TEC-9 Mini , a variant removing the pistol's shrouded barrel. The TEC-9 was taken from Counter Blox along with many other weapons. CB:RO's version of the TEC-9 was semi-auto unlike the TEC-9 in Arsenal . The TEC-9 is one of the automatic pistols along with the G-18 , the Electric Revolver , the Little Tom , and the Falkor . People often mistaken the TEC-9 as a SMG, despite looking like one alongside with the Falkor . The TEC-9 used to have an appearance in the game Typical Colors 2 . It is the signature weapon of the Nevaeh skin . 100 Gamemodes Bombfest Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Kill Icon Creator Unknown The Bomb is a projectile weapon used in Bombfest . The intentions for this weapon is represented as a soccer ball, as the main goal for players to catch and score it to the opposite team's ring before it could explode on the hands of a grabber. It shares the same model as the BrickBattle Bomb , however it is attentively fused. In-Game Information [ ] Because of its fusion, the Bomb behaves like a regular time-bomb and would go off when the user holds it for 8 seconds, sending them to the Penalty Box and resets the match. However, this can be prevented when passing to a teammate or a opponent, as the exploding timer is set back to 0 seconds simultaneously. Similar to OddBall , the Bomb uses a marked indicator. Pros and Cons [ ] Note: The pros and cons here only documented the gameplay of Bombfest gamemode. Pros: Infinite ammo. Exploding timer is reset if passing to a teammate/enemy. Can be thrown with RMB. Cons: One player gets it per game. Activates explosion if holding it for too long. Players can accidentally pass it to the enemy if not careful. 11-33 (27-37) Gamemodes Standard Counter Blox Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio (Outdated) 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Auto-Ordnance Model 1928 Thompson Machine Gun , (referred to as Tommy Gun in Arsenal ) is an American submachine gun. In-game Information [ ] In almost every aspect except the fire rate, this is comparable to the MG42 . Its move-speed while carrying it is faster, the reload does not take as long, and it deals less damage. However, its low damage can be a problem for players. Dealing only 11 damage along with the high spread can be a massive issue at almost all ranges, especially long ranges, where it is almost unusable. This can be avoided if players aim for the head, killing an enemy in four hits instead of ten. In order for players to not suffer both downsides, players should tap fire to make every shot count. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage at close range. Fast fire rate. Quick reload time. High magazine capacity of 50. No recoil. Cons: Low minimum damage. Slower movement speed compared to other SMGs. High spread. Trivia [ ] The Tommy Gun is the Mobster, Hitman, and Kingpin's signature weapon. The Tommy Gun has many different nicknames, including the "Chicago Typewriter." The Tommy Gun fires 45 ACP in real life. This Tommy Gun is fitted with a drum magazine. Drum magazines were rarely used for Tommy Guns by the U.S. as it was bulkier than a box magazine. Despite this, The Tommy Gun is most commonly seen with a drum magazine in other parts of media. The Tommy Gun had no reload sound except for the hammer recock. The Tommy Gun's reload animation is incorrect. People would have to pull the bolt back before pulling out the drum, and the character doesn't take out or insert the drum right. You would have to push it out of the side in real life, not just pulling it downwards. The previous firing sound was taken from Red Orchestra 2: Rising Storm . Per Pellet 7 (42-384) Pellets Per Shot 9 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Bolt-Action Special Fall-off HUD Icon Creator nettimato Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The TOZ-106 or Tulsky Oruzheiny Zavod 106 is a Russian bolt-action shotgun that was manufactured in 1993 and was added to Arsenal during the Christmas Update . In-game Information [ ] An unusual firearm, owing to its use of a bolt-action mechanism, the TOZ-106 is a cheap and heavy weapon. While its bolt-action mechanism may at first appear to be a detriment, the weapon's bolt speed is similar to the pump speed of other shotguns. As with most shotguns, the TOZ-106 will instantaneously kill an enemy upon a close-range shot, although the TOZ-106 is capable of long-range kills, should the user aim for the head. As with most other manually operated weapons, players will have to cycle the bolt before they can fire again, placing more of an emphasis on hitting their target. The TOZ-106 also comes with a low magazine size of 4, the second-lowest size in its category. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High headshot damage. Fast reload for a shotgun. Reloads all shells when reloading. Firerate can be increased by double keying Cons: Slow rate of fire. Has low magazine capacity. Slow movement speed. Very low body damage. Tips [ ] The TOZ-106 is not very good at intense fights, as it both fires and reloads slowly. It's better off if you used this weapon for sneak attacks instead of approaching opponents head-on. This weapon's low body damage makes it less viable at mid-range. This is why getting close and quickly getting a kill is important. Make every shot count. If you miss, do not panic and keep a steady aim. Try not to reload while you still have ammo, as one good shot is all you need to get a kill. Better to risk it than to play it safe with the slow reload. Gallery [ ] The TOZ-106 in real life with a 2-round magazine. Trivia [ ] The TOZ-106 is a cheap and small bolt-action shotgun colloquially known as the Death of the Chairman . It's a compacted version of the MTs 20-01 and is generally used as a hunting weapon within the Russian Federation. The model was made by Discord user and Mad STUDIO developer, nettimato who also created the STEN , the Calico , the G11 , the Dual Shotguns , the Focus and the Stake Launcher . The TOZ-106 is the 4th magazine fed shotgun to be added to Arsenal . The TOZ-106 uses 20-gauge rounds in real life and can feed from 2 or 4-round box magazines. The weapon in Arsenal fires from a 4-round magazine. The TOZ-106 is the first weapon to be bolt-action that is not equipped with a scope. Per Pellet 4-360 (8-560) Pellets Per Shot 8 Gamemodes Standard Firing Mode Semi-automatic HUD Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros and Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History General Information [ ] The TOZ-34 has been produced and sold by the Tulsky Oruzheiny Zavod ( Tula Arms Plant ) since 1964. Since then, more than one million of these firearms have been made, and that number still continues to count up today. The TOZ-34 is a double-barreled shotgun that was released in the archived phase of Arsenal during mid-2016. In-game Information [ ] The TOZ-34 is a powerful shotgun from medium and close quarter combat. but not in long ranged combat, as each pellet deals 12 damage, about 3 times the single pellet damage of the XM1014 and Lever Shotgun . Like the DBS and DB Shotgun , the TOZ has a low 2 shell capacity due to the 2 barrels, and doesn't automatically reload even when it's empty just like all the guns in Arsenal Archived . It has a low ammo pool, even lower than the DBS. Pros and Cons [ ] Pros: Decent damage. Fast reload if there's still 1-round in remain (tactical reload). Cons: Low magazine & ammo pool. Low minimum damage. Somewhat slow empty reload. Trivia [ ] The model is based on a soviet double-barreled shotgun of the same name made in 1964 by Tulsky Oruzheiny Zavod . It can fire either 12, 20, 28, or 32 gauge in real life. 80-118 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Firing Mode Automatic Special Ramp-up Projectile Arch Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 The TP Launcher (fully known as the Toilet Paper Launcher ) is a joke weapon that was released in the Halloween Update II of Arsenal . Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio (Outdated) 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The TP Launcher shoots toilet paper rolls within high damage. It also lacks in fire rate, however it's an automatic-projectile weapon. An interesting fact is that the TP Launcher has a 1-by-1 reload, making it one of the only projectile weapons to have this, along with the Rocket Launcher . Having a projectile arch is another disadvantage for making it difficult to hit enemies at further ranges. It should also be noted that this weapon performs best from long distances. Unlike the other weapons in this game, it deals more damage from far away (at a max of 118) and is weaker at close distances (at least 80). Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Instantly kills from long range. 1-by-1 reload allows topping off. Decent magazine capacity of 20. Shot ammo has trails that the user can use to adjust aim if they miss. Cons: Long empty reload time. Slow fire rate. Has projectile arch, making it harder to hit enemies. No headshot multiplier. Shot ammo can be traced back to the user, exposing their location. Tips [ ] The TP Launcher's method of damage is reversed: unlike the other weapons, it deals more damage when far away from opponents. This makes you a deadly force at long-range. It will be easy for you to hit opponents, but they can't shoot back at you just as easily. You can practically hit an opponent on the other side of a map if you angle your aim just right. The TP Launcher is the only Special weapon that can go toe-to-toe with Sniper Rifles. The TP Launcher's biggest con is its slow fire rate, which is a 0.8 second delay between shots. This makes you more easy to kill at close-range, especially since the TP Launcher is weaker at this distance. Due to this con, the TP Launcher naturally loses to Shotguns, Automatic RIfles, and SMGs, which can quickly kill you at close-range. Make your shots count. This weapon may have 20 toilet paper rolls at once, but its reload speed is incredibly slow which can leave you vulnerable to opponents. Do not use all your ammo at once, and reload constantly. Gallery [ ] Stage one development. Stage two. Stage three. Trivia [ ] TP Launcher was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on October 17th, 2020. The TP Launcher is one of the joke weapons along with the Literal Gun , the Pocket Potassium , the Potassium Power , the Origami Gun , the Very Long Bat , and the Dispenser . The TP Launcher is mostly a joke reference from the current pandemic which so many people fighting over TPs. It also might reference " toilet papering " (TP-ing), a prank where you throw toilet papers on trees and buildings. TP-ing happens more often during Halloween. The TP Launcher is one of the only projectile weapons that allows 1-by-1 reloading. The reloading sound cycles through different pitches. 120 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Hard Mode Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Special Projectile Arch Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Audio 5 Weapon History General Information [ ] Trash Can is a projectile weapon that was added in the Summer Update III of Arsenal . It is a shiny metallic garbage can, filled with reflective green liquid representing trash. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Large hitbox means that you don't need to precisely aim at the target. High damage. Fast fire-rate. Relatively high ammo capacity. One "Shot" kills at any distance. Ability to fly. Cons: Projectile arches, making targets at longer ranges harder to hit. Trivia [ ] The thrown projectile has collision. This means it is possible to fling yourself and even perform a rocket-jump like mechanic by throwing it toward the ground whilst walking forward. Additionally, it may sometimes kill players who touch it even if it hasn't been recently thrown. It is the signature weapon of Lenny, Garbage Handler and Trash Worker skins . Occasionally, when hitting or killing a player, it will make a LG phone echo ringtone. Per Pellet 24- 137 (34) Pellets Per Shot 9 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Legacy Competitive Clown Infection Arcade All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Pump-Action Special Fall-off HUD Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] A powerful American-made shotgun, the Trench Gun is a shotgun with high damage and potential to go on killing sprees. In-game Information [ ] A single shell fired from the Trench Gun will always deal 24 damage on the body and 34 to the head, no matter the distance. If all pellets strike a target, they will deal with a combined damage of 216 to 306, instantly killing anyone close enough. As with the majority of shotguns, the Trench Gun fires in a circular pattern. It has an above-average reload time for its class. The Trench Gun is similar in statistics to the Inertial Shotgun . They have high pellet damage and the magazine capacity being at 5 shells at max. However, the Inertial Shotgun fires faster, has less pellet spread, has a slower reload time and deals slightly less damage. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage per pellet is useful at farther ranges. 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. Rather tight pellet spread. Firerate can be increased by double keying Cons: Small magazine size. Long empty reload time. Slow rate of fire. Tips [ ] The Trench Gun is one of the easiest (if not the easiest) Shotgun-class weapons to get a kill with, due to its even bullet spread and immense damage. This weapon can even be used from mid-range and (if you're lucky) long-range, and it will still deal respectable damage. If shooting further than close-range, remember that aiming for the head will give you an edge in fights. The Trench Gun's reload is moderately quick, so it will help you fight off enemies currently locked in an intense fight with you. In gamemodes such as Randomizer or Gun Rotation, you'll stay alive longer with this weapon fully reloaded. Trivia [ ] The Trench Gun in-game appears to be a hybrid of the M1897 Trench Gun and the Winchester Model 1912, with the barrel modelled after the former and the receiver and stock for the latter. While the weapon in-game lacks this ability, the Trench Gun has the ability to slam-fire, meaning that one can rapid fire the weapon as if it was a semi-automatic shotgun. In real life, this can be done by holding down the shotgun's trigger and rapidly pumping the foregrip back and forth. The Trench Gun model is used for another one of ROLVE's games, Typical Colors 2. It is used by the Trooper , Arsonist , Brute and the Mechanic and is called the Bullet-Stormer in said game. The Trench Gun along with the Rocket Launcher , the Peacemaker , the Barrett , the G-17 , the AUG , the XR15 , and the DB Shotgun are the only primary weapons that appear in the Arcade gamemode. The Trench Gun may be a reference to the Chrome Shotgun from one of Valve's games Left 4 Dead 2 , which bears a "chrome" finish and an attached flashlight. 90 Gamemodes Standard Randomizer Gun Rotation Hard Mode Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Special Projectile Arch Kill Icon Creator xonae Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Ultraball is a weapon that was added into the Summer Update III of Arsenal . It is an alternate and somewhat powerful counterpart of the Superball , as it bounces longer, travels faster through the air, and has multiple rebounds. However, this is balanced by its lower damage and even slower firing rate, although firerate can be increased by double keying (quickly switching to the melee and back). Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Has infinite ammunition. Fast projectile speed. High damage. Bounces aggressively, useful in enclosed spaces. Firerate can be increased by double keying. Cannot be easily dodged due to its size. Cons: Hard to hit enemies because of the projectile arch. No headshot multiplier. Slow throw rate. Tips [ ] The Ultraball is incredibly powerful against groups of opponents. It bounces around a lot , which can take out an entire squad with just one ball. Beware that it does not insta-kill, unlike the Superball . If there's no teammates present, opponents will need two Ultraballs to be killed. Alternatively, you can throw an Ultraball at a specific angle where it hits an opponent, bounces off a wall, then hits them again for the kill. Because it doesn't insta-kill, it will bounce off of opponents' bodies. Take this into account if throwing at specific angles. If you throw a single Ultraball into a room, you can (almost) guarantee it will kill every opponent inside. Good areas to try this strategy are: Any of the three doorways on Beach . All indoor areas of Villa . Both buildings on Tuscan . The tunnel with the overhead aquarium tank on Aquatic . The loghouse featured in Lodgeworks . The hallway with teleporters on the first floor of ROLVe Station . The main building featured in Ridge Park . Trivia [ ] The Ultraball was not mentioned in either of the update log posts for the Summer Update III . It uses the same inspect animation as the Superball . Due to its size, it can block 1/2 of the screen. 18-58 (34-69) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Counter Blox Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown (Current) VALVe (Archived) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Heckler & Koch UMP (simply known as SMG in Gun Game) is a machine pistol developed and manufactured by Heckler & Koch. Heckler & Koch developed the UMP as a lighter and cheaper successor to the MP5 , though both remain in production. The UMP has been adopted by various agencies such as the U.S. Customs and Border Protection. Other than agencies, they also served in various military forces. A small number of UMPs chambered in .45 ACP were officially purchased by the 5th Special Forces Group of the United States Army Special Forces, with some of the weapons seeing limited service in the early years of the Iraqi insurgency, making them among the small number of submachine guns deployed by the U.S. military in recent conflicts. In-game Information [ ] With a slower than average fire rate and a low magazine size, the UMP-45 may not seem suited to being called an SMG. However, the weapon is versatile, able to two-shot kill at close range. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage at closer ranges. Fast reload time. Fairly low spread. Cons: Slow fire rate for its class. Low minimum body damage. Lower magazine compared to other SMGs. Tips [ ] The UMP-45 is one of the more familiar SMGs, as it deals very good damage and has a spread pattern that's easy to get used to. Unforuntately, the UMP-45's spread is not low enough to be used from a distance. It becomes impossible to land shots from beyond mid-range. The most effective strategy would be to start firing from mid-range and then get closer to your target, getting you a headstart on the fight and securing the kill. This strategy will still work if you die in the middle of it, as you'll have dealt enough damage for a teammate to get you an assist. Make your shots count, as this weapon has a slow firing rate for an SMG. A few missed bullets could allow your opponent to kill you first. Trivia [ ] The UMP-45, or Universale Maschinenpistole 45 (German for " Universal Submachine Gun "), was developed by H&K as the successor to the MP5; although, both the UMP and MP5 still remain in production and use to this day. The UMP can come with three different calibers; the .45 ACP, the one in-game, 9x19mm, and .40 S&W. Some models of the UMP have 2-round burst as an option. The UMP-45 firing sound is same as the old UMP-45 in CS:GO . Gallery [ ] UMP-45 in real life with the grip. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The USP is a decent pistol for all ranges as the firing rate is similar to the G-19X , with a slightly higher ammo pool. The low spread makes it easier to land headshots. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Low spread. Large magazine size. High maximum damage. Fast reload. Cons: Low minimum body damage. Moderately slow rate of fire for its class. Tips [ ] The USP is practically the M9 but with better accuracy, so treat it as so. The spread is still noticeable at a distance, but being more accurate, the USP's effective distance is not restricted to close-range. Because of its hefty damage and fast reload, the USP is very good at intense fights. Gallery [ ] USP in real life. Trivia [ ] This weapon was originally suppressed in the Arsenal Archived . When this weapon was added back, it reused the M9 's sounds before being changed at a later time. The 12-round mag suggests that it fires .45 ACP rounds. 16-90 Gamemodes Standard Firing Mode Semi-automatic Special Ramp-up Kill Icon Contents 1 General information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History General information [ ] The USP-S is a silenced USP , made by the German company, Heckler & Koch . In-game Information [ ] In-game, the USP-S was quite a viable weapon for all ranges. It shot fast similar to the Makarov , but had a slightly higher ammo pool. The lack of spread and recoil was an easier way of hitting headshots, but this really was not a real advantage, because of the gun under-performing at longer ranges. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Virtually no spread and recoil. Silenced shots won't give away your spot for enemies. Cons: Somewhat slow rate of fire. Trivia [ ] The USP-S is inspired by the weapon with the same name in CS:GO. This is one of many weapons in old Arsenal that was taken from CB:RO Archived . This is most likely reason for this move by ROLVe was because they had the meshes already. This is a secondary weapon for the Counter Terrorist class in CB:RO . USP-S is a silenced version of the USP . The USP-S is modeled after the USP Tactical, (because of its ability to equip suppressors). While the USP is modeled after the standard variant with the same name. 16-31 (20-36) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Automatics Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Gallery 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Uzi is an Israeli fully-automatic SMG developed by Major Uziel Gal in the late 1940s-1950s during the Arab-Israeli war. Because of its use of a telescoping bolt (a technology borrowed from the ZK 476), the weapon was smaller than other SMGs from its time. The magazine/grip is nearer towards the center of the weapon, making the Uzi a more ergonomic design and allowing for more intuitive reloads. In-game Information [ ] The weapon has an emphasis on close-range power. In-game, players can expect a quick fire rate coming from the UZI, able to dispense from its 30-round magazine within several seconds. However, as it is an SMG, the Uzi deals with a relatively low amount of damage; players will deal 16 damage at the most extreme ranges to the body, and deal 36 damage upon a close-range headshot. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Quick reload. Good maximum damage. Low spread. Good firerate. Cons: Low minimum damage. Ineffective at longer ranges. Tips [ ] The Uzi is noticeably weaker than the other SMGs in the game. This means that there's less room to make mistakes when aiming. The headshot damage range is barely more powerful than its normal damage range, too. So either headshots or bodyshots will still give you the same amount of progress. Go for opponents at close-range instead of mid-range to ramp-up your damage as much as possible. To make up for its abysmal damage, the Uzi reloads moderately fast, which will allow you to reload in the middle of intense fights. Trivia [ ] The Uzi Submachine Gun is an open-bolt, blowback SMG manufactured by IMI ( Israel Military Industries ), and is a part of the Uzi family, which includes weapons such as the Mini Uzi, Micro Uzi , and the Uzi Pro. The Uzi was one of the earliest weapons to utilize a telescoping bolt design, allowing its magazine to be loaded into the pistol grip and lower the overall length of the weapon. Uniquely, the Uzi only has 1 moving part, which is its bolt. A smaller, dual-wielded version of the UZI was added in the Halloween Update , the Micro Uzis. The Uzi Submachine Gun was sold more to the military, law enforcement, and security markets than any other SMGs made. The weapon fires 600 rounds per minute in real life, but its cousins, the Micro-Uzi and Mini-Uzi can fire up to 1250 RPM. It is the signature weapon of Isaiah and Doctor skin . 16-31 (20-36) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Legacy Competitive Competitive Headshots Only Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Suppressor ADS Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The KRISS Vector is a submachine gun developed by the American company Kriss USA , formerly known as Transformational Defense Industries ( TDI ). They use an unconventional delayed blowback system combined with in-line design to reduce perceived recoil and muzzle climb. In-game Information [ ] The Vector in-game is fit with a suppressor and a futuristic sight, which can be accessed by right clicking or pressing "LT" on Xbox. Its low spread helps with fighting opponents at longer ranges, as well as a fast fire-rate, which helps damage opponents quickly. However, the Vector has downsides, such as somewhat low damage, long reload, and a magazine that expends easily. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Swift fire-rate. Accessible sight. Low spread. Decent damage at close quarters. Moderate magazine size. Cons: Low minimum damage. Somewhat long reload. Magazine size is easily expended due to its fast fire rate. Gallery [ ] ADS Stage one development. Stage two. Stage three. Stage four. Stage five. Stage six. Stage seven. Vector in ROBLOX Studio . Vector in real life without magazine. Trivia [ ] Vector was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on July 23th, 2020. It is also the first weapon to be streamed while in development. This is one of the seven weapons to be suppressed, the others being the Hush Puppy , the MK18 , the MP9-S , Mauser Carbine , the Maxim-9 and Sako 85 . The Vector in-game is based on the CRB model because of the barrel shroud. The barrel shroud acts as a suppressor in-game. This weapon is one of the weapons that has the ability to use ADS, the others being the MK18 , the M14 EBR , the DBS , the Falkor , the Pulse Musket and the DB Chauchat . The Vector is the only SMG with ADS. The firing sound for the Vector is more or less the Hush Puppy's firing sound, but pitched down a little. The 30-round mag suggests that it fires .45 ACP rounds. Looking carefully, the ammo actually reloads before the actual reload animation is finished, this can be used as an advantage. The reloading sound is the same as the UMP-45 , but in a different order. 70 Gamemodes All Special Instant-Hit Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Trivia 4 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Very Long Bat is a weapon that is exclusive to developers. It is the longest weapon in the game and is the only melee weapon to hit anyone from any distance. The Very Long Bat is very powerful as it is possible to kill any player from any range, and it deals 70 damage, which is nearly twice the damage of a normal knife. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Can hit enemy at infinite range. Cons: Able to give away the location of the player. No backstabs. Does not demote on kill. Trivia [ ] The Very Long Bat is an extended mesh of the baseball bat from Wii Sports . When a player gets a Golden Gun kill with Very Long Bat or Golden Gun, the Golden Knife would become the regular golden Bat melee. This was first revealed public in a video " ARSENAL.EXE | Secret DLC " by Arsenal content creator, GDILIVES. He later received the weapon for a video, however it was removed from him later. This weapon was the signature weapon for the Weenie and Noodle Man skins . This is one of the melees that does not demote on kill along with the Ice Dagger . The Very Long Bat is one of the joke weapons along with the Literal Gun , the Pocket Potassium , the Potassium Power , the Origami Gun , the Dispenser , and the TP Launcher . The Very Long Bat is considered be the first melee to hit opponents from any distance. 45 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Projectiles Party Hard Mode Firing Mode Thrown Projectile Special Projectile Arch Kill Icon Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Water Balloon is a weapon that was added in the Summer Update II that, as the name implies, has water inside a balloon. Alike other projectiles, the water balloon feeds from a large ammo pool and does not reload. In-game Information [ ] In-game, it functions and behaves very similarly to the Snowball . Throwing it at opponents deals an amount of damage that is slightly higher than a melee attack. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire. High ammo pool. No reloading required. Deals the same amount of damage from any distance. Cons: No headshot multiplier. Weak damage. Fires a projectile, meaning that timing is key. Projectile arches, making it harder to hit players. Tips [ ] Water Balloons can be thrown quickly, but it's also very weak, taking three to kill an opponent with full HP. It's better at getting assists rather than direct kills, so try sticking close to teammates if you have this weapon. This weapon is very bad against other weapons, but it especially loses to Shotguns or Automatics. Water Balloons lack a damage range, so it deals a flat damage of 45 from any distance. It is recommended that you use this from mid-range to easily hit opponents and avoid easily getting shot at. Keep a look out for any opponents using a Sniper Rifle as they can easily counter this strategy. Trivia [ ] This weapon has a rare chance of appearing in game. This weapon was used to obtain the Fire Golem skin alongside Snowball . The firing sound of this weapon is the same as the Snowball. range: The minimum to maximum amount of damage a weapon can do. Headshot damage is written inside brackets ( ). Ramp-up: Maximum damage against opponents close to you. Fall-off: Minimum damage against opponents far away. Firing rate: How fast a weapon can shoot its ammo. Reload speed: How fast a weapon can reload. Spread: How far from middle of the crosshair will a weapon shoot. Bloom: How wide the crosshair gets when firing a weapon. Magazine capacity: How many bullets (or ammo) that can be fired before a reload. For example: 6 / 24. The user has six bullets to shoot before reloading. Reserve ammo: How much ammo players have that can be reloaded. If the reserve ammo runs out, knife is automatically deployed. For example: 30 / 100 . The user has one hundred reserved ammo. Scope: A weapon's ability to see players and objects far away upon right-clicking. The view turns black except for a big circle in the middle. ADS (aim down sights): Like Scope, but the user can only see anything at mid-range. The view turns to sights of the weapon. Hip-Firing: Attempting to shoot without using Scope or ADS, most effective against nearby targets. Distance [ ] Close-range: Being very close to opponents, within 20 studs. Mid-range: A sizeable distance two players, about 50 studs. This distance is naturally met when approaching or running from an enemy. Long-range: Far away from opponents, 100 studs or more, especially if both players are on opposite ends of a map. Miscellaneous [ ] Intense fight: When two or more players are actively shooting at each other. Double-keying: Switching to a melee and back to the main weapon. Most often used if the main weapon is a projectile with a slow firing speed. To double-key on PC, press 3 → 1 or Q twice as fast as possible. One-and-done: A weapon is powerful but its reload is incredibly slow, pushing users to get a kill within the first magazine. Special Abilities : A weapon that has a unique way of dealing damage. Examples include Fan-fire, Rebound, Afterburn, etc. Trivia [ ] The Admin Launcher , Influencer Launcher , Creagle , Golden Creagle , Very Long Bat and the Fasticuffs are the only weapons exclusive to ROLVe staff. The Literal Gun does the highest damage of all weapons in the game with 810-1350 (1035-1552) damage, followed by the musket with 600 (690) damage. The Golden Musket, all snipers (except for the muskets and the DBS), both the Hush Puppy versions, Handcannon, Luger, Crossbow, Python, Webley, Pathbringer, Peacemaker, Deagle, Makarov, Armament, SCAR-H, Dragunov, Springfield Rifle, SKS, DB Chauchat and Autobow deal triple damage for headshots. Some weapons have a set kill effect regardless of the one you have equipped, such as the Railgun . The Railgun , Laser Rifle , Handcannon and the R800 all use the Evaporate kill effect. The Rocket Launcher , RPG , Plasma Launcher and the M16A2 grenade launcher all use the Gib kill effect. The Spellbook 's fire spell and Firebrand use the Scorch kill effect. There are weapons and weapon badges that were supposed to be in the game but were cut-off upon release. Weapons Battle Axe - The Battle Axe was originally supposed to be in the Swordfights game mode (VIP Exclusive) but never made it into the game. The reason for the Battle Axe being removed is, as of now, unknown. Mop - The Mop was supposed to be in the Brickbattle gamemode, but didn't make it into the game upon the update's release for unknown reasons. It was supposed to be able to fling opponents off the map. It was later added as a normal melee in the Minor Monday Update . Scout - The Scout was originally supposed to return in the Mega Update , but was scrapped as a tweet revealed. The Lever Shotgun , original DB Shotgun , Rocket Launcher , original Flamethrower , Minigun , Mosin-Nagant , Pump Shotgun , SPAS 12 , M40 , Windicator , Hi-Power , Battle Axe , Bat, Fisticuffs, Brass Knuckles, Machete, Icicle, Pan and Butterfly Knife were taken from Typical Colors 2 . The scrapped Battle Axe and the original Railgun model was taken from the ROBLOX catalog. Some weapons feature the Reflectance on weapon parts such as Trench Gun , DBS , Pulse Laser , Laser Rifle , Nailgun , DB Chauchat , Windforce and Butterfly Knife . Because of this, these weapons on maps that took place on nighttime are completely black. The Concussion Rifle is the only explosive weapon that is not a projectile. v • t • e Main Mechanics (20) Announcers - Calling Cards - Cases - Codes - Gamepasses - In-Game Update Log - Item Kits - Kill Effects - Locker - Menu Themes - Rarity - Server Browser - Settings - Shop - Skins - Starter Pack - Taunts - Teams - Unusual Effects - Victory Themes - Votekick Gameplay Mechanics (10) Controls - Damage Bricks - Domination and Revenge - Event Currency - Gamemodes - Maps - Rocket/Recoil Jumping - Special Abilities - Stomp - Weapons Arsenal Spinoffs (4) Arsenal Skin Creator - Arsenal Archived - Gun Game - MURDER Wiki Navigation (3) Wiki Contributors - Manual of Style - Rules Miscellaneous (12) Arsenal Spoofs - Badges - Banners - Community Events - Crossovers - Developers - Private Servers - Merchandise - Secrets - Soundtrack - Thumbnails - Update Log/Version History

60-160 (240-480) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Hackula Headshots Only Competitive Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Single-Action Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 (Current) Unknown (Previous) Other Functions EQUIP TIME ATTACK INTERVAL MOVE SPEED RELOAD TIME 0.5 0.65 21.728 2.6 INITIAL SPREAD MAX SPREAD SPREAD RECOVERY 0 1.747 1.25 The Webley or the Webley Mark VI is a British revolver adopted in the year 1915, and is a break-action revolver and is a "general purpose" revolver. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Webley does a lot more damage per shot and has less spread, however, it has a slower rate of fire. It instantly kills on a headshot and takes two hits to kill on the body. It also has damage fall-off, which can lead to an instant kill at close ranges. However, players should take note of the slow rate of fire and 6-round speedloader, which can be easily expended despite the fire rate if the player cannot hit their shots, as well as the slow reload time. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Very low spread. Has very minimal recoil. One-shot-kill on the head. Firerate can be increased by double keying Cons: Slightly small magazine size. Slow rate of fire (somehow). Slow reload time. Tips [ ] The Webley's ability to insta-kill opponents at close-range makes it a very deadly weapon in intense fights. Beware of the Webley's slow firing rate, as it can punish you for missing your shots during intense fights at close-range. Flicking your aim before shooting with this weapon can often get a kill. Try it! From mid-range, it takes at least 2 landed shots to get a kill, so you'll have to aim more carefully from this distance. The recoil is more noticeable at this distance, so it might be harder to get headshots from there. To balance out its ability to dominate intense fights, the Webley reloads very slowly. More often than not, your opponents will have an easy time killing you when you're reloading the Webley. The Webley is practically considered a "one-and-done" weapon due to its power and slow reload, so you must get a kill within the first magazine. Gallery [ ] Webley in real life. Trivia [ ] The Webley had six different variants such as the Mk I, Mk II, Mk III, Mk IV, Mk V , and Mk VI . The Webley service revolvers were some the most powerful break-action revolvers ever produced. Despite the ability to fire on double-action in real life, the in-game firing mode is single-action The Webley's reload animation is based on the same gun with the same name, featured in some Battlefield games. It is the signature weapon of the Trash Worker skin . The Webley's firing sound has the same sound as the Peacemaker , but it was in high pitch. This sword has a high knockback, as it can easily shove enemies off the map. However, the only problem is that the enemies will come down and likely strike from above. Unlike some of the swords, Windforce has a range of 6.25. Pros and Cons [ ] Pros: Pushes opponents away. High damage. Cons: Lacks backstab ability. Trivia [ ] This sword is based off the Windforce gear created by ROBLOX in 2012. This sword used have a bug where players get permanently banned from the Anti-Cheat. 41-110 (165-410) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Pistols Typical Colors Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive All Weapons Hackula Headshots Only Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Double-action Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator Unknown The EAA Windicator is a German revolver made by Weihrauch that appears to be a snub-nosed revolver. Contents 1 In-Game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History In-Game Information [ ] The Windicator has it's damage fall-off that has a one-shot capability upon a headshot at any range, and on the body at closer ranges. The fairly fast rate of fire helps with killing enemies quickly. The reload time is very quick with the use of a speed loader to load the weapon. However, the Windicator's drawbacks are the small 6-round capacity, despite the fast reload making up for the small magazine size, but the high spread as well. Combined with the somewhat fast rate of fire, spamming the Windicator results in the spread being very wide which forces players to get kills up-close. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: High damage. Fast rate of fire for a revolver. Quick one second reload. One shot on the head. One shot if very close to the target. Cons: Moderate spread upon continuous shots. Tips [ ] The Windicator is good at mid-range, but is most effective at close-range. At mid-range, it takes about 2-4 shots. At very close distances, one shot is an instant kill. If your opponent has a Shotgun or Automatic weapon, stay at mid-range to avoid getting easily killed. Do not use the Windicator at longer ranges because of its spread. The very first shot when it's fully loaded will be 100% accurate, so you can shoot at an enemy far away and hope that a teammate gets you an assist. The Windicator's very quick reload will help you while in intense fights. Back away from the enemy currently firing at you when reloading to make it harder to get killed. Once those shots get loaded in, jump towards them to ramp-up your damage. If you're coming to Arsenal as a Typical Colors 2 player, the Windicator is a slightly more buffed stock Revolver used by the Agent. The Windicator's damage is stronger, as its maximum ramped-up damage is 110, compared to the Revolver which only does a max of 60. The Windicator also crits on headshot, just like TC2's Ambassador. If one of your shots do 64 damage or more, you can quickly finish your target off with your Knife to demote them, just like an Agent would. Gallery [ ] In third person. Windicator in real life. Trivia [ ] The Windicator model and sounds in Arsenal are taken from the stock Revolver in Typical Colors 2 , used by the Agent class, albeit with a lack of rear sights. It's also the Agent's in-game signature weapon in Arsenal, as well as Private Eye. The Windicator, as of the Halloween Update , has the most balance changes made to it. This type of revolver is a snub-nosed revolver, with any size of frame with a short barrel. The old firing sound was taken from Team Fortress 2's Revolver .
