Per Pellet 6-36 (13-40) Pellets Per Shot 9 Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Counter Blox Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Competitive All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Shotguns Only Firing Mode Automatic Special Fall-off HUD Icon Creator dev_keni (Current) Unknown (Previous, Original) Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Trivia 5 Audio 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The Benelli M4 (better known as the XM1014 , simply known as Auto Shotgun in Gun Game ) is a semi-automatic shotgun produced by Italian firearm manufacturer Benelli Armi SpA . In-game information [ ] A single pellet from the XM1014 will do 6 damage at long ranges, and if all pellets hit at close range, you will deal 110 damage. Its semi-automatic nature allows you to easily dispatch enemies close with a barrage of shells. Unlike its similar rival, the SPAS-12 , the XM1014 fires slower, but has a faster reload time. However, the weapon is loaded by hand and takes around 4 seconds to reload fully, a half-second for each shell, and a second taken to chamber the shotgun. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Above-average rate of fire for a shotgun. 1-by-1 reloading allows topping off. High maximum damage per pellet. Decent magazine size for a shotgun. Cons: Long empty reload time. Wide pellet spread upon continuous shots. Tips [ ] The XM1014 is most effective during approximately the first 5 shots. The remaining shots will be a bit difficult to deal with. Reloading just one shell in after 5 shots will reset the bullet spread, and finish off enemies during intense fights. Unlike most of the other Shotgun-class weapons, the XM1014's effective range is slightly closer to enemies while at mid-range. It is recommended you get a little closer to enemies before you start firing shots. Trivia [ ] The XM1014, as is its USMC prototype designation, is manufactured by Benelli Armi SpA as the Benelli M4 Super 90 . The XM1014 uses a simple ARGO (auto regulating gas operated) system, allowing it to be cheaper and less complex than other semi-automatic shotguns. The XM1014 was also in Typical Colors 2 where it is originally known as the " Specialist " and is a primary weapon for Flanker. The XM1014 also appears in Counter Blox and is taken from the respective game. The XM1014 can reliably function up to firing 25,000 rounds without replacement of any major parts. Despite the XM1014 being depicted as fully-automatic, in real life the Benelli M4 family shotguns are semi-automatic. 28-42 (32-48) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Legacy Competitive Arcade All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Competitive Firing Mode Burst-fire (2) Special Fall-off Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 1.1 In-game Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Gallery 4 Trivia 5 Audio (Outdated) 6 Weapon History General Information [ ] The XR15 ( S.T.A.R. XR-5 FG-1508 Advanced Battle Rifle ) is an airsoft weapon now made to fire lethal cartridges. With the interior of an M4 carbine and a sleek, ergonomic, polymer body, the XR15 provides a more futuristic take on its predecessor. In-game Information [ ] The XR15 is notable for being one of the only weapons to fire a two-round burst with every pull of the trigger. It fires from a 20-round magazine, with 60 rounds in reserve. The weapon's burst speed is quite fast, though players will need to fire at least two bursts to kill an opponent. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Fast rate of fire while bursting. Low spread. Decent damage for its class. Fast reload speed. Cons: Small magazine size. Gallery [ ] Weapon render. XR15 in real life Trivia [ ] XR15 was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on September 8th, 2019. The XR15 is an identical copy of the CSI S.T.A.R XR-5 FG-1508 Advanced Battle Rifle , an airsoft rifle built around a M4 gearbox. It also bares resemblance to the CZ 805 BREN created by Česká zbrojovka Uherský Brod in 2009. The XR15 is the third burst-operated weapon that was added to Arsenal . This, the M16A2 , the Plasma Launcher , and the DB Chauchat 's ADS are the only burst-operated weapons in Arsenal . While the M16A2 and Plasma Launcher are 3-burst, the XR15 and DB Chauchat are 2-burst weapons. The XR15's sounds are the same as the M16A2 , albeit slowed down and lowered in pitch. This along with the Rocket Launcher , the Peacemaker , the Barrett , the G-17 , the AUG , the Trench Gun and the DB Shotgun are the only primary weapons that appear in the Arcade gamemode. In real-life, the XR-15 can fire 2 separate ammo types, which are the .223 Remington and the 5.56x45mm NATO. 44 (55-110) Gamemodes Standard Gun Rotation Kill Confirmed Randomizer Clown Infection Juggernaut Laser Tag All Weapons Hackula Hackula DX Monkey Business OddBall Firing Mode Automatic Special Overheat Tracer Shot Piercing Shot Kill Icon Creator PrimeFIRE94 Contents 1 General Information 2 Pros & Cons 3 Tips 4 Gallery 5 Trivia 6 Audio 7 Weapon History General Information [ ] Current Previous The Z80 is a futuristic automatic SMG in Arsenal , appearing to be more unique than the others. The Z80's piercing shot is one of the most unique features, meaning as long as another target is behind an enemy and the shots land on the front, both enemies will get hurt. The fast rate of fire and high damage means that shredding enemies won't be difficult. However, the most unique feature of the Z80, overheating, means that if players fire the Z80 too long, they will have to suffer from three seconds of not firing. The high spread penalty as well causes an issue at further ranges, although going closer fixes the issue. The Z80 used to be a futuristic semi-auto laser pistol instead of an SMG. It used to have a magazine of 10 and reserve ammo of 30 and did 24-120 damage on the body, 26 on the head and did 120-136 damage with a full charge. It also didn't have the overheating due to the magazine system. The model of Z80 was also a fictional variant of the Vladas Model 92. Pros & Cons [ ] Pros: Very fast fire rate. Has infinite magazine and ammo. High damage. Piercing ability allows to hit more enemies Cons: High spread penalty upon continuous firing. Tracer shot can give away the user's position. 3 second cooldown after firing consecutively. Tips [ ] The Z80 has infinite ammo, but its overheat feature prevents you from using it too agressively. (This is indicated by the little screen on the top of the Z80 that slowly fills up with a red color.) As a real number, you only have 15 shots per "magazine" before it forces itself into cooldown. To prevent overheating, you must space out your shots. It also makes your shots more accurate as its spread will not get high quickly. At long-range, only your very first shot will guarantee to hit (just like every weapon). However, it is especially important for the Z80 as a headshot from this range is worth 99 damage. If you land a headshot from that far, you can depend on a teammate to go in for the kill, crediting you with an assist. Because the Z80 pierces through enemies, keep an eye out for groups of enemies clumped up together. However , shots that pierce through opponents have limited range. It will only hit other opponents directly behind your first target. (In other words, its piercing shots are not like the Railgun .) You also don't necessarily need to get kills. Just one shot deals enough damage so that a teammate can kill them in one or two shots which will credit you with an assist. Stage four. Stage five. Stage six (showcase). Stage 5 (final showcase). TCtully 's Discord avatar. Segg Trivia [ ] The current model of Z80 was revealed in the Arsenal Discord on May 18th, 2020. Originally, the Z80's light-emitting parts change color to correspond with the player's team. Before the buff given time the weapon a few hours upon release, the Z80 forced players to hit every single shot in the magazine in order to body shot kill an enemy. The original Z80 has a unique draw animation, in which player characters will inspect the pistol momentarily. The original model of Z80 seems to be modeled after Vladas Model 92 , a Lithuanian prototype submachine gun, which was easily produced and manufactured since it had a cheap and cost-effective design. However, the creator declined its necessary amount of creations. This is the signature weapon of the Alien, Alien In Disguise & the Space Soldider skins. The previous model was used for Mechanic's secondary weapon, the Noisy Cricket in Typical Colors 2 . Unlike other weapons, the original Z80's charge method is not shown on the right-hand lower corner of the screen. This, along with the Pathbringer , the BH10 , and the Pulse Musket do not use the Evaporate kill effect by default. The Z80 has the same inspection animation as the Tavor . There is a way to bypass the overheating by quickly switching to the knife and then switching back.
